_source.description:
Verantwortung fanduuml;r ein soziales Gesundheitswesen: Wir suchen zur Unterstanduuml;tzung unserer IT-Administration in der Hauptverwaltung in Lahr zum nandauml;chstmandouml;glichen Zeitpunkt einenIT-System- und Netzwerkandshy;administrator (m/w/d)in Vollzeit (38,5 Std./Woche).Ihre Aufgabe bei uns:Administration, Konfiguration und Dokumentation der bestehenden Netzwerkinfrastruktur des Medizinischen Dienstes Baden-Wanduuml;rttemberg (LAN, WAN, MPLS)
Betrieb und Weiterentwicklung komplexer LAN- / WLAN- / WAN-Netzwerke
Sicherheitstechnische Einrichtung und Monitoring des Netzwerks
Administration, Weiterentwicklung und Implementierung von Firewall-Systemen
Ansprechpartner und Koordinator fanduuml;r externe Dienstleister
Erstellung technischer Leistungsandshy;beschreibungen und Unterstanduuml;tzung bei Ausschreibungen im Netzwerkandshy;bereich (Hardware und Dienstandshy;leistungen)
Unterstanduuml;tzung externer Dienstleister bei allen Netzwerkandshy;belangen in der Telefonie (VoIP)
Unterstanduuml;tzung bei der Adminiandshy;stration der Windows-Server- / Client-Systeme und der Virtualisierungsandshy;umgebung (VMware / MS Hyper-V)
Unterstanduuml;tzung bei Installation, Betrieb und Optimierung von Storage- und Backupumgebungen (bspw. NetApp und Veeam)
Das bringen Sie mit:Abgeschlossene Ausbildung im IT-Bereich oder vergleichbare Qualifikation
Fundiertes Fachwissen im Bereich Netzwerktechnik und Netzwerkandshy;kommunikation
Berufserfahrung im Netzwerkandshy;umfeld und gute Kenntnisse in der IP-Technologie
Fundierte Kenntnisse in der Betreuung von Windows Client- / Server-Umgebungen 2012
Kenntnisse im Bereich VMware
Wanduuml;nschenswert: Kenntnisse im Storageumfeld NetApp
Analytische Fandauml;higkeiten, Eigenandshy;initiative und Teamfandauml;higkeit
Freuen Sie sich auf:Ein vielseitiges Betandauml;tigungsfeld in einem modernen Arbeitsumfeld
Eine flexible Arbeitszeitgestaltung
Eine Verganduuml;tung entsprechend der Aufgabenstellung, auf Basis eines attraktiven Tarifvertrags
Zusandauml;tzliche Altersversorgung
Regelmandauml;andszlig;ige Fortbildungsangebote
Betriebliche Gesundheitsfandouml;rderung sowie die Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Familie
_source.description_html:
Verantwortung für ein soziales Gesundheitswesen: Wir suchen zur Unterstützung unserer IT-Administration in der Hauptverwaltung in Lahr zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen

IT-System- und Netzwerk­administrator (m/w/d)




in Vollzeit (38,5 Std./Woche).



Ihre Aufgabe bei uns:




  • Administration, Konfiguration und Dokumentation der bestehenden Netzwerkinfrastruktur des Medizinischen Dienstes Baden-Württemberg (LAN, WAN, MPLS)

  • Betrieb und Weiterentwicklung komplexer LAN- / WLAN- / WAN-Netzwerke

  • Sicherheitstechnische Einrichtung und Monitoring des Netzwerks

  • Administration, Weiterentwicklung und Implementierung von Firewall-Systemen

  • Ansprechpartner und Koordinator für externe Dienstleister

  • Erstellung technischer Leistungs­beschreibungen und Unterstützung bei Ausschreibungen im Netzwerk­bereich (Hardware und Dienst­leistungen)

  • Unterstützung externer Dienstleister bei allen Netzwerk­belangen in der Telefonie (VoIP)

  • Unterstützung bei der Admini­stration der Windows-Server- / Client-Systeme und der Virtualisierungs­umgebung (VMware / MS Hyper-V)

  • Unterstützung bei Installation, Betrieb und Optimierung von Storage- und Backupumgebungen (bspw. NetApp und Veeam)



Das bringen Sie mit:




  • Abgeschlossene Ausbildung im IT-Bereich oder vergleichbare Qualifikation

  • Fundiertes Fachwissen im Bereich Netzwerktechnik und Netzwerk­kommunikation

  • Berufserfahrung im Netzwerk­umfeld und gute Kenntnisse in der IP-Technologie

  • Fundierte Kenntnisse in der Betreuung von Windows Client- / Server-Umgebungen 2012

  • Kenntnisse im Bereich VMware

  • Wünschenswert: Kenntnisse im Storageumfeld NetApp

  • Analytische Fähigkeiten, Eigen­initiative und Teamfähigkeit



Freuen Sie sich auf:




  • Ein vielseitiges Betätigungsfeld in einem modernen Arbeitsumfeld

  • Eine flexible Arbeitszeitgestaltung

  • Eine Vergütung entsprechend der Aufgabenstellung, auf Basis eines attraktiven Tarifvertrags

  • Zusätzliche Altersversorgung

  • Regelmäßige Fortbildungsangebote

  • Betriebliche Gesundheitsförderung sowie die Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Familie
_source.position_name: IT-System- und Netzwerkadministrator (m/w/d) at Medizinischer Dienst Baden-Württemberg (Lahr/Schwarzwald, Deutschland)

_source.description:
Please find English version below.andUuml;berblick:Technologie untermauert das gesamte Geschandauml;ft der Deutschen Bank und verandauml;ndert und gestaltet die Art und Weise, wie wir intern und extern mit all unseren Stakeholdern in Kontakt treten, interagieren und Transaktionen durchfanduuml;hren. Unsere Strategie fanduuml;r Technologie, Daten und Innovation (TDI) konzentriert sich auf die Standauml;rkung des technischen Fachwissens, die Einfanduuml;hrung eines agile delivery models sowie die Modernisierung der IT-Infrastruktur der Bank mit langfristigen Investitionen und die Nutzung von Cloud Computing. Wir investieren weiter und bauen ein Team von visionandauml;ren Technologietalenten auf, die sicherstellen, dass wir in dieser Zeit beispielloser Verandauml;nderungen fanduuml;r die Branche erfolgreich sind. Es bedeutet, die richtigen Leute einzustellen und ihnen die Ausbildung, Freiheit und Gelegenheit zu geben, die sie brauchen, um Pionierarbeit zu leisten.Als Senior Business Analyst sind Sie fanduuml;r die Erfassung und Analyse von Geschandauml;ftsanforderungen verantwortlich und wandeln diese in funktionale Spezifikationen um, die fanduuml;r die delivery teams verstandauml;ndlich sind.Hauptverantwortlichkeiten:Als Lead Business Analyst bei der Entwicklung neuer Technologieanwendungen in Zusammenarbeit mit Stakeholdern aus den Bereichen Business und Operations tandauml;tig sein, um die Corporate Bank zu transformieren
Verstandauml;ndnis fanduuml;r relevante Geschandauml;ftsstrategien, Metriken, Prioritandauml;ten und andAuml;nderungsbedanduuml;rfnisse von Kunden, Benutzern und Stakeholdern. Dies spiegelt sich in der Mission des agilen Teams, dem product backlog, den Prioritandauml;ten und der Roadmap wider
Aktives Scrum-Teammitglied und Kooperation mit unseren Geschandauml;fts- und Betriebsbenutzern, Entwicklern, Architekten, UX-Designern und UI-Entwicklern
andUuml;berpranduuml;fung komplexer Anforderungen auf hoher Ebene und anduuml;bersetzen Sie sie in lieferbare User Stories

Persandouml;nliche und fachliche Anforderungen:Hervorragendes Verstandauml;ndnis der Kunden- und Benutzerbedanduuml;rfnisse und Vorerfahrung im Bereich Merchant Solutions, Acquiring oder Zahlungsabwicklung
Fandauml;higkeit, strategisch zu denken und Kunden-, Benutzer- und Stakeholderbedanduuml;rfnisse langfristig zu antizipieren, was sich in der Produktvision und der Fandauml;higkeit widerspiegelt, inkrementelle Funktionen bereitzustellen, die der Vision zugeordnet sind
Erfahrung in Change Management und Fandauml;higkeit, die Auswirkungen einer agilen Teambereitstellung zu optimieren und gleichzeitig Informationen effektiv mit Personen mit unterschiedlichem Hintergrund und Senioritandauml;t, einschlieandszlig;lich geschandauml;ftlicher, technischer und anderer Interessengruppen, zu kommunizieren
Zwischenmenschliche Fandauml;higkeiten auf verschiedenen Organisationsebenen mit technischen und nichttechnischen Mitarbeitern sowie Fandauml;higkeit, den Kommunikationsansatz fanduuml;r verschiedene Stakeholdergruppen (Entwickler, Unternehmen, Betriebsbenutzer) anzupassen
Substanzielle Vorkenntnisse in agiler Umgebung sowie mit dem Erstellen komplexer Landouml;sungsentwanduuml;rfe und beim Schreiben von User Storys
Wenn Sie Fragen zum Rekrutierungsprozess haben sollten, wenden Sie sich bitte an Marvin Hamann +49(69)910-45482.Overview:Technology underpins Deutsche Bankandrsquo;s entire business and is changing and shaping the way we engage, interact and transact with all our stakeholders, both internally and externally. Our Technology, Data and Innovation (TDI) strategy is focused on strengthening engineering expertise, introducing an agile delivery model, as well as modernising the bank's IT infrastructure with long-term investments and taking advantage of cloud computing. But this is only the foundation. We continue to invest and build a team of visionary tech talent who will ensure we thrive in this period of unprecedented change for the industry. It means hiring the right people and giving them the training, freedom and opportunity they need to do pioneering work.As Senior Business Analyst you will be responsible for collection and analysis of business requirements with further transformation of them into functional specification understandable for delivery teams.Key Responsibilities:Act as Lead Business Analyst in developing new technology applications in partnership with Business and Operations stakeholders to transform the Corporate Bank.
Understand the relevant business strategy, metrics, priorities and customer, user and stakeholder change needs, reflecting this in the agile team mission, product backlog, priorities and roadmap
Participate as an active scrum team member working alongside our business and operations users, developers, architects, UX Designers and UI Developers.
Review complex high level requirements and translate them into deliverable User Stories.
Organise working groups and provide regular updates to stakeholders on delivery status and risks and involve our Subject Matter Experts (SME) into the scrum team refinement sessions for form requirements with the team.
Skills and Qualifications:Excellent understanding of customer and user needs, business dynamics and banking/technology (as relevant), in general also ability to understand key issues and how these drive potential solutions
Ability to think strategically and anticipate customer, user and stakeholder needs on a long-term basis, reflecting this in the product vision and ability to deliver incremental features mapped to the vision

Interpersonal skills at different organisational level with both technical and non-technical people and ability to tailor communication approach for different stakeholder groups (Developers, Business, Operations Users)

_source.description_html:
Please find English version below.


Überblick:


Technologie untermauert das gesamte Geschäft der Deutschen Bank und verändert und gestaltet die Art und Weise, wie wir intern und extern mit all unseren Stakeholdern in Kontakt treten, interagieren und Transaktionen durchführen. Unsere Strategie für Technologie, Daten und Innovation (TDI) konzentriert sich auf die Stärkung des technischen Fachwissens, die Einführung eines agile delivery models sowie die Modernisierung der IT-Infrastruktur der Bank mit langfristigen Investitionen und die Nutzung von Cloud Computing. Dies ist aber nur die Grundlage. Wir investieren weiter und bauen ein Team von visionären Technologietalenten auf, die sicherstellen, dass wir in dieser Zeit beispielloser Veränderungen für die Branche erfolgreich sind. Es bedeutet, die richtigen Leute einzustellen und ihnen die Ausbildung, Freiheit und Gelegenheit zu geben, die sie brauchen, um Pionierarbeit zu leisten.


Als Senior Business Analyst sind Sie für die Erfassung und Analyse von Geschäftsanforderungen verantwortlich und wandeln diese in funktionale Spezifikationen um, die für die delivery teams verständlich sind.


Hauptverantwortlichkeiten:



  • Als Lead Business Analyst bei der Entwicklung neuer Technologieanwendungen in Zusammenarbeit mit Stakeholdern aus den Bereichen Business und Operations tätig sein, um die Corporate Bank zu transformieren

  • Verständnis für relevante Geschäftsstrategien, Metriken, Prioritäten und Änderungsbedürfnisse von Kunden, Benutzern und Stakeholdern. Dies spiegelt sich in der Mission des agilen Teams, dem product backlog, den Prioritäten und der Roadmap wider

  • Aktives Scrum-Teammitglied und Kooperation mit unseren Geschäfts- und Betriebsbenutzern, Entwicklern, Architekten, UX-Designern und UI-Entwicklern

  • Überprüfung komplexer Anforderungen auf hoher Ebene und übersetzen Sie sie in lieferbare User Stories

  • Organisation von Arbeitsgruppen und proaktive, regelmäßige Einbindung der Stakeholder über den Lieferstatus und die Risiken. Integration unserer Fachexperten (SME) in die refinement sessions des Scrum-Teams, um die Anforderung mit dem Team zu erfüllen


Persönliche und fachliche Anforderungen:



  • Hervorragendes Verständnis der Kunden- und Benutzerbedürfnisse und Vorerfahrung im Bereich Merchant Solutions, Acquiring oder Zahlungsabwicklung

  • Fähigkeit, strategisch zu denken und Kunden-, Benutzer- und Stakeholderbedürfnisse langfristig zu antizipieren, was sich in der Produktvision und der Fähigkeit widerspiegelt, inkrementelle Funktionen bereitzustellen, die der Vision zugeordnet sind

  • Erfahrung in Change Management und Fähigkeit, die Auswirkungen einer agilen Teambereitstellung zu optimieren und gleichzeitig Informationen effektiv mit Personen mit unterschiedlichem Hintergrund und Seniorität, einschließlich geschäftlicher, technischer und anderer Interessengruppen, zu kommunizieren

  • Zwischenmenschliche Fähigkeiten auf verschiedenen Organisationsebenen mit technischen und nichttechnischen Mitarbeitern sowie Fähigkeit, den Kommunikationsansatz für verschiedene Stakeholdergruppen (Entwickler, Unternehmen, Betriebsbenutzer) anzupassen

  • Substanzielle Vorkenntnisse in agiler Umgebung sowie mit dem Erstellen komplexer Lösungsentwürfe und beim Schreiben von User Storys


Wenn Sie Fragen zum Rekrutierungsprozess haben sollten, wenden Sie sich bitte an Marvin Hamann +49(69)910-45482.


Overview:


Technology underpins Deutsche Bank’s entire business and is changing and shaping the way we engage, interact and transact with all our stakeholders, both internally and externally. Our Technology, Data and Innovation (TDI) strategy is focused on strengthening engineering expertise, introducing an agile delivery model, as well as modernising the bank's IT infrastructure with long-term investments and taking advantage of cloud computing. But this is only the foundation. We continue to invest and build a team of visionary tech talent who will ensure we thrive in this period of unprecedented change for the industry. It means hiring the right people and giving them the training, freedom and opportunity they need to do pioneering work.


As Senior Business Analyst you will be responsible for collection and analysis of business requirements with further transformation of them into functional specification understandable for delivery teams.


Key Responsibilities:



  • Act as Lead Business Analyst in developing new technology applications in partnership with Business and Operations stakeholders to transform the Corporate Bank.

  • Understand the relevant business strategy, metrics, priorities and customer, user & stakeholder change needs, reflecting this in the agile team mission, product backlog, priorities and roadmap

  • Participate as an active scrum team member working alongside our business and operations users, developers, architects, UX Designers & UI Developers.

  • Review complex high level requirements and translate them into deliverable User Stories.

  • Organise working groups and provide regular updates to stakeholders on delivery status and risks and involve our Subject Matter Experts (SME) into the scrum team refinement sessions for form requirements with the team.


Skills & Qualifications:



  • Excellent understanding of customer and user needs, business dynamics and banking/technology (as relevant), in general also ability to understand key issues and how these drive potential solutions

  • Ability to think strategically and anticipate customer, user and stakeholder needs on a long-term basis, reflecting this in the product vision and ability to deliver incremental features mapped to the vision

  • Experience in change management activities and ability to optimise the impact of agile team delivery while being able to communicate information effectively with people from varying backgrounds and levels of seniority including business, technical and other stakeholders

  • Interpersonal skills at different organisational level with both technical and non-technical people and ability to tailor communication approach for different stakeholder groups (Developers, Business, Operations Users)

  • Prior experience in the Merchant Solutions, Acquiring or payment processing area.

  • Significant prior experience working in an Agile environment as well as in building complex solution designs and User Story writing


Our values define the working environment we strive to create – diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer.


We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.


Click here to find out more about our diversity and inclusion policy and initiatives.
_source.position_name: Senior Business Analyst Corporate Bank Technology (m/w/d) at Deutsche Bank AG (Eschborn, Germany)

_source.description:
Please find English version below.IT Lead Engineer Cash Services Corporate Bank Technology ist fanduuml;r die Entwicklung und den Betrieb aller zur Corporate Bank / Unternehmensbank gehandouml;rigen Applikationen verantwortlich. Wir unterstanduuml;tzen somit technologielastige Geschandauml;ftsbereiche, die in enger Kooperation mit uns arbeiten und die voll hinter der neuen IT-Strategie der Deutschen Bank stehen.Wir sind eine globale Organisation und Sie werden auandszlig;er mit unseren deutschen Kollegen sehr eng mit Partnern in unseren internationalen Standorten arbeiten. Die Weiterentwicklung unseres deutschen Standorts eine Prioritandauml;t. Deshalb wachsen wir weiter vor Ort in Deutschland mit starkem Fokus auf Ingenieurskultur und Eigenentwicklung im Rahmen unserer kommunizierten Strategie.Historisch bedingt ist der aktuelle Kundenstamm der Corporate Bank in Deutschland auf zwei groandszlig;e Systemplattformen und Prozesslandschaften verteilt. Dies schrandauml;nkt aktuell neue Geschandauml;ftsideen ein und verhindert Synergien zu erzielen.Der Lead Engineer arbeitet mit unseren Kunden innerhalb von Cash Services zusammen, um IT-Landouml;sungen anhand der fachlichen Anforderungen zu entwerfen. Bis eine mandouml;gliche Systemkonsolidierung erreicht wird, manduuml;ssen dabei Landouml;sungsansandauml;tze und Stufenplandauml;ne unter Beranduuml;cksichtigung der Koexistenz der Plattformen entwickelt werden.VerantwortlichkeitenEntwicklung geeigneter Landouml;sungen und Services, die den Kundenanforderungen entsprechen und entsprechenden Mehrwert bieten
Analyse vorhandener Geschandauml;ftsprozesse und der zugrunde liegenden Systemlandschaft
Entwicklung einer stufenweise Umsetzungsplanung basierend auf fachlichen und technischen Prioritandauml;ten
Steuerung des technischen Softwareentwicklungsteam und verantwortlich fanduuml;r die ordnungsgemandauml;andszlig;e und zeitnahe Projektdurchfanduuml;hrung
Aktive, regelmandauml;andszlig;ige Kommunikation mit dem Team und den Geschandauml;ftsbereichen um die Kundenzufriedenheit sowie die Projektziele zu anduuml;berpranduuml;fen
Unterstanduuml;tzung und Beratung des Geschandauml;ftsbereichs beim Vergleich und der Auswahl von Technologielandouml;sungen
Persandouml;nliche und fachliche AnforderungenBachelor- oder Masterabschluss in Informatik, Software Engineering oder Mathematik (idealerweise kombiniert mit Finanz- oder Geschandauml;ftskenntnissen)
Mehrjandauml;hrige Berufserfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung mitsamt vertiefter Kenntnisse und praktischer Erfahrung in Programmiersprachen und -tools, insbesondere Java, Webservices (RESTful-Diensten), Datenbanken
Sehr gute Kenntnisse der Architekturkonzepte, insbesondere des Microservice-Architekturparadigmas, des container- und ereignisbasierten Anwendungsdesigns
Kenntnisse und Erfahrungen in Cloud-Umgebungen, idealerweise Google Cloud Platform
Starke analytische Fandauml;higkeiten zur Problemlandouml;sung sowie strukturierte Herangehensweise um Ideen in Konzepte, Design und Code umzuwandeln sowie gute Kommunikationsfandauml;higkeiten in der englischen Sprache (in Wort und Schrift)
Erfahrung in der Steuerung von Softwareentwicklungsteams sowie Fandauml;higkeit, in einer weitgehend virtuellen Organisation erfolgreich zu sein
Wenn Sie Fragen zum Rekrutierungsprozess haben sollten, wenden Sie sich bitte an Marvin Hamann +49(69)910-45482.IT Lead Engineer Cash ServicesCorporate Bank Technology is responsible for all development and production of applications owned by the Corporate Bank. As such, we support technology centric businesses that work in very close partnership with us and that are fully committed to DBandrsquo;s IT strategy.We are a fundamentally global organization and you will work very closely with stakeholders in our international locations. However, our German location is a priority for us and we are growing locally with a heavy engineering focus in line with our strategy.Due to it's origin, the current client base of the Corporate Bank in Germany is distributed across 2 major system platforms. Thus a substantial part of the process landscape have not been harmonized yet, which is preventing our business to achieve synergies and also limiting new business opportunities.The lead technology engineer works with our clients within Cash Services to design and align IT solutions with their business requirements / objectives and budgetary needs, and then implement those solutions. While a system consolidation is a target to aim, roadmap and solution approaches must reflect the co-existence of platforms until this target is reached.ResponsibilitiesDevelop and Recommend appropriate solutions and services that meet client needs and provide value
Analysis of existing process and underlying system landscape
Develop plans and roadmaps based on business drivers
Responsible for dev team management, monitoring, reporting and proper and timely project execution. She / He is responsible for the development team to control and manage phases of the project in hand
Communicate regularly with the team and clients to ensure client satisfaction, review client initiatives and team goals, and identify new business opportunities
Act as a subject matter and IT expert and assist customers with the technology selections
SkillsA bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, software engineering or mathematic (ideally combined with finance or business knowledge)
Profound experience in software development and experience in leading teams technically. Ability to thrive in a largely remote / virtual organization
Excellent knowledge of architectural concepts, especially microservice architectural paradigm, container-based and event-based application design. Knowledge and experience of cloud environments, ideally Google Cloud Platform
Deep knowledge and hands-on experience in programming languages and tools, esp Java, web services (RESTful services), databases (Relational DBs and No-SQL)
Excellent problem solving and analytical skills and structured approach and ability to turn ideas into concepts, design and code. Willingness to constantly update his/her understanding of technology and cutting edge methods
Proficiency in the English language, with good written and oral communication skills 
Our values define the working environment we strive to create andndash; diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer.We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.Click here to find out more about our diversity and inclusion policy and initiatives.
_source.description_html:
Please find English version below.


IT Lead Engineer Cash Services


Corporate Bank Technology ist für die Entwicklung und den Betrieb aller zur Corporate Bank / Unternehmensbank gehörigen Applikationen verantwortlich. Wir unterstützen somit technologielastige Geschäftsbereiche, die in enger Kooperation mit uns arbeiten und die voll hinter der neuen IT-Strategie der Deutschen Bank stehen.


Wir sind eine globale Organisation und Sie werden außer mit unseren deutschen Kollegen sehr eng mit Partnern in unseren internationalen Standorten arbeiten. Die Weiterentwicklung unseres deutschen Standorts eine Priorität. Deshalb wachsen wir weiter vor Ort in Deutschland mit starkem Fokus auf Ingenieurskultur und Eigenentwicklung im Rahmen unserer kommunizierten Strategie.


Historisch bedingt ist der aktuelle Kundenstamm der Corporate Bank in Deutschland auf zwei große Systemplattformen und Prozesslandschaften verteilt. Dies schränkt aktuell neue Geschäftsideen ein und verhindert Synergien zu erzielen.


Der Lead Engineer arbeitet mit unseren Kunden innerhalb von Cash Services zusammen, um IT-Lösungen anhand der fachlichen Anforderungen zu entwerfen. Bis eine mögliche Systemkonsolidierung erreicht wird, müssen dabei Lösungsansätze und Stufenpläne unter Berücksichtigung der Koexistenz der Plattformen entwickelt werden.


Verantwortlichkeiten



  • Entwicklung geeigneter Lösungen und Services, die den Kundenanforderungen entsprechen und entsprechenden Mehrwert bieten

  • Analyse vorhandener Geschäftsprozesse und der zugrunde liegenden Systemlandschaft

  • Entwicklung einer stufenweise Umsetzungsplanung basierend auf fachlichen und technischen Prioritäten

  • Steuerung des technischen Softwareentwicklungsteam und verantwortlich für die ordnungsgemäße und zeitnahe Projektdurchführung

  • Aktive, regelmäßige Kommunikation mit dem Team und den Geschäftsbereichen um die Kundenzufriedenheit sowie die Projektziele zu überprüfen

  • Unterstützung und Beratung des Geschäftsbereichs beim Vergleich und der Auswahl von Technologielösungen


Persönliche und fachliche Anforderungen



  • Bachelor- oder Masterabschluss in Informatik, Software Engineering oder Mathematik (idealerweise kombiniert mit Finanz- oder Geschäftskenntnissen)

  • Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung mitsamt vertiefter Kenntnisse und praktischer Erfahrung in Programmiersprachen und -tools, insbesondere Java, Webservices (RESTful-Diensten), Datenbanken

  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse der Architekturkonzepte, insbesondere des Microservice-Architekturparadigmas, des container- und ereignisbasierten Anwendungsdesigns

  • Kenntnisse und Erfahrungen in Cloud-Umgebungen, idealerweise Google Cloud Platform

  • Starke analytische Fähigkeiten zur Problemlösung sowie strukturierte Herangehensweise um Ideen in Konzepte, Design und Code umzuwandeln sowie gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in der englischen Sprache (in Wort und Schrift)

  • Erfahrung in der Steuerung von Softwareentwicklungsteams sowie Fähigkeit, in einer weitgehend virtuellen Organisation erfolgreich zu sein


Wenn Sie Fragen zum Rekrutierungsprozess haben sollten, wenden Sie sich bitte an Marvin Hamann +49(69)910-45482.



IT Lead Engineer Cash Services


Corporate Bank Technology is responsible for all development and production of applications owned by the Corporate Bank. As such, we support technology centric businesses that work in very close partnership with us and that are fully committed to DB’s IT strategy.


We are a fundamentally global organization and you will work very closely with stakeholders in our international locations. However, our German location is a priority for us and we are growing locally with a heavy engineering focus in line with our strategy.


Due to it's origin, the current client base of the Corporate Bank in Germany is distributed across 2 major system platforms. Thus a substantial part of the process landscape have not been harmonized yet, which is preventing our business to achieve synergies and also limiting new business opportunities.


The lead technology engineer works with our clients within Cash Services to design and align IT solutions with their business requirements / objectives and budgetary needs, and then implement those solutions. While a system consolidation is a target to aim, roadmap and solution approaches must reflect the co-existence of platforms until this target is reached.


Responsibilities



  • Develop and Recommend appropriate solutions and services that meet client needs and provide value

  • Analysis of existing process and underlying system landscape

  • Develop plans and roadmaps based on business drivers

  • Responsible for dev team management, monitoring, reporting and proper and timely project execution. She / He is responsible for the development team to control and manage phases of the project in hand

  • Communicate regularly with the team and clients to ensure client satisfaction, review client initiatives and team goals, and identify new business opportunities

  • Act as a subject matter and IT expert and assist customers with the technology selections


Skills



  • A bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, software engineering or mathematic (ideally combined with finance or business knowledge)

  • Profound experience in software development and experience in leading teams technically. Ability to thrive in a largely remote / virtual organization

  • Excellent knowledge of architectural concepts, especially microservice architectural paradigm, container-based and event-based application design. Knowledge and experience of cloud environments, ideally Google Cloud Platform

  • Deep knowledge and hands-on experience in programming languages and tools, esp Java, web services (RESTful services), databases (Relational DBs and No-SQL)

  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills and structured approach and ability to turn ideas into concepts, design and code. Willingness to constantly update his/her understanding of technology and cutting edge methods

  • Proficiency in the English language, with good written and oral communication skills


Our values define the working environment we strive to create – diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer.


We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.


Click here to find out more about our diversity and inclusion policy and initiatives.
_source.position_name: Lead Engineer Cash Services (m/w/d) at Deutsche Bank AG (Eschborn, Germany)

Professional experience with security and privacy (e.g. anonymization of PII)

Ansible and Terraform
Docker and Kubernetes
Git, GitLab and GitLab CI

_source.description_html:
Get to know us


eyeo is an open source software company whose market-leading ad-filtering technology powers products like Adblock Plus, Adblock and Adblock Browser, and whose privacy-first products like Crumbs promote transparency and an improved browsing experience. eyeo is dedicated to giving users control of their online experience while fostering a sustainable online value exchange to offer creators, publishers and advertisers more ways to earn money for the content they provide.


In combining our reach of distribution partnerships and our own products, our technology runs on over 225 million devices.


At eyeo, we’re passionate about user agency, personal privacy, sustainability and keeping the web an open, fair resource for everyone.


How we work


eyeo has colleagues based all over the world. We practice agile and work in distributed, cross-functional teams that span nearly every timezone. Many of our tech teams prefer to work asynchronously.


After your morning coffee, you'll be expected to...



  • Support data engineers and scientists, as well as other engineering teams

  • Manage on-prem servers and services

  • Extend and evolve eyeo’s data platform (on-prem and Google Cloud Platform)

  • Automate anything and everything

  • Continuously improve code, processes and service quality

  • Monitor existing automation and CI/CD infrastructure


What you bring to the table...



  • Strong foundation in Golang and Python

  • Proficient with the Unix/Linux command line and shell scripting

  • Solid foundation in infrastructure or software engineering

  • Professional experience with at least one infrastructure-as-code tool stack

  • Professional experience with security and privacy (e.g. anonymization of PII)

  • Experience with containers (e.g. Docker)

  • Fluent in English, verbal and written

  • Comfortable with remote work within CET ±3 hours supported by issue tracking systems and documenting work in writing


It's awesome, but not required, if you have experience with...



  • Debian GNU/Linux

  • Ansible & Terraform

  • Docker & Kubernetes

  • Git, GitLab & GitLab CI

  • Apache Airflow


What we offer



  • Work from home or one of our offices —we trust you to find what works best for you

  • Stipend for one of the following: home office or relocation

  • Flexible working hours

  • 28 days paid vacation

  • Personal and professional development budget

  • Monthly child care stipend for children under 6

  • Offsite team days and the annual summer company retreat in Cologne

  • Company-sponsored hackathons


Privacy Notice


When you apply, you’ll be automatically forwarded to our recruitment platform operated by an external service provider called Greenhouse (seated in the US). Greenhouse collects some information on its website, such as anonymous usage statistics, by using cookies, server logs, and other similar technology. For more information, please refer to Greenhouse’s Privacy Policy. All documents and information provided by you are stored with Greenhouse. In order to ensure an adequate level of data protection, eyeo and Greenhouse have entered into the EU Standard Contractual Clauses (“processors”) - Commission Decision C(2010)593. You can request a copy of this by contacting us at privacy[at]eyeo.com. If you don’t want your data forwarded to Greenhouse, please do not apply. For detailed and further information, please refer to our Privacy Policy at https://eyeo.com/en/privacy.

2+ years of experience leading and mentoring experts and teams

Ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organisation and creating an understanding of technical needs and investments
Openness to feedback and interest in working in a multicultural environment
Preferably, a degree in Information Technology, Software Engineering or a related field
Excellent English skills

_source.description_html:
We Want You:


Are you an expert who can develop, deliver, and support applications in which data is received from, or rapidly made available to users of the systems with the highest degree of integrity? Are you highly fueled, and can you work closely with our Software Development Teams to develop innovative software applications and update or modify existing applications? As a Mobile Application Engineer, you will partake in rapid development projects processing users’ needs to customise software for computer programs, design prototype applications, implements, and test source code, as well as troubleshoot software applications.



You Bring:



  • At least 3 years’ experience within a development environment (preferably mobile and application);

  • IT Diploma/Degree: Computer Engineering or Software Programming;

  • Good written and verbal communication skills;

  • Strong attention to detail;

  • Proficiency in project tracking software (e.g. Jira);

  • Experience in programming languages (Java, C#, CSS, HTML, JavaScript, Typescript, NodeJS, etc);

  • Production development experience in hybrid and native mobile development (Ionic or React native or native Android development or IOS swift development, etc);

  • Strong exposure to the SDLC, Cyber Security skills, Testing environment and UI/UX components.



What You’ll Do:



  • Design solutions using the most appropriate approved architectural pattern;

  • Ensure design meets best practices and is Test, DevOps, and Support friendly;

  • Identify potential alternative strategies and refactor approaches for maximum benefit within the shortest possible time;

  • Deliver an appropriate solution that facilitates the accomplishments of specified tasks and objectives comprehensively, whilst excluding unnecessary steps;

  • Ensure checked-in code is reviewed to ensure standards are met and the code base is sound;

  • Deliver a solution in which effective/efficient resource utilisation of system resources occurs during operation;

  • Deliver a solution that ensures the maximum operational capacity requirement is achieved or exceeded;

  • Ensure the system logically supports user self-learning on how to use the system with effectiveness and efficiency;

  • Ensure the solution is accessible and can be used by people with the widest range of characteristics, capabilities, cultures, and languages where appropriate;

  • Improve fault tolerance even when operational conditions are not optimal;

  • Ensure the solution is secure, and confidential by protecting all information and data (as well as data transmission);

  • Ensure persons or other solutions have the degree of access appropriate to their level of authorisation and types;

  • Ensure the solution has high integrity where the solution prevents unauthorised access to, modification of computer programs, data, or settings;

  • Ensure the solution has a high degree of survivability despite third-party interventions (attacks, human errors, hardware or software faults);

  • Employ logs and records so that actions and events can be proven to have taken place and cannot be disputed/ repudiated later;

  • Ensure relevant documentation is provided to support teams to reduce the development support burden;

  • Ensure the adaptable solution delivered is appropriate for different or evolving hardware, software, or other operational usage environments;

  • Provide support to the Dev Support when required during operational events and create or assist with the creation of SOP’s;

  • Perform troubleshooting and effectively resolve issues to increase solution stability and reduce intervention required over time;

  • Assess risk and impact of production issues/changes and take appropriate steps to mitigate risk;

  • Take corrective action when deviation from the plan is observed.


The Company We Keep:


At BET Software, we don't just recruit talent, we cultivate it. Our learning and development programmes, our various opportunities for growth, and our well-deserved incentives are what keep our All-Star Team the best amongst the rest.



Only candidates who meet the minimum requirements will be considered for this opportunity.


If you have not been contacted within 30 days, kindly consider your application to be unsuccessful.

_source.description:
Mobile Engineer* (iOS or Android) 80-100%Your team is responsible for the websites and apps for some of the largest media brands in Switzerland, such as Tages-Anzeiger or Tribune de Genandegrave;ve, reaching a million daily users. As a team we want to build state of the art digital products our customers love.Together with a team of frontend and backend developers you are dedicated to building our digital newspapers. Collaborate closely with the tech lead and product owner on new initiatives, including building a hybrid app.Requirements:4+ years experience in software engineering including 2+ years in mobile native development (Swift for iOS and/or Java/Kotlin for Android)
Deep experience with various aspects of a mobile application lifecycle (prototyping, design and implementation, release, performance, debugging, security)
Understanding of modern web frontend frameworks (React, Vue or Angular) and interest in hybrid apps
A desire to share your expertise and mentor other team members
An ability to engage with business stakeholders, designers and software engineers from other teams to jointly craft the best solutions possible
Nice to have:Experience with REST, in-app purchases, push notifications
Experience integrating webviews into a mobile app
Interest in leading a small team of developers
Experience with Firebase or similar
About the ProductOur web front-end platform was relaunched in 2020. The platform was completely rebuilt on a modern tech stack, leveraging TypeScript, React, and the open source Next.js framework for a seamless single-page application experience. Server-side rendering provides a fast initial load and excellent SEO optimization. We handle a sustained load of 150'000 requests/min, with peaks regularly exceeding 300'000.In order to iterate rapidly and have new features reach usersandrsquo; hands as quickly as possible, we have a modern CI/CD workflow where we deploy to production multiple times per day.Now, we want to bring this same rapid iteration cycle to our native app. To that end, weandrsquo;re looking into integrating parts of the web front-end into our native apps. However, itandrsquo;s very important that the native app delivers a premium user experience, so some things will certainly remain native. Help us find the best mix of both worlds!About the TeamOur news platform is built in-house, by our international team of smart and talented software engineers based in Zurich and Belgrade. Communication within the team and with other stakeholders is mostly in English. We value work-life balance and have flexible working hours, 25 vacation days and vacation purchase days. Your place of work is in the heart of Zurich and wherever you work best andndash; you will have the possibility of working partially remotely.We see digitization as an opportunity to successfully lead our quality journalism into the future with technology and innovation. To do this, we need outstanding employees. That's why we have high standards, attract talented people and keep them. With us, they find room for good work and opportunities for individual development.About the CompanyThe TX Group is a large private Swiss media group and has been listed on the Swiss Stock Exchange since 2000. Founded in 1893, the company now has around 3,400 employees in Switzerland, Luxembourg, Germany, Serbia, and Austria. As such, TX Group plays an active role in supporting and guiding these companies to further success.This is a great place to be an engineer - come join us and build the technology that delivers quality independent journalism!
_source.description_html:
Mobile Engineer* (iOS or Android) 80-100%


Your team is responsible for the websites and apps for some of the largest media brands in Switzerland, such as Tages-Anzeiger or Tribune de Genève, reaching a million daily users. As a team we want to build state of the art digital products our customers love.


Together with a team of frontend and backend developers you are dedicated to building our digital newspapers. Collaborate closely with the tech lead and product owner on new initiatives, including building a hybrid app.


Requirements:



  • 4+ years experience in software engineering including 2+ years in mobile native development (Swift for iOS and/or Java/Kotlin for Android)

  • Deep experience with various aspects of a mobile application lifecycle (prototyping, design & implementation, release, performance, debugging, security)

  • Understanding of modern web frontend frameworks (React, Vue or Angular) and interest in hybrid apps

  • A desire to share your expertise and mentor other team members

  • An ability to engage with business stakeholders, designers and software engineers from other teams to jointly craft the best solutions possible


Nice to have:



  • Experience with REST, in-app purchases, push notifications

  • Experience integrating webviews into a mobile app

  • Interest in leading a small team of developers

  • Experience with Firebase or similar


About the Product


Our web front-end platform was relaunched in 2020. The platform was completely rebuilt on a modern tech stack, leveraging TypeScript, React, and the open source Next.js framework for a seamless single-page application experience. Server-side rendering provides a fast initial load and excellent SEO optimization. We handle a sustained load of 150'000 requests/min, with peaks regularly exceeding 300'000.


In order to iterate rapidly and have new features reach users’ hands as quickly as possible, we have a modern CI/CD workflow where we deploy to production multiple times per day.


Now, we want to bring this same rapid iteration cycle to our native app. To that end, we’re looking into integrating parts of the web front-end into our native apps. However, it’s very important that the native app delivers a premium user experience, so some things will certainly remain native. Help us find the best mix of both worlds!


About the Team


Our news platform is built in-house, by our international team of smart and talented software engineers based in Zurich and Belgrade. Communication within the team and with other stakeholders is mostly in English. We value work-life balance and have flexible working hours, 25 vacation days and vacation purchase days. Your place of work is in the heart of Zurich and wherever you work best – you will have the possibility of working partially remotely.


We see digitization as an opportunity to successfully lead our quality journalism into the future with technology and innovation. To do this, we need outstanding employees. That's why we have high standards, attract talented people and keep them. With us, they find room for good work and opportunities for individual development.


About the Company


The TX Group is a large private Swiss media group and has been listed on the Swiss Stock Exchange since 2000. Founded in 1893, the company now has around 3,400 employees in Switzerland, Luxembourg, Germany, Serbia, and Austria. As such, TX Group plays an active role in supporting and guiding these companies to further success.


This is a great place to be an engineer - come join us and build the technology that delivers quality independent journalism!
_source.position_name: Mobile Engineer* (iOS or Android) 80-100% at TX Group (Zürich, Switzerland)

_source.description_html:
Who we are


In a life without sound, our work provides meaning. As a leading provider of innovative hearing care solutions, we are not just a company that makes products: we are a team on a mission to help people enjoy the delight of hearing. To enable a life without limitations, we – through our core business brands Phonak, Unitron, Hansaton, Advanced Bionics and AudioNova – develop, manufacture and distribute solutions that push the limits of technology and redefine the future of our industry.








Staefa, Switzerland










Embedded Software Engineer










In a multidisciplinary team of electrical and software engineers, you will contribute to the design, development and the maintenance of firmware and software components. The developed tools are in use worldwide to support the entire lifecycle of all Sonova hearing instruments and products. From the engineering phases to the mass-manufacturing you will be engaged in delivering highly flexible and reliable firmware and software applications.


Your tasks



  • Close-to-metal firmware implementation, testing, bug fixing and documentation of production related components

  • Work on a C-code base built with an object oriented approach

  • Contribute in the test process plans, definition and implementation

  • Contribute to the specification and design of test devices and systems (hardware and software)

  • Agile software development, code reviews and interdisciplinary collaboration

  • Support the users of the developed components

  • Support for manufacturing engineering and process improvements


Your profile



  • University degree (MSc/BSc) in electrical engineering or computer science

  • 3+ years of experience in the development, deployment and maintenance of real-time systems

  • Experienced in object oriented thinking and development

  • Solid embedded C knowledge; Python, .net and C# are a plus

  • Systematic approach to debugging, strong analytical and problem-solving skills

  • Service oriented and willing to support peer developers

  • Fluent in English; German is a plus


Our offer


We can offer you a new challenge, with interesting tasks and much more – including an open corporate culture, flat hierarchies, support for further training and development, opportunities to take on responsibility, an excellent range of foods, sports and cultural facilities, attractive employment conditions, and flexible working time models in various roles.


Gianni S. Raffi, Senior Talent Acquisition Manager, is looking forward to receiving your complete application (cover letter, CV, references and certificates) via our online job application platform.



For this vacancy only direct applications will be considered.



Sonova AG
Laubisrüt istrasse 28
CH-8712 Stäfa
+41 58 928 01 01








Sonova is an equal opportunity employer.


We team up. We grow talent. We collaborate with people of diverse backgrounds to win with the best team in the market place. We guarantee every person equal treatment in regard to employment and opportunity for employment, regardless of a candidate’s ethnic or national origin, religion, sexual orientation or marital status, gender, genetic identity, age, disability or any other legally protected status.

_source.description:
Join a fast growing startup, where youandrsquo;ll have impact from day one! Weandrsquo;re looking for an experienced engineering manager who has been managing engineering teams successfully before and has the desire to join us on our journey to become a successful international scale-up.
For us, the engineering manager is first and foremost a people role. You will not be expected to touch the codebase on a regular basis - your key mission is to be there for your teams, but also be a strong communicator to stakeholders in connected parts of the business. This means you will have strong working relationships with product managers, your colleagues in engineering leadership - and of course your team and their leads.
We expect you to be an expert when it comes to hiring and building successful teams, as well as finding and attracting the right talent to Worksome.
The engineering manager is still a technical profile, as you are expected to facilitate technology and architectural discussions across teams as well as support your team in solving complex problems.About the jobWork closely with the development team and product managers to come up with ideal solutions to current challenges
Build and maintain high-performance teams through hiring for the future, both with technology and culture in mind
Focus on and nurture the personal and professional development of the engineers reporting to you
Improve and build new processes to enable your teams to achieve their goals and impact productivity and efficiency
Involve yourself in team planning, make sure teams are aligned and are working towards and are achieving their goals
Collaborate with your team as well as other stakeholders and make sure expectations are set and met across the organization
About you2+ years of relevant engineering management experience
Experience as a technology professional, preferably from the SaaS industry
Experience building high-performance teams through both hiring and professional development
Track record of recruiting and retaining software engineering talent
Experience building an engineering culture that empowers teams to build great products
Experience with scalable microservice architecture
Refined prioritization skills - able to focus your time and energy where itandrsquo;ll have the most impact
Collaborative, upbeat work ethic where you can take ownership and have fun
TECHNOLOGIES AND TOOLS WE USEPHP 8
Laravel
GraphQL
Vue.js
Docker
Kubernetes
MySQL
Redis
GitHub (Incl. Actions)
JIRA
Notion
CHALLENGES OUR TEAMS ARE SOLVINGExpanding the feature set in our product to satisfy our users
Tweaking our search algorithm to deliver the most relevant results
Exploring cutting-edge methods for matching profiles with jobs (ML/AI/DL)
Creating an awesome mobile experience in a web app
Making our users feel good through great UX and usability
Optimizing load and response time in our web app
Building scalable infrastructure
WE OFFERCompetitive salary
Equity plan
Pension- and private health insurance plans
6 weeks of paid vacation
Relocation assistance if required
Attractive office location in central Copenhagen
Coffee, lunch, snacks, and soft drinks included
An annual trip to a developer conference
_source.description_html:
Join a fast growing startup, where you’ll have impact from day one!


We’re looking for an experienced engineering manager who has been managing engineering teams successfully before and has the desire to join us on our journey to become a successful international scale-up.



For us, the engineering manager is first and foremost a people role. You will not be expected to touch the codebase on a regular basis - your key mission is to be there for your teams, but also be a strong communicator to stakeholders in connected parts of the business. This means you will have strong working relationships with product managers, your colleagues in engineering leadership - and of course your team and their leads.



We expect you to be an expert when it comes to hiring and building successful teams, as well as finding and attracting the right talent to Worksome.



The engineering manager is still a technical profile, as you are expected to facilitate technology and architectural discussions across teams as well as support your team in solving complex problems.


About the job



  • Work closely with the development team and product managers to come up with ideal solutions to current challenges

  • Build and maintain high-performance teams through hiring for the future, both with technology and culture in mind

  • Focus on and nurture the personal and professional development of the engineers reporting to you

  • Improve and build new processes to enable your teams to achieve their goals and impact productivity and efficiency

  • Involve yourself in team planning, make sure teams are aligned and are working towards and are achieving their goals

  • Collaborate with your team as well as other stakeholders and make sure expectations are set and met across the organization


About you



  • 2+ years of relevant engineering management experience

  • Experience as a technology professional, preferably from the SaaS industry

  • Experience building high-performance teams through both hiring and professional development

  • Track record of recruiting and retaining software engineering talent

  • Experience building an engineering culture that empowers teams to build great products

  • Experience with scalable microservice architecture

  • Refined prioritization skills - able to focus your time and energy where it’ll have the most impact

  • Collaborative, upbeat work ethic where you can take ownership and have fun


TECHNOLOGIES AND TOOLS WE USE



  • PHP 8

  • Laravel

  • GraphQL

  • Vue.js

  • Docker

  • Kubernetes

  • MySQL

  • Redis

  • GitHub (Incl. Actions)

  • JIRA

  • Notion


CHALLENGES OUR TEAMS ARE SOLVING



  • Expanding the feature set in our product to satisfy our users

  • Tweaking our search algorithm to deliver the most relevant results

  • Exploring cutting-edge methods for matching profiles with jobs (ML/AI/DL)

  • Creating an awesome mobile experience in a web app

  • Making our users feel good through great UX and usability

  • Optimizing load and response time in our web app

  • Building scalable infrastructure


WE OFFER



  • Competitive salary

  • Equity plan

  • Pension- & private health insurance plans

  • 6 weeks of paid vacation

  • Relocation assistance if required

  • Attractive office location in central Copenhagen

  • Coffee, lunch, snacks, and soft drinks included

  • An annual trip to a developer conference
_source.position_name: Engineering Manager at Worksome ApS (København, Denmark)

_source.description_html:
Wir suchen Dich als:



SENIOR WEB ENTWICKLER (M/W/D)





DAS ERWARTET DICH BEI UNS:




  • Dein Arbeitsvertrag: Ist unbefristet bei einem der Top Arbeitgeber Mittelstand 2020 (Focus-Business)

  • Intensive Einarbeitung: Damit Du schnell im Team durchstarten kannst, durchläufst Du einen umfangreichen Onboardingprozess, bei dem Du Dein Team kennenlernst und auf Deine neue Tätigkeit vorbereitet wirst

  • Faires Gehalt: Attraktives und leistungsorientiertes Gehaltspaket

  • Unbegrenzte Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten: Workshops, Zertifizierungen und vieles mehr

  • Dein Wohlfühlfaktor: Flexible Arbeitszeiten, mobiles Arbeiten oder Arbeiten im Office in der Mainzer Altstadt

  • Deine Goodies: E-Bike Leasing und optionale Firmenwagennutzung

  • Gemeinsame Events: Mitarbeitertreffen, Teamevents sowie Sommerfest und Weihnachtsfeier

  • Ein großartiges familienfreundliches Team: Wir wollen uns gegenseitig unterstützen und gemeinsam wachsen



DEINE AUFGABEN:



Als Senior Web Entwickler/in unterstützt Du unsere Kunden aus verschiedensten Branchen bei der Implementierung von Softwarelösungen gesamtheitlich, oder nur mit dem Fokus auf Front- oder Backend. Du berätst und interagierst mit unseren Kunden und deinen ilum:e Kolleg/innen bei der Umsetzung von komplexen CRM-Lösungen bis hin zu Single Page Applications für Desktop, Tablets und Smartphone. Du sorgst dafür, dass die Anforderungen durch Deine Erfahrungen und Best Practices fachgerecht umgesetzt werden und wirkst z. B. bei der Festlegung der Gesamtarchitektur aktiv mit.


Je nach Präferenz besteht die Möglichkeit sich auf den Bereich Frontend oder Backend zu fokussieren. Unsere Frontend Entwickler/innen sorgen dafür, dass die Anforderungen an Design und Usability fachgerecht umgesetzt werden. Neben der Umsetzung der Design-Anforderungen sind sie in der Lage die Anwendungen mittels WebServices mit den Backend-Systemen zu verbinden.



DAFÜR SOLLTEST DU MIT­BRINGEN:




  • Erfahrung mit gängigen Front- und/oder Backend-Frameworks (z. B. Laravel, Symphony, React, Vue oder Angular)

  • Erfahrung mit der Integration von Backend-Systemen über WebServices

  • Gute Kenntnisse in der Webentwicklung (z. B. PHP, JavaScript, HTML, CSS)

  • Routinierter Umgang mit Entwicklertools (Git, CLI, Jira, IDE's, Build-Tools)

  • Fließende Deutschkenntnisse (mind. B2 Level) und gute Englischkenntnisse

_source.description:
At OpenUnited, we are creating a new platform and innovative model that helps digital talent around the world to develop skills, and to have long-term paying digital work whilst ensuring the sustainability of the open source ecosystem.We are now live in our beta phase whereby the platform is live at https://openunited.com/ and we have made our code repositories public at: https://github.com/OpenUnited/product-factory-composerHelp us build the future of digital work at OpenUnited. Getting Started

1) Join our discord server: https://discord.gg/T3xevYvWey 2) Register at https://openunited.com/ and create your profile 3) Fork our repos on GitHub https://github.com/OpenUnited/product-factory-composer andzwj;4) Get OpenUnited running on your development machine (see the README in the repo) 

5) Claim and complete a task on OpenUnited https://openunited.com/meta/openunited-product-factory/tasks When you are done with the task, issue a pull request and (IMPORTANT) make sure you complete the steps in OpenUnited to have this added to your portfolio. 

After you have collected 50 non-liquid points by working on tasks on Open Products like OpenUnited itself (https://openunited.com/meta/openunited-product-factory/tasks), you are eligible to claim tasks with liquid points that are convertible into payment.

We are now live in our beta phase whereby the platform is live at https://openunited.com/ and we have made our code repositories public at: https://github.com/OpenUnited/product-factory-composer


Help us build the future of digital work at OpenUnited.


Getting Started

2) Register at https://openunited.com/ and create your profile


3) Fork our repos on GitHub https://github.com/OpenUnited/product-factory-composer ‍


4) Get OpenUnited running on your development machine (see the README in the repo)

5) Claim and complete a task on OpenUnited https://openunited.com/meta/openunited-product-factory/tasks When you are done with the task, issue a pull request and (IMPORTANT) make sure you complete the steps in OpenUnited to have this added to your portfolio.


After you have collected 50 non-liquid points by working on tasks on Open Products like OpenUnited itself (https://openunited.com/meta/openunited-product-factory/tasks), you are eligible to claim tasks with liquid points that are convertible into payment.

_source.description:
About this Role:Pacaso is seeking an ambitious, creative government relations executive to lead the organization's advocacy before state and local government agencies and elected leaders across the US West Coast and other expansion markets. This leader will work closely with the Pacaso executive team providing counsel on business, policy and corporate reputation issues. Key focus areas include: positioning the company for positive government affairs outcomes through external communications about the company and its business model; developing domestic policy recommendations to support the company's expansion plans; developing and executing a comprehensive political affairs plan; forming and owning relationships with senior leaders at all levels of government; partnering with legal stakeholders to shape policy decisions; and managing outside consultants.What You'll Do:Create a vision and strategy for the function to continue to meet the needs of an evolving business, with a focus on efficiently expanding geographic impact and enhancing core competencies in advocacy, communication engagement, and coalition building.
Advocate for and represent Pacaso at the state and local level
About You:Bachelor's degree plus minimum of 6+ years of public affairs and communications experience and strong business acumen.
Comprehensive understanding of sensitivities inherent to the housing industry, or experience supporting a disruptor in a high-growth phase.
Demonstrated experience advocating on behalf of a complex, rapidly-growing business in an uncertain political environment.
Strong understanding of how the political and social landscape affects and shapes Pacaso's ability to achieve its communications, policy and business objectives.
Strong strategic thinking skills, grounded in a sophisticated understanding of the political process.
Strong negotiation skills.
The ability to assess and timely communicate government relations outcomes and changes to the company's advocacy prospects.
Willingness to roll up your sleeves and get the job done in a rapidly scaling environment.
The ability to listen and challenge respectfully, and bring together diverse perspectives and priorities toward an aligned goal.
Composure in dynamic, high-pressure situations.
You'll love working at Pacaso because of our ...Amazing purpose-driven team and culture.
Competitive salary and stock options.
Unlimited, flexible PTO for exempt employees.
Excellent medical, dental and vision insurance.
401(k) to help you save for the future.
Paid maternity and paternity leave.
Generous home office stipend.
Company-sponsored meetups.

FunctieomschrijvingBen jij een ervaren .NET developer, en heb je daarbij interesse in de mensen en processen om je heen? We zijn op zoek naar iemand die het verschil kan en wil maken. Als ervaren developer probeer je het beste uit je team naar boven te halen. Je maakt samen met je team technische afwegingen, je begeleidt je teamleden waar nodig, en je communiceert met jouw collega's vanuit de Business units om tot het beste eindresultaat te komen.Zie jij jezelf dit dagelijks doen? Dan ben je bij Maxdoro op de juiste plek!Dit zijn wij
Wij zijn Maxdoro. Een IT bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in het ontwikkelen van enterprise cloud-oplossingen van zowel web- als mobiele applicaties. Kwaliteit is de basis van ons bestaansrechten. De gedreven vakmensen van Maxdoro hebben maar andeacute;andeacute;n doel: Wij creandeuml;ren de toekomst van efficiency. Onze klanten slimmer en efficiandeuml;nter laten werken door middel van het gebruik van onze oplossingen.Hier kom je te werken
Als .Net developer ga je deel uitmaken van een Scrum development team. Daar kan je sparren met ervaren collegaandrsquo;s zoals jijzelf over het project waar je aan werkt. We beschikken over een ruime andlsquo;Woonkamerandrsquo; waar we samen lunchen, bijpraten, lekker kopje koffiedrinken, en ook regelmatig ontspannen voor een wedstrijdje tafelvoetballen of darten. Daarnaast organiseren we regelmatig kennissessies, zodat je altijd op de hoogte blijft van de nieuwste ontwikkelingen. Het is voor ons belangrijk dat je passie hebt voor het vak en dat je met plezier werkt aan onze gezamenlijke toekomst.Dit ben jij
We kunnen nu een hele lange lijst maken van de kennis die je moet hebben, maar eigenlijk willen we gewoon van je weten wat jij allemaal kan. Het minste wat we van je vragen is:Ruime ervaring als .Net Developer,
het bouwen en verbeteren van code is jouw passie,
je bent initiatiefrijk en streeft ernaar continu verbeteringen aan te brengen,
jouw manier van werken is gebaseerd op wederzijds respect.
Dit bieden we jou
Wanneer je voor Maxdoro komt werken krijg je een goed salaris dat past bij wie je bent en wat je kunt. Daarnaast hebben we voor je:Goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden
Een pensioenregeling
Eventuele een lease budget
Een individueel ontwikkelingsbudget
Kennissessies, sportsessies, jaarlijkse wintersport weekend, uitjes, en wekelijkse vrijdag borrelen
_source.description_html:
Functieomschrijving



Ben jij een ervaren .NET developer, en heb je daarbij interesse in de mensen en processen om je heen? We zijn op zoek naar iemand die het verschil kan en wil maken. Als ervaren developer probeer je het beste uit je team naar boven te halen. Je maakt samen met je team technische afwegingen, je begeleidt je teamleden waar nodig, en je communiceert met jouw collega's vanuit de Business units om tot het beste eindresultaat te komen.


Zie jij jezelf dit dagelijks doen? Dan ben je bij Maxdoro op de juiste plek!


Dit zijn wij
Wij zijn Maxdoro. Een IT bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in het ontwikkelen van enterprise cloud-oplossingen van zowel web- als mobiele applicaties. Kwaliteit is de basis van ons bestaansrechten. De gedreven vakmensen van Maxdoro hebben maar één doel: Wij creëren de toekomst van efficiency. Onze klanten slimmer en efficiënter laten werken door middel van het gebruik van onze oplossingen.


Hier kom je te werken
Als .Net developer ga je deel uitmaken van een Scrum development team. Daar kan je sparren met ervaren collega’s zoals jijzelf over het project waar je aan werkt. We beschikken over een ruime ‘Woonkamer’ waar we samen lunchen, bijpraten, lekker kopje koffiedrinken, en ook regelmatig ontspannen voor een wedstrijdje tafelvoetballen of darten. Daarnaast organiseren we regelmatig kennissessies, zodat je altijd op de hoogte blijft van de nieuwste ontwikkelingen. Het is voor ons belangrijk dat je passie hebt voor het vak en dat je met plezier werkt aan onze gezamenlijke toekomst.


Dit ben jij
We kunnen nu een hele lange lijst maken van de kennis die je moet hebben, maar eigenlijk willen we gewoon van je weten wat jij allemaal kan. Het minste wat we van je vragen is:



  • Ruime ervaring als .Net Developer,

  • het bouwen en verbeteren van code is jouw passie,

  • je bent initiatiefrijk en streeft ernaar continu verbeteringen aan te brengen,

  • jouw manier van werken is gebaseerd op wederzijds respect.


Dit bieden we jou
Wanneer je voor Maxdoro komt werken krijg je een goed salaris dat past bij wie je bent en wat je kunt. Daarnaast hebben we voor je:



  • Goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden

  • Een pensioenregeling

  • Eventuele een lease budget

  • Een individueel ontwikkelingsbudget

  • Kennissessies, sportsessies, jaarlijkse wintersport weekend, uitjes, en wekelijkse vrijdag borrelen

_source.description:
#shapeyourcareerAt foodspring, we have a dedicated commitment to putting consumers and their aspirations and needs first. To do so, we understand the importance of brand marketing as one of the main drivers to grow brand love and engage more people, more often, for longer through campaigns, events, opinion leader programs, community marketing, PR and cool activations, tailored to our ever growing roster of markets.As the Senior Brand Marketing Project Manager, you will be responsible for the development of key strategic projects in the brand marketing and partnerships space. You will have ownership for concepts from end-to-end, scope, set up the framework conditions and goals, assemble project teams, lead the execution and hand-over finalized, high-quality items ready to be implemented on market level. Taking the lead for projects in new markets will be another key responsibility for you, as you will contribute to their journey to market maturity. You will work very closely with the director of brand marketing and partnerships and act as important contributor in the strategic development of the global brand marketing and partnerships strategy. Who you will report to: Clemens Zehetner - Director of Brand Marketing and PartnershipsType: Full-timeLocation: Berlin (currently with more remote options)Team: Brand Marketing and Partnerships So, what can you expect to work on?Project ownership for strategically important topics within the area of brand marketing and partnerships
Concept development and the transfer thereof into actionable go-to-market strategies
Project ownership for high-priority projects with the goal to support their maturity journey
Strategic development of the global brand marketing plan, in close collaboration with the Director of Brand Marketing and Partnerships
Close collaboration with the regional brand marketing managers in the team and associates in the areas of consumer engagement, strategy, product development and operations
Contribution of creative ideas for global marketing campaigns and activations
Setting, measuring and reporting on KPIs regarding key projects under your leadership
 Market research, case studies and deriving action items for the area, always being on par with the latest developments in the brand marketing space
Account management for strategic partners and the joint development of exciting brand partnerships
 What you offer us:Academic degree in management, business administration, marketing or a related field
>5 years of experience in a similar role
Outstanding project management skills and experience in leadership of project teams
Experience in brand marketing in a strategic context
An entrepreneurial spirit and a "can do" attitude
The desire and ability to work in teams and with individuals from diverse cultural backgrounds
Fluency in English
Interest in an active, healthy lifestyle is a plus
 What we offer you:At foodspring, benefits mean much more than a competitive salary and company discounts. We support the growth of our core asset - our people - by offering individualized learning and growth plans for all foodspringers to support them in building their careers. We also believe in the power of feedback: we have the habit of 3 feedback check-ins per year. We feel very strongly about work-life balance and understand individual needs and expectations vary; as part of our hybrid working setup, we allow foodpsringers to balance their presence between our modern and fully renovated office in the heart of Berlin, and the comfort of their own home.But wait, there is more! Not only will you be part of a high-performing company where you can learn from the best, you will also have the opportunity to make a real impact on the future of healthy nutrition by working on unique and exciting projects, such as expanding into additional countries and developing innovative food for the foodspring community. We are not just a place to work; many of our employees build strong friendships that will last a lifetime and help them to call Berlin as their new home. With around 200 employees coming from 24 countries - 53% of us are female, 47% are male - and thanks to activities organized by our social committee, we strive to continuously create an inclusive, open and friendly culture where every foodspringer can truly be themselves.Make an impact and Apply now!If you have any questions, please email the team at jobs@foodspring.com. For more information about us as an employer have a look at our career page: https://www.foodspring.de/en/jobs. Follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram to keep up to date with our company, culture and people!What are you waiting for? 
With my application, I accept the foodspring Privacy Policy.

#shapeyourcareer

At foodspring, we have a dedicated commitment to putting consumers and their aspirations and needs first. To do so, we understand the importance of brand marketing as one of the main drivers to grow brand love and engage more people, more often, for longer through campaigns, events, opinion leader programs, community marketing, PR and cool activations, tailored to our ever growing roster of markets.

As the Senior Brand Marketing Project Manager, you will be responsible for the development of key strategic projects in the brand marketing & partnerships space. You will have ownership for concepts from end-to-end, scope, set up the framework conditions and goals, assemble project teams, lead the execution and hand-over finalized, high-quality items ready to be implemented on market level. Taking the lead for projects in new markets will be another key responsibility for you, as you will contribute to their journey to market maturity. You will work very closely with the director of brand marketing & partnerships and act as important contributor in the strategic development of the global brand marketing & partnerships strategy.

 

Who you will report to: Clemens Zehetner â Director of Brand Marketing & Partnerships

Type: Full-time

Location: Berlin (currently with more remote options)

Team: Brand Marketing & Partnerships

 

So, what can you expect to work on?

  • Project ownership for strategically important topics within the area of brand marketing & partnerships
  • Concept development and the transfer thereof into actionable go-to-market strategies
  • Project ownership for high-priority projects with the goal to support their maturity journey
  • Strategic development of the global brand marketing plan, in close collaboration with the Director of Brand Marketing & Partnerships
  • Close collaboration with the regional brand marketing managers in the team and associates in the areas of consumer engagement, strategy, product development and operations
  • Contribution of creative ideas for global marketing campaigns and activations
  • Setting, measuring and reporting on KPIÂ´s regarding key projects under your leadership
  •  Market research, case studies and deriving action items for the area, always being on par with the latest developments in the brand marketing space
  • Account management for strategic partners and the joint development of exciting brand partnerships

 

What you offer us:

  • Academic degree in management, business administration, marketing or a related field
  • >5 years of experience in a similar role
  • Outstanding project management skills and experience in leadership of project teams
  • Experience in brand marketing in a strategic context
  • An entrepreneurial spirit and a âcan doâ attitude
  • The desire and ability to work in teams and with individuals from diverse cultural backgrounds
  • Fluency in English
  • Interest in an active, healthy lifestyle is a plus

 

What we offer you:

At foodspring, benefits mean much more than a competitive salary and company discounts. We support the growth of our core asset - our people - by offering individualized learning and growth plans for all foodspringers to support them in building their careers. We also believe in the power of feedback: we have the habit of 3 feedback check-ins per year. We feel very strongly about work-life balance and understand individual needs and expectations vary; as part of our hybrid working setup, we allow foodpsringers to balance their presence between our modern and fully renovated office in the heart of Berlin, and the comfort of their own home.

But wait, there is more! Not only will you be part of a high-performing company where you can learn from the best, you will also have the opportunity to make a real impact on the future of healthy nutrition by working on unique and exciting projects, such as expanding into additional countries and developing innovative food for the foodspring community. We are not just a place to work; many of our employees build strong friendships that will last a lifetime and help them to call Berlin as their new home. With around 200 employees coming from 24 countries â 53% of us are female, 47% are male â and thanks to activities organized by our social committee, we strive to continuously create an inclusive, open and friendly culture where every foodspringer can truly be themselves.

Make an impact and Apply now!

If you have any questions, please email the team at jobs@foodspring.com. For more information about us as an employer have a look at our career page: https://www.foodspring.de/en/jobs. Follow us on LinkedIn & Instagram to keep up to date with our company, culture and people!

What are you waiting for?

With my application, I accept the foodspring Privacy Policy.
