_source.description:
Full Stack DeveloperLocation: Hybrid / remote working with offices based in LondonTerm: Full-time, Permanent Salary: 36000 - 55000 pa + excellent benefitsAs an experienced Developer, you enjoy the challenge of improving and modernising an existing stack. You favour refactoring and continuous improvement over rewriting something from scratch. Testing and automation are some of your go-to tools to achieve this. You enjoy working in a cross functional team in an agile environment on high traffic customer facing websites and web applications. The Role: Youll take a key role in bringing the Focusrite Group platform (currently largely based on Drupal9)to the next level. Youll help us get the most out of the CMS while giving us the flexibility to work with other tools. Were going headless, using modern front-end frameworks and making more use of cloud technologies. Youll be working on making our back end scalable and performant. You'll also be working with designers writing web user interfaces in a semantic and accessible way. 
 You have a good grounding in traditional PHP / MySQL stacks and experience working with micro-services (REST APIS). 
 Youll also be joining the team on their journey as we adopt development practices like continuous integration, TDD and infrastructure as code. 
 Youll work closely with other developers, pairing remotely, implementing features and bug fixes, reviewing pull requests in an agile scrum environment. 
 Duties: Work on features and bugs for our flagship websites. 
 Write excellent, maintainable code, and take part in code reviews. 
 Discuss design and implementation details with the rest of the team. 
 Adopt modern development practices with the team. 
 Skills and experience required: Previous experience with PHP, JavaScript or similar. 
 You have experience developing with the Drupal content management system. 
 You practice test-driven development and continuous integration/deployment (we use Circle CI). 
 You are comfortable with relational databases (specifically MySQL). 
 You have experience developing applications in the cloud (preferably AWS). 
 You have worked on REST APIs (and/or graph QL). 
 You are comfortable using a modern JavaScript framework (preferably React). 
 You understand common web infrastructure tooling (CDN, databases, in memory caches, etc...). 
 You enjoy working in an Agile environment. 
 You are familiar with git-based workflows (pull requests, rebasing, etc.). We use GitHub. 
 You are comfortable writing tests, pair programming, and reviewing code. 
 Experience of any of the following would be an advantage: Good CSS knowledge (Sass). 
 Experience with ecommerce and integrating with payment gateways. 
 Experience with Node JS. 
 Experience designing REST APIs. 
 Experience with GraphQL
 About UsFocusrite plc is a global music and audio group that develops and markets music technology products. Used by audio professionals and amateur musicians alike, its solutions facilitate the high-quality production of recorded and live sound. Our audio technology brands stand together, seeking to enrich lives through music by removing barriers to creativity we make music easy to make.The Focusrite Group trades under eight established and rapidly growing brands: Focusrite, Focusrite Pro, Novation, ADAM Audio, Sequential, Martin Audio, Optimal Audio and Ampify Music. With a high-quality reputation and a rich heritage spanning decades, its brands are category leaders in the music-making industry.Music technology is an enriching space to work in and we enjoy a Group-wide open-door culture which encourages innovation. This culture, combined with a passion for the inspirational solutions we create, has led to the group winning numerous accolades, including three Queen's Awards for Enterprise and the AIM Company of the Year Award 2021.
The Focusrite Group is dedicated to building a great place to work and as an equal opportunity employer we are committed to Diversity and Inclusion. The group mission is to cultivate an equitable culture, internally and externally, where all people feel they are welcome and positively represented, whether office-based or working remotely. Equally, we recognise the major impact that climate change is having on our world and work every day towards being industry leaders in a carbon neutral future.
Benefits include flexible/hybrid working, company pension, life insurance, private healthcare, employee purchase scheme, company music events, free breakfast/lunch in the canteen at Focusrite HQ. We arrange company training sessions and encourage personal development.
_source.description_html:
Full Stack Developer

Location: Hybrid / remote working with offices based in London

Term: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £36000 - £55000 pa + excellent benefits

As an experienced Developer, you enjoy the challenge of improving and modernising an existing stack. You favour refactoring and continuous improvement over rewriting something from scratch. Testing and automation are some of your go-to tools to achieve this. You enjoy working in a cross functional team in an agile environment on high traffic customer facing websites and web applications.

The Role:

  • Youll take a key role in bringing the Focusrite Group platform (currently largely based on Drupal9)to the next level. Youll help us get the most out of the CMS while giving us the flexibility to work with other tools. Were going headless, using modern front-end frameworks and making more use of cloud technologies. Youll be working on making our back end scalable and performant. You'll also be working with designers writing web user interfaces in a semantic and accessible way.
  • You have a good grounding in traditional PHP / MySQL stacks and experience working with micro-services (REST APIS).
  • Youll also be joining the team on their journey as we adopt development practices like continuous integration, TDD and infrastructure as code.
  • Youll work closely with other developers, pairing remotely, implementing features and bug fixes, reviewing pull requests in an agile scrum environment.

Duties:

  • Work on features and bugs for our flagship websites.
  • Write excellent, maintainable code, and take part in code reviews.
  • Discuss design and implementation details with the rest of the team.
  • Adopt modern development practices with the team.

Skills and experience required:

  • Previous experience with PHP, JavaScript or similar.
  • You have experience developing with the Drupal content management system.
  • You practice test-driven development and continuous integration/deployment (we use Circle CI).
  • You are comfortable with relational databases (specifically MySQL).
  • You have experience developing applications in the cloud (preferably AWS).
  • You have worked on REST APIs (and/or graph QL).
  • You are comfortable using a modern JavaScript framework (preferably React).
  • You understand common web infrastructure tooling (CDN, databases, in memory caches, etc...).
  • You enjoy working in an Agile environment.
  • You are familiar with git-based workflows (pull requests, rebasing, etc.). We use GitHub.
  • You are comfortable writing tests, pair programming, and reviewing code.

Experience of any of the following would be an advantage:

  • Good CSS knowledge (Sass).
  • Experience with ecommerce and integrating with payment gateways.
  • Experience with Node JS.
  • Experience designing REST APIs.
  • Experience with GraphQL

About Us

Focusrite plc is a global music and audio group that develops and markets music technology products. Used by audio professionals and amateur musicians alike, its solutions facilitate the high-quality production of recorded and live sound. Our audio technology brands stand together, seeking to enrich lives through music by removing barriers to creativity we make music easy to make.

The Focusrite Group trades under eight established and rapidly growing brands: Focusrite, Focusrite Pro, Novation, ADAM Audio, Sequential, Martin Audio, Optimal Audio and Ampify Music. With a high-quality reputation and a rich heritage spanning decades, its brands are category leaders in the music-making industry.

Music technology is an enriching space to work in and we enjoy a Group-wide open-door culture which encourages innovation. This culture, combined with a passion for the inspirational solutions we create, has led to the group winning numerous accolades, including three Queen's Awards for Enterprise and the AIM Company of the Year Award 2021.

The Focusrite Group is dedicated to building a great place to work and as an equal opportunity employer we are committed to Diversity and Inclusion. The group mission is to cultivate an equitable culture, internally and externally, where all people feel they are welcome and positively represented, whether office-based or working remotely. Equally, we recognise the major impact that climate change is having on our world and work every day towards being industry leaders in a carbon neutral future.

Benefits include flexible/hybrid working, company pension, life insurance, private healthcare, employee purchase scheme, company music events, free breakfast/lunch in the canteen at Focusrite HQ. We arrange company training sessions and encourage personal development.
_source.position_name: Full Stack Developer at The Focusrite Group (London, UK) (allows remote)

_source.description:
Remote within the U.S. -- $105-125k
About Podsights
Podsights is a small, distributed organization seeking a Software Engineer to join our growing team! Here's a little about us, a little about what we believe, and what we are looking for.Podsights is an industry-leading attribution platform for podcast advertising. We likely work with some of your favorite brands and publishers and handle over 10 billion events a month.We believe that where you went to school has little bearing on your performance. Where you live isnt a proxy for talent. Your current employer provides a low signal about your future potential.We believe that different backgrounds bring different perspectives. Podsights promotes diversity and inclusion in its hiring, and we encourage applicants from all backgrounds.About the roleYour role will focus on our Django application and Graph API with some projects dipping into the data layer or front end. On a given day, you might be creating new data models, adding an endpoint to our API, or working with our data pipelines. The benefit of joining a small team is you will have a tremendous impact on the company's direction and, to some extent, the industry.What you bring 2+ years of experience as a data or backend engineer
 Proficiency with Python or a similar language
 Django, Flask, or a similar web framework
 Familiarity with SQL and NoSQL data structures
 Bonus if you have experience with... Django ORM and migrations
 GraphQL (Graphene)
 Cloud infrastructure (GCP preferred)
 Data and ETL platforms (Airflow, Dataflow, and BigQuery preferred)
 Podsights Benefits: Opportunity to build something meaningful from the ground up. Were changing the way podcast ads are bought and sold.
 Fast-paced and challenging work environment ideal for a life-long learner.
 Competitive compensation and a 401K program.
 Fully remote role with an annual WFH stipend.
 We cover 100% of health benefits (medical, dental, and vision)!
 4 weeks of PTO each year.
 Holiday break before the New Year.
 A generous parental leave policy.
 Podsights cannot provide visa sponsorship for this position now or in the future and to be considered for this role, you must have the ability to work in the United States without sponsorship.
_source.description_html:
Remote within the U.S. -- $105-125k

About Podsights

Podsights is a small, distributed organization seeking a Software Engineer to join our growing team!

Here's a little about us, a little about what we believe, and what we are looking for.

Podsights is an industry-leading attribution platform for podcast advertising. We likely work with some of your favorite brands and publishers and handle over 10 billion events a month.

We believe that where you went to school has little bearing on your performance. Where you live isnt a proxy for talent. Your current employer provides a low signal about your future potential.

We believe that different backgrounds bring different perspectives. Podsights promotes diversity and inclusion in its hiring, and we encourage applicants from all backgrounds.

About the role

Your role will focus on our Django application and Graph API with some projects dipping into the data layer or front end. On a given day, you might be creating new data models, adding an endpoint to our API, or working with our data pipelines. The benefit of joining a small team is you will have a tremendous impact on the company's direction and, to some extent, the industry.

What you bring

  • 2+ years of experience as a data or backend engineer
  • Proficiency with Python or a similar language
  • Django, Flask, or a similar web framework
  • Familiarity with SQL and NoSQL data structures

Bonus if you have experience with...

  • Django ORM and migrations
  • GraphQL (Graphene)
  • Cloud infrastructure (GCP preferred)
  • Data and ETL platforms (Airflow, Dataflow, and BigQuery preferred)

Podsights Benefits:

  • Opportunity to build something meaningful from the ground up. Were changing the way podcast ads are bought and sold.
  • Fast-paced and challenging work environment ideal for a life-long learner.
  • Competitive compensation and a 401K program.
  • Fully remote role with an annual WFH stipend.
  • We cover 100% of health benefits (medical, dental, and vision)!
  • 4 weeks of PTO each year.
  • Holiday break before the New Year.
  • A generous parental leave policy.

Podsights cannot provide visa sponsorship for this position now or in the future and to be considered for this role, you must have the ability to work in the United States without sponsorship.

_source.description:
Fullscript helps people get better. It's at the core of everything we do. As the leading platform for prescribing integrative health products, our work positively impacts millions of lives everyday. Our purpose extends well beyond our platform. As a health company, we are committed to the wellbeing of our team members. We are building an organization where people thrive, grow, and have a high impact through their work. By joining us, you stand with our purpose. You are an independent thinker, who likes to leave things better than you found them. You do things not because they are easy but because they are right. Ready to make an impact?We are seeking a WMS Developer for our Distribution Department. This role will enhance the functionality and effectiveness of our WMS platform, resulting in higher productivity in our distribution center operations. The right candidate will have the opportunity to create a significant and positive impact in the organization.What you'll doThe Highjump Developer will be responsible for the delivery of customizations and procedures within the WMS system. The Developer maintains the WMS and will configure and execute changes in the environment. The Developer enjoys working with the operations and technology groups dedicated to seamless production.
Expert configuration experience with SQL database queries and stored procedures.
Assist in the translating of business requirements into technical design documents using MS Visio
Ensure our WMS can scale with our business needs
Ability to configure, develop, debug, and troubleshoot solutions or production issues
Ensure issues are identified, tracked, reported on and resolved in a timely manner.
Possess understanding in the areas of application programming, database, and system design.
Other duties as assigned
What you bring to the table5+ years developing solutions within Highjump Advantage tools (like Webwise, Advantage Commander, workflow engine, advantage architect solutions)
Supply chain and distribution industry knowledge and experience. Must have in-depth knowledge WMS, Shipping and Logistics
Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) expertise in HighJump Software, prior experience with Automation Preferred
Strong knowledge of fulfillment center process flows. Best practices around picking, packing, replenishment, order waving, receiving, put away
Self-motivated, tenacious and a natural problem solver
Strong consulting, analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to prioritize tasks and self-manage
Excellent listening, oral, and written communication skills with strong interpersonal skills
What we can offer youGenerous PTO and competitive pay
Fullscriptandrsquo;s 401k program for financial health
Flexible benefits package (medical, dental, vision) and workplace wellness program
Training budget and company-wide learning initiatives
Discount on Fullscript catalog of products
Ability to work Wherever You Work Well*
*Our Wherever You Work Well philosophy means Fullscript teammates get to pick their own office andmdash; whether thatandrsquo;s in-office, at home, or a bit of both. We also believe pups make life better, which also means some of our physical locations are dog-friendly.*Our Wherever You Work Well philosophy means Fullscript teammates get to pick their own office andmdash; whether thatandrsquo;s in-office, at home, or a bit of both.Fullscript is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are excited to work with talented people, period. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national or ethnic origin, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital or civil status, political affiliation, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the jurisdictions in which we operate.Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Please send an email to accessibility@fullscript.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.Our team handles both personal information and personal health information, which means candidates that receive and accept employment offers must undergo a background check. Want to learn more? Check us out at www.fullscript.com/careers, find us on social media, or check out our culture guide
_source.description_html:
Fullscript helps people get better. It's at the core of everything we do. As the leading platform for prescribing integrative health products, our work positively impacts millions of lives everyday. Our purpose extends well beyond our platform. As a health company, we are committed to the wellbeing of our team members. We are building an organization where people thrive, grow, and have a high impact through their work.


By joining us, you stand with our purpose. You are an independent thinker, who likes to leave things better than you found them. You do things not because they are easy but because they are right. Ready to make an impact?


We are seeking a WMS Developer for our Distribution Department. This role will enhance the functionality and effectiveness of our WMS platform, resulting in higher productivity in our distribution center operations. The right candidate will have the opportunity to create a significant and positive impact in the organization.


What you'll do




    • The Highjump Developer will be responsible for the delivery of customizations and procedures within the WMS system. The Developer maintains the WMS and will configure and execute changes in the environment. The Developer enjoys working with the operations and technology groups dedicated to seamless production.

    • Expert configuration experience with SQL database queries and stored procedures.

    • Assist in the translating of business requirements into technical design documents using MS Visio

    • Ensure our WMS can scale with our business needs

    • Ability to configure, develop, debug, and troubleshoot solutions or production issues

    • Ensure issues are identified, tracked, reported on and resolved in a timely manner.

    • Possess understanding in the areas of application programming, database, and system design.

    • Other duties as assigned



What you bring to the table




    • 5+ years developing solutions within Highjump Advantage tools (like Webwise, Advantage Commander, workflow engine, advantage architect solutions)

    • Supply chain and distribution industry knowledge and experience. Must have in-depth knowledge WMS, Shipping & Logistics

    • Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) expertise in HighJump Software, prior experience with Automation Preferred

    • Strong knowledge of fulfillment center process flows. Best practices around picking, packing, replenishment, order waving, receiving, put away

    • Self-motivated, tenacious and a natural problem solver

    • Strong consulting, analytical and problem-solving skills

    • Ability to prioritize tasks and self-manage

    • Excellent listening, oral, and written communication skills with strong interpersonal skills



What we can offer you




    • Generous PTO and competitive pay

    • Fullscript’s 401k program for financial health

    • Flexible benefits package (medical, dental, vision) and workplace wellness program

    • Training budget and company-wide learning initiatives

    • Discount on Fullscript catalog of products

    • Ability to work Wherever You Work Well*



*Our Wherever You Work Well philosophy means Fullscript teammates get to pick their own office — whether that’s in-office, at home, or a bit of both. We also believe pups make life better, which also means some of our physical locations are dog-friendly.


*Our Wherever You Work Well philosophy means Fullscript teammates get to pick their own office — whether that’s in-office, at home, or a bit of both.


Fullscript is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are excited to work with talented people, period. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national or ethnic origin, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital or civil status, political affiliation, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the jurisdictions in which we operate.


Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Please send an email to accessibility@fullscript.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.


Our team handles both personal information and personal health information, which means candidates that receive and accept employment offers must undergo a background check.


Want to learn more? Check us out at www.fullscript.com/careers, find us on social media, or check out our culture guide

_source.description:
Full time, Fully remoteAt Meraki, weandrsquo;re making IT easier, faster, and smarter. Our full-stack teams build and maintain our web applications, which manages millions of network devices from our cloud. Our customers use the Meraki dashboard to monitor and configure critical IT infrastructure that serves tens of millions of people every single day.Merakiandrsquo;s product Dashboard teams are small, fast paced teams striving to make our products unique by balancing feature-rich abilities and simplicity. Our full-stack engineers are well versed in a wide array of CS concepts and excited to jump around languages, platforms, and all levels of the Meraki stack!What you will do:Develop tools for customers to configure and monitor networking devices all over the world.
Build intuitive and powerful workflows to tackle important problems for IT professionals around the world, by collaborating with product managers and UX designers.
Solve challenging scaling problems to ensure a seamless user experience and high uptime.
Identify and solve performance bottlenecks in our web application.
Be a technical leader by helping other specialists make architectural design decisions while evangelizing engineering best practices.
Be a unifying force connecting people and motivating others to do their best.
You are an ideal candidate if you:Have 5-7+ years of experience writing professional production code and tests.
2-3+ years of experience in building rich web UIs with React (and Redux).
2-3+ years of experience in web backend technologies, like Ruby on Rails or Go.
Take complete ownership from conception to production release by leveraging your ability to influence, facilitate, and work collaboratively across teams.
Would thrive in a small engineering team and are excited to solve open-ended problems across the stack.
Are a strong leading individual contributor and want to grow into a tech lead role.
Are passionate about what you do and ignite people around you
Bonus points for:Experience with Ruby on Rails, React, and Postgres.
Experience or willingness to work in an agile environment (Scrum, Kanban, etc.).
Have working knowledge of network protocols used on both local and wide-area networks.
_source.description_html:
Full time, Fully remote


At Meraki, we’re making IT easier, faster, and smarter. Our full-stack teams build and maintain our web applications, which manages millions of network devices from our cloud. Our customers use the Meraki dashboard to monitor and configure critical IT infrastructure that serves tens of millions of people every single day.


Meraki’s product Dashboard teams are small, fast paced teams striving to make our products unique by balancing feature-rich abilities and simplicity. Our full-stack engineers are well versed in a wide array of CS concepts and excited to jump around languages, platforms, and all levels of the Meraki stack!


What you will do:



  • Develop tools for customers to configure and monitor networking devices all over the world.

  • Build intuitive and powerful workflows to tackle important problems for IT professionals around the world, by collaborating with product managers and UX designers.

  • Solve challenging scaling problems to ensure a seamless user experience and high uptime.

  • Identify and solve performance bottlenecks in our web application.

  • Be a technical leader by helping other specialists make architectural design decisions while evangelizing engineering best practices.

  • Be a unifying force connecting people and motivating others to do their best.


You are an ideal candidate if you:



  • Have 5-7+ years of experience writing professional production code and tests.

  • 2-3+ years of experience in building rich web UIs with React (and Redux).

  • 2-3+ years of experience in web backend technologies, like Ruby on Rails or Go.

  • Take complete ownership from conception to production release by leveraging your ability to influence, facilitate, and work collaboratively across teams.

  • Would thrive in a small engineering team and are excited to solve open-ended problems across the stack.

  • Are a strong leading individual contributor and want to grow into a tech lead role.

  • Are passionate about what you do and ignite people around you


Bonus points for:



  • Experience with Ruby on Rails, React, and Postgres.

  • Experience or willingness to work in an agile environment (Scrum, Kanban, etc.).

  • Have working knowledge of network protocols used on both local and wide-area networks.

_source.description:
Das von dir als Scrum Master betreute Team hat auf einen erfolgreichen Arbeitstag randuuml;ckblickend wieder ein Standuuml;ck tolle Software geschaffen. Alle andAuml;nderungen sind deployed, alle automatisierten Tests sind korrekt und euer Sprintziel ist erreicht. Der Launch der neuen Applikation kann kommen. Du kannst entspannt in den Feierabend gehen und weiandszlig;t, dass dein Team dir vertraut. Am nandauml;chsten Tag packst du wieder mit an und landouml;st die Impediments des Teams. Mit Vorfreude beschandauml;ftigst du dich schon mit der nandauml;chsten Retro. Zusammen haltet ihr das Arbeitstempo hoch, freut euch auf die Aufgaben, die noch kommen und tragt maandszlig;geblich dazu bei, das Unternehmen stetig voranzubringen.Was dich erwartet:Betreuung und Begleitung von selbstorganisierten, crossfunktionalen und engagierten Scrum-Teams, welche anspruchsvolle Landouml;sungen fanduuml;r unsere MLP-Applikationslandschaft erstellen
Methodische Durchfanduuml;hrung von Scrum Events der einzelnen Teams sowie Vermittlung der Scrum Theorie fanduuml;r das einheitliche Verstandauml;ndnis der Praktiken, Regeln und Werte
Begleitung und Unterstanduuml;tzung der Scrum-Teams bei Impediments und Optimierung der Performance
Unterstanduuml;tzung des Product Owners in der Zusammenarbeit mit Stakeholdern
Bildung einer Scrum-Community zur stetigen Weiterentwicklung sowie das Coaching der Organisation bei der agilen Transformation
Was wir erwarten:Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Informatik oder Wirtschaftspandauml;dagogik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation idealerweise im IT-Umfeld verbunden mit einer Zertifizierung zum Scrum Master und einer fundierten Methodenkompetenz
Mehrjandauml;hrige Berufserfahrung als Scrum Master, insbesondere die Anwendung agiler Prinzipien in der Praxis aus voller andUuml;berzeugung und mit Leidenschaft
Ausgeprandauml;gte Empathie, sehr gute Kommunikationsfandauml;higkeit sowie eine ergebnisorientierte und selbststandauml;ndige Arbeitsweise
Gute Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Jira und Confluence
 Unsere Benefits Verantwortungsvolle Tandauml;tigkeit
 Kollegiale Atmosphandauml;re
 Vielfandauml;ltige Weiterbildung
 Flexible Arbeitszeiten
 Moderner Arbeitsplatz
 Attraktives Verganduuml;tungspaket
_source.description_html:
Das von dir als Scrum Master betreute Team hat auf einen erfolgreichen Arbeitstag rückblickend wieder ein Stück tolle Software geschaffen. Alle Änderungen sind deployed, alle automatisierten Tests sind korrekt und euer Sprintziel ist erreicht. Der Launch der neuen Applikation kann kommen. Du kannst entspannt in den Feierabend gehen und weißt, dass dein Team dir vertraut. Am nächsten Tag packst du wieder mit an und löst die Impediments des Teams. Mit Vorfreude beschäftigst du dich schon mit der nächsten Retro. Zusammen haltet ihr das Arbeitstempo hoch, freut euch auf die Aufgaben, die noch kommen und tragt maßgeblich dazu bei, das Unternehmen stetig voranzubringen.




Was dich erwartet:


  • Betreuung und Begleitung von selbstorganisierten, crossfunktionalen und engagierten Scrum-Teams, welche anspruchsvolle Lösungen für unsere MLP-Applikationslandschaft erstellen

  • Methodische Durchführung von Scrum Events der einzelnen Teams sowie Vermittlung der Scrum Theorie für das einheitliche Verständnis der Praktiken, Regeln und Werte

  • Begleitung und Unterstützung der Scrum-Teams bei Impediments und Optimierung der Performance

  • Unterstützung des Product Owners in der Zusammenarbeit mit Stakeholdern

  • Bildung einer Scrum-Community zur stetigen Weiterentwicklung sowie das Coaching der Organisation bei der agilen Transformation





Was wir erwarten:


  • Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Informatik oder Wirtschaftspädagogik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation idealerweise im IT-Umfeld verbunden mit einer Zertifizierung zum Scrum Master und einer fundierten Methodenkompetenz

  • Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung als Scrum Master, insbesondere die Anwendung agiler Prinzipien in der Praxis aus voller Überzeugung und mit Leidenschaft

  • Ausgeprägte Empathie, sehr gute Kommunikationsfähigkeit sowie eine ergebnisorientierte und selbstständige Arbeitsweise

  • Gute Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Jira und Confluence




Unsere Benefits


  • Verantwortungsvolle Tätigkeit

  • Kollegiale Atmosphäre

  • Vielfältige Weiterbildung

  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten

  • Moderner Arbeitsplatz

  • Attraktives Vergütungspaket
_source.position_name: Scrum Master (m/w/d) at MLP Finanzberatung SE (Wiesloch, Deutschland)

_source.description_html:
Were looking for a motivated System administrator / DevOps engineer to join our team. If youre excited to work with one of the very few Italian companies offering SaaS solutions internationally to ~1M users and to join a team of friendly people with a culture based on continuous learning, transparency, and collaboration, youre looking at the right place.


Location

Bologna and Milan, Italy or remote. Our offices are incredibly nice places to work from, both are located in the center of their respective cities. We are currently offering a hybrid work model, in which we give the possibility to our team members to work from one of our offices up to 2 days per week and/or work remotely.


Benefits


  • REMOTE WORK - You can work from one of our beautiful offices in Italy (in Bologna and Milan and both being incredibly well located nice places to work from) or remotely. We are used and fully structured to onboard people who rather work full-time remotely;
  • LEARNING BUDGET - Well sponsor your professional growth by providing a budget that can be used for courses, events, workshops, and books;
  • WORK EQUIPMENT - Well provide an equipment allowance so that you can perform at your best;
  • COMPETITIVE SALARY - We offer a highly competitive salary when compared with other Italian startups since we have high standards for finding the best people to join our team. Besides, we offer a generous paid-time-off (+25 weekdays/year);
  • COMPANY RETREATS - Twice a year (summer and winter) we get together in amazing destinations to work, bond, and enjoy team-building activities. We offer fully paid week-long retreats to places like Val D'Orcia, Capri, the Dolomites, or the Tonnara di Scopello;
  • TRAVEL ALLOWANCE TO VISIT A COLLEAGUE - Well provide a travel allowance so you can visit a colleague (as long as the travel itinerary meets the COVID travel rules and restrictions);
  • GREAT WORK ENVIRONMENT - You will be part of a multicultural team full of talented and expert people and you will find a team spirit, which you would rarely find elsewhere;
  • THERAPY INCENTIVE - We offer online therapy sessions, in English/Italian, and anonymously. You can also choose among psychologists with different approaches and specializations;
  • ENGLISH CLASSES - We offer online English classes on a weekly basis, on several different levels, within working hours.

    • Please send your CV in English.

    Want to know more about iubenda? Check us out at:

    iubenda.com | LinkedIn | Facebook | Twitter
_source.position_name: System Administrator / DevOps at iubenda (Milan, Italy) (allows remote)

_source.description_html:
Experience Level: Senior


Hello! Are you ready to Work from Home and transform your career?


We're looking for a Front End Engineer to join the engineering team at Modus. Want to help our client’s build awesome solutions to accomplish their goals and vision? Are you interested in working from home with some of the best talents on the planet? Then keep reading.


About You


You love building great software. Your work could be supporting new feature development, migrating existing features, and creating other mobile and web solutions for customers. You'll have a primary focus on front-end development using Ionic, Angular, Javascript, and Typescript. We use modern tools, which means you’ll have the opportunity to work with Webpack, Redux, Apollo, Styled Components, and much more.


You relish creating high-quality code from the comfort of your own home. Your engineering projects will focus on understanding customers' needs and translating those needs from product specifications into functional, production-ready code. You'll have the opportunity to ship code daily that will be used by customers.


You love learning. Engineering is an ever-evolving world. You enjoy playing with new tech and exploring areas that you might not have experience with yet. You are a self-driven, self-learner willing to share knowledge and participate actively in your community.


Having overlap with your team is critical when working in a global remote team. For this role, Modus requires all team members to overlap with EST morning hours daily. In addition, reliable high speed internet is a must and experience in using an iOS device.


Things You Might Do


Modus is a fast-growing, and remote-first company, so you'll likely get experience on many different projects across the organization. That said, here are some things you'll probably do:



  • Give back to the community via open source and blog posts

  • Travel and meet great people- as part of our remote-first lifestyle, it's important that we come together as needed to work together, meet each other in person and have fun together. Please keep that in mind when you apply.

  • Teach and be taught: Modus creates active teams that work in internal and external projects together, giving opportunities to stay relevant with the latest technologies and learning from experts worldwide

  • Interact directly with internal and external clients to represent Modus and its values


Why Modus Create:


Our Benefits may vary according to the country you are located in, so please reach out to our recruiter in case you have any questions.


If you become a contractor we offer:



  • Competitive compensation

  • 100% Remote work (could vary according to the client's needs)

  • Travel according to client's needs

  • The chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech


If you live in the USA and you become a full-time employee we offer:



  • Competitive compensation

  • Health insurance (medical, vision, and dental) and other benefits (FSA and HSA)

  • 401(K) match to up to 3.5% of your annual salary

  • Remote work

  • The chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech

  • Flexible Time Off/PTO


If you live in Romania and you become a full-time employee we offer:



  • Competitive compensation

  • Private medical insurance

  • Attractive flexible benefits system

  • Evergreen benefits (Bookster account, flexible working schedule, company lunch in the office, unlimited work from home days, company team building and events, company dinner events etc)

  • The chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech


If you live in Costa Rica and you become a full-time employee we offer:



  • Competitive compensation

  • 100% Remote work (could vary according to the client's needs)

  • Travel according to client's needs

  • Company-paid private insurance

  • The chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech

  • Social Security (CCSS) by law


Do you have what it takes? Apply today!
_source.position_name: Front End Engineer (Ionic, Angular) at Modus Create () (allows remote)

Fortgeschrittene Fandauml;higkeiten im Umgang mit VBA-Programmierung

_source.description_html:
Making an impact that matters. Unser Anspruch ist, jeden Tag das zu tun, was wirklich zählt. Mit unserem breiten Leistungsspektrum – von Audit & Assurance, Risk Advisory über Tax & Legal bis Financial Advisory und Consulting – unterstützen wir Kunden auf einzigartige Weise. Wir setzen neue Maßstäbe, liefern innovative Denkansätze und ermöglichen nachhaltiges Wachstum. Wir fördern unsere hochqualifizierten Mitarbeiter mit ihren verschiedensten Talenten, sodass sie mit uns mehr erreichen.


Für unser Team am Standort München suchen wir engagierte Verstärkung.


Spannende Aufgaben erwarten Sie


Als Excel Specialist (m/w/d) im Bereich Tax werden Sie bei uns ab dem ersten Tag innovative und spannende Projekte begleiten und mit Ihrer ausgeprägten Affinität sowie Kreativität, Erfahrung und Umsetzungsfreude in MS Excel komplexe Sachverhalte implementieren, darstellen und auswerten. Ein internationales und diverses Team und ein Arbeitsumfeld, welches erlaubt Ihre eigenen Ideen umzusetzen, sind ein Garant für unser Versprechen an Sie.


Wir suchen einen Excel-Spezialisten (m/w/d), der folgende Tätigkeiten selbstständig umsetzen kann:




  • Implementierung von steuerrelevanten Themen in MS Excel

  • Entwicklung von Excel-Architekturen als Grundlage für große Projekte

  • Auswertung und Darstellung von steuerrelevanten Themen in MS Excel

  • Transfer von fachspezifischen Themen in eine geeignete Darstellung mittels MS Excel




Darin sind Sie Spezialist



  • Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung

  • Mehrjährige Erfahrung im Umgang mit MS Excel

  • Fortgeschrittene Fähigkeiten im Umgang mit VBA-Programmierung

  • Erfahrung in einem Steuerberatungsumfeld

  • Sichere Deutsch- oder Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift



Was Sie von uns erwarten können


Neben einer angenehmen, kollegialen Atmosphäre bieten wir Ihnen ein chancenreiches, internationales Arbeitsumfeld. Bei uns gelten flache Hierarchien und ein Prinzip der offenen Tür. Ein weiterer Pluspunkt: Dank einer Vielzahl von Weiterbildungsprogrammen bringen wir Sie in Ihrer beruflichen und persönlichen Entwicklung einen großen Schritt nach vorn.


Sie sind interessiert? Wir freuen uns auf Sie!


Bitte richten Sie Ihre Bewerbung an das Deloitte Recruiting-Team.


Die Inklusion von Menschen mit Behinderung entspricht unserem Selbstverständnis und wir begrüßen daher Ihre Bewerbung. Bitte haben Sie Verständnis dafür, dass wir aufgrund der geltenden Datenschutzgrundverordnung ausschließlich Online-Bewerbungen über unser Recruiting-Management-System entgegennehmen können.


Bei Fragen rund um das Thema Bewerbung bei Deloitte helfen Ihnen unsere FAQs schnell weiter. Unsere Bewerbungshinweise geben Ihnen konkrete Ratschläge zur erfolgreichen Bewerbung über unser Online-Portal:



⇒ FAQs



⇒ Bewerbungshinweise



What impact will you make?

DescriptionWe are looking for a talented fully remote front-end engineer to help us transition our marketing site to a Git based CMS coupled with a static site generator. You'll be playing a core role in our marketing development team and youandrsquo;ll report directly to the front-end lead.What Youandrsquo;ll Do:Help transition our marketing site at hubstaff.com from a rails application to a Git based CMS coupled with a Static site generator (preferably based on Vue.js)
Define the data structures in the CMS based on our Design system components.
Translate the current Design system components from our rails views to the Static site generator templates. (Our rails views are written in slim, which is very easy to understand, and youandrsquo;ll need to transition them to Vue.js view files)
Create documentation along the way on how to use the system, as it will be used by non developers in creating new pages and editing the existing ones.
RequirementsVue.js and JavaScript.
Expert knowledge and experience using HTML and CSS.
Experience working with Wordpress and headless CMS systems is highly valued. Bonus points for experience with Git based CMS.
Understanding of SEO and accessibility best practices.
Experience building high-quality, responsive layouts.
Great communication skills, focused on solutions, thinking independently
_source.description_html:
Description


We are looking for a talented fully remote front-end engineer to help us transition our marketing site to a Git based CMS coupled with a static site generator. You'll be playing a core role in our marketing development team and you’ll report directly to the front-end lead.


What You’ll Do:



  • Help transition our marketing site at hubstaff.com from a rails application to a Git based CMS coupled with a Static site generator (preferably based on Vue.js)

  • Define the data structures in the CMS based on our Design system components.

  • Translate the current Design system components from our rails views to the Static site generator templates. (Our rails views are written in slim, which is very easy to understand, and you’ll need to transition them to Vue.js view files)

  • Create documentation along the way on how to use the system, as it will be used by non developers in creating new pages and editing the existing ones.


Requirements



  • Vue.js & JavaScript.

  • Expert knowledge & experience using HTML and CSS.

  • Experience working with Wordpress and headless CMS systems is highly valued. Bonus points for experience with Git based CMS.

  • Understanding of SEO and accessibility best practices.

  • Experience building high-quality, responsive layouts.

  • Great communication skills, focused on solutions, thinking independently

The andldquo;MandA Taxandrdquo; service line covers all tax issues relating to the acquisition or sale of companies. In addition, the MandA Tax team also offers advice from a tax perspective regarding mergers, demergers, joint venture formations, and similar.At the location Munich we are looking for dedicated reinforcement.Exciting tasks await youRequirements analysis with the business department and implementation of the requirements in IT
Business process analysis and identification of potential for process optimization, in particular by observing trends on the market
Creating web applications according to the requirements of stakeholders
Together with your colleagues, you cover all project phases andndash; starting from the idea to the successful go-live
You will act as the central point of contact for IT solutions required by the MandA Tax team
In this you are a specialistBachelorandrsquo;s/Masterandrsquo;s degree in computer science or related areas of study
4+ years of professional experience in web development and advanced knowledge of Angular (at least 3 years)
Experience in XML and XPath is a big plus
Experience in classical development paradigms such as OOP as well as design patterns in software architecture
Strong interest and enthusiasm for understanding our business and developing ideas to make processes more efficient
Strong presentation and communication skills in English
What you can expect from usIn addition to a pleasant, collegial atmosphere, we offer you a promising and international working environment. We have flat hierarchies and an open door atmosphere. Another plus point: Thanks to a large number of education programs, we take you one big step forward in your professional and personal development.You are interested? We look forward to seeing you!Please submit your application to the Deloitte Recruiting-Team.The inclusion of people with disabilities is our mutual understanding. We very much appreciate your application. Due to our German data protection law, please note that we can only accept online applications via our online recruitment system.Our FAQs will help you with questions concerning applications at Deloitte and will give you specific advice on how to apply successfully via our online portal:andrArr; FAQsWhat impact will you make?
_source.description_html:
The “M&A Tax” service line covers all tax issues relating to the acquisition or sale of companies. In addition, the M&A Tax team also offers advice from a tax perspective regarding mergers, demergers, joint venture formations, and similar.



At the location Munich we are looking for dedicated reinforcement.


Exciting tasks await you



  • Requirements analysis with the business department and implementation of the requirements in IT

  • Business process analysis and identification of potential for process optimization, in particular by observing trends on the market

  • Creating web applications according to the requirements of stakeholders

  • Together with your colleagues, you cover all project phases – starting from the idea to the successful go-live

  • You will act as the central point of contact for IT solutions required by the M&A Tax team


In this you are a specialist



  • Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in computer science or related areas of study

  • 4+ years of professional experience in web development and advanced knowledge of Angular (at least 3 years)

  • Experience in XML and XPath is a big plus

  • Experience in classical development paradigms such as OOP as well as design patterns in software architecture

  • Strong interest and enthusiasm for understanding our business and developing ideas to make processes more efficient

  • Strong presentation and communication skills in English


What you can expect from us


In addition to a pleasant, collegial atmosphere, we offer you a promising and international working environment. We have flat hierarchies and an open door atmosphere. Another plus point: Thanks to a large number of education programs, we take you one big step forward in your professional and personal development.


You are interested? We look forward to seeing you!


Please submit your application to the Deloitte Recruiting-Team.



The inclusion of people with disabilities is our mutual understanding. We very much appreciate your application. Due to our German data protection law, please note that we can only accept online applications via our online recruitment system.



Our FAQs will help you with questions concerning applications at Deloitte and will give you specific advice on how to apply successfully via our online portal:



⇒ FAQs



What impact will you make?

Do you love TDD, pairing, and refactoring code? Were building a team of software practitioners who are passionate about writing fantastic code, and we would love to meet you! Were an agile consultancy helping both enterprise and startup clients build critical products and systems. We not only build great products, we care about how great products are built and improving the experience of it. Were dedicated to inclusion, transparency, a bias towards action, and learning through experimentation.Were looking for people that are self-motivated and demonstrated team-players. You will be a lead developer responsible for the development of new software products and enhancements to existing products, as well as helping grow those around you. You excel in working with large-scale applications and frameworks and have outstanding communication and leadership skills.
Responsibilities: Writing high-quality, high-performance, maintainable code
 Develop and support software working with our clients
 Coordinate cross-functionally to ensure your project meets business objectives and compliance standards
 Support test and deployment of new products and features
 Mentor, share, and learn every day
 
Benefits
 Healthcare including HMO and PPO options
 Fitness membership reimbursement
 401K with matching
 Company equity
 Annual performance bonus
 Professional development
 Work-life balance
 Competitive salary

The CompanyHuman Agency offers full-service business solutions to partners and the organizations we create. We are a team of problem solvers driven by purpose and commitment to the free exercise of our and our partners' human agency. The RoleThe Performance Marketing Manager, Email Specialist is responsible for managing email marketing campaigns across Human Agency's client portfolio. The Email Marketing Coordinator is ultimately responsible for developing and executing comprehensive email marketing strategies to achieve client goals. This person will also report on the success of efforts, and document any challenges in order to make changes going forward to ensure campaign success. The Email Marketing Coordinator will work closely with account management, media, and other Agency teams. ResponsibilitiesCampaign Management: Manage and optimize client email campaigns, from initial strategy and roadmapping, to creative development, testing, delivery, and evaluation.
Plan, coordinate and execute email experiences that drive conversion, retention, upsell, and reactivation.
Analyze customer behavior and engagement, leveraging those insights to identify customer segments for use in email marketing automation.
Drive ongoing optimization through comprehensive A/B testing strategy, including developing and refining best practices and socializing learnings across the team.
Be obsessed with our Agency's and our clients' email experiences, always uncovering new opportunities for improvements, and being the internal expert on all things email.
Manage our in-house email production. 
Be responsible for all HTML and CSS-based email development, reaching towards thoughtful use of templates and internal process updates in order to drive efficiency.
Data and Reporting Management: Provide accurate and insightful reporting for clients and internally for the Human Agency team.
Utilize real-time performance data to inform strategy, cadence, and creative asset development.
Analyze key performance metrics to adjust and optimize campaigns providing regular and easily understood reports to clients and internal stakeholders. 
Stay informed and actively research new platform updates, channels, and performance methods to provide insight for clients and the Human Agency team.
Craft insights-driven briefs that inspire our creative team to develop email communications that further our client-customer relationships and deliver on our business objectives.
Support Sales Pipeline: Support sales team to develop campaign goals and strategies for potential clients.
Provide regular updates to our sales team on effective email campaigns and promotion-worthy statistics and case-studies.
Assist in the development and proposition of holistic digital strategies and recommend proper platform/channel use when appropriate.
 This could be the job for you if you:Have 2-4 years of paid acquisition, media planning, or growth marketing experience at an agency or within an organization or political campaign.
Know how to use a test driven approach to problem solving (scientific method, A/B testing, tests for statistical significance, randomized controlled trials).
Are a team-player with high-energy and a desire to help improve internal processes and contribute to startup growth beyond your day-to-day tasks.
Desire to learn, grow, and get in on the ground floor of a high-growth startup while launching your career.
Are able to work independently in an entrepreneurial, start-up environment - we give you something, you're able to get creative, think scientifically, and run with it.
This job is definitely for you if you:Have deep experience with marketing automation platforms, analytics and business intelligence tools, and A/B testing tools.
Have a proficient knowledge of HTML, CSS, responsive design, and email testing tools for QA'ing email templates and website landing pages.
Demonstrate a solid understanding of marketing attribution, UTM tracking, and Pixel implementation.
Are extremely well-versed with Google Sheets and Google Analytics.
Have experience with eCommerce and direct-to-consumer marketing
Are familiar with data visualization software such as Tableau, Google Data Studio, etc.
Have exceptional attention to detail and enjoy experiment design.
Are very comfortable working with numbers and have the ability to present and analyze data in various ways.
Have an unwavering willingness to learn and go above and beyond what is asked of you.
 Location: Anywhere in the USA is fine. We are a fully remote company with employees concentrated in Austin, New York, Chicago, and St Louis.

Equal Opportunity Employment StatementHuman Agency is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion or sexual orientation. All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law. Human Agency is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

_source.description:
Want to be a Hero? - Join one of the leading global online food ordering and delivery platforms!We are looking for an Engineering Manager - Order Optimisation, Logistics (f/m/d) to join our Logistics team to help us create a fast, reliable, and transparent delivery experience. You will be leading one of our engineering teams into building and maintaining stable, scalable, and useful applications that will simplify and automate important parts of our logistics operations, increasing our efficiency and therefore having a direct impact on our millions of customers every day. If you are a creative problem solver, who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!The Order Optimisation tribe in Logistics owns the core delivery processing and live automation processes, so if you are a person aiming to go beyond your limits and take your career to the next level, we have large-scale, complex, real-time challenges ready for you!Your mission:Lead and empower a team of software engineers in their day-to-day activities, defining and communicating priorities, clarifying requirements, and supporting in solving blockers.
Be an active partner for product management, in order to provide the best value for the customers; working closely with other teams, communicating solutions with technical and non-technical stakeholders, and solving related challenges.
Be responsible for a set of applications completely owned by the team. We give our teams a lot of autonomy in technical decisions and you will be expected to drive those by leveraging the teamandrsquo;s skills and knowledge, but also bringing in your own experience and insights.
Monitor and advocate for the continuous improvement of the stability and scalability of our services. The applications you will own are deployed globally to many brands belonging to the Delivery Hero family, so you will work with a tech stack running 24/7 and constantly growing.
Take part in architectural discussions and decision-making on a platform that is used by millions of people every day and implement impactful and sustainable solutions to complex problems by taking bold and measured risks together with your team.
Your heroic skills:You are an empathic and respected leader.
You have at least two years of technical leadership and people management experience in cross-functional teams (backend, frontend).
You have a degree in the field of computer sciences, software engineering, or equivalent education or practical experience.
You are a pragmatic leader who understands what is needed to get things done in a collaborative manner.
You are capable of mentoring your people and support their growth by successfully sharing your knowledge.
You are familiar with at least one of the following programming languages and its development stack: Ruby, Kotlin, Golang.
You have a solid understanding of microservices architecture, API-based and event-based communication and you have experience in designing and implementing large-scale software systems following it.
You have experience working with and scaling both SQL and noSQL databases.
You have a solid understanding of engineering best practices for the full software development life cycle including coding standards, code reviews, source control, build processes, testing, operations, and monitoring.
You have experience working with cloud environments and managed services such as AWS EC2, RDS/Aurora, ElastiCache, SNS, SQS, and CloudWatch.
You are fluent in English and can communicate clearly.
Nice to have: Experience with Javascript or Typescript and frontend development (React.js).
Experience with PostgreSQL, Redis, and other NoSQL engines.
Experience with infrastructure and related tools (Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, Terraform).
Experience with WebSockets and real-time bi-directional communication applications and related technologies.
Familiarity with common monitoring, alerting, and logging practices and tools such as Prometheus, Datadog, Distributed Tracing, Grafana, etc.
Experience implementing and supporting an independent DevOps culture within your teams.
_source.description_html:
Want to be a Hero? - Join one of the leading global online food ordering and delivery platforms!


We are looking for an Engineering Manager - Order Optimisation, Logistics (f/m/d) to join our Logistics team to help us create a fast, reliable, and transparent delivery experience. You will be leading one of our engineering teams into building and maintaining stable, scalable, and useful applications that will simplify and automate important parts of our logistics operations, increasing our efficiency and therefore having a direct impact on our millions of customers every day. If you are a creative problem solver, who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!


The Order Optimisation tribe in Logistics owns the core delivery processing and live automation processes, so if you are a person aiming to go beyond your limits and take your career to the next level, we have large-scale, complex, real-time challenges ready for you!


Your mission:




  • Lead and empower a team of software engineers in their day-to-day activities, defining and communicating priorities, clarifying requirements, and supporting in solving blockers.




  • Be an active partner for product management, in order to provide the best value for the customers; working closely with other teams, communicating solutions with technical and non-technical stakeholders, and solving related challenges.




  • Be responsible for a set of applications completely owned by the team. We give our teams a lot of autonomy in technical decisions and you will be expected to drive those by leveraging the team’s skills and knowledge, but also bringing in your own experience and insights.




  • Monitor and advocate for the continuous improvement of the stability and scalability of our services. The applications you will own are deployed globally to many brands belonging to the Delivery Hero family, so you will work with a tech stack running 24/7 and constantly growing.




  • Take part in architectural discussions and decision-making on a platform that is used by millions of people every day and implement impactful and sustainable solutions to complex problems by taking bold and measured risks together with your team.




Your heroic skills:




  • You are an empathic and respected leader.




  • You have at least two years of technical leadership and people management experience in cross-functional teams (backend, frontend).




  • You have a degree in the field of computer sciences, software engineering, or equivalent education or practical experience.




  • You are a pragmatic leader who understands what is needed to get things done in a collaborative manner.




  • You are capable of mentoring your people and support their growth by successfully sharing your knowledge.




  • You are familiar with at least one of the following programming languages and its development stack: Ruby, Kotlin, Golang.




  • You have a solid understanding of microservices architecture, API-based and event-based communication and you have experience in designing and implementing large-scale software systems following it.




  • You have experience working with and scaling both SQL and noSQL databases.




  • You have a solid understanding of engineering best practices for the full software development life cycle including coding standards, code reviews, source control, build processes, testing, operations, and monitoring.




  • You have experience working with cloud environments and managed services such as AWS EC2, RDS/Aurora, ElastiCache, SNS, SQS, and CloudWatch.




  • You are fluent in English and can communicate clearly.




Nice to have:




  • Experience with Javascript or Typescript and frontend development (React.js).




  • Experience with PostgreSQL, Redis, and other NoSQL engines.




  • Experience with infrastructure and related tools (Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, Terraform).




  • Experience with WebSockets and real-time bi-directional communication applications and related technologies.




  • Familiarity with common monitoring, alerting, and logging practices and tools such as Prometheus, Datadog, Distributed Tracing, Grafana, etc.




  • Experience implementing and supporting an independent DevOps culture within your teams.

_source.description:
dubizzle is the biggest online classifieds marketplace in the UAE. The platform handles millions of requests per day and continuous integration, auto-scaled rolling releases, event-driven microservice architectures are all part of the daily gig.dubizzle "Squads" are high performing x-functional teams set with a mission to provide win-win exchanges for our beloved users. We believe engineers are central to the problem discovery process, which is why we let teams own the "what and how" of their respective missions.At dubizzle, we believe in honesty, ownership and innovation. We are here to bring on digital disruption and to build the best platform the Middle East has ever seen!As a Senior Android Engineer, you'll build and maintain a world-class mobile application in collaboration with the other engineers within your product stream, the QA team, the design team and your Tech Team Leads. You'll be responsible for advancing our mobile application and ensuring scale as we grow to millions of monthly active users across many countries.In this role, you will:Live true to our ambitions of building an industry-leading platform which is relentlessly focused on innovation.
Develop elegant solutions for complex problems.
Write and maintain exemplary code following industry-standard programming practices.
Gain a detailed understanding of the complete architecture of our product.
Work in a mentoring capacity within a peer-programming environment and provide guidance on tasks, irrespective of complexity or scale.
Work closely with other teams from the early stages of design all the way through identifying and resolving production issues, and handling the complete SDLC.
Support a wide range of products focusing on automation, availability and performance, and above all reliability as well as supporting mobile engineers and business intelligence leading up to, during and after each sprint.
Requirements: At least 4 years of experience in native Android development (Java and Kotlin);
A deep understanding of the Android SDK, Room Database, RxJava/RxAndroid.
Working knowledge of Android Jetpack, architecture components and dependency injection libraries (eg. Dagger and HILT)
Experience with cross-platform technologies (Flutter, React Native, etc) is a plus.
A good understanding of MVC, MVP and MVVM patterns.
A solid understanding of RESTful applications.
Analytical thinking; Conceptual thinking; Detail-oriented;
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to prioritize tasks and quickly adjust in a rapidly changing environment.
_source.description_html:
dubizzle is the biggest online classifieds marketplace in the UAE. The platform handles millions of requests per day and continuous integration, auto-scaled rolling releases, event-driven microservice architectures are all part of the daily gig.


dubizzle "Squads" are high performing x-functional teams set with a mission to provide win-win exchanges for our beloved users. We believe engineers are central to the problem discovery process, which is why we let teams own the "what and how" of their respective missions.


At dubizzle, we believe in honesty, ownership and innovation. We are here to bring on digital disruption and to build the best platform the Middle East has ever seen!


As a Senior Android Engineer, you'll build and maintain a world-class mobile application in collaboration with the other engineers within your product stream, the QA team, the design team and your Tech Team Leads. You'll be responsible for advancing our mobile application and ensuring scale as we grow to millions of monthly active users across many countries.


In this role, you will:



  • Live true to our ambitions of building an industry-leading platform which is relentlessly focused on innovation.

  • Develop elegant solutions for complex problems.

  • Write and maintain exemplary code following industry-standard programming practices.

  • Gain a detailed understanding of the complete architecture of our product.

  • Work in a mentoring capacity within a peer-programming environment and provide guidance on tasks, irrespective of complexity or scale.

  • Work closely with other teams from the early stages of design all the way through identifying and resolving production issues, and handling the complete SDLC.

  • Support a wide range of products focusing on automation, availability and performance, and above all reliability as well as supporting mobile engineers and business intelligence leading up to, during and after each sprint.


Requirements:



  • At least 4 years of experience in native Android development (Java and Kotlin);

  • A deep understanding of the Android SDK, Room Database, RxJava/RxAndroid.

  • Working knowledge of Android Jetpack, architecture components and dependency injection libraries (eg. Dagger and HILT)

  • Experience with cross-platform technologies (Flutter, React Native, etc) is a plus.

  • A good understanding of MVC, MVP & MVVM patterns.

  • A solid understanding of RESTful applications.

  • Analytical thinking; Conceptual thinking; Detail-oriented;

  • Excellent communication & interpersonal skills.

  • Ability to prioritize tasks and quickly adjust in a rapidly changing environment.

_source.description:
We are looking for Firmware Engineers to join our teams.As a Firmware Engineer you will:Design and implement directly in the Android Application layer;
Responsible for the development process from design to product;
Grow to be an expert on key components in our Operating System;
Communicate and co-work with our teams addressing from driver level up to Web user interface of the security cameras;
Participate in- and contribute to discussions on component architecture and integration;
Be part of an autonomous OS development team;
Work on advanced IoT features like inter device messaging, controlling camera movement from application, deployment of neural network/ machine learning interfaces, enabling advanced audio and visual analytics;
Work in a startup-like / Agile environment.
QualificationsWhat you bring:Bachelor or masterandrsquo;s in computer science or comparable level
Profound experience in Embedded software development
Good knowledge of preferably Java or C++ and Object-Oriented Programming
Experience with Android OS or Linux full stack is a plus
Experience in Android App development is nice to have
Fluent in English
Who you are:You are a team-player and enjoy working on complex problems together with your teammates
Your working-style can be described as supportive and collaborative and you have good communication skills
You are curious to learn and have fun using new technologies
Additional informationJoin a great and international team andmdash; Work with international colleagues (we have more than 25 nationalities) and enjoy our great team culture inside and outside work
Have impact - Join a venture at an early stage and play a key part in revolutionizing and digitizing the security industry
Get the best out of both worlds - Enjoy the benefits of a dynamic start up environment and the security and expertise of a corporate company
Everyone matters - Get things moving quickly and take your own decisions within a fast-paced company culture - we live agile and flat hierarchies
Feel comfortable - We offer a comfortable working space, diverse employee discounts and free drinks as well as home office opportunities
Be yourself - Work in an open culture where everyone can be themselves and can come to work in a casual dress code
Have fun at work! andmdash; Our teams love to have fun and so will you
Contact HR department:Nicole Narjes

  • Be responsible for the development process from design to product;

  • Grow to be an expert on key components in our Operating System;

  • Communicate and co-work with our teams addressing from driver level up to Web user interface of the security cameras;

  • Participate in- and contribute to discussions on component architecture and integration;

  • Be part of an autonomous OS development team;

  • Work on advanced IoT features like inter device messaging, controlling camera movement from application, deployment of neural network/ machine learning interfaces, enabling advanced audio and visual analytics;

  • Work in a startup-like / Agile environment.



Qualifications



What you bring:



  • Bachelor or master’s in computer science or comparable level

  • Experience with Android OS or Embedded Linux System development

  • Good knowledge of preferably Java or C++ and Object-Oriented Programming

  • Experience in Android App development is nice to have

  • Fluency in English


Who you are:



  • You are a team-player and enjoy working on complex problems together with your teammates

  • Your working-style can be described as supportive and collaborative and you have good communication skills

  • You are curious to learn and have fun using new technologies



Additional information




  • Join a great and international team — Work with international colleagues (we have more than 25 nationalities) and enjoy our great team culture inside and outside work

  • Have impact - Join a venture at an early stage and play a key part in revolutionizing and digitizing the security industry

  • Get the best out of both worlds - Enjoy the benefits of a dynamic start up environment and the security and expertise of a corporate company

  • Everyone matters - Get things moving quickly and take your own decisions within a fast-paced company culture - we live agile and flat hierarchies

  • Feel comfortable - We offer a comfortable working space, diverse employee discounts and free drinks as well as home office opportunities

  • Be yourself - Work in an open culture where everyone can be themselves and can come to work in a casual dress code

  • Have fun at work! — Our teams love to have fun and so will you


Contact HR department:


Nicole Narjes

_source.description_html:
Überzeugen Sie sich von unserem aktuellen Technologie Stack und dem individuellen Arbeitsumfeld mit umfangreichen Zusatz­leistungen! Wir leisten mit über 620 Mitarbeitern Software­entwicklung im B2B-Projektgeschäft weltweit.


Kommen Sie in unser Team und unterstützen Sie uns als Java Entwickler (m/w/d) an den Standorten Nürnberg, Frankfurt am Main, Duisburg, München oder Berlin.


Sie sind hier in einer hochkarätigen, innovativen Enterprise-Umgebung mit sehr erfahrenen Kollegen tätig und entwerfen, realisieren, testen und mitverantworten komplexe Anwendungen sowie alle damit verbundenen Prozess-Komponenten.


Wenn Sie ein agiles Mindset sowie Spaß an agiler Software­entwicklung mitbringen und gleichzeitig Freude daran haben Ihr Wissen mit anderen im Team zu teilen, passen Sie exzellent zu unseren Teams bei der ISO-Gruppe.




Ihre Aufgaben



  • Softwareentwicklungstätigkeiten in crossfunktionalen Teams in den Bereichen Touristik oder Public Services

  • weiterentwickeln und implementieren hochverfügbarer Java/JEE-Anwendungen sowie pflegen und erweitern bestehender Systeme

  • fachliche Beratung von Kunden hinsichtlich Anforderungskonzeption, technischer Problemstellungen und Softwareumsetzung

  • entwickeln eigener Ideen in internen Projekten der ISO-Gruppe

  • Unterstützung bei der kontinuierlichen Verbesserung von agilen Entwicklungsprozessen und unseres modernen Technologie-Stacks




Ihr Profil



  • abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung mit relevanter Berufserfahrung

  • Berufserfahrung in der Anwendungsentwicklung im Java/JEE Umfeld (Spring, Akka, Eclipse, SQL, Hibernate, Spring Boot)

  • gute Backend-Kenntnisse mit REST, JSON, Spring, SOAP, JPA (Hibernate oder EclipseLink)

  • idealerweise Frontend-Erfahrung mit TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, HTML & Angular

  • vorteilhaft sind Erfahrungen mit einschlägigen Werkzeugen wie Eclipse, IntelliJ, JUnit, Rancher, Docker, Jenkins, Maven, Git, SVN, Maven oder Hudson etc.

  • sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse




Unser Angebot



  • unbefristete Anstellung in einem familiengeführten Unternehmen mit flachen Hierarchien

  • durch flexible Arbeitszeiten schaffen Sie es, Privates und Berufliches zu vereinbaren

  • in Zeiten der Pandemie fällt ein Jobwechsel nicht leicht. Wir bieten ein umfassendes Onboarding, auch remote, FFP2-Masken und regelmäßige Covid-19-Tests an. Für alle, die nicht im Homeoffice arbeiten können, richten wir sichere Arbeitsplätze in unseren Büros ein. So gelingt der Einstieg ins Team, auch in der aktuellen Zeit.

  • umfassende Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten für Ihre berufliche Entwicklung wie z. B. Fachkonferenzen, Workshops, BarCamps

  • spätere Wechselmöglichkeiten zu anderen Geschäftsbereichen innerhalb der ISO-Gruppe sin möglich (z. B. Flugsicherung, Automatisierungs-, Medizintechnik, Mobile Solutions, SAP, Datenqualität)




Bringen Sie Ihre Expertise, Ideen und Impulse in die ISO-Gruppe ein und bewerben Sie sich mit einem aussagekräftigen Portfolio und unter Angabe Ihrer Kündigungsfrist sowie Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellung.
