_source.description:
At OpenUnited, we are creating a new platform and innovative model that helps digital talent around the world to develop skills, and to have long-term paying digital work whilst ensuring the sustainability of the open source ecosystem.We are now live in our beta phase whereby the platform is live at https://openunited.com/ and we have made our code repositories public at: https://github.com/OpenUnited/product-factory-composerHelp us build the future of digital work at OpenUnited. Getting Started

1) Join our discord server: https://discord.gg/T3xevYvWey 2) Register at https://openunited.com/ and create your profile 3) Fork our repos on GitHub https://github.com/OpenUnited/product-factory-composer andzwj;4) Get OpenUnited running on your development machine (see the README in the repo) 

5) Claim and complete a task on OpenUnited https://openunited.com/meta/openunited-product-factory/tasks When you are done with the task, issue a pull request and (IMPORTANT) make sure you complete the steps in OpenUnited to have this added to your portfolio. 

After you have collected 50 non-liquid points by working on tasks on Open Products like OpenUnited itself (https://openunited.com/meta/openunited-product-factory/tasks), you are eligible to claim tasks with liquid points that are convertible into payment.
_source.description_html:
At OpenUnited, we are creating a new platform and innovative model that helps digital talent around the world to develop skills, and to have long-term paying digital work whilst ensuring the sustainability of the open source ecosystem.


We are now live in our beta phase whereby the platform is live at https://openunited.com/ and we have made our code repositories public at: https://github.com/OpenUnited/product-factory-composer


Help us build the future of digital work at OpenUnited.


Getting Started

1) Join our discord server: https://discord.gg/T3xevYvWey


2) Register at https://openunited.com/ and create your profile


3) Fork our repos on GitHub https://github.com/OpenUnited/product-factory-composer ‍


4) Get OpenUnited running on your development machine (see the README in the repo)

5) Claim and complete a task on OpenUnited https://openunited.com/meta/openunited-product-factory/tasks When you are done with the task, issue a pull request and (IMPORTANT) make sure you complete the steps in OpenUnited to have this added to your portfolio.


After you have collected 50 non-liquid points by working on tasks on Open Products like OpenUnited itself (https://openunited.com/meta/openunited-product-factory/tasks), you are eligible to claim tasks with liquid points that are convertible into payment.

_source.description_html:
At OpenUnited, we are creating a new platform and innovative model that helps digital talent around the world to develop skills, and to have long-term paying digital work whilst ensuring the sustainability of the open source ecosystem.


We are now live in our beta phase whereby the platform is live at https://openunited.com/ and we have made our code repositories public at: https://github.com/OpenUnited/product-factory-composer


Help us build the future of digital work at OpenUnited.


Getting Started

1) Join our discord server: https://discord.gg/T3xevYvWey


2) Register at https://openunited.com/ and create your profile


3) Fork our repos on GitHub https://github.com/OpenUnited/product-factory-composer ‍


4) Get OpenUnited running on your development machine (see the README in the repo)

5) Claim and complete a task on OpenUnited https://openunited.com/meta/openunited-product-factory/tasks When you are done with the task, issue a pull request and (IMPORTANT) make sure you complete the steps in OpenUnited to have this added to your portfolio.


After you have collected 50 non-liquid points by working on tasks on Open Products like OpenUnited itself (https://openunited.com/meta/openunited-product-factory/tasks), you are eligible to claim tasks with liquid points that are convertible into payment.

_source.description:
Job DescriptionTo manage Software Programs and Projects that are directly tied to the development of silicone development including managing platform HW/ SW dependencies across the platform.
Your specific responsibilities may include but are not limited to the following:
Manages program of large and global scope throughout all phases of product life cycle
QualificationsLeads the SW program and key program interface in Core Team and Mission Control meetings
Leads decision making at program level for SW
Develops, monitors and adjusts program schedule and take action as appropriate
Negotiates and coordinate program milestone and schedule with broader Silicone development teams
Identifies and manages interdependencies and integration activities across SW and HW teams and stakeholders
Identifies risks and work with relevant stakeholders to develop mitigation plan
Exercises judgement and discretion to remove obstacles and redefine approaches
Owns communication and report out to different levels of program and management
Sets direction and business operations in support of program goals, influences cross functional strategies relevant to program goals
Drive cross functional teams root cause analysis and resolution
Partners with SW Product Owner and Engineering Manager for program prioritization, change management and schedule alignment
Has an understanding of technical concept, architecture and system, development methods and utilizes knowledge to accelerate program execution
Inside this Business GroupThe Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential.

Job Description




  • To manage Software Programs and Projects that are directly tied to the development of silicone development including managing platform HW/ SW dependencies across the platform.




  • Your specific responsibilities may include but are not limited to the following:




  • Manages program of large and global scope throughout all phases of product life cycle




Qualifications




  • Leads the SW program and key program interface in Core Team and Mission Control meetings




  • Leads decision making at program level for SW




  • Develops, monitors and adjusts program schedule and take action as appropriate




  • Negotiates and coordinate program milestone and schedule with broader Silicone development teams




  • Identifies and manages interdependencies and integration activities across SW and HW teams and stakeholders




  • Identifies risks and work with relevant stakeholders to develop mitigation plan




  • Exercises judgement and discretion to remove obstacles and redefine approaches




  • Owns communication and report out to different levels of program and management




  • Sets direction and business operations in support of program goals, influences cross functional strategies relevant to program goals




  • Drive cross functional teams root cause analysis and resolution




  • Partners with SW Product Owner and Engineering Manager for program prioritization, change management and schedule alignment




  • Has an understanding of technical concept, architecture and system, development methods and utilizes knowledge to accelerate program execution




Inside this Business Group


The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential.

_source.description:
Do you want to change the real estate market with us? Together we build the PropTech company of the future. About Homeday and the Job MissionHomeday aims to improve the way people buy and sell real estate. Making the entire process simple, transparent, and more efficient. Together we have already saved our customers millions in commission. Supporting users and guiding them efficiently through the processes involved in buying or selling real estate is a very important aspect. Therefore we, the Closing Squad, focus on the processes after buyers have been qualified as good and fitting the property. This includes booking the on-site viewing (OSV), the OSV itself, the feedback and offer-making process, the selection of a suitable buyer, and the "Digital Deal Closing" (DDC: the final steps to conclude a selling or buying).Stakeholder - Lars Feske (Engineering Manager)
Recruiter - Wolf-Martin Naumann (LinkedIn)
Contract - Full Time, unlimited
Remote Policy - Work 4 days from "wherever you are" and one Team-Day* in the office (*when the Covid situation allows it)
Location - Berlin or Cologne, Germany
 Where your expertise is needed
Write clean and efficient code and follow best practices (TDD, CI, PRs, Code Reviews and Standards) in an agile environment
Continually introduce and integrate relevant new technologies.
Working closely with other developers and product designers to develop and test new ideas.
Your self organized attitude will help you to prioritize your tasks independently
manage business requirements and challenge them 

Closing - Squad - Context:

As a Backend Engineer, you will be focussing on Homeday Connect, a customer relationship management (CRM) application that enables partner realtors from our brokerage business model as our one single source of truth of all documents and to keep everyone up to date about the status of deals. It is also used by our own back office team to manage deals, property-related data, buyer requests, and contacts in general. You will help the squad take meaningful actions based on the insights and analytical products to implement new, innovative features as well as maintain given ones. What we are looking for
You have a profound experience in Ruby and object-oriented development
You have a good knowledge of the Rails framework and Ruby ecosystem
You work well with relational databases (MySQL and PostgreSQL)
You worked with third-party APIs and developed APIs yourself
You have a strong testing background (RSpec, Minitest, etc.)
You write meaningful and traceable Git commits
You are familiar with agile development methods like SCRUM or KANBAN
You are a great communicator, enjoy working in a team and paying attention to details
You do not meet all of the points listed? No problem! Whether our expectations match, we will find out within a first call! What we offer
Work-Life-Balance - You can work up to 80% of your time from home, choose part-time models and spend 30 days of vacation.
Advancement - You get 1000 educational budget (+educational leave) yearly, biyearly feedback talks and annual salary increases.
Innovation - You work on products that revolutionize a conservative market.
PropTech Company - We work with top notch technologies and you'll work with the equipment of your choice.
Product Engineering Week - You'll have the chance to work on anything you want for a week every quarter.
Relocation Support - If you need to move, we will support you to finance and organize your relocation.
 At Homeday, we don't just accept diversity - we celebrate and support it! We're committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of gender, place of origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, colour and disabilities. We care about each other!Our employees often refer to the 'Homeday Culture' as something special. We are proud they do - as we are building and rebuilding it together everyday. At the core we are just a nice bunch of people. Working together on a mission. Guided by principles. Fair, diverse, transparent. Do you share our values? Then come and visit our teams for a glimpse of how Homeday works.Do you have any questions in advance?
Please contact our responsible RecruiterWolf-Martin Naumann
wolf.naumann@homeday.de
_source.description_html:
Do you want to change the real estate market with us? Together we build the PropTech company of the future.

 

About Homeday and the Job Mission

Homeday aims to improve the way people buy and sell real estate. Making the entire process simple, transparent, and more efficient. Together we have already saved our customers millions in commission. 

Supporting users and guiding them efficiently through the processes involved in buying or selling real estate is a very important aspect. Therefore we, the Closing Squad, focus on the processes after buyers have been qualified as good and fitting the property. This includes booking the on-site viewing (OSV), the OSV itself, the feedback and offer-making process, the selection of a suitable buyer, and the âDigital Deal Closingâ (DDC: the final steps to conclude a selling or buying).

  • Stakeholder - Lars Feske (Engineering Manager)
  • Recruiter - Wolf-Martin Naumann (LinkedIn)
  • Contract - Full Time, unlimited
  • Remote Policy - Work 4 days from âwherever you areâ and one Team-Day* in the office (*when the Covid situation allows it)
  • Location - Berlin or Cologne, Germany

 

Where your expertise is needed

  • Write clean and efficient code and follow best practices (TDD, CI, PRs, Code Reviews & Standards) in an agile environment
  • Continually introduce and integrate relevant new technologies.
  • Working closely with other developers and product designers to develop and test new ideas.
  • Your self organized attitude will help you to prioritize your tasks independently
  • manage business requirements and challenge them

Closing - Squad - Context:

As a Backend Engineer, you will be focussing on Homeday Connect, a customer relationship management (CRM) application that enables partner realtors from our brokerage business model as our one single source of truth of all documents and to keep everyone up to date about the status of deals. It is also used by our own back office team to manage deals, property-related data, buyer requests, and contacts in general. You will help the squad take meaningful actions based on the insights and analytical products to implement new, innovative features as well as maintain given ones.

 

What we are looking for

  • You have a profound experience in Ruby and object-oriented development
  • You have a good knowledge of the Rails framework and Ruby ecosystem
  • You work well with relational databases (MySQL and PostgreSQL)
  • You worked with third-party APIs and developed APIs yourself
  • You have a strong testing background (RSpec, Minitest, etc.)
  • You write meaningful and traceable Git commits
  • You are familiar with agile development methods like SCRUM or KANBAN
  • You are a great communicator, enjoy working in a team and paying attention to details

You do not meet all of the points listed? No problem! Whether our expectations match, we will find out within a first call!

 

What we offer

  • Work-Life-Balance - You can work up to 80% of your time from home, choose part-time models and spend 30 days of vacation.
  • Advancement - You get 1000â¬ educational budget (+educational leave) yearly, biyearly feedback talks and annual salary increases.
  • Innovation - You work on products that revolutionize a conservative market.
  • PropTech Company - We work with top notch technologies and youâll work with the equipment of your choice.
  • Product Engineering Week - Youâll have the chance to work on anything you want for a week every quarter.
  • Relocation Support - If you need to move, we will support you to finance and organize your relocation.

 

At Homeday, we donât just accept diversity - we celebrate and support it! Weâre committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of gender, place of origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, colour and disabilities. We care about each other!

Our employees often refer to the 'Homeday Culture' as something special. We are proud they do â as we are building and rebuilding it together everyday. At the core we are just a nice bunch of people. Working together on a mission. Guided by principles. Fair, diverse, transparent. Do you share our values? Then come and visit our teams for a glimpse of how Homeday works.

Do you have any questions in advance?
Please contact our responsible Recruiter

Wolf-Martin Naumann
wolf.naumann@homeday.de

_source.description:
Do you believe that people should compassionately support one another to create a better world? Well, we do!Serving as the world's most trusted fundraising platform, GoFundMe is committed to creating a better world by making it safe and easy for people to support causes they're passionate about. When someone sees a need-whether it's in their neighborhood or across the globe-they can turn their compassion into action through GoFundMe. Our customers have raised over $15 billion for their personal causes, making GoFundMe a top 200 website in the US based on traffic, with a monthly audience of over 100 million people.GoFundMe is looking for an Associate Product Manager to own and drive a section of our Authentication, Identity and Communications Infrastructure roadmap for GoFundMe. The Job...Working embedded in a team building systems and products that support account security, user experience and communications on the GoFundMe platform 
Collaborate closely with our key stakeholders and team to continuously drive our workflow and prioritize new initiatives 
Partner with other product managers and engineers to develop a product strategy that supports the strategic objectives and interests of the team and company
Ensure the health of your product by testing and monitoring key performance data
Overseeing the end to end development, from planning and defining requirements to launch, for improvements, new features and projects. 
Manage expectations by communicating progress to stakeholders and partners.
Partner with a multitude of cross functional teams inside of Product Development and across the entire company
You...Undergraduate degree in engineering, math, business, economics.
Deep understanding and empathy for our users and the product development functions that serve them.
System thinking mindset, technical background and passion.
An analytical and metrics driven work style that leverages data to make informed decisions.
Great interpersonal and communication skills that shine, whether you're talking with a teammate or engaging a cross-functional audience.
Natural curiosity, obsession with the details, desire to build the right thing in an ever changing environment.
Why you'll love it here...Market competitive pay
Rich healthcare benefits including employer paid premiums for medical/dental/vision (100% for employee only plans and 85% for employee + dependent plans) and employer HSA contributions. 
401(k) retirement plan with company matching
Hybrid workplace with fully remote flexibility for many roles
Monetary support for new hire setup, hybrid work and wellbeing, family planning, and commuting expenses
A variety of mental and wellness programs to support employees 
Generous paid parental leave and family planning stipend
Supportive time off policies including vacation, sick/mental health days, volunteer days, company holidays, and a floating holiday
Learning and development and recognition programs
Gives Back Program where employees can nominate a fundraiser every week for a donation from the company
Inclusion, diversity, equity, and belonging are vital to our priorities and we continue to evolve our strategy to ensure DEI is embedded in all processes and programs at GoFundMe. Our Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion team is always finding new ways for our company to uphold and represent the experiences of all of the people in our organization.
Employee resource groups
Your work has a real purpose and will help change lives on a global scale.
You'll be a part of a fun, supportive team that works hard and celebrates accomplishments together. 
We live by our core values: consider everything, do the right thing, spread empathy, delight the customer, and give back.
We are a certified Great Place to Work, are growing fast and have incredible opportunities ahead!
GoFundMe is proud to be an equal opportunity employer that actively pursues candidates of diverse backgrounds and experiences. We are committed to providing diversity, equity, and inclusion training to all employees, and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, ethnicity, nationality or national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy status, marital status, age, medical condition, mental or physical disability, or military or veteran status.Learn more about GoFundMe...A Year in Giving: 2021GoFundMe HeroesWhy GoFundMeWe Support Justice + Equality

_source.description:
As our new Site Reliability Engineer (all genders) you will design and optimize the operation and ensure the availability of our micro services processing thousands of requests per second. You will take responsibility for the availability of our services and help bring new services to our customers. With a large portion of the biggest websites in central Europe using our services, you have the rare opportunity to help design and extend a system serving at web scale.

Key responsibilities:
Extend, operate and monitor the hosting setup for our micro services
 Work with engineering team to coordinate service deployments
 Organize and handle incident management and resolution
 Provide logging facilities to our engineering team for research purposes
 Maintain system documentation

_source.description_html:
Software Engineering (CCAR Developer), Assistant Vice President



  • Requisition # 10050255-WD

  • Job Type Full time

  • Location Tempe, Arizona

  • Date posted 01/27/2022


Your potential. Your opportunity.


Do you want your voice heard and your actions to count?


Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 5th largest financial group in the world. Across the globe, we’re 180,000 colleagues, striving to make a difference for every client, organization, and community we serve. We stand for our values, building long-term relationships, serving society, and fostering shared and sustainable growth for a better world.


With a vision to be the world’s most trusted financial group, it’s part of our culture to put people first, listen to new and diverse ideas and collaborate toward greater innovation, speed and agility. This means investing in talent, technologies, and tools that empower you to own your career.


Join MUFG, where being inspired is expected and making a meaningful impact is rewarded.


This is a hybrid position. There are flexible work from home options available. A member of our recruitment team will discuss the options with you in more detail.


Software Engineering (CCAR Developer), Assistant Vice President


Major Responsibilities



  • Understanding the business requirements and project objectives and perform fit gap analysis and design the solutions for Reg reporting

  • Develop the ETL process to support the Regulatory reporting using Axiom & Informatica

  • Identify the potential risks and controls

  • Document the testing results and support the SIT & UAT

  • Complete the work on timely basis with high quality

  • Report issues/findings to manager

  • Maintain the compliance with Reg tech SDLC methodology , while also operating within industry best standards

  • Build relationships with peers and client within the organization

  • Providing the third level support for production issue


Qualifications



  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a closely-related discipline, or an equivalent combination of formal education and experience

  • 5+ years of experience as a developer, experience in object-oriented languages like Java, Informatica or other ETL tools, and PL/SQL is required

  • Experience on AxiomSL Controller View is strongly preferred, experience on Axiom free form or tabular reports is a plus

  • Strong knowledge in data warehousing and experience in mapping techniques for Type 1, Type 2 and Type 3 Dimensions

  • Experience in Windows Server, Linux/Unix scripting, Autosys or similar job scheduling tools

  • Extensive experience in debugging

  • Solid experience in implementing business requirements, error handling

  • Expertise in analysis of functional specifications

  • Excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills

  • Ability to prioritize, meet deadlines and manage changing priorities

  • Prior experience in banking/financial services industry is desirable

  • Knowledge of CCAR Reporting (Comprehensive Capital Analysis and Review), FR Y-14M, FR Y-14Q & FR Y-14A and other relevant regulatory reports is strongly desirable


The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities duties and skills required of personnel so classified.


We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and committed to leveraging the diverse backgrounds, perspectives and experience of our workforce to create opportunities for our colleagues and our business. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, gender expression, gender identity, sex, age, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran and military status, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other status of an individual or that individual’s associates or relatives that is protected under applicable federal, state, or local law.


Some MUFG roles require that individuals be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, subject to exemptions for medical or religious reasons, as well as any other reason required by applicable law or order. Should you be selected for an interview, your recruiter will provide additional information.

_source.description:
Your impact
As a TA Partner for Technology, you know how to lead in-house recruitment efforts and are an expert in conducting in-depth interviews along with proving amazing candidate experiences. You have a clear, data-based, well-established voice when it comes to hiring talent - and you love what you do. You're all about relationships; you get that this is where it all happens. You're business-oriented, data-driven, interested in the world of technology and have a sense of urgency. You're creative, independent, and own what you do. Plus, you have strong interpersonal skills and local talent market knowledge.Your responsibilitiesPlay a major role in achieving the company's global growth goals;
Manage the full-cycle tech recruitment process from an engaging sourcing strategy to getting talent on board
Work closely with the Talent Acquisition team to move candidates through the interview process as smoothly and quickly as possible
Collaborate closely with Hiring Managers throughout the recruiting process to ensure we meet their hiring needs and goals and drive offer process, partnering with hiring managers and HR
Leverage and maintain data reports and performance metrics to drive improvements as needed
Manage established networks to attract diverse, ambitious tech talent to join our team;
Lead or participate in projects to support the development of our tech talent acquisition;
Be an ambassador for our culture and mission
Create a unique and memorable experience for candidates.
About youProven commercial experience in leading tech talent acquisition
A track record of high-performance, and success working in a fast moving environment within the tech/IT niche
Interpersonal experience with communicating across all levels of the organisation internally, as well as externally
Experience independently partnering with leadership and driving hiring initiatives
Industry knowledge with experience in understanding similar, you are an expert in creating a tech/IT talent pool
You are structured, hands on, innovative and love to take ownership.
Proactive, enthusiastic, results-focus, flexible, adaptable, ability to deal with a fast paced environment, attention to detail, superb organisational skills.

_source.description:
Want to be a Hero? Join one of the leading global online food ordering and delivery marketplaces!We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer (f/m/d)to join the People Analytics team on our journey to always delivering amazing experiences. Contribute to the creation of our next-generation analytics products that will help our business make the right decisions utilizing people and business data. Add real value to the company by expanding our data warehouse with new data sources and functionalities to support our analysts in building amazing solutions for our stakeholders. If youandrsquo;re looking for a fun team and a role with lots of potential and freedom in utilizing your skills, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!About People Analytics:Our team is like a family and we all work closely together to create great products. We support People Analytics globally across all of Delivery Heroandrsquo;s entities and work with stakeholders and users across the entire business which allows us to have a great understanding of the organizationandrsquo;s needs. We manage end to end solutions from integrating data to our data warehouse, conducting data quality to ensure what we provide is accurate and trustworthy to our users, creating interactive dashboards and visualizations as well as building data science products to predict and anticipate future challenges and opportunities. All the while building strong relationships with our stakeholders to enable them to always make the most informed decisions.Your mission:You will support the People Analytics strategy for Delivery Hero as part of the People Analytics Solutions team
Your main responsibility will be to work closely with the rest of the People Analytics Solutions team on developing new products and solutions
You will work together with stakeholders from multiple countries, companies and teams to design innovative products in a fast paced environment
You will be responsible for continued development and maintenance of our data warehouse, including improvements of existing data structures and integrations
You will continue to integrate new systems from our IT landscape to further enhance our analytic capabilities
You will be the technical expert on solution design and support the Demand team with prototyping solutions for our stakeholders
You want to promote a data driven environment and help the business perform better through the use and analysis of people data
Your heroic skills:Background in Mathematics, Statistics, Data Engineering, Analytics or similar
Passionate about data and have computer science fundamentals
You are running, maintaining, and deploying your own code to production
You have experience with processing large amounts of structured and unstructured data
Experience with cloud environments, data engineering, and API integrations
Experience working with Amazon Web Services or similar cloud environment
Highly proficient in SQL and Python
Thorough understanding of data quality control and best practices
Comfortable working in a technical environment, being able to assess and decide on optimal technical and scalable solutions

_source.description_html:
Want to be a Hero? Join one of the leading global online food ordering and delivery marketplaces!


We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer (f/m/d)to join the People Analytics team on our journey to always delivering amazing experiences. Contribute to the creation of our next-generation analytics products that will help our business make the right decisions utilizing people and business data. Add real value to the company by expanding our data warehouse with new data sources and functionalities to support our analysts in building amazing solutions for our stakeholders. If you’re looking for a fun team and a role with lots of potential and freedom in utilizing your skills, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!



About People Analytics:


Our team is like a family and we all work closely together to create great products. We support People Analytics globally across all of Delivery Hero’s entities and work with stakeholders and users across the entire business which allows us to have a great understanding of the organization’s needs. We manage end to end solutions from integrating data to our data warehouse, conducting data quality to ensure what we provide is accurate and trustworthy to our users, creating interactive dashboards and visualizations as well as building data science products to predict and anticipate future challenges and opportunities. All the while building strong relationships with our stakeholders to enable them to always make the most informed decisions.



Your mission:




  • You will support the People Analytics strategy for Delivery Hero as part of the People Analytics Solutions team




  • Your main responsibility will be to work closely with the rest of the People Analytics Solutions team on developing new products and solutions




  • You will work together with stakeholders from multiple countries, companies and teams to design innovative products in a fast paced environment




  • You will be responsible for continued development and maintenance of our data warehouse, including improvements of existing data structures and integrations




  • You will continue to integrate new systems from our IT landscape to further enhance our analytic capabilities




  • You will be the technical expert on solution design and support the Demand team with prototyping solutions for our stakeholders




  • You want to promote a data driven environment and help the business perform better through the use and analysis of people data





Your heroic skills:




  • Background in Mathematics, Statistics, Data Engineering, Analytics or similar




  • Passionate about data and have computer science fundamentals




  • You are running, maintaining, and deploying your own code to production




  • You have experience with processing large amounts of structured and unstructured data




  • Experience with cloud environments, data engineering, and API integrations




  • Experience working with Amazon Web Services or similar cloud environment




  • Highly proficient in SQL and Python




  • Thorough understanding of data quality control and best practices




  • Comfortable working in a technical environment, being able to assess and decide on optimal technical and scalable solutions




  • Strong communication skills in English





Nice to have:




  • Strong understanding of HR processes and data structures




  • Knowledgeable in Tableau or other Business Intelligence tools (PowerBI, Looker, Workday Discovery Boards)




  • Ability to successfully manage multiple projects and priorities at a time




  • Experience with other HCM systems and advanced analytics




  • Experience working with data science products
_source.position_name: Senior Data Engineer, People Analytics (f/m/d) at Delivery Hero SE (Berlin, Germany)

_source.description:
Fanduuml;r unser Institut fanduuml;r Aerodynamik und Strandouml;mungstechnik in Gandouml;ttingen suchen wir eine/nMathematiker/in, Physiker/in oder Ingenieur/in Luft- und Raumfahrttechnik, Maschinenbau o. andauml;. (w/m/d) Identifikation von Strandouml;mungsphandauml;nomenen und Unsicherheiten in hochaufgelandouml;sten SimulationsdatenIhre Mission:Das Institut fanduuml;r Aerodynamik und Strandouml;mungstechnik ist ein fanduuml;hrendes Forschungsinstitut auf den Gebieten Flugzeug-Aerodynamik, Flugzeug- Aeroakustik und Raumfahrt-Aerothermodynamik.Die Abteilung Candsup2;Aandsup2;Sandsup2;E entwickelt numerische Verfahren und Prozesse zur multidisziplinandauml;ren Simulation und Optimierung von Fluggerandauml;ten. Die Forschungsaktivitandauml;ten umfassen neben der physikalischen Modellierung komplexer Strandouml;mungen und der Entwicklung fortschrittlicher Landouml;sungsalgorithmen auch die Einbindung aller relevanten Disziplinen, die Entwicklung effizienter Optimierungsstrategien sowie die Entwicklung von Ersatzmodellen auf Basis handouml;herwertiger Simulationsverfahren. Die in der Abteilung entwickelten hybriden Strandouml;mungslandouml;ser werden fanduuml;r einen breiten Anwendungsbereich in Forschung und Industrie routinemandauml;andszlig;ig eingesetzt.Ihre Aufgabe besteht in der Entwicklung und Anwendung einer Methode zur automatisierten Identifikation von relevanten Strandouml;mungsphandauml;nomenen in der Luftfahrt bzw. Windenergie (z. B. Grenzschichten, freie Scherschichten, Wirbel) sowie von mandouml;glichen Unsicherheiten in der numerischen Simulation. Aufgrund der enormen Grandouml;andszlig;e der betrachteten Datensandauml;tze, die mit Hilfe skalenauflandouml;sender Simulationsverfahren auf Hochleistungsrechnern (HPC) erzeugt werden, sollen hierfanduuml;r Methoden des Machine Learnings (Klassifizierung) zur Anwendung kommen. Neben der effizienten Analyse von groandszlig;en Simulationsdaten soll die entwickelte Methodik auch zur automatisierten Verbesserung von hybriden RANS/LES-Simulationen genutzt werden. Im Rahmen der Arbeiten kommen die CFD-Landouml;ser TAU und CODA zur Erstellung von Simulationsdaten, die Software Smarty zur Anbindung des Machine Learnings sowie die Kopplungsumgebung FlowSimulator DataManager (FSDM) zum Einsatz.Die Stelle kann auch in Teilzeit besetzt werden.Ihre Qualifikation:abgeschlossenes wissenschaftliches Hochschulstudium (Diplom/Master) in der Physik, Mathematik oder in einer Ingenieurwissenschaft wie Luft- und Raumfahrttechnik, Maschinenbau o. andauml;.
sehr gute Kenntnisse im Bereich der numerischen Strandouml;mungsmechanik und Algorithmen
gute Kenntnisse im Bereich der Anwendung von Machine-Learning-Methoden insbesondere fanduuml;r Klassifizierung
gute Kenntnisse im Bereich skalenauflandouml;sender Simulationsverfahren
gute Kenntnisse im Bereich handouml;herer Programmiersprachen (Python, C/C++, o. andauml;.) unter Linux/Unix
Fandauml;higkeit zur standortanduuml;bergreifenden Teamarbeit und zur eigenstandauml;ndigen, termingebundenen Erledigung von Aufgaben
gute Kenntnisse der englischen Sprache in Wort und Schrift
vorzugsweise Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung im Team

Unser einzigartiges Arbeitsumfeld bietet Ihnen Gestaltungsandshy;freiandshy;randauml;ume und eine unvergleichbare Infrastruktur, in der Sie Ihre Mission verwirklichen kandouml;nnen. Vereinbarkeit von Privatleben, Familie und Beruf sowie Chancengleichheit von Personen aller Geschlechter (w/m/d) sind wichtiger Bestandteil unserer Personalandshy;politik. _source.description_html:
Für unser Institut für Aerodynamik und Strömungstechnik in Göttingen suchen wir eine/n


Mathematiker/in, Physiker/in oder Ingenieur/in Luft- und Raumfahrttechnik, Maschinenbau o. ä. (w/m/d) Identifikation von Strömungsphänomenen und Unsicherheiten in hochaufgelösten Simulationsdaten


Ihre Mission:


Das Institut für Aerodynamik und Strömungstechnik ist ein führendes Forschungsinstitut auf den Gebieten Flugzeug-Aerodynamik, Flugzeug- Aeroakustik und Raumfahrt-Aerothermodynamik.


Die Abteilung C²A²S²E entwickelt numerische Verfahren und Prozesse zur multidisziplinären Simulation und Optimierung von Fluggeräten. Die Forschungsaktivitäten umfassen neben der physikalischen Modellierung komplexer Strömungen und der Entwicklung fortschrittlicher Lösungsalgorithmen auch die Einbindung aller relevanten Disziplinen, die Entwicklung effizienter Optimierungsstrategien sowie die Entwicklung von Ersatzmodellen auf Basis höherwertiger Simulationsverfahren. Die in der Abteilung entwickelten hybriden Strömungslöser werden für einen breiten Anwendungsbereich in Forschung und Industrie routinemäßig eingesetzt.


Ihre Aufgabe besteht in der Entwicklung und Anwendung einer Methode zur automatisierten Identifikation von relevanten Strömungsphänomenen in der Luftfahrt bzw. Windenergie (z. B. Grenzschichten, freie Scherschichten, Wirbel) sowie von möglichen Unsicherheiten in der numerischen Simulation. Aufgrund der enormen Größe der betrachteten Datensätze, die mit Hilfe skalenauflösender Simulationsverfahren auf Hochleistungsrechnern (HPC) erzeugt werden, sollen hierfür Methoden des Machine Learnings (Klassifizierung) zur Anwendung kommen. Neben der effizienten Analyse von großen Simulationsdaten soll die entwickelte Methodik auch zur automatisierten Verbesserung von hybriden RANS/LES-Simulationen genutzt werden. Im Rahmen der Arbeiten kommen die CFD-Löser TAU und CODA zur Erstellung von Simulationsdaten, die Software Smarty zur Anbindung des Machine Learnings sowie die Kopplungsumgebung FlowSimulator DataManager (FSDM) zum Einsatz.


Die Stelle kann auch in Teilzeit besetzt werden.


Ihre Qualifikation:



  • abgeschlossenes wissenschaftliches Hochschulstudium (Diplom/Master) in der Physik, Mathematik oder in einer Ingenieurwissenschaft wie Luft- und Raumfahrttechnik, Maschinenbau o. ä.

  • sehr gute Kenntnisse im Bereich der numerischen Strömungsmechanik und Algorithmen

  • gute Kenntnisse im Bereich der Anwendung von Machine-Learning-Methoden insbesondere für Klassifizierung

  • gute Kenntnisse im Bereich skalenauflösender Simulationsverfahren

  • gute Kenntnisse im Bereich höherer Programmiersprachen (Python, C/C++, o. ä.) unter Linux/Unix

  • Fähigkeit zur standortübergreifenden Teamarbeit und zur eigenständigen, termingebundenen Erledigung von Aufgaben

  • gute Kenntnisse der englischen Sprache in Wort und Schrift

  • vorzugsweise Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung im Team


Ihr Start:


Freuen Sie sich auf einen Arbeitgeber, der Ihr Engagement zu schätzen weiß und Ihre Entwicklung durch vielfältige Qualifizierungs- und Weiterbildungs­möglich­keiten fördert. Unser einzigartiges Arbeitsumfeld bietet Ihnen Gestaltungs­frei­räume und eine unvergleichbare Infrastruktur, in der Sie Ihre Mission verwirklichen können. Vereinbarkeit von Privatleben, Familie und Beruf sowie Chancengleichheit von Personen aller Geschlechter (w/m/d) sind wichtiger Bestandteil unserer Personal­politik. Bewerbungen schwerbehinderter Menschen bevorzugen wir bei fachlicher Eignung.


Fachliche Fragen beantwortet Ihnen gerne Frau Dr. Cornelia Grabe telefonisch unter +49 551 709-2628. Weitere Informationen zu dieser Position mit der Kennziffer 62953 sowie zur Vergütung und zum Bewerbungsweg finden Sie unter www.DLR.de/dlr/jobs/#47358
_source.position_name: Mathematiker, Physiker, Ing. Luft- und Raumfahrttech., Maschinenbau o.ä. (w/m/d) at Deutsches Zentrum für Luft- und Raumfahrt e. V. (DLR) (Göttingen, Deutschland)

You will take responsibility for the availability of our services and help bring new services to our customers. With a large portion of the biggest websites in central Europe using our services, you have the rare opportunity to help design and extend a system serving at web scale.

Key responsibilities:
Extend, operate and monitor the hosting setup for our micro services
 Work with engineering team to coordinate service deployments
 Organize and handle incident management and resolution
 Provide logging facilities to our engineering team for research purposes
 Maintain system documentation

eLearning Industry (founded in 2012) is a US-based digital marketing powerhouse. Its headquarters are located in Reno, NV with a branch in Athens, Greece. eLearning Industry facilitates the promotion of companies in the booming eLearning sector, creating awareness for their brand, generating leads, and driving exceptional results.

More than 930,000 eLearning professionals utilize the content hosted on eLearning Industrys platform to stay up to date with the latest developments in the industry and become empowered to make informed decisions for their large-scale eLearning projects.

eLearning Industrys team is growing rapidly and is looking for a Frontend Developer to work remotely or on-site for their Athens branch.

Role description

As a Frontend Developer, you will play a vital role in building efficient, testable, and well-documented code that delivers real business value to the users of our platform.

Be an essential part of our agile team of web professionals, building our front-end components and libraries. Stay plugged into emerging technologies and apply them to day-to-day operations.

  • Gather and refine specifications based on business and technical requirements

  • Collaborate with UX experts and backend developers for optimal results

  • Competitive remuneration package
  • Career development and continuous training opportunities
  • Private medical insurance
  • Exceptional corporate culture and working environment

_source.description:
Experience level: SeniorHello! Are you ready to Work from Home and transform your career?We're looking for an Android Engineer to join the engineering team at Modus. Want to help our clients build awesome solutions to accomplish their goals and vision? Are you interested in working from home with some of the best talents on the planet? Then keep reading.About YouYou love building great software. Your work could be supporting new feature development, migrating existing features, or integrating APIs. You are a skilled Android Engineer with professional experience with Kotlin. You also may have experience working with Java in the past.You have worked with teams before on large and demonstrable projects. You have a deep understanding of Android fundamentals and the intricacies of the Android lifecycle with a strong focus on high-quality mobile experiences. You are familiar with the pitfalls of high-volume applications, and their accompanying services. You are excited to work in a lean and fast-paced environment where you invent, maintain, and scale-out both new and existing high-volume mobile applications. You have knowledge of UI/UX and can confidently translate the designs from our UX and visual design team members.You relish creating high-quality code from the comfort of your own home. Your engineering projects will focus on understanding customers' needs and translating those needs from product specifications into functional, production-ready code. You'll have the opportunity to ship code daily that will be used by customers.You love learning. Engineering is an ever-evolving world. You enjoy playing with new tech and exploring areas that you might not have experience with yet. You are a self-driven, self-learner willing to share knowledge and participate actively in your community.Having overlap with your team is critical when working in a global remote team. In addition, reliable high-speed internet is a must.
Things You Might DoModus is a fast-growing, and remote-first company, so you'll likely get experience on many different projects across the organization. That said, here are some things you'll probably do:Give back to the community via open source and blog posts
Travel and meet great people- as part of our remote-first lifestyle, it's important that we come together as needed to work together, meet each other in person and have fun together. Please keep that in mind when you apply.
Teach and be taught: Modus creates active teams that work in internal and external projects together, giving opportunities to stay relevant with the latest technologies and learning from experts worldwide
Interact directly with internal and external clients to represent Modus and its values
Why Modus Create:Our Benefits may vary according to the country you are located in, so please reach out to our recruiter in case you have any questions.If you become a contractor we offer:Competitive compensation
100% Remote work (could vary according to the client's needs)
Travel according to client's needs
The chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech
If you live in the USA and you become a full-time employee we offer:Competitive compensation
Health insurance (medical, vision, and dental) and other benefits (FSA and HSA)
401(K) match to up to 3.5% of your annual salary
Remote work
The chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech
Flexible Time Off/PTO
If you live in Romania and you become a full-time employee we offer:Competitive compensation
Private medical insurance
Attractive flexible benefits system
Evergreen benefits (Bookster account, flexible working schedule, company lunch in the office, unlimited work from home days, company team building and events, company dinner events, etc)
The chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech
If you live in Costa Rica and you become a full-time employee we offer:Competitive compensation
100% Remote work (could vary according to the client's needs)
Travel according to client's needs
Company-paid private insurance
The chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech
Social Security (CCSS) by law 
Do you have what it takes? Apply today!
_source.description_html:
Experience level: Senior


Hello! Are you ready to Work from Home and transform your career?


We're looking for an Android Engineer to join the engineering team at Modus. Want to help our clients build awesome solutions to accomplish their goals and vision? Are you interested in working from home with some of the best talents on the planet? Then keep reading.


About You


You love building great software. Your work could be supporting new feature development, migrating existing features, or integrating APIs. You are a skilled Android Engineer with professional experience with Kotlin. You also may have experience working with Java in the past.


You have worked with teams before on large and demonstrable projects. You have a deep understanding of Android fundamentals and the intricacies of the Android lifecycle with a strong focus on high-quality mobile experiences. You are familiar with the pitfalls of high-volume applications, and their accompanying services.


You are excited to work in a lean and fast-paced environment where you invent, maintain, and scale-out both new and existing high-volume mobile applications. You have knowledge of UI/UX and can confidently translate the designs from our UX and visual design team members.


You relish creating high-quality code from the comfort of your own home. Your engineering projects will focus on understanding customers' needs and translating those needs from product specifications into functional, production-ready code. You'll have the opportunity to ship code daily that will be used by customers.


You love learning. Engineering is an ever-evolving world. You enjoy playing with new tech and exploring areas that you might not have experience with yet. You are a self-driven, self-learner willing to share knowledge and participate actively in your community.


Having overlap with your team is critical when working in a global remote team. In addition, reliable high-speed internet is a must.



Things You Might Do


Modus is a fast-growing, and remote-first company, so you'll likely get experience on many different projects across the organization. That said, here are some things you'll probably do:



  • Give back to the community via open source and blog posts

  • Travel and meet great people- as part of our remote-first lifestyle, it's important that we come together as needed to work together, meet each other in person and have fun together. Please keep that in mind when you apply.

  • Teach and be taught: Modus creates active teams that work in internal and external projects together, giving opportunities to stay relevant with the latest technologies and learning from experts worldwide

  • Interact directly with internal and external clients to represent Modus and its values


Why Modus Create:


Our Benefits may vary according to the country you are located in, so please reach out to our recruiter in case you have any questions.


If you become a contractor we offer:



  • Competitive compensation

  • 100% Remote work (could vary according to the client's needs)

  • Travel according to client's needs

  • The chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech


If you live in the USA and you become a full-time employee we offer:



  • Competitive compensation

  • Health insurance (medical, vision, and dental) and other benefits (FSA and HSA)

  • 401(K) match to up to 3.5% of your annual salary

  • Remote work

  • The chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech

  • Flexible Time Off/PTO


If you live in Romania and you become a full-time employee we offer:



  • Competitive compensation

  • Private medical insurance

  • Attractive flexible benefits system

  • Evergreen benefits (Bookster account, flexible working schedule, company lunch in the office, unlimited work from home days, company team building and events, company dinner events, etc)

  • The chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech


If you live in Costa Rica and you become a full-time employee we offer:



  • Competitive compensation

  • 100% Remote work (could vary according to the client's needs)

  • Travel according to client's needs

  • Company-paid private insurance

  • The chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech

  • Social Security (CCSS) by law


Do you have what it takes? Apply today!

_source.description:
IMS is currently undertaking a programme of work to modernise and enhance our industry acclaimed DriveSync platform.DriveSync is a highly scalable, resilient, and robust AWS cloud-based platform that is perfectly placed to meet the needs of insurance and mobility customers. It ingests telematics data from many sources such as custom designed and commodity IoT devices, white labelled mobile apps, and an SDK. Once the data is ingested and validated, it is processed, analysed, and scored to produce valuable insights to our clients about their customers aimed at reducing their operational costs, increasing road safety, and improving driving behaviour.Our clients interact with our platform using APIs and portals and their customers visualise their journeys and see driving scores using our mobile phone application andldquo;OneAppandrdquo;.At its core, DriveSync is a big-data platform continuously ingesting, processing, and storing many terabytes of data sent from in-car devices. It leverages cutting edge data science, machine learning and data modelling capabilities to analyse and provide insights on the data. It is built using serverless technologies and microservice APIs coupled with modern software engineering practices and principles.As a DevOps engineer you will be involved in collaborative design and guidance, hands-on technical work, problem solving and solution implementation. You'll also share your knowledge with other members of the team, identify and champion improvement initiatives across the estate, working in tandem with engineering teams and other stakeholders to achieve business goals alongside your own personal development goals.Some of your responsibilities will include;- Being directly responsible for the implementation of the CI/CD toolchain and promoting best practice with CI/CD.- Providing input into the design and implementation of cloud infrastructure whilst also ensuring systems are secure by design and conform to AWS security best practices.- Actively seeking out opportunities for improvement and enhancement of the platform, finding delivery bottlenecks creating solutions for those bottlenecks.- Work closely with technical leads to ensure that platforms are designed for zero downtime and help support engineering team peers to ensure that development work is delivered on time, on budget and in line with best practice. Take accountability for the success of the project and offer input and insight to areas other than just the development.We know you'll have a great amount of skill to draw upon, but we think the most important are;- A passion for cloud computing tech, specifically AWS, and a desire for continuous improvement and innovation.- At least 2 yearsandrsquo; experience of working in a commercial environment using cloud technologies, preferably AWS including:API Gateway, Route 53, ECS, Fargate, S3, EC2, VPC and Lambda.
- An understanding of DevOps andlsquo;philosophyandrsquo; and a passion to embrace it, confidence in system architecture and a deep understanding of foundational concepts, particularly IAM, networking, DNS and HTTP.- Hands-on software engineering experience with one (or more!) programming language.- Proven, recent experience using tools for CI/CD e.g. GitLab or similar.- Experience of Infrastructure as code principles and technologies, including Terraform.- Able to work in harmony with multiple departments alongside colleagues or independently, as the task requires.- A forward thinking, 'can do' change mindset, making you open to adapting to changing business requirements.It would also be great, but not essential, if you had experience working as a Software Engineer, working in an agile environment and experience using SAM and AWS CloudFormation.Benefits- 33 days holiday inclusive of bank holidays plus a holiday buy/sell scheme to really make the most of your time.- Private life and health insurance- Christmas Savings Club and store discounts- Hybrid working policy- Online learning platform and Teams channels to help support your knowledge and enable you to share it with others- Employee Assistance Programme and an enhanced maternity/paternity package.- Kudos Hub - here you can recognise others using points, which can be collected and redeemed against a huge catalogue of rewards!- Culture Calendar - where everyone is invited to celebrate days on importance, such as Remembrance Day, National Coding Week and Road Safety Week.
_source.description_html:
IMS is currently undertaking a programme of work to modernise and enhance our industry acclaimed DriveSync platform.


DriveSync is a highly scalable, resilient, and robust AWS cloud-based platform that is perfectly placed to meet the needs of insurance and mobility customers. It ingests telematics data from many sources such as custom designed and commodity IoT devices, white labelled mobile apps, and an SDK. Once the data is ingested and validated, it is processed, analysed, and scored to produce valuable insights to our clients about their customers aimed at reducing their operational costs, increasing road safety, and improving driving behaviour.


Our clients interact with our platform using APIs and portals and their customers visualise their journeys and see driving scores using our mobile phone application “OneApp”.


At its core, DriveSync is a big-data platform continuously ingesting, processing, and storing many terabytes of data sent from in-car devices. It leverages cutting edge data science, machine learning and data modelling capabilities to analyse and provide insights on the data. It is built using serverless technologies and microservice APIs coupled with modern software engineering practices and principles.


As a DevOps engineer you will be involved in collaborative design and guidance, hands-on technical work, problem solving and solution implementation. You'll also share your knowledge with other members of the team, identify and champion improvement initiatives across the estate, working in tandem with engineering teams and other stakeholders to achieve business goals alongside your own personal development goals.


Some of your responsibilities will include;


- Being directly responsible for the implementation of the CI/CD toolchain and promoting best practice with CI/CD.


- Providing input into the design and implementation of cloud infrastructure whilst also ensuring systems are secure by design and conform to AWS security best practices.


- Actively seeking out opportunities for improvement and enhancement of the platform, finding delivery bottlenecks creating solutions for those bottlenecks.


- Work closely with technical leads to ensure that platforms are designed for zero downtime and help support engineering team peers to ensure that development work is delivered on time, on budget and in line with best practice. Take accountability for the success of the project and offer input and insight to areas other than just the development.


We know you'll have a great amount of skill to draw upon, but we think the most important are;


- A passion for cloud computing tech, specifically AWS, and a desire for continuous improvement and innovation.


- At least 2 years’ experience of working in a commercial environment using cloud technologies, preferably AWS including:



  • API Gateway, Route 53, ECS, Fargate, S3, EC2, VPC and Lambda.


- An understanding of DevOps ‘philosophy’ and a passion to embrace it, confidence in system architecture and a deep understanding of foundational concepts, particularly IAM, networking, DNS and HTTP.


- Hands-on software engineering experience with one (or more!) programming language.


- Proven, recent experience using tools for CI/CD e.g. GitLab or similar.


- Experience of Infrastructure as code principles and technologies, including Terraform.


- Able to work in harmony with multiple departments alongside colleagues or independently, as the task requires.


- A forward thinking, 'can do' change mindset, making you open to adapting to changing business requirements.


It would also be great, but not essential, if you had experience working as a Software Engineer, working in an agile environment and experience using SAM and AWS CloudFormation.


Benefits


- 33 days holiday inclusive of bank holidays plus a holiday buy/sell scheme to really make the most of your time.


- Private life and health insurance


- Christmas Savings Club and store discounts


- Hybrid working policy


- Online learning platform and Teams channels to help support your knowledge and enable you to share it with others


- Employee Assistance Programme and an enhanced maternity/paternity package.


- Kudos Hub - here you can recognise others using points, which can be collected and redeemed against a huge catalogue of rewards!


- Culture Calendar - where everyone is invited to celebrate days on importance, such as Remembrance Day, National Coding Week and Road Safety Week.
_source.position_name: DevOps Engineer at IMS (Crewe, UK) (allows remote)

_source.description:
As a Site Reliability Engineer at Flow Traders, you will closely collaborate with our Development, QA and IT team to build the most efficient pipelines for the continuous delivery of our software and infrastructure, from idea to production. You will follow the IaC approach for buildup and maintenance of our set ups in the cloud and on premises.A day in the life of a Site Reliability EngineerA typical day for a Site Reliability Engineer is a blend of short cycle maintenance and ongoing development and engineering work with a focus on optimizing the Continuous Delivery infrastructure, by improving performance, scalability and efficiency of the setup. It is required work closely with message broker systems, like Kafka, and longtime storage systems, such as HDFS. Some of the usual tasks are implementing security, monitoring and tuning the configuration of these systems.What will you work onDesign, implement, and maintain the Kafka clusters
Setup and maintain the Cloudera stack
Improve scalability and efficiency of the infrastructure of our Trading Landscape
Help to automate deployments
Work closely with Business (Trading, Risk and Compliance)
To succeed at Flow Traders, you have to be very self-motivated. Innovation is key to our culture, so we always encourage team members to seek out and implement improvements to our set up. We are fully focused on improving our level of automation of operational work, as that enables us to spend more time on innovation.
What you need to succeed:3+ years working as a DevOps or Site Reliability Engineer with a Cloud and on premise infrastructure (Hybrid set up)
3+ years hands on working experience in a complex Linux infrastructure environment with in-depth knowledge of Linux
Extensive experience in working with AWS or GCP, Terraform, Kafka, Kubernetes, Hadoop
Experience with Ansible
Working experience with CI/CD setups
Solid working knowledge of TCP/IP, routing, switching, and multicast
Excellent scripting skills in Python, Bash, Ruby, or Perl
Attracted to the dynamics of the financial markets
Experience with the Atlassian stack: Jira, Bitbucket, Confluence is a plus
_source.description_html:
As a Site Reliability Engineer at Flow Traders, you will closely collaborate with our Development, QA and IT team to build the most efficient pipelines for the continuous delivery of our software and infrastructure, from idea to production. You will follow the IaC approach for buildup and maintenance of our set ups in the cloud and on premises.


A day in the life of a Site Reliability Engineer


A typical day for a Site Reliability Engineer is a blend of short cycle maintenance and ongoing development and engineering work with a focus on optimizing the Continuous Delivery infrastructure, by improving performance, scalability and efficiency of the setup. It is required work closely with message broker systems, like Kafka, and longtime storage systems, such as HDFS. Some of the usual tasks are implementing security, monitoring and tuning the configuration of these systems.


What will you work on



  • Design, implement, and maintain the Kafka clusters

  • Setup and maintain the Cloudera stack

  • Improve scalability and efficiency of the infrastructure of our Trading Landscape

  • Help to automate deployments

  • Work closely with Business (Trading, Risk and Compliance)

  • To succeed at Flow Traders, you have to be very self-motivated. Innovation is key to our culture, so we always encourage team members to seek out and implement improvements to our set up. We are fully focused on improving our level of automation of operational work, as that enables us to spend more time on innovation.


What you need to succeed:



  • 3+ years working as a DevOps or Site Reliability Engineer with a Cloud and on premise infrastructure (Hybrid set up)

  • 3+ years hands on working experience in a complex Linux infrastructure environment with in-depth knowledge of Linux

  • Extensive experience in working with AWS or GCP, Terraform, Kafka, Kubernetes, Hadoop

  • Experience with Ansible

  • Working experience with CI/CD setups

  • Solid working knowledge of TCP/IP, routing, switching, and multicast

  • Excellent scripting skills in Python, Bash, Ruby, or Perl

  • Attracted to the dynamics of the financial markets

  • Experience with the Atlassian stack: Jira, Bitbucket, Confluence is a plus
_source.position_name: Site Reliability Engineer at Flow Traders (Amsterdam, Netherlands)

_source.description:
Creative Assembly are looking for an experienced Build Engineer to join our brand-new and exciting First-Person Shooter IP based at our studio in Horsham, in the heart of West Sussex.

As part of the Build team, you will be responsible for developing backend infrastructure for the build pipeline and maintaining the continuous integration and testing systems.

Key Responsibilities
 
In this new and varied role as a Build Engineer, you will be a crucial member of the team, enabling the development team to work as efficiently as possible to deliver solid tools to facilitate rapid and stable build. 

On a day-to-day basis, you will carry out varying tasks such as:Creating extensions to Unreal Engine code (C++)
Writing scripts to support CI and all related systems (C#, Python, batch files), dashboard UIs (C#/web development)
Working with store APIs (e.g. Steamworks) to manage builds
Liaising with the Engineering teams to formulate plans to help with the fast and effective delivery of builds and tools for the wider team
Creating and managing work processes that improve build robustness and helping to foster an environment of responsible development
Knowledge, Skill and Experience 

EssentialA solid technical foundation - e.g. Computer Science / Maths degree or equivalent work experience
Solid C++ skills
Experience in higher-level programming languages andndash; e.g. C# or Python
Knowledge of version control software andndash; e.g., Helix Perforce or Git
Worked with CI systems such as Teamcity, Jenkins or Hudson
Approachable, friendly, and confident in decision making with excellent communication skills
DesirableGames industry experience
Experience using UE4
Experience with database systems such as SQL, Elasticsearch or MongoDB
Familiarity with any of the following languages: Java, Batch, PowerShell
Experience with post launch title support
Console game development experience
Web development

_source.description:
This an excellent opportunity to join Creative Assemblyandrsquo;s Total War AI team as an AI Programmer based at our studio in Horsham, West Sussex.

You will be working collaboratively with a diverse group of programmers, designers and QA technicians to create efficient and effective AI solutions to tackle the complex challenges presented by Total Warandrsquo;s turn-based strategic Campaign map and so help deliver a challenging, immerse and fun gameplay experience to our players.

Key Responsibilities 

As an AI Programmer you will be working with colleagues within the AI team, as well as the wider project teams, to help develop code for behavioural elements of the Total War AI systems. 

On a day-to-day basis, you will:Support existing AI systems through incremental improvement, feature updates and debugging along with creating new AI systems in response to project requirements
Be expected to familiarise yourself with the sizeable existing codebase as well as contributing to evolution of future AI systems.
Knowledge, Skills and Experience 

EssentialGood C++ programming skills and knowledge of more recent language features
Previous development experience
Interest in AI and games
Strong academic background in a numeric discipline or relevant prior development experience
Comfortable working in a collaborative, diverse and multi-disciplinary environment
An ability to focus on working independently when needed
Creative problem solving.
DesirableExperience developing AI or related systems in games, research or other settings
Experience in game development
Broad gaming experience and a sense for good game design
An appreciation of games, and Creative Assembly titles, is an advantage.
