íká ti nco clean architecture nebo Rx? Rád/a se dlíš o zkušenosti se svými kolegy a umíš je technologicky vést? Pokud chceš vyvíjet moderní aplikace nejen pro smartphony, ale teba i pro hodinky, robotické hraky a jiné smart gadgets, baví t architektura nebo vedení lidí, ozvi se nám.
Jsme mobilní - naše týmy vzájemn spolupracují v Praze, Brn i Bratislav. Ke kterému se pidáš ty?


Co t v této roli eká?



  • budeš vyvíjet Android aplikace, které pouívají statisíce a milióny lidí

  • pevezmeš odpovdnost za technickou analýzu a vývojové ešení

  • v Praze t eká nový projekt na zelené louce na vývoj mobilní banky

  • dle zkušeností máš monost pejít k návrhu architektury nebo zajištní odborného rozvoje týmu

  • rádi si sami testujeme, otestování svené aplikace proto pjde také za tebou

  • souástí tvé práce bude i tvorba dokumentace


Jaké znalosti a zkušenosti u nás zúroíš?



  • získáš monost zúroit své znalosti Android Studio a Gradle (modularizace aplikací; Gradle Kotlin DSL výhodou)

  • uvítáme tvoji praktickou znalost Kotlinu (jako hlavní jazyk) a Javy

  • orientuješ se v nativní Android SDK a de facto standardních knihovnách (Android Jetpack, Material Components, dále nap. Room, OkHttp, Retrofit, Moshi aj.)

  • máš zkušenosti s tvorbou objektov orientovaného návrhu aplikace

  • zaboduješ zkušenostmi s aplikováním dependency injection (Dagger nebo Koin)


Výhodou, nikoliv nutností:



  • zajímáš se o automatizované testování Android aplikací (JUnit 4/5, KotlinTest, Spek, Espresso + Mockito, Mockk nebo jiné)

  • zkušenost s moderním asynchronním programováním (RxJava/LiveData a/nebo coroutiny) ti bude výhodou

  • máš zájem o architekturu mobilních aplikací (nap. MVVM, MVI, Clean architecture aj.)

  • meš vyuít svoji zkušenost s multiplatformním Kotlinem a/nebo Kotlin/Native

  • potší nás tvoje zkušenost s Kotlinx Serialization a/nebo Ktor frameworkem

  • zaboduješ zkušeností s continuous integration (Jenkins a/nebo GitLab, pípadn jiné)

  • orientuješ se ve funkcionálním programování

  • máš za sebou zkušenost s publikováním aplikací do Google Play

  • znalost souvisejících platforem (Wear OS, Android TV aj.)

  • máš zkušenost s Firebase, TensorFlow, ARCore

  • skvle ovládáš eštinu/slovenštinu, komunikuješ anglicky na pokroilé úrovni


Co ti nabízíme?



  • píjemné pracovní prostedí a stabilní zázemí dobe prosperující eské IT firmy, psobící na trhu ji od roku 2000

  • prostor pro samostatnou a kreativní práci s moností realizace vlastních nápad a píleitostmi se stále uit nové vci a pístupy

  • u nás máš monost ovlivovat své smrování ve firm

  • kvalitní HW i SW vybavení, pístup k nejmodernjším technologiím a specifickým projektm

  • v Cleverlance získáš ve svém rozvoji kvalitní podporu i díky bohaté nabídce interních a externích školení

  • nabízíme ti benefity jako jsou píspvek na ivotní a penzijní pipojištní, výuku AJ/NJ/RJ, MultiSport kartu, sick days, píspvek na stravné, eká t tu spousta firemních akcí, zázemí moderních kanceláí na Palmovce v blízkosti stanice metra s kvalitním vybavením i pro sportovce a milovníky jídla a kávy, po vzájemné dohod u vybraných projekt monost ásteného home office, a další
_source.position_name: Android Developer at Cleverlance (Prague, Czechia)

_source.description:
We at Goodgame Studios are convinced that only the best people will create the best products and drive a company towards success. We believe that teamwork, expertise and bringing different perspectives together are the heart and soul of game development. Conquer the gaming world collectively with the greatest colleagues and the most exciting company around - become a part of our family, apply now!As Marketing Tech Specialist you will be a guardian of our marketing data streams. As a member of the Marketing Tech team, you will develop a deep technical and business understanding of the online marketing industry and the Goodgame Studios infrastructure. With interdisciplinary skills and an engineering eye, you will be a hub between the User Acquisition, Data Science and Data Warehouse teams, and will be working on concepts, setup, analysis and maintenance of meaningful marketing data streams.YOUR MISSIONYou take ownership of the Marketing Tech stack
You work on concepts, setups, analysis and improvements of the Marketing data streams
You are acting as an interface between the Performance Marketing, Data Warehouse and Data Science teams, as well as external partners
You define and setup data interfaces to external and internal systems; e.g. cost import, attribution data
You support the Marketing team in setting up partner integrations; e.g. Facebook Ads, Google Ads, Firebase, ad mediation platforms
You configure our tracking and attribution systems; e.g. mobile measurement partners (AppsFlyer, Adjust, Kochava) or Google Tag Manager, incl. postback or pixel configuration, iOS SKAdNetwork, etc.
You analyze and improve processes
YOUR BACKSTORYYou have a solid background in computer science (good understanding of data processing engineering, a programming language should be mastered)
You are interested in Marketing business operations, curiosity for the technology behind online Performance Marketing
You have a firm knowledge of SQL, with experience using SQL for qualitative and quantitative analysis of data
You have a good understanding of fundamental web technologies (HTTP, REST, etc.)
You have an analytical mindset
Experience in online Performance Marketing is a plus
SOUNDS GREAT? MORE REASONS TO TAKE THIS MISSIONYou have full flexibility: Work remotely or come and work from our modern office in Hamburg with roof terrace, cafeteria, common rooms, gaming and lounging etc. or take a lap in the swimming pool on our beautiful campus
You join a supportive team in a pragmatic, yet challenging environment, flat hierarchies and state of the art technologies
You will get the chance to work with multidisciplinary and experienced colleagues from the entire production lifecycle
You will experience a culture of continuous development and learning opportunities
You won't ever have to be hungry again. There are fresh fruits, snacks and drinks available at the office
ADDITIONAL INFORMATIONThe safety of our employees and everyone else is of utmost importance to us which is why you will experience a solely virtual recruiting process. We are happy to receive your application in English! #Stayhome #StayhealthyYour contact person for this job offer is Juliane Voigtlandauml;nder.Goodgame Studios is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage and support diversity and welcome all qualified applications.
_source.description_html:
We at Goodgame Studios are convinced that only the best people will create the best products and drive a company towards success. We believe that teamwork, expertise and bringing different perspectives together are the heart and soul of game development. Conquer the gaming world collectively with the greatest colleagues and the most exciting company around - become a part of our family, apply now!


As Marketing Tech Specialist you will be a guardian of our marketing data streams. As a member of the Marketing Tech team, you will develop a deep technical and business understanding of the online marketing industry and the Goodgame Studios infrastructure. With interdisciplinary skills and an engineering eye, you will be a hub between the User Acquisition, Data Science and Data Warehouse teams, and will be working on concepts, setup, analysis and maintenance of meaningful marketing data streams.


YOUR MISSION



  • You take ownership of the Marketing Tech stack

  • You work on concepts, setups, analysis and improvements of the Marketing data streams

  • You are acting as an interface between the Performance Marketing, Data Warehouse and Data Science teams, as well as external partners

  • You define and setup data interfaces to external and internal systems; e.g. cost import, attribution data

  • You support the Marketing team in setting up partner integrations; e.g. Facebook Ads, Google Ads, Firebase, ad mediation platforms

  • You configure our tracking and attribution systems; e.g. mobile measurement partners (AppsFlyer, Adjust, Kochava) or Google Tag Manager, incl. postback or pixel configuration, iOS SKAdNetwork, etc.

  • You analyze and improve processes


YOUR BACKSTORY



  • You have a solid background in computer science (good understanding of data processing engineering, a programming language should be mastered)

  • You are interested in Marketing business operations, curiosity for the technology behind online Performance Marketing

  • You have a firm knowledge of SQL, with experience using SQL for qualitative and quantitative analysis of data

  • You have a good understanding of fundamental web technologies (HTTP, REST, etc.)

  • You have an analytical mindset

  • Experience in online Performance Marketing is a plus


SOUNDS GREAT? MORE REASONS TO TAKE THIS MISSION



  • You have full flexibility: Work remotely or come and work from our modern office in Hamburg with roof terrace, cafeteria, common rooms, gaming and lounging etc. or take a lap in the swimming pool on our beautiful campus

  • You join a supportive team in a pragmatic, yet challenging environment, flat hierarchies and state of the art technologies

  • You will get the chance to work with multidisciplinary and experienced colleagues from the entire production lifecycle

  • You will experience a culture of continuous development and learning opportunities

  • You won't ever have to be hungry again. There are fresh fruits, snacks and drinks available at the office


ADDITIONAL INFORMATION


The safety of our employees and everyone else is of utmost importance to us which is why you will experience a solely virtual recruiting process. We are happy to receive your application in English! #Stayhome #Stayhealthy


Your contact person for this job offer is Juliane Voigtländer.


Goodgame Studios is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage and support diversity and welcome all qualified applications.
_source.position_name: Marketing Tech Specialist (all genders) at Goodgame Studios (Hamburg, Deutschland) (allows remote)

_source.description:
AssemblyAI is the #1 rated API for speech recognition and has become the go-to solution for developers. Think the "Stripe of Speech Recognition". Beyond just Automatic Speech Recognition, AssemblyAI builds APIs that help developers understand their audio and video files. For example, with features like Topic Detection, Summarization, and Sentiment Analysis - AssemblyAI is the only API offering a suite of developer tools for companies to build exciting applications with their audio and video data. Thousands of developers use our APIs to transcribe millions of videos, podcasts, phone calls, and zoom meetings every day - powering innovative products like visual voicemail, meeting summarizers, and closed captioning. We have already grown our revenue about 5x in the past year, and are backed by leading investors including Y Combinators AI Fund, Patrick and John Collision (Founders of Stripe), Nat Friedman (Former CEO of GitHub), and Daniel Gross (Entrepreneur and Investor in companies including GitHub, Uber, Coinbase, SpaceX, Instacart, Notion, and Cruise Automation). AssemblyAIs Speech-to-Text APIs are already trusted by Fortune 500s, startups, and thousands of developers around the world, with well-known customers including Spotify, Algolia, Dow Jones, The Wall Street Journal, and NBCUniversal. As part of a huge and emerging market, AssemblyAI is well on its way to becoming the leader in speech recognition. To do that, we are hiring a world-class team to help us build an iconic deep learning company that will be just as well-known as Twilio or Stripe!The Role: AssemblyAI is growing quickly, and were searching for a Deep Learning Researcher to join our team. With significant investment and strong leadership to fuel our growth, its the perfect time to join the AssemblyAI team!In this role youll have the opportunity to:
 Continually push the state of the art in speech recognition and NLP. You will conduct cutting edge deep learning research in speech and NLP. Our ASR models already outperform companies like Google, AWS, and Microsoft - and were looking for the best deep learning engineers and researchers to help us continually push the state of the art in speech recognition to get to human level performance. 
 Research and train AssemblyAIs deep learning models. You will work with large scale data sets to research and train deep learning models for speech recognition. You will research and develop novel algorithms and techniques to advance the state of the art in natural language understanding. You will conduct research and experiments in order to improve accuracy of our Deep Learning ASR pipeline. You will also dig into weaknesses and failure points of our current ASR models in order to identify further areas for improvement.
 Be part of a world-class team of creative researchers and engineers. You will help strengthen the position of AssemblyAI as a leading company in AI research. Our deep learning team is a tight knit group of creative researchers and engineers, who are not afraid to try unconventional ideas. You will also work with the broader speech recognition team as we continually strive to match human level accuracy. 
 Our Team: We are a fully remote team made up of problem solvers, innovators and top AI researchers with 20+ years of experience in Machine Learning, Speech Recognition, and NLP from places like Amazon, Cisco, Apple, BMW, and MyCroft. Our culture is super collaborative, low-ego, transparent, and fast-paced. We want to win - and have a flat organization where everyone can openly share ideas (regardless of their title or position) in order to get the best idea. As a remote company, our team members are given a lot of trust and autonomy to work where and how they want. We look for people to join our team who are ambitious, curious, and self-motivated, and we put a lot of trust and autonomy into everyone on our team. We want to empower everyone to do their best work with whatever tools, structures, or resources they need to perform at their highest potential!
Benefits
 Competitive Salary
 Equity
 100% Remote team
 Unlimited PTO
 Premium Healthcare (100% Covered)
 Vision and Dental Care
 $1K budget for your home office setup
 New Macbook Pro (or PC if you prefer)
 3-4x/year company paid team retreats
_source.description_html:
AssemblyAI is the #1 rated API for speech recognition and has become the go-to solution for developers. Think the "Stripe of Speech Recognition".

Beyond just Automatic Speech Recognition, AssemblyAI builds APIs that help developers understand their audio and video files. For example, with features like Topic Detection, Summarization, and Sentiment Analysis - AssemblyAI is the only API offering a suite of developer tools for companies to build exciting applications with their audio and video data.

Thousands of developers use our APIs to transcribe millions of videos, podcasts, phone calls, and zoom meetings every day - powering innovative products like visual voicemail, meeting summarizers, and closed captioning. We have already grown our revenue about 5x in the past year, and are backed by leading investors including Y Combinators AI Fund, Patrick and John Collision (Founders of Stripe), Nat Friedman (Former CEO of GitHub), and Daniel Gross (Entrepreneur & Investor in companies including GitHub, Uber, Coinbase, SpaceX, Instacart, Notion, and Cruise Automation).

AssemblyAIs Speech-to-Text APIs are already trusted by Fortune 500s, startups, and thousands of developers around the world, with well-known customers including Spotify, Algolia, Dow Jones, The Wall Street Journal, and NBCUniversal. As part of a huge and emerging market, AssemblyAI is well on its way to becoming the leader in speech recognition. To do that, we are hiring a world-class team to help us build an iconic deep learning company that will be just as well-known as Twilio or Stripe!

The Role:

AssemblyAI is growing quickly, and were searching for a Deep Learning Researcher to join our team. With significant investment and strong leadership to fuel our growth, its the perfect time to join the AssemblyAI team!

In this role youll have the opportunity to:

  • Continually push the state of the art in speech recognition and NLP. You will conduct cutting edge deep learning research in speech and NLP. Our ASR models already outperform companies like Google, AWS, and Microsoft - and were looking for the best deep learning engineers and researchers to help us continually push the state of the art in speech recognition to get to human level performance.
  • Research & train AssemblyAIs deep learning models. You will work with large scale data sets to research and train deep learning models for speech recognition. You will research and develop novel algorithms and techniques to advance the state of the art in natural language understanding. You will conduct research and experiments in order to improve accuracy of our Deep Learning ASR pipeline. You will also dig into weaknesses and failure points of our current ASR models in order to identify further areas for improvement.
  • Be part of a world-class team of creative researchers & engineers. You will help strengthen the position of AssemblyAI as a leading company in AI research. Our deep learning team is a tight knit group of creative researchers and engineers, who are not afraid to try unconventional ideas. You will also work with the broader speech recognition team as we continually strive to match human level accuracy.

Our Team:

We are a fully remote team made up of problem solvers, innovators and top AI researchers with 20+ years of experience in Machine Learning, Speech Recognition, and NLP from places like Amazon, Cisco, Apple, BMW, and MyCroft. Our culture is super collaborative, low-ego, transparent, and fast-paced. We want to win - and have a flat organization where everyone can openly share ideas (regardless of their title or position) in order to get the best idea.

As a remote company, our team members are given a lot of trust and autonomy to work where and how they want. We look for people to join our team who are ambitious, curious, and self-motivated, and we put a lot of trust and autonomy into everyone on our team. We want to empower everyone to do their best work with whatever tools, structures, or resources they need to perform at their highest potential!


Benefits


  • Competitive Salary
  • Equity
  • 100% Remote team
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Premium Healthcare (100% Covered)
  • Vision & Dental Care
  • $1K budget for your home office setup
  • New Macbook Pro (or PC if you prefer)
  • 3-4x/year company paid team retreats
_source.position_name: Deep Learning Researcher, ASR (Remote) at AssemblyAI (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)

_source.description:
About BlueModus:We are a fully remote technology agency - comprised of colleagues who bring a daily commitment to transparency, efficiency, and helping. We approach our clients and colleagues with sincerity - and recognize that innovative tech solutions pair best with wholehearted teams.Many companies talk about their awesome offices, flexible schedules, and cool events. We can, too. Great benefits, a 100% remote culture, ongoing training, and learning are part of BlueModus. But when you come to work here, you also become a part of an incredible team that we think separates us from other tech companies. We have created a culture that attracts bright, passionate, caring people who sincerely want to do their best for clients and each other.What You Will Be Doing:Leading the technical vision for medium to large website, webstore, and intranet builds using the Microsoft stack with C# and JavaScript.
Integrating creative designs and user experience (UX) functionality into content management systems (CMS), including Kentico, Sitecore, Umbraco, Sitefinity, and Contentstack.
Building packages and deploying software to integration environments such as Microsoft Azure and Amazon Web Services (AWS).
Assigning work to a small team of Web Developers who are working on several projects simultaneously.
Contributing to an agile project team consisting of Designers, UX/UI Developers, Web Developers, Solution Leads, Projects Managers, and Strategists to help understand and document client requirements, estimate work, develop new solutions, and enhance existing solutions.
Providing clear guidance and recommendations to clients on technical solutions to optimize value and foster trust.
Actively conducting code reviews.
Mentoring Web Developers to grow their technical skills.
Building and maintaining internal tools to streamline our development process and enhance productivity.
Promoting and collaborating on our development and coding best practices.
What You Need:8+ years of experience developing web applications on the Microsoft technology stack using C# and JavaScript.
5+ years of experience with modern software design patterns, debugging, and refactoring.
3+ years of experience developing with traditional and headless content management systems (CMS), such as Kentico, Sitecore, Umbraco, Sitefinity, and Contentstack.
3+ years of experience leading a technical team.
3+ years of experience in a client-facing professional services role.
3+ years of experience with Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services (AWS).
Experience troubleshooting HTML, JavaScript, and CSS issues.
Experience with JavaScript frameworks with React, Vue.js, or Angular.
Experience resolving cross-browser compatibility issues.
Experience with search engine optimization best practices.
Experience with MS SQL.
Experience with Visual Studio Tooling.
Experience with code versioning tools, such as Git.
Experience with continuous integration and automated build products like Team City and Azure DevOps.
What We Love Finding:Experience managing and organizing several work streams with different priorities.
Experience working in an agency environment with multiple clients.
Strong testing and quality assurance ethic.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interface directly with clients.
Ability to thrive in an independent environment.
Benefits:Competitive salary between $110,000 to $130,000, with annual increases based on performance.
Ability to work fully remote at home andndash; we are a 100% virtual company.
Get the checkup you and your family need with excellent health, dental, vision, and disability coverage.
Recharge your batteries with ample paid time off, including 9 holidays and 20 vacation/flex days.
Plan for your future with our 401(k) plan and 3% employer match.
Team building andldquo;funandrdquo; days and other company-sponsored activities in different cities throughout the year.
Whether you are an early riser or a snooze master, pick a schedule that works for you with flexible working hours.
Tuition reimbursement and professional development opportunities with conferences and training.
_source.description_html:
About BlueModus:


We are a fully remote technology agency - comprised of colleagues who bring a daily commitment to transparency, efficiency, and helping. We approach our clients and colleagues with sincerity - and recognize that innovative tech solutions pair best with wholehearted teams.


Many companies talk about their awesome offices, flexible schedules, and cool events. We can, too. Great benefits, a 100% remote culture, ongoing training, and learning are part of BlueModus. But when you come to work here, you also become a part of an incredible team that we think separates us from other tech companies. We have created a culture that attracts bright, passionate, caring people who sincerely want to do their best for clients and each other.


What You Will Be Doing:



  • Leading the technical vision for medium to large website, webstore, and intranet builds using the Microsoft stack with C# and JavaScript.

  • Integrating creative designs and user experience (UX) functionality into content management systems (CMS), including Kentico, Sitecore, Umbraco, Sitefinity, and Contentstack.

  • Building packages and deploying software to integration environments such as Microsoft Azure and Amazon Web Services (AWS).

  • Assigning work to a small team of Web Developers who are working on several projects simultaneously.

  • Contributing to an agile project team consisting of Designers, UX/UI Developers, Web Developers, Solution Leads, Projects Managers, and Strategists to help understand and document client requirements, estimate work, develop new solutions, and enhance existing solutions.

  • Providing clear guidance and recommendations to clients on technical solutions to optimize value and foster trust.

  • Actively conducting code reviews.

  • Mentoring Web Developers to grow their technical skills.

  • Building and maintaining internal tools to streamline our development process and enhance productivity.

  • Promoting and collaborating on our development and coding best practices.


What You Need:



  • 8+ years of experience developing web applications on the Microsoft technology stack using C# and JavaScript.

  • 5+ years of experience with modern software design patterns, debugging, and refactoring.

  • 3+ years of experience developing with traditional and headless content management systems (CMS), such as Kentico, Sitecore, Umbraco, Sitefinity, and Contentstack.

  • 3+ years of experience leading a technical team.

  • 3+ years of experience in a client-facing professional services role.

  • 3+ years of experience with Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services (AWS).

  • Experience troubleshooting HTML, JavaScript, and CSS issues.

  • Experience with JavaScript frameworks with React, Vue.js, or Angular.

  • Experience resolving cross-browser compatibility issues.

  • Experience with search engine optimization best practices.

  • Experience with MS SQL.

  • Experience with Visual Studio Tooling.

  • Experience with code versioning tools, such as Git.

  • Experience with continuous integration and automated build products like Team City and Azure DevOps.


What We Love Finding:



  • Experience managing and organizing several work streams with different priorities.

  • Experience working in an agency environment with multiple clients.

  • Strong testing and quality assurance ethic.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interface directly with clients.

  • Ability to thrive in an independent environment.


Benefits:



  • Competitive salary between $110,000 to $130,000, with annual increases based on performance.

  • Ability to work fully remote at home – we are a 100% virtual company.

  • Get the checkup you and your family need with excellent health, dental, vision, and disability coverage.

  • Recharge your batteries with ample paid time off, including 9 holidays and 20 vacation/flex days.

  • Plan for your future with our 401(k) plan and 3% employer match.

  • Team building “fun” days and other company-sponsored activities in different cities throughout the year.

  • Whether you are an early riser or a snooze master, pick a schedule that works for you with flexible working hours.

  • Tuition reimbursement and professional development opportunities with conferences & training.

_source.description_html:
Data Scientist


100% Remote (U.S. Based Only)


About StyleSeat:


At StyleSeat, our mission is to help people look and feel their best. We are on the path to achieving this mission by being the go-to marketplace for consumers to discover, book, and pay for beauty and grooming services (hair stylists, colorists, nail artists, estheticians, barbers, etc). We are also the premier solution for all independent professionals in the industry to run and grow their business. We have powered over 120 million appointments booked and $10B in revenue for small businesses and are on the path to much more.


As a Data Scientist at StyleSeat, you will have a rare opportunity to join a startup empowering small business owners across the country to be more successful doing what they love. Our team believes in discipline, hustle and supporting each other to make a positive impact for our community and bottom line. We believe that diversity makes us stronger and helps us better support our customers. Our community is the center of everything we do.


About the Role:


We are a greenfield team focused on Data Science which sits at the epicenter of the business and work closely with our sister teams in Data Engineering and Business Intelligence. This is an extremely exciting time for Data Science at StyleSeat as we are at the infancy of defining the roadmap, which you will have an opportunity to influence. Our work will have an impact and add value to multiple domains, from engineering, marketing, and product, to the executive team.


We are looking for a driven Data Scientist with software engineering experience to help take the StyleSeat experience to the next level of intelligence and joy. This role will work on core machine learning algorithms and systems that are part of our ability to understand the behavior and goals of our professional and client communities and build outstanding products. It will involve a wide variety of skills and innovation and is an unusual opportunity that sits at the cutting-edge of various engineering disciplines, and the work will have a huge impact on hundreds of millions of users across the US.


What You Can Bring to the Table:



  • 3+ years of experience working in a production environment

  • Experience with the Python scientific stack (numpy, scipy, matplotlib, pandas, scikit-learn, etc.).

  • Fluent in SQL

  • Experience designing, training, deploying and maintaining custom machine learning models

  • Experience in developing and tuning custom neural networks with state of the art components.

  • Experience applying one or more major deep learning packages (e.g. TensorFlow, PyTorch) to very large data sets.

  • Comfortable owning and guiding machine learning projects from conception through research, development and production deployment


Nice-to-Haves:




  • Experience working cross-functionally with other business units such as engineering, product, and marketing

  • Ability to explain and present machine learning concepts to both a technical and non-technical Audience

  • Experience identifying opportunities in Product that can benefit from machine learning

  • Experience transferring machine learning solutions to engineers on product teams

  • Experience with AWS services (SageMaker, S3, etc.)
_source.position_name: Data Scientist at StyleSeat () (allows remote)

_source.description:
Engineering Manager-FDP We are a national, innovative, high-growth software company devoted to K12 education administration. Our products beat the competition by focusing on all business operations of K12 schools, including both financial and school nutrition management. We have a deep understanding of K12 school systems and regulations, with a focus on providing creative, integrated and user-friendly solutions supported by excellent customer service. Our workforce is talented, loyal, dedicated and highly enthusiastic. This is a fantastic career opportunity for the right individual. Where else can you play beach volleyball and work for a leading tech company? CULTURE We offer challenging work in a team environment. We respect each other and collaborate for continuous improvement. We are the experts in our product lines and we anticipate the needs of our customers. Our customers say we work efficiently and always strive to provide the proper solution. We have achieved this by building relationships based upon: expertise, patience, attentiveness, clear positive communication, tenacity, and a calm presence. BASIC FUNCTION As an Engineer at LINQ, you will work as a member of a cross-functional team to deliver business critical applications of high function and technical quality. You will be responsible for working closely with the product owners and quality assurance to create software that fulfills business needs. You are capable of quickly learning new business domains as well as working in a team environment. You are passionate about delivering high quality, maintainable software to the business. KEY TRAITSTechnical Excellence: A passion for creating cutting edge software through application of best engineering practices
Continuous Improvement: A self-driven desire to find better ways to accomplish things
Teamwork: A commitment to working as part of a team to achieve optimal results
KNOWLEDGE/ SKILL REQUIREMENTSAt least 10+ years of experience in Software Application Development
Prior experience as a Manager or Team Lead
Bachelorandrsquo;s degree in Computer Science, or equivalent working experience
Strong understanding of relational database systems
Strong understanding of object-oriented programming
5+ years Typescript Angular/React development
Experience managing a team
Experience in .Net C#, API microservices, AWS serverless technologies
Experience in Java, AWS Lambda, NodeJS a plus
Strong belief in and use of best practices
Experience practicing DevOps and CI/CD
Experience with unit testing and test-driven development
Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively with all stakeholders
Collaborate with teams to clarify design and implementation while meeting project needs
Collaborate with other developers and architects (when appropriate) to determine optimal solution architecture, efficiency, maintainability and scalability
Complete projects/tasks in a timely fashion while meeting sprint goals and commitments
TOTAL REWARDSGenerous 401K with matching 4% of base salary
Health insurance paid 100% for employee; 80% for spouse/dependents
Paid Time Off (PTO) Plan and paid holidays
Annual bonus
Company social events, happy hour, free snacks, professional development, paid volunteer time, on site massages, professional development opportunities
Salary: $170K-$190K EOE STATEMENT We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

_source.description:
COVID 19 UPDATE: We have leaned into the current health crisis with the development of new features like Volusion Curbside. Since March, we have hired more than a dozen new Volusioneers with no signs of slowing down. We are actively interviewing for key roles in order to keep up with our product roadmap goals. During these unprecedented times Volusion continues to provide stability and growth opportunities to our employees and merchants alike.We are doing our part to flatten the curve so for the time being all interviews will be conducted virtually. As a company ALL employees are currently working remotely.We are looking for an experienced Software Engineer Manager to lead an engineering team in development related to our best-of-breed eCommerce platform and its rendering technologies. This position will report to our CTO and be responsible for the execution of major technology initiatives related to our platform. If you crave room to grow and autonomy and want to make a difference with your contributions, this is the role for you.About Us:At Volusion, we make products that people love. Our teams are dedicated to providing SaaS commerce solutions and services for all business types, ranging from startups to large enterprises. If you are the kind of engineering leader that loves working in teams, has a passion for driving positive change, and wants to change the world with your ideas, we want to hear from you. If you want to help build the worldandrsquo;s greatest software for our customers, youandrsquo;ve come to the right place!You will:Be accountable for business-driven technical outcomes. You are the hands-on, accountable engineering lead and driver for your team delivering value to the next-generation Volusion platform.
Ensure your team runs smoothly. You will need to continually identify technical blockers and work with your team and across teams to clear those blockers.
Communicate your teamandrsquo;s results to outside stakeholders. In addition to our Agile processes, you will communicate on the status of your teamandrsquo;s short- and long-term goals.
Align technical initiatives with the product managerandrsquo;s requirements. We are a product-driven company that provides detailed requirements to our engineering teams. You will work closely with a product manager to keep your team focused on driving business value.
Lead and manage ~4 people. Our people are the most important aspect of our company. You will meet weekly with your direct reports, set goals, and develop our engineers.
Responsibilities include:Ensure your team is running smoothly and delivering results on time
Be willing and able to work alongside your team on a daily basis
Contribute on the ground floor alongside the folks you are managing
Continuously deliver high-quality software
Break down clear requirements into independent coding tasks and strategies
Be the lead engineering voice for your team in meetings with product, content, sales, and engineering departments
Help evolve the best tech company in Austin
We are looking for someone with:A Bachelor of Science Degree in Electrical, Mechanical, Software, or other Engineering discipline
5+ years developing high-quality software
3+ years leading technical teams
2+ years managing direct reports (3 or more)
Experience with Node.js, React/Angular, and TypeScript
Google Cloud or AWS experience (Google Cloud preferred)
SQL and no-SQL Database knowledge; specific experience with PostgreSQL and MongoDB is a plus
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Volusionandrsquo;s Technology Stack:React (including React hooks), NextJS, mobx-state-tree, and custom server-side rendering
Public-facing REST APIs backed by TypeScript, Node.js, Fastify, and Express
SQL and no-SQL Databases; specific experience with PostgreSQL and MongoDB
Google Cloud Platform including Kubernetes, and managed database services
Search and caching using Elasticsearch, RediSearch, Algolia, and Redis
Event streaming using Kafka
Who is also the embodiment of our culture code (we hope you are nodding your head in agreement as you browse through it!):Humble: Have humility and be respectful; no egos allowed.
Effective: Get stuff done!
Adaptable: Willing to fill any role, anytime. Going above/beyond the call of duty.
Transparent: Open and honest to self and others.
Collaborative: We favor teamwork and take ownership.
A founder: Think big, go fast, and solve for the customer.
Benefits and Perks:Competitive Compensation Packages
401(k) with Company Matching
Medical, Dental, Vision, and Voluntary Life Insurance
Employee Assistance Program
Paid Parental Leave
Flexible Paid Time Off
Two Volunteer Days Off
Birthday Off
Remote Work Flexibility
Professional Development Opportunities for Career and Skills Advancement
Robust Peer Recognition Program
Virtual Events: Trivia, Monthly Bingo, Scavenger Hunts, Back to School Day, Wellness
Giving Back to the Community Initiatives
Quarterly Virtual Team Building events
_source.description_html:
COVID 19 UPDATE:


We have leaned into the current health crisis with the development of new features like Volusion Curbside. Since March, we have hired more than a dozen new Volusioneers with no signs of slowing down. We are actively interviewing for key roles in order to keep up with our product roadmap goals. During these unprecedented times Volusion continues to provide stability and growth opportunities to our employees and merchants alike.


We are doing our part to flatten the curve so for the time being all interviews will be conducted virtually. As a company ALL employees are currently working remotely.


We are looking for an experienced Software Engineer Manager to lead an engineering team in development related to our best-of-breed eCommerce platform and its rendering technologies. This position will report to our CTO and be responsible for the execution of major technology initiatives related to our platform. If you crave room to grow and autonomy and want to make a difference with your contributions, this is the role for you.


About Us:


At Volusion, we make products that people love. Our teams are dedicated to providing SaaS commerce solutions and services for all business types, ranging from startups to large enterprises. If you are the kind of engineering leader that loves working in teams, has a passion for driving positive change, and wants to change the world with your ideas, we want to hear from you. If you want to help build the world’s greatest software for our customers, you’ve come to the right place!


You will:



  • Be accountable for business-driven technical outcomes. You are the hands-on, accountable engineering lead and driver for your team delivering value to the next-generation Volusion platform.

  • Ensure your team runs smoothly. You will need to continually identify technical blockers and work with your team and across teams to clear those blockers.

  • Communicate your team’s results to outside stakeholders. In addition to our Agile processes, you will communicate on the status of your team’s short- and long-term goals.

  • Align technical initiatives with the product manager’s requirements. We are a product-driven company that provides detailed requirements to our engineering teams. You will work closely with a product manager to keep your team focused on driving business value.

  • Lead and manage ~4 people. Our people are the most important aspect of our company. You will meet weekly with your direct reports, set goals, and develop our engineers.


Responsibilities include:



  • Ensure your team is running smoothly and delivering results on time

  • Be willing and able to work alongside your team on a daily basis

  • Contribute on the ground floor alongside the folks you are managing

  • Continuously deliver high-quality software

  • Break down clear requirements into independent coding tasks and strategies

  • Be the lead engineering voice for your team in meetings with product, content, sales, and engineering departments

  • Help evolve the best tech company in Austin


We are looking for someone with:



  • A Bachelor of Science Degree in Electrical, Mechanical, Software, or other Engineering discipline

  • 5+ years developing high-quality software

  • 3+ years leading technical teams

  • 2+ years managing direct reports (3 or more)

  • Experience with Node.js, React/Angular, and TypeScript

  • Google Cloud or AWS experience (Google Cloud preferred)

  • SQL and no-SQL Database knowledge; specific experience with PostgreSQL and MongoDB is a plus

  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills


Volusion’s Technology Stack:



  • React (including React hooks), NextJS, mobx-state-tree, and custom server-side rendering

  • Public-facing REST APIs backed by TypeScript, Node.js, Fastify, and Express

  • SQL and no-SQL Databases; specific experience with PostgreSQL and MongoDB

  • Google Cloud Platform including Kubernetes, and managed database services

  • Search and caching using Elasticsearch, RediSearch, Algolia, and Redis

  • Event streaming using Kafka


Who is also the embodiment of our culture code (we hope you are nodding your head in agreement as you browse through it!):



  • Humble: Have humility and be respectful; no egos allowed.

  • Effective: Get stuff done!

  • Adaptable: Willing to fill any role, anytime. Going above/beyond the call of duty.

  • Transparent: Open and honest to self and others.

  • Collaborative: We favor teamwork and take ownership.

  • A founder: Think big, go fast, and solve for the customer.


Benefits & Perks:



  • Competitive Compensation Packages

  • 401(k) with Company Matching

  • Medical, Dental, Vision, and Voluntary Life Insurance

  • Employee Assistance Program

  • Paid Parental Leave

  • Flexible Paid Time Off

  • Two Volunteer Days Off

  • Birthday Off

  • Remote Work Flexibility

  • Professional Development Opportunities for Career and Skills Advancement

  • Robust Peer Recognition Program

  • Virtual Events: Trivia, Monthly Bingo, Scavenger Hunts, Back to School Day, Wellness

  • Giving Back to the Community Initiatives

  • Quarterly Virtual Team Building events

_source.company_name: Deutsches Zentrum für Luft- und Raumfahrt e. V. (DLR)
_source.description:
Fanduuml;r unser Institut fanduuml;r den Schutz terrestrischer Infrastrukturen in Sankt Augustin suchen wir eine/nInformatiker/in, Ingenieur/in, Physiker/in, Mathematiker/in o. andauml;. (w/m/d) Projektleitung DrohnendetektionIhre Mission:Das Institut zum Schutz kritischer Infrastrukturen hat die stabile Versorgung der Gesellschaft zum Ziel. Die Entwicklung von Methoden zur Erkennung und Abwehr von Bedrohungen gehandouml;rt ebenso zu den Aufgaben wie verbessertes Management im Fall von Groandszlig;schadenslagen. In der Abteilung andbdquo;Digitale Zwillinge von Infrastrukturenandldquo; werden sowohl komplexe vernetzte Versorgungssysteme, sozio-technische Zusammenhandauml;nge als auch Gebandauml;ude und technische Anlagen in Struktur und Verhalten modelliert und simuliert. Durch die Nachfanduuml;hrung der Modelle mit Echtzeit-Daten und der Bereitstellung von intelligenten Tools fanduuml;r Krisenstandauml;be und Einsatzkrandauml;fte entstehen Digitale Zwillinge, die neue Mandouml;glichkeiten zur andUuml;berwachung und Reaktion auf Krisen bereitstellen. Zudem bilden sie eine Grundlage zur Analyse und Optimierung der Resilienz von terrestrischen Infrastrukturen.
Unbemannte, fliegende Systeme (Drohnen, UAVs) sind mittlerweile einem breiten Markt zugandauml;nglich und kandouml;nnen von fast jedem zur Aufklandauml;rung, Standouml;rung oder Zerstandouml;rung von kritischer Infrastruktur eingesetzt werden. Beispiele hierfanduuml;r sind die Standouml;rung des Flugbetriebs an Flughandauml;fen, Platzierung von Sprengmitteln in der Nandauml;he von Einrichtungen mit hoheitlicher Relevanz oder Spionage von Betreibern kritischer Infrastrukturen. Es gilt daher die zu schanduuml;tzenden Areale mit verschiedenartigen Sensoriken zu anduuml;berwachen, Bedrohungen durch Drohnenflanduuml;ge zu erkennen und Gegenmaandszlig;nahmen zu planen.Ihre Aufgabe ist die Projektleitung im Bereich Counter-UAS zur Detektion, Tracking und Abwehr von Drohnen in Zusammenarbeit mit Anwendern und Industrie. Sie koordinieren die Beitrandauml;ge aus unterschiedlichen Bereichen im DLR und vertreten das Projekt innerhalb und auandszlig;erhalb des DLR und stimmen sich mit der Abteilungsleitung ab. Dies umfasst folgende Verantwortlichkeiten:Erfassung von Anwender-Bedarfen fanduuml;r verschiedene Szenarien und Stand der Technik
Entwicklung von innovativen Methoden zur Detektion, Tracking und Klassifikation von Drohnen sowie Ansteuerung von Abwehrmaandszlig;nahmen in einem bekannten Gebiet und Integration zu einem Gesamtkonzept
Nutzung von Verfahren aus den Bereichen Kanduuml;nstliche Intelligenz, Sensorfusion, synthetische Datengenerierung, Umgebungsreprandauml;sentationen mit semantischen Informationen
Aufbau von Simulatoren zur synthetischen Datengenerierung
Konzipierung von Demonstratoren und Evaluation der Methoden im Rahmen von Messkampagnen
Vertretung des Projekts bei Partnern und auf nationalen und internationalen Konferenzen
Ihre Ideen setzen Sie in einem dynamischen und innovativen Institut um. Neben einem hohen Maandszlig; an Teamspirit erwartet Sie eine exzellente Infrastruktur mit modernster Ausranduuml;stung und aktuellen Entwicklungsumgebungen. Wir unterstanduuml;tzen Sie zudem aktiv bei Ihrer beruflichen und wissenschaftlichen Weiterentwicklung.Ihre Qualifikation:Abgeschlossenes wissenschaftliches Hochschulstudium (Universitandauml;tsdiplom oder Master) in Informatik, Data Science, einem ingenieurwissenschaftlichen Bereich (z. B. Elektrotechnik, Maschinenbau) oder naturwissenschaftlichen Bereich (z. B. Mathematik, Technomathematik, Numerik, Physik)
Sehr gute Kenntnisse und Erfahrungen in folgenden Bereichen:Kanduuml;nstliche Intelligenz, Deep Neural Network
Computer Vision, Sensor AI und Sensorfusion
Umgebungsreprandauml;sentationen

Erfahrung in der Leitung von Projekten in wissenschaftlichen Projekten und Koordination von Projektteilnehmern in unterschiedlichen Institutionen und Zusammenarbeit mit Anwendern
Erfahrung in der Nutzung von Entwicklungsprozessen zur Softwareentwicklung, Aufbau von Softwarearchitekturen fanduuml;r verteilte Sensorsysteme, Kanduuml;nstliche Intelligenz und Simulatoren
Fandauml;higkeit, interdisziplinandauml;r zu denken und zu arbeiten, sich in komplexe Kontexte und Methoden einzuarbeiten und die Bereitschaft, im Team zu arbeiten
Hervorragendes manduuml;ndliches und schriftliches Ausdrucksvermandouml;gen sowie verhandlungssichere Englischkenntnisse
Reisebereitschaft (national/international)
Ausgeprandauml;gte Kommunikations- und Kooperationsbereitschaft sowie Teamfandauml;higkeit
Promotion oder umfangreiche Erfahrung im wissenschaftlichem Projektmanagement wanduuml;nschenswert
Gute Programmierkenntnisse wanduuml;nschenswert, idealerweise in Python, C++ oder JavaScript

_source.description_html:
Für unser Institut für den Schutz terrestrischer Infrastrukturen in Sankt Augustin suchen wir eine/n


Informatiker/in, Ingenieur/in, Physiker/in, Mathematiker/in o. ä. (w/m/d) Projektleitung Drohnendetektion




Ihre Mission:


Das Institut zum Schutz kritischer Infrastrukturen hat die stabile Versorgung der Gesellschaft zum Ziel. Die Entwicklung von Methoden zur Erkennung und Abwehr von Bedrohungen gehört ebenso zu den Aufgaben wie verbessertes Management im Fall von Großschadenslagen. In der Abteilung „Digitale Zwillinge von Infrastrukturen“ werden sowohl komplexe vernetzte Versorgungssysteme, sozio-technische Zusammenhänge als auch Gebäude und technische Anlagen in Struktur und Verhalten modelliert und simuliert. Durch die Nachführung der Modelle mit Echtzeit-Daten und der Bereitstellung von intelligenten Tools für Krisenstäbe und Einsatzkräfte entstehen Digitale Zwillinge, die neue Möglichkeiten zur Überwachung und Reaktion auf Krisen bereitstellen. Zudem bilden sie eine Grundlage zur Analyse und Optimierung der Resilienz von terrestrischen Infrastrukturen.
Unbemannte, fliegende Systeme (Drohnen, UAVs) sind mittlerweile einem breiten Markt zugänglich und können von fast jedem zur Aufklärung, Störung oder Zerstörung von kritischer Infrastruktur eingesetzt werden. Beispiele hierfür sind die Störung des Flugbetriebs an Flughäfen, Platzierung von Sprengmitteln in der Nähe von Einrichtungen mit hoheitlicher Relevanz oder Spionage von Betreibern kritischer Infrastrukturen. Es gilt daher die zu schützenden Areale mit verschiedenartigen Sensoriken zu überwachen, Bedrohungen durch Drohnenflüge zu erkennen und Gegenmaßnahmen zu planen.


Ihre Aufgabe ist die Projektleitung im Bereich Counter-UAS zur Detektion, Tracking und Abwehr von Drohnen in Zusammenarbeit mit Anwendern und Industrie. Sie koordinieren die Beiträge aus unterschiedlichen Bereichen im DLR und vertreten das Projekt innerhalb und außerhalb des DLR und stimmen sich mit der Abteilungsleitung ab. Dies umfasst folgende Verantwortlichkeiten:



  • Erfassung von Anwender-Bedarfen für verschiedene Szenarien und Stand der Technik

  • Entwicklung von innovativen Methoden zur Detektion, Tracking und Klassifikation von Drohnen sowie Ansteuerung von Abwehrmaßnahmen in einem bekannten Gebiet und Integration zu einem Gesamtkonzept

  • Nutzung von Verfahren aus den Bereichen Künstliche Intelligenz, Sensorfusion, synthetische Datengenerierung, Umgebungsrepräsentationen mit semantischen Informationen

  • Aufbau von Simulatoren zur synthetischen Datengenerierung

  • Konzipierung von Demonstratoren und Evaluation der Methoden im Rahmen von Messkampagnen

  • Vertretung des Projekts bei Partnern und auf nationalen und internationalen Konferenzen


Ihre Ideen setzen Sie in einem dynamischen und innovativen Institut um. Neben einem hohen Maß an Teamspirit erwartet Sie eine exzellente Infrastruktur mit modernster Ausrüstung und aktuellen Entwicklungsumgebungen. Wir unterstützen Sie zudem aktiv bei Ihrer beruflichen und wissenschaftlichen Weiterentwicklung.




Ihre Qualifikation:



  • Abgeschlossenes wissenschaftliches Hochschulstudium (Universitätsdiplom oder Master) in Informatik, Data Science, einem ingenieurwissenschaftlichen Bereich (z. B. Elektrotechnik, Maschinenbau) oder naturwissenschaftlichen Bereich (z. B. Mathematik, Technomathematik, Numerik, Physik)

  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse und Erfahrungen in folgenden Bereichen:

    • Künstliche Intelligenz, Deep Neural Network

    • Computer Vision, Sensor AI und Sensorfusion

    • Umgebungsrepräsentationen



  • Erfahrung in der Leitung von Projekten in wissenschaftlichen Projekten und Koordination von Projektteilnehmern in unterschiedlichen Institutionen und Zusammenarbeit mit Anwendern

  • Erfahrung in der Nutzung von Entwicklungsprozessen zur Softwareentwicklung, Aufbau von Softwarearchitekturen für verteilte Sensorsysteme, Künstliche Intelligenz und Simulatoren

  • Fähigkeit, interdisziplinär zu denken und zu arbeiten, sich in komplexe Kontexte und Methoden einzuarbeiten und die Bereitschaft, im Team zu arbeiten

  • Hervorragendes mündliches und schriftliches Ausdrucksvermögen sowie verhandlungssichere Englischkenntnisse

  • Reisebereitschaft (national/international)

  • Ausgeprägte Kommunikations- und Kooperationsbereitschaft sowie Teamfähigkeit

  • Promotion oder umfangreiche Erfahrung im wissenschaftlichem Projektmanagement wünschenswert

  • Gute Programmierkenntnisse wünschenswert, idealerweise in Python, C++ oder JavaScript

  • Erfahrung mit ROS, Linux, Sensorik und Embedded Systeme wünschenswert

  • Erfahrung in der Beantragung und Durchführung von Drittmittelprojekten wünschenswert, auch in Kooperation mit Industriepartnern

  • Erfahrung in agiler Arbeitsweise wünschenswert




Ihr Start:


Freuen Sie sich auf einen Arbeitgeber, der Ihr Engagement zu schätzen weiß und Ihre Entwicklung durch vielfältige Qualifizierungs- und Weiterbildungs­möglich­keiten fördert. Unser einzigartiges Arbeitsumfeld bietet Ihnen Gestaltungs­frei­räume und eine unvergleichbare Infrastruktur, in der Sie Ihre Mission verwirklichen können.
Vereinbarkeit von Privatleben, Familie und Beruf sowie Chancengleichheit von Personen aller Geschlechter (w/m/d) sind wichtiger Bestandteil unserer Personal­politik. Bewerbungen schwerbehinderter Menschen bevorzugen wir bei fachlicher Eignung.


Fachliche Fragen beantwortet Ihnen gerne Frau Prof. Dr. Eva Brucherseifer telefonisch unter +49 2241 20148-50. Weitere Informationen zu dieser Position mit der Kennziffer 62885 sowie zur Vergütung und zum Bewerbungsweg finden Sie unter www.DLR.de/dlr/jobs/#47260

_source.description_html:
Für unser Institut für den Schutz terrestrischer Infrastrukturen in Darmstadt suchen wir eine/n


Informatiker/in, Physiker/in, Mathematiker/in, Ingenieur/in o. ä. (w/m/d) Digitale Zwillinge der SmartCity




Ihre Mission:


Das Institut zum Schutz terrestrischer Infrastrukturen hat die stabile Versorgung der Gesellschaft zum Ziel. Die Entwicklung von Methoden zur Erkennung und Abwehr von Bedrohungen gehört ebenso zu den Aufgaben wie verbessertes Management im Fall von Großschadenslagen.


Das Team „Modellierung komplexer Infrastruktursysteme in der SmartCity“ soll innovative und neuartige Ansätze entwickeln, um komplexe vernetzte Infrastruktursysteme in Smart Cities zu modellieren und simulieren. Ebenso sollen die Bedarfe und Verhaltensweisen der Bevölkerung im Stadtleben sowie im Krisenfall abgebildet werden. Durch die Nachführung der Modelle mit Echtzeit-Daten und der Bereitstellung von intelligenten Tools für Krisenstäbe und Einsatzkräfte entstehen Digitale Zwillinge, die neue Möglichkeiten zur Überwachung und Reaktion auf Krisen bereitstellen. Zudem bilden sie eine Grundlage zur Analyse und Optimierung der Resilienz von terrestrischen Infrastrukturen.


Als Forscher/in definieren und planen Sie die detaillierte fachliche Ausrichtung des Projekts. Dies umfasst folgende Verantwortlichkeiten:



  • Erfassung von Anwender-Bedarfen für verschiedene Szenarien und Stand der Technik im Bereich Energie-, Wasser-, Mobilitäts-Infrastrukturen sowie der Einsatzkräfte und städtischer Krisenstäbe

  • Entwicklung und Evaluation von innovativen Methoden zur Modellierung von komplexen Systemen und der Bevölkerung in Smart Cities auf Mikro- und Makroebene und für verschiedene Infrastrukturen, z. B. mit Hilfe agentenbasierter Simulation

  • Ausarbeitung der Anforderungen an in Echtzeit zu erhebenden Daten und strukturiertem Datenmanagement

  • Entwicklung von Verfahren und Methoden zur Erstellung und Betrieb von Digitalen Zwillingen für Smart Cities in IT-Plattformen

  • Konzipierung von Demonstratoren und Evaluation der Methoden mit Testdaten

  • Konzipierung und Identifikation der wissenschaftlichen Kernarbeitsgebiete im Hinblick auf Innovations- sowie Transferpotentiale

  • Anleitung von Doktoranden und Jungwissenschaftlern

  • Abstimmung der Arbeiten mit anderen Projekten im DLR und der Abteilung, Aufbau von Kooperationen mit Anwendern und die Akquise von Projekten

  • Vertretung des Projekts bei Partnern und auf nationalen und internationalen Konferenzen


Die Arbeiten finden in Kooperation mit dem Zentrum emergenCITY statt, für das das DLR eine Außenstelle des Instituts in Darmstadt eingerichtet hat. Das LOEWE-Zentrum emergenCITY ist ein interdisziplinäres Forschungszentrum an der TU Darmstadt. Ziel von emergenCITY ist die Erforschung von Grundlagen, Methoden und Lösungen für zukünftige resiliente digitale Städte. Im Fokus steht insbesondere die Erforschung und Entwicklung von Informations- und Kommunikationstechnologie, die in Krisensituationen selbstständig reagieren, sich anpassen und neu konfigurieren kann.


Ihre Ideen setzen Sie in einem dynamischen und innovativen Institut um. Neben einem hohen Maß an Teamspirit erwartet Sie eine exzellente Infrastruktur mit modernster Ausrüstung und aktuellen Entwicklungsumgebungen. Wir unterstützen Sie zudem aktiv bei Ihrer beruflichen und wissenschaftlichen Weiterentwicklung.




Ihre Qualifikation:



  • abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, einem naturwissenschaftlichen Bereich (z. B. Mathematik, Technomathematik, Numerik, Physik) oder einem ingenieurwissenschaftlichen Bereich (z. B. Elektrotechnik, Maschinenbau)

  • Erfahrungen in der Entwicklung, Evaluation und Simulation von funktionalen und technischen Systemmodellen nach naturwissenschaftlichen Methoden

  • Erfahrung in der Nutzung von Entwicklungsprozessen zur Softwareentwicklung, Aufbau von Softwarearchitekturen für Simulationssysteme oder Data Science sowie Nutzung von Datenbanken

  • Erfahrung in der Durchführung von Drittmittelprojekten wünschenswert

  • Erfahrung in der Führung von Projektteams in wissenschaftlichen Projekten, Erfahrung mit agilen Projektmethoden

  • Erfahrungen im Umgang mit Industriepartnern und Behörden, möglichst auch in gemeinsamen Projekten

  • hervorragendes mündliches und schriftliches Ausdrucksvermögen sowie verhandlungssichere Englischkenntnisse

  • ausgeprägte Kommunikations- und Kooperationsbereitschaft sowie Teamfähigkeit

  • sehr gute Kenntnisse und Erfahrungen in folgenden Bereichen wünschenswert:

    • agentenbasierte Modellierung und Bedarfs-Modelle

    • Theorie vernetzter komplexer Systeme

    • datengetriebene Kalibrierung von Modellen

    • Datenmanagement und Simulationssoftware



  • hohe Bereitschaft, sich mit neuen (Anwendungs-)Technologien vertraut zu machen

  • Fähigkeit, interdisziplinär zu denken und zu arbeiten und die Bereitschaft, im Team zu arbeiten

  • Leidenschaft für innovative Forschung und einen wissenschaftlichen und systematischen Ansatz

  • Reisebereitschaft (national/international)




Ihr Start:


Freuen Sie sich auf einen Arbeitgeber, der Ihr Engagement zu schätzen weiß und Ihre Entwicklung durch vielfältige Qualifizierungs- und Weiterbildungs­möglich­keiten fördert. Unser einzigartiges Arbeitsumfeld bietet Ihnen Gestaltungs­frei­räume und eine unvergleichbare Infrastruktur, in der Sie Ihre Mission verwirklichen können. Vereinbarkeit von Privatleben, Familie und Beruf sowie Chancengleichheit von Personen aller Geschlechter (w/m/d) sind wichtiger Bestandteil unserer Personal­politik. Bewerbungen schwerbehinderter Menschen bevorzugen wir bei fachlicher Eignung.


Fachliche Fragen beantwortet Ihnen gerne Frau Prof. Dr. Eva Brucherseifer telefonisch unter +49 2241 20148-50. Weitere Informationen zu dieser Position mit der Kennziffer 62738 sowie zur Vergütung und zum Bewerbungsweg finden Sie unter www.DLR.de/dlr/jobs/#47255

About usGoldbach neXT AG is the central technology and digital implementation hub for advertising in the TX Group. With innovative product developments, data-driven advertising, and technology, we take care of the smooth connection of the media and data of our publishers and sales units.We are looking forIn order to strengthen our project organization, we are looking for a smart, talented, and dedicated person to join our team in the role ofScrum Master / Project Manager* / 80-100%
Your tasks:-You lead 2-3 cross-functional Scrum teams and are responsible for the development of the specification and ensure the achievement of epics in close cooperation with the product owner and the engineering team.-You organize and manage Scrum events and ensure a structured documentation in Confluence and Jira-You address impediments and actively support their elimination-You independently identify fields of action and find solutions with your colleagues across the organization-You inform and communicate actively within the team, with key stakeholders and the various committees in the group-You help the team to understand the theories and practices, as well as rules and values of Scrum, Kanban and agile methods and to understand more-In addition to your activity as a Scrum Master, you will lead individual transformation projects and thus actively contribute to the digitization of the group-You ensure continuous development and process improvement; you use KPIs and metrics and learn iteratively what works - and what doesn'tYour profile:-You have successfully completed a university degree in business, computer science or a comparable professional qualification-You have several years of practical experience as a Scrum Master or Project Leader / Management Consultant and are familiar with agile methods and techniques, especially Scrum and Kanban-You are highly solution oriented and share our passion for driving sustainable organizational change-You have already gained experience with agile tools (e.g. Jira, Confluence, Miro)-You have very good analytical and conceptual skills paired with excellent presentation and moderation skills-You have strong communication skills, empathy, conflict resolution skills, organizational skills and are a team player-Business fluent German or English complete your profile
_source.description_html:
About us


Goldbach neXT AG is the central technology and digital implementation hub for advertising in the TX Group. With innovative product developments, data-driven advertising, and technology, we take care of the smooth connection of the media and data of our publishers and sales units.






We are looking for


In order to strengthen our project organization, we are looking for a smart, talented, and dedicated person to join our team in the role of


Scrum Master / Project Manager* / 80-100%







Your tasks:


-You lead 2-3 cross-functional Scrum teams and are responsible for the development of the specification and ensure the achievement of epics in close cooperation with the product owner and the engineering team.


-You organize and manage Scrum events and ensure a structured documentation in Confluence and Jira


-You address impediments and actively support their elimination


-You independently identify fields of action and find solutions with your colleagues across the organization


-You inform and communicate actively within the team, with key stakeholders and the various committees in the group


-You help the team to understand the theories and practices, as well as rules and values of Scrum, Kanban and agile methods and to understand more


-In addition to your activity as a Scrum Master, you will lead individual transformation projects and thus actively contribute to the digitization of the group


-You ensure continuous development and process improvement; you use KPIs and metrics and learn iteratively what works - and what doesn't






Your profile:


-You have successfully completed a university degree in business, computer science or a comparable professional qualification


-You have several years of practical experience as a Scrum Master or Project Leader / Management Consultant and are familiar with agile methods and techniques, especially Scrum and Kanban


-You are highly solution oriented and share our passion for driving sustainable organizational change


-You have already gained experience with agile tools (e.g. Jira, Confluence, Miro)


-You have very good analytical and conceptual skills paired with excellent presentation and moderation skills


-You have strong communication skills, empathy, conflict resolution skills, organizational skills and are a team player


-Business fluent German or English complete your profile
_source.position_name: Scrum Master / Project Manager*  / 80-100% at Goldbach Group AG (Zürich, Switzerland)

_source.description:
Your TasksAs 4th team member in the area of Business Intelligence, you will handle all tasks related to BI and data engineering independently, including all stages of the process of setting up a BI infrastructure.Define key metrics that directly determine our strategic and operational decision-making processes
Design and set up a data warehouse that acts as a central hub for all our data
Create reports and dashboards using modern BI solutions such as Metabase, Redash, Looker or Tableau
Write SQL queries and automated scripts to perform complex analyses
Build ETL pipelines that integrate data from several internal and external sources
Constantly improve our OLAP data model to make sure we can analyse our data effectively
Manage and improve all business intelligence processes within the company
Your Qualifications4+ years of experience in BI and data modelling
Experience with commonly used BI tools such as Looker or Tableau
Excellent knowledge of SQL, relational databases such as MySQL or Postgres, as well as data warehouse technologies such as Snowflake or Redshift
Ideally, coding experience with languages common in data engineering such as Python or R
Generalist mindset; eagerness to learn about new technologies and tackle unfamiliar problems
Startup mindset and pragmatic, hands-on attitude
Fluency in English and great communication skills
Your BenefitsOpportunity to shape a valuable, impactful product in a meaningful way
Full ownership over your responsibilities and tasks
Fully remote position, but we also have an office centrally located in Berlin Mitte
Casual startup environment with no bureaucracy and no complex processes
Competitive compensation
Flexible working hours and working from home policy
Hardware of your choice (e.g. Macbook Pro)
We are looking forward to receiving your application!
_source.description_html:
Your Tasks


As 4th team member in the area of Business Intelligence, you will handle all tasks related to BI and data engineering independently, including all stages of the process of setting up a BI infrastructure.



  • Define key metrics that directly determine our strategic and operational decision-making processes

  • Design and set up a data warehouse that acts as a central hub for all our data

  • Create reports and dashboards using modern BI solutions such as Metabase, Redash, Looker or Tableau

  • Write SQL queries and automated scripts to perform complex analyses

  • Build ETL pipelines that integrate data from several internal and external sources

  • Constantly improve our OLAP data model to make sure we can analyse our data effectively

  • Manage and improve all business intelligence processes within the company


Your Qualifications



  • 4+ years of experience in BI and data modelling

  • Experience with commonly used BI tools such as Looker or Tableau

  • Excellent knowledge of SQL, relational databases such as MySQL or Postgres, as well as data warehouse technologies such as Snowflake or Redshift

  • Ideally, coding experience with languages common in data engineering such as Python or R

  • Generalist mindset; eagerness to learn about new technologies and tackle unfamiliar problems

  • Startup mindset and pragmatic, hands-on attitude

  • Fluency in English and great communication skills


Your Benefits



  • Opportunity to shape a valuable, impactful product in a meaningful way

  • Full ownership over your responsibilities and tasks

  • Fully remote position, but we also have an office centrally located in Berlin Mitte

  • Casual startup environment with no bureaucracy and no complex processes

  • Competitive compensation

  • Flexible working hours and working from home policy

  • Hardware of your choice (e.g. Macbook Pro)


We are looking forward to receiving your application!

Daran werden Sie wachsen:Entwicklung von neuen algorithmischen Verfahren fanduuml;r die Anwendung und Problemstellung von Level 3 Fahrfunktionen
Unterstanduuml;tzung der Tandauml;tigkeiten im hochautomatisierten Fahrendurch moderne und komplexe Sensorik wie z.B. Kurz-/ Mittel- oder Langstreckenradar, LIDAR und kamerabasierte 2D/3D Sensoren
Implementierung von Algorithmen in C++ und Optimierung auf unterschiedliche Embedded Hardware 
Verantwortung fanduuml;r die Erstellung von Anforderungen, Design und Validierungskonzepten
Aktive Mitwirkung in unserem agilen Entwicklungsteam zur standauml;ndigen Weiterentwicklung des kontinuierlichen Verbesserungsprozesses 
Damit bringen Sie uns voran:Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Mathematik oder vergleichbare Qualifikation und mindestens ein Jahr praktische Erfahrung im Bereich der Algorithmen Entwicklung fanduuml;r ADAS Sensorik oder Funktion 
Kenntnisse in einem oder mehreren Bereichen wie beispielsweise der Objektverfolgung / Tracking und Objektklassifikation, Merkmalsextraktion, Belegungsgitter, Lokalisation, Map-Matching, Bildverarbeitung, Machine Learning 
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in den Bereichen der objektorientierten Programmierung C / C++ sowie Matlab oder Python 
Flieandszlig;ende Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse

Daran werden Sie wachsen:



  • Entwicklung von neuen algorithmischen Verfahren für die Anwendung und Problemstellung von Level 3 Fahrfunktionen

  • Unterstützung der Tätigkeiten im hochautomatisierten Fahrendurch moderne und komplexe Sensorik wie z.B. Kurz-/ Mittel- oder Langstreckenradar, LIDAR und kamerabasierte 2D/3D Sensoren

  • Implementierung von Algorithmen in C++ und Optimierung auf unterschiedliche Embedded Hardware

  • Verantwortung für die Erstellung von Anforderungen, Design und Validierungskonzepten

  • Aktive Mitwirkung in unserem agilen Entwicklungsteam zur ständigen Weiterentwicklung des kontinuierlichen Verbesserungsprozesses




Damit bringen Sie uns voran:



  • Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Mathematik oder vergleichbare Qualifikation und mindestens ein Jahr praktische Erfahrung im Bereich der Algorithmen Entwicklung für ADAS Sensorik oder Funktion

  • Kenntnisse in einem oder mehreren Bereichen wie beispielsweise der Objektverfolgung / Tracking und Objektklassifikation, Merkmalsextraktion, Belegungsgitter, Lokalisation, Map-Matching, Bildverarbeitung, Machine Learning

  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in den Bereichen der objektorientierten Programmierung C / C++ sowie Matlab oder Python

  • Fließende Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse

_source.description_html:
Einleitung



Wir sind ein deutscher Innovations­führer für Contact Center und Unified Communi­cation Software Made in Germany. Unsere modulare All-In-One Software CAESAR und TIMIO ermög­licht gebündelte und ziel­gerichtete Omni­channel-Kommunikation. Zur Ver­stärkung unseres Ent­wicklungs­teams suchen wir moti­vierte Ent­wickler:innen mit fundierten Kennt­nissen und Erfah­rung im Bereich Web- und/oder Windows-Entwicklung.




Wir suchen Dich!


Software-Entwickler (w/m/d)





Das bringt der Job




  • Entwicklung, Test und Dokumen­tation komplexer Cloud-Lösungen für den multi­medialen Kunden­dialog

  • Mitarbeit bei der Konzeption und Design neuer Software-Lösungen

  • Weiterentwicklung bestehender Kommuni­kations­lösungen

  • Mitwirkung bei der Gestaltung von Soft­ware­architekturen und der Auswahl von Technologien

  • Aktive Teilnahme an agilen Arbeits­prozessen





Das bringst Du mit




  • Informatikstudium, MATSE oder ver­gleichbar

  • Erfahrung in der Web- und/oder Windows-Entwicklung

  • Gute Kenntnisse in C++/C#, XAML und .Net Core

  • Gute Kenntnisse in Bereich Client-Server Architektur

  • Kenntnisse in REST und SOAP von Vorteil

  • Gute Kenntnisse in Vue, React und Sencha

  • Gute Kenntnisse in Javascript, HTML, CSS

  • Erfahrung mit Microsoft TFS und Microsoft Visual Studio





Das gibt es bei uns




  • Umfangreiches Gehaltspaket

  • Unbefristetes Arbeitsver­hältnis nach Probezeit

  • 30 Tage Urlaub, flexible Arbeits­zeiten (Gleitzeit)

  • Möglichkeit zum mobilen Arbeiten

  • Betriebliches Gesundheits­management

  • Klimatisierter Arbeits­platz

  • Höhenverstellbarer Schreib­tisch (elektrisch)

  • On Office Power-Flat: Kaffee, Mineral­wasser, Obst

  • Flache Hierarchien

  • Ein Team, viel Spaß: regel­mäßige Company Events

  • Indoor-Gaming: Kicker, Flight-Simulator





Starte Deine neue Karriere bei CASERIS!



Online Bewerbung hier auf unserem Karriere-Portal oder per E-Mail.




Oder per Post an: CASERIS GmbH | Personal | Am Birkenfeld 1-3 | 52222 Stolberg


Hier findest Du mehr Details: https://www.caseris.de/karriere

_source.description:
Deine Aufgaben:Du entwickelst Proof-of-Concepts, Prototypen und Softwarelandouml;sungen fanduuml;r den produktiven Einsatz basierend auf Machine Learning, Deep Learning und Big Data
Dabei bewertest du die Einsatzmandouml;glichkeiten und erarbeitest Konzepte zum Einsatz von KI-basierten Software-Landouml;sungen im Connected Commerce
Du erarbeitest Landouml;sungen mit verschiedenen Fachbereichen und Kunden
An wechselnden Herausforderungen hast du Spaandszlig; und bist neugierig, dir neue Themengebiete in einem tollen Team zu erarbeiten
Dein Profil:Du hast ein Studium aus dem Fachbereich Informatik oder eine entsprechende Ausbildung erfolgreich abgeschlossen und dabei oder danach Berufserfahrung im Bereich Kanduuml;nstliche Intelligenz gesammelt
Du bist sicher im Umgang mit Python und hast im besten Fall auch Erfahrungen in anderen Programmiersprachen gesammelt
Du weiandszlig;t nicht nur wie man ein Modell erstellt und trainieren, sondern kennt den Life Cycle bis zum Produktivsystem
Ein mathematisches Grundverstandauml;ndnis in Bezug auf Machine Learning bringst du genauso mit wie auch die Kenntnisse anduuml;ber neuronale Netze (MLP, CNN, RNN sollten dir dabei bekannt sein)
Dein Profil rundest du mit einer schnellen Auffassungsgabe, hohem technischen Verstandauml;ndnis und analytischen Fandauml;higkeiten ab
Das sind wir:hmmh ist Deutschlands fanduuml;hrende Agentur im Connected Commerce. Mehr als 330 Kollegen arbeiten an vier Standorten: Bremen (Hauptsitz), Berlin, Hamburg und Manduuml;nchen. hmmh unterstanduuml;tzt Unternehmen bei der digitalen Transformation und entwirft vernetzte Landouml;sungen fanduuml;r nahtlose, auf den Kunden abgestimmte Nutzererlebnisse entlang aller Touchpoints. Dafanduuml;r entwerfen die Experten in interdisziplinandauml;ren und agil arbeitenden Teams intelligente Landouml;sungen: Von der Strategie und dem Konzept anduuml;ber die Entwicklung und Realisierung von Websites, Portalen, Online-Shops sowie Apps und Voice Interfaces, bis zum vernetzten CRM, PIM-Systemen und digitalen Kommunikationsmaandszlig;nahmen. Kunden wie Otto, Schaeffler, Deutschland Card, bonprix, 1and1, ALBA, Tchibo Mobil und Outletcity Metzingen vertrauen auf die Expertise der Agentur. Seit Juli 2014 ist hmmh Teil der Plan.Net Gruppe, der fanduuml;hrenden und grandouml;andszlig;ten unabhandauml;ngigen Digitalagentur Europas, die an anduuml;ber 25 Standorten weltweit vertreten ist.
_source.description_html:
Deine Aufgaben:




  • Du entwickelst Proof-of-Concepts, Prototypen und Softwarelösungen für den produktiven Einsatz basierend auf Machine Learning, Deep Learning und Big Data




  • Dabei bewertest du die Einsatzmöglichkeiten und erarbeitest Konzepte zum Einsatz von KI-basierten Software-Lösungen im Connected Commerce




  • Du erarbeitest Lösungen mit verschiedenen Fachbereichen und Kunden



  • An wechselnden Herausforderungen hast du Spaß und bist neugierig, dir neue Themengebiete in einem tollen Team zu erarbeiten



Dein Profil:










  • Du hast ein Studium aus dem Fachbereich Informatik oder eine entsprechende Ausbildung erfolgreich abgeschlossen und dabei oder danach Berufserfahrung im Bereich Künstliche Intelligenz gesammelt


  • Du bist sicher im Umgang mit Python und hast im besten Fall auch Erfahrungen in anderen Programmiersprachen gesammelt




  • Du weißt nicht nur wie man ein Modell erstellt und trainieren, sondern kennt den Life Cycle bis zum Produktivsystem




  • Ein mathematisches Grundverständnis in Bezug auf Machine Learning bringst du genauso mit wie auch die Kenntnisse über neuronale Netze (MLP, CNN, RNN sollten dir dabei bekannt sein)



  • Dein Profil rundest du mit einer schnellen Auffassungsgabe, hohem technischen Verständnis und analytischen Fähigkeiten ab








Das sind wir:

hmmh ist Deutschlands führende Agentur im Connected Commerce. Mehr als 330 Kollegen arbeiten an vier Standorten: Bremen (Hauptsitz), Berlin, Hamburg und München. hmmh unterstützt Unternehmen bei der digitalen Transformation und entwirft vernetzte Lösungen für nahtlose, auf den Kunden abgestimmte Nutzererlebnisse entlang aller Touchpoints. Dafür entwerfen die Experten in interdisziplinären und agil arbeitenden Teams intelligente Lösungen: Von der Strategie und dem Konzept über die Entwicklung und Realisierung von Websites, Portalen, Online-Shops sowie Apps und Voice Interfaces, bis zum vernetzten CRM, PIM-Systemen und digitalen Kommunikationsmaßnahmen. Kunden wie Otto, Schaeffler, Deutschland Card, bonprix, 1&1, ALBA, Tchibo Mobil und Outletcity Metzingen vertrauen auf die Expertise der Agentur. Seit Juli 2014 ist hmmh Teil der Plan.Net Gruppe, der führenden und größten unabhängigen Digitalagentur Europas, die an über 25 Standorten weltweit vertreten ist.
