_source.position_name: Associate Software Engineer at MarketAxess Holdings Inc. (New York, NY) (allows remote)

_source.description:
Join our team of talented and passionate software engineers and help us build the next generation of ArcGIS Enterprise, a suite of products delivering state-of-the-art geospatial capability to thousands of our customers and millions of users worldwide.The team works on the cutting edge of distributed systems, designing and building software that is massively scalable, reliable, and secure with a cloud native philosophy. Our engineers look for the best tools to solve a challenging problem with a software design focused on sustainability and evolution. If you are proficient in Java, love to build challenging distributed systems to run awesomely on the cloud, and are not afraid to be on the bleeding-edge of technology this is the place to be!Responsibilities:Build server-side Java components and web services to power user experience and geospatial workflows
Prototype, design, develop, and deliver complete software features and products that can scale, are fault tolerant, and handle concurrent workloads
Apply cloud native principles to design software architecture that takes advantage of cloud services and infrastructure for massive scale and availability
Find, analyze, and fix bugs/performance problems whenever and wherever they occur
Work collaboratively with other teams to understand requirements and incorporate them into the software
Collaborate with your team via design and code reviews, technology presentations, and insights
Requirements:2-5 years of experience developing middleware software components using core Java, Servlets (JavaEE), JSP
Solid understanding and hands-on experience working with cloud computing platforms (AWS and/or Azure) and services such as Amazon S3, SQS, EC2, cloud formation templates, and Azure services such as Blob Service, Table Service, ARM templates, etc.
Good understanding of Java design patterns
Knowledge of relational databases such as SQL Server, Oracle, PostgreSQL, or DB2
Experience working with large code bases
Fundamental understanding of web services including REST and SOAP
Proficient in debugging and profiling tools (Eclipse/IntelliJ Debugger, JProfiler, etc.)
Knowledge of working with a source control system, preferably GIT
Excellent problem-solving, design, development, and debugging skills
Excellent written and verbal communication and time management skills
Bachelor's, masterandrsquo;s, or Ph.D. in math, computer science, physics, or related field, depending on position level
Recommended Qualifications:Familiarity with JSON and XML
Knowledge of and familiarity with Java build systems, i.e. Maven and ANT
Experience with HTTP monitoring tools (Fiddler) and JDK debugging tools (JProfiler, jmap)
Knowledge of Docker containers and orchestrators such as Kubernetes
Questions about our interview process? We have answers.
_source.description_html:
Join our team of talented and passionate software engineers and help us build the next generation of ArcGIS Enterprise, a suite of products delivering state-of-the-art geospatial capability to thousands of our customers and millions of users worldwide.


The team works on the cutting edge of distributed systems, designing and building software that is massively scalable, reliable, and secure with a cloud native philosophy. Our engineers look for the best tools to solve a challenging problem with a software design focused on sustainability and evolution. If you are proficient in Java, love to build challenging distributed systems to run awesomely on the cloud, and are not afraid to be on the bleeding-edge of technology this is the place to be!


Responsibilities:



  • Build server-side Java components and web services to power user experience and geospatial workflows

  • Prototype, design, develop, and deliver complete software features and products that can scale, are fault tolerant, and handle concurrent workloads

  • Apply cloud native principles to design software architecture that takes advantage of cloud services and infrastructure for massive scale and availability

  • Find, analyze, and fix bugs/performance problems whenever and wherever they occur

  • Work collaboratively with other teams to understand requirements and incorporate them into the software

  • Collaborate with your team via design and code reviews, technology presentations, and insights


Requirements:



  • 2-5 years of experience developing middleware software components using core Java, Servlets (JavaEE), JSP

  • Solid understanding and hands-on experience working with cloud computing platforms (AWS and/or Azure) and services such as Amazon S3, SQS, EC2, cloud formation templates, and Azure services such as Blob Service, Table Service, ARM templates, etc.

  • Good understanding of Java design patterns

  • Knowledge of relational databases such as SQL Server, Oracle, PostgreSQL, or DB2

  • Experience working with large code bases

  • Fundamental understanding of web services including REST and SOAP

  • Proficient in debugging and profiling tools (Eclipse/IntelliJ Debugger, JProfiler, etc.)

  • Knowledge of working with a source control system, preferably GIT

  • Excellent problem-solving, design, development, and debugging skills

  • Excellent written and verbal communication and time management skills

  • Bachelor's, master’s, or Ph.D. in math, computer science, physics, or related field, depending on position level


Recommended Qualifications:



  • Familiarity with JSON and XML

  • Knowledge of and familiarity with Java build systems, i.e. Maven and ANT

  • Experience with HTTP monitoring tools (Fiddler) and JDK debugging tools (JProfiler, jmap)

  • Knowledge of Docker containers and orchestrators such as Kubernetes


Questions about our interview process? We have answers.
_source.position_name: Cloud Software Engineer at Esri (Redlands, CA)

_source.description:
Als Senior .NET Developer sta je in voor de ontwikkeling van nieuwe applicaties en voor de verbetering en het onderhoud van bestaande applicaties.

Je vertaalt functionele analyses in technische analyses en helpt de analist bij de validatie van technische specificaties van applicaties.

Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het oplossen van bugs op tweedelijnsniveau en biedt technische ondersteuning aan de junior ontwikkelaars.

Je test de ontwikkelde programmaandrsquo;s zodat ze beantwoorden aan de gewenste verbeteringen en aanpassingen. 

Je maakt de technische documentatie op, controleert de opgestelde documentatie van de junior ontwikkelaars en werkt eventueel mee aan de functionele documentatie.

Daarnaast volg je de trends en evoluties op betreffende technologieandeuml;n en methodologieandeuml;n in je domein.

Tot slot stuur je relevante informatie naar je verantwoordelijke en lever je nuttige input voor de reporting naar het management.ProfielJe beschikt over een bachelor in de Informatica en hebt bij voorkeur 5 jaar ervaring als .NET Developer.

Je hebt een goede kennis van ontwikkeling in een Microsoft .NET-omgeving (backend en frontend) en bent vertrouwd met functionele (UML- use case) en technische analyse.

Je bent vertrouwd met de volgende technologieandeuml;n : C#, VB script, VBA, XSLT, HTML, Oracle, SQL-server, SQL.

Je hebt bij voorkeur een basiskennis van de technologieandeuml;n MVC, WCF, Entity Framework, NHibernate, Angular Typescript, SSIS/SSAS, services REST, Azure.

Je bent op zoek naar een afwisselende functie die uitdagingen met zich meebrengt. Je werkt graag in teamverband. Je bent creatief en hebt verantwoordelijkheidszin. Je neemt initiatief en biedt kwaliteitsvolle oplossingen aan.

Je hebt eveneens een passieve kennis van de tweede landstaal.AanbodBij Smals bouw je mee aan complexe ICT-services die een rol gaan spelen in de hele samenleving. Zowel in application development als in ICT infrastructure of ondersteunende diensten is opleiding, specialisatie en carriandegrave;re mogelijk. ICT for Society wordt daarnaast geflankeerd door een nadrukkelijke balans tussen werk en leven, marktconforme lonen, een hospitalisatieverzekering, 2e pensioenpijler, maaltijdcheques en telewerk. Smals betaalt het openbaar vervoer 100% terug en zorgt voor maximaal bereikbare kantoren. Bovendien voert Smals een gelijkekansenbeleid.

Bring your own ideas for our code structure and new features to be implemented

Language Agnostic, e.g. experience in or willing to learn Go, Rust, React, Vue

  • Development and Maintenance of our existing products and (internal) services

  • Enhancement and refactoring of our services for more performance, constant up-time and maintainability

  • Development of new products and features, using various types of technologies (React and Vue.js, eventually Kafka or Go)


Requirements



  • Whether degree educated or not, you are an experienced Python developer, and ideally familiar with Django

  • Performant database design and querying with either PostgreSQL or MySQL

  • Experience writing unit tests


Nice to have



  • Experienced in the development of Facebook applications (Graph API)

  • The ability to write clean and compact code, e.g. DRY, KISS, Loose Coupling principles

  • Language Agnostic, e.g. experience in or willing to learn Go, Rust, React, Vue

Our engineering team is responsible for designing, developing, and running web services that make up the foundation of the Assurance business.

This position is responsible for developing the customer- and agent-facing UI as well as supporting whole engineering team on our mission to better UIs. We are working on developing the next generation of our platform that would allow us Assurance to expand into other business domains at a fraction of engineering cost.

You are a seasoned software engineer, who has been working on internal- and public-facing web services for a number of years. You have made your share of mistakes and learned from them. You have good instincts and strong judgment, and your decisions were tested by time over and over again. You demonstrate an exemplary level of ownership and no problem is below you. You enjoy creating designs and writing code that would outlive you.

_source.description:
Whatandrsquo;s the jobWith your expertise in software and systems engineering, you will be responsible for the Catawiki Platform infrastructure and automation by:Developing infrastructure automation and eliminating menial tasks
Making sure the infrastructure is scalable, reproducible and stable
Identifying any single point of failures and building solutions to remove them
Sharing on-call responsibilities
Guiding Engineering teams on best practices and approaches

Hereandrsquo;s Finke, one of our senior engineersandldquo;Hi, Iandrsquo;m Finke! I have been working for Catawiki for 5+ years and I keep learning a lot as Iandrsquo;m morphing through different iterations of our Platform team to keep up with the business requirements and the need for growth of the infrastructure. As business demands change, so must we, and the Infrastructure team is picking up the responsibility of managing the Cloud platforms we use, as well as supporting the rest of the Platform team in providing their services on top of what we built.andldquo;

You'll move in sync withandhellip;As a part of a multidisciplinary team (software/ reliability/ data /test engineers and product/project managers) within a functional area, youandrsquo;ll be making sure scalability and reliability aspects are built-in and being delivered on within all steps of the development lifecycle, ensuring smooth operations.
A little bit about you...You have a solid knowledge base of system concepts, particularly in Linux systems and have used this to hone your skills with hypervisors and/or container runtimes. By sharing ownership with developers and using the same tools you reduce organisational silos. You leverage tooling and automation and love to effectively solve and communicate problems.Next, to this itandrsquo;s likely youandrsquo;ll also have experience with:
Software, Systems and Security engineering
iAC tools like Ansible/Puppet/Terraform/Pulumi and its use and/or introduction in existing large-scale infrastructure.
Kubernetes and other Cloud Native technologies (Docker/Helm)
Relational databases some familiarity with NoSQL databases
Monitoring and alerting tools (Prometheus/AlertManager, ELK, Grafana)
Next to a passion for problem solving, troubleshooting and a sharp eye for details youandrsquo;ll also have excellent written and verbal communication. 

Nice to havePractical experience with Kafka
Practical experience in large distributed systems and how to ensure stability
Practical experience with Google Cloud or other cloud providers

And here's some more information about our tech stack...It's not essential you know all of these but here's what our team are currently using day to day:Terraform / Ansible / helm / kustomize
CI/CD - CircleCI/ArgoCD
Github
Google Cloud
Kubernetes
AWS
Nginx
Bash / Python / Go
LocationWe are based in Amsterdam and offer a fantastic relocation package. We operate in a hybrid model and have an environment of flexibility and trust.
_source.description_html:
What’s the job


With your expertise in software and systems engineering, you will be responsible for the Catawiki Platform infrastructure and automation by:



  • Developing infrastructure automation and eliminating menial tasks

  • Making sure the infrastructure is scalable, reproducible and stable

  • Identifying any single point of failures and building solutions to remove them

  • Sharing on-call responsibilities

  • Guiding Engineering teams on best practices and approaches



Here’s Finke, one of our senior engineers


“Hi, I’m Finke! I have been working for Catawiki for 5+ years and I keep learning a lot as I’m morphing through different iterations of our Platform team to keep up with the business requirements and the need for growth of the infrastructure. As business demands change, so must we, and the Infrastructure team is picking up the responsibility of managing the Cloud platforms we use, as well as supporting the rest of the Platform team in providing their services on top of what we built.“


You'll move in sync with…


As a part of a multidisciplinary team (software/ reliability/ data /test engineers and product/project managers) within a functional area, you’ll be making sure scalability and reliability aspects are built-in and being delivered on within all steps of the development lifecycle, ensuring smooth operations.



A little bit about you...


You have a solid knowledge base of system concepts, particularly in Linux systems and have used this to hone your skills with hypervisors and/or container runtimes. By sharing ownership with developers and using the same tools you reduce organisational silos. You leverage tooling and automation and love to effectively solve and communicate problems.Next, to this it’s likely you’ll also have experience with:



  • Software, Systems and Security engineering

  • iAC tools like Ansible/Puppet/Terraform/Pulumi and its use and/or introduction in existing large-scale infrastructure.

  • Kubernetes and other Cloud Native technologies (Docker/Helm)

  • Relational databases some familiarity with NoSQL databases

  • Monitoring and alerting tools (Prometheus/AlertManager, ELK, Grafana)

  • Next to a passion for problem solving, troubleshooting and a sharp eye for details you’ll also have excellent written and verbal communication.



Nice to have



  • Practical experience with Kafka

  • Practical experience in large distributed systems and how to ensure stability

  • Practical experience with Google Cloud or other cloud providers



And here's some more information about our tech stack...


It's not essential you know all of these but here's what our team are currently using day to day:



  • Terraform / Ansible / helm / kustomize

  • CI/CD - CircleCI/ArgoCD

  • Github

  • Google Cloud

  • Kubernetes

  • AWS

  • Nginx

  • Bash / Python / Go


Location


We are based in Amsterdam and offer a fantastic relocation package. We operate in a hybrid model and have an environment of flexibility and trust.
_source.position_name: Infrastructure Engineer at Catawiki (Amsterdam, Netherlands)

_source.description:
How we work At Catawiki, we keep our users close to our hearts and make sure that we deliver a great user experience across all platforms. Android is no exception! As an Android developer working at Catawiki, you are empowered to take full ownership of the features we deliver and full ownership of how we structure our codebase.We embrace change, weandrsquo;ve migrated from MVC to MVP and then to MVVM. Currently, we are using Kotlin and enjoying all the cool advantages that come with it. We are constantly improving our architecture, which makes working at Catawiki fun and challenging at the same time.What youandrsquo;ll do Here at Catawiki, you will have a huge impact, working in a data-driven way to add value to the business along with the other 7 members of the Android team. You will add your own expertise to further grow our business, experiment, and innovate the product.Youandrsquo;ll be adding new features to create an even greater experience for our users. As well as actively collaborating with your fellow Android developers to take the codebase and the entire Android App to the next level. Our millions of users will thank you for that!How we roll - Our Stack Our codebase is primarily written in Java but we are strongly adopting Kotlin for our new features and refactorings. Our app uses MVVM as a general architecture, and we rely heavily on the reactive/functional paradigm using RxJava. We also make use of Androidandrsquo;s Architecture Components. We are using the most popular 3rd parties like Dagger 2, Retrofit, data binding, as well as Mockito and Espresso for testing.What youandrsquo;ll bring You are a passionate experienced Android Developer with a strong eye for detail.
You strive to be a great team player and donandrsquo;t shy away from new challenges.
You are comfortable in a startup environment and are ready to jump in and help if needed.
You keep the company's values close to your heart and enjoy being in a diverse environment.
We expect you to have experience with:Strong Object-oriented programming skills - priority
Strong knowledge of the Android framework
Proficient with Kotlin
Knowledge of the reactive/functional paradigm
Familiarity with MVVM architecture
Familiarity with consuming RESTful APIs
Unit testing
Next to this, itandrsquo;s likely youandrsquo;ll also have experience with RxJava, UI testing, and A/B testingHereandrsquo;s what we can offer youThis is your chance to become part of a fast but sustainable growing tech company! You'll be part of an enthusiastic, highly motivated team of 650+ international Catawikians; you'll have big responsibilities and can really create something. Additionally, you can expect:For people living outside of The Netherlands we offer a great relocation package for you and your family
An attractive Stock Option package
A diverse and international team with over 50 different nationalities.
Catawiki provides you with a membership to the Oandrsquo;Reilly learning platform.
As part of Catawikiandrsquo;s goal to create a healthy and happy culture, weandrsquo;ve partnered with Headspace, a global leader in mindfulness and meditation! We provide our employees with a free one-year subscription for Headspace.
Work from home office set-up to make sure you have all you need in an ergonomically-friendly manner.
A bike scheme for employees that helps realise a tax advantage which makes a bike up to 35% cheaper than buying!
Our entrepreneurial environment encourages everyone to take initiative and experiment with new ideas. Youandrsquo;ll actively contribute to the growth of the Catawiki platform.
The fun part! Our Activity Committee plans everything from andlsquo;CataFootyandrsquo; to International Food Festivals, Friday Drinks, Board Game Nights, Pub Quizzes and Boot Camps!
And thereandrsquo;s more! Paid holidays, Holiday Allowance, a discount on health insurance and a fantastic pension plan paid for by Catawiki.
_source.description_html:
How we work


At Catawiki, we keep our users close to our hearts and make sure that we deliver a great user experience across all platforms. Android is no exception! As an Android developer working at Catawiki, you are empowered to take full ownership of the features we deliver and full ownership of how we structure our codebase.


We embrace change, we’ve migrated from MVC to MVP and then to MVVM. Currently, we are using Kotlin and enjoying all the cool advantages that come with it. We are constantly improving our architecture, which makes working at Catawiki fun and challenging at the same time.


What you’ll do


Here at Catawiki, you will have a huge impact, working in a data-driven way to add value to the business along with the other 7 members of the Android team. You will add your own expertise to further grow our business, experiment, and innovate the product.


You’ll be adding new features to create an even greater experience for our users. As well as actively collaborating with your fellow Android developers to take the codebase and the entire Android App to the next level. Our millions of users will thank you for that!


How we roll - Our Stack


Our codebase is primarily written in Java but we are strongly adopting Kotlin for our new features and refactorings. Our app uses MVVM as a general architecture, and we rely heavily on the reactive/functional paradigm using RxJava. We also make use of Android’s Architecture Components. We are using the most popular 3rd parties like Dagger 2, Retrofit, data binding, as well as Mockito and Espresso for testing.


What you’ll bring



  • You are a passionate experienced Android Developer with a strong eye for detail.

  • You strive to be a great team player and don’t shy away from new challenges.

  • You are comfortable in a startup environment and are ready to jump in and help if needed.

  • You keep the company's values close to your heart and enjoy being in a diverse environment.


We expect you to have experience with:



  • Strong Object-oriented programming skills - priority

  • Strong knowledge of the Android framework

  • Proficient with Kotlin

  • Knowledge of the reactive/functional paradigm

  • Familiarity with MVVM architecture

  • Familiarity with consuming RESTful APIs

  • Unit testing


Next to this, it’s likely you’ll also have experience with RxJava, UI testing, and A/B testing


Here’s what we can offer you


This is your chance to become part of a fast but sustainable growing tech company! You'll be part of an enthusiastic, highly motivated team of 650+ international Catawikians; you'll have big responsibilities and can really create something. Additionally, you can expect:



  • For people living outside of The Netherlands we offer a great relocation package for you and your family

  • An attractive Stock Option package

  • A diverse and international team with over 50 different nationalities.

  • Catawiki provides you with a membership to the O’Reilly learning platform.

  • As part of Catawiki’s goal to create a healthy and happy culture, we’ve partnered with Headspace, a global leader in mindfulness and meditation! We provide our employees with a free one-year subscription for Headspace.

  • Work from home office set-up to make sure you have all you need in an ergonomically-friendly manner.

  • A bike scheme for employees that helps realise a tax advantage which makes a bike up to 35% cheaper than buying!

  • Our entrepreneurial environment encourages everyone to take initiative and experiment with new ideas. You’ll actively contribute to the growth of the Catawiki platform.

  • The fun part! Our Activity Committee plans everything from ‘CataFooty’ to International Food Festivals, Friday Drinks, Board Game Nights, Pub Quizzes and Boot Camps!

  • And there’s more! Paid holidays, Holiday Allowance, a discount on health insurance and a fantastic pension plan paid for by Catawiki.
_source.position_name: Senior Android Engineer at Catawiki (Amsterdam, Netherlands)

_source.description:
Our Security storyBeing the largest online auction platform for special objects in Europe we strive to provide a secure and trustworthy experience for our customers. Security protects the data of the business through the promotion of security expertise, awareness, and collective oversight.Here's Paul, our Security VPandldquo;I joined Catawiki to share my knowledge and grow the security functions with an exceptional group of people. Iandrsquo;m faced with a unique set of challenges in an ultra modern development environment where there are no traditional infrastructure borders. Building solutions for problems that arenandrsquo;t restricted by slow processes or andldquo;checkboxesandrdquo; are what make this job fun! The culture is relaxed and I have a great time getting to know the various teams that support selling some of the most sought after items on the planet.andrdquo; So whatandrsquo;s the job?Help us find solutions for emerging and evolving threats within the business. Youandrsquo;ll perform threat hunting exercises and use that data to tune our response tooling. Respond to threats from both within our environment and looking in from the outside. Configure Security Monitoring (SIEM) tools to provide more visibility on the Catawiki platform and corporate IT. This role will primarily focus on the strategic objectives within corporate IT, Legal, and the Security teams own objectives.Some of the daily duties include response, enrichment, and tuning of alerts generated from our endpoint systems. Contributions to our security awareness program for new and existing employees through the form of training or workshops. Additionally, report on threats mitigated, perform phishing exercises, and facilitate in closing reported security gaps. Must understand basic web application stacks and be comfortable with a duty rotation rotation with the team.Long term, youandrsquo;ll provide input adjusting security strategy, adapting to emerging threats, and new technology used at Catawiki. Provide workshops and cross-team training to promote security initiatives throughout the organization.Experience with MacOs/Linux/ Cloud environments is preferable.

Hereandrsquo;s what we can offer youThis is your chance to become part of a fast but sustainable growing tech company! You will have an exciting role in a young, fast-growing, dynamic and international organisation. You'll be part of an enthusiastic, highly motivated team of 500+ international Catawikians; you'll have big responsibilities and can really create something. Additionally you can expect:Significant stock options and Relocation package.
Working with a top notch team acting on a champions league level in a super complex dynamic environment; you will learn a lot!
A diverse and international team with over 50 different nationalities.
A great office located in the heart of Amsterdam with an easy-going atmosphere.
Our entrepreneurial environment encourages everyone to take initiative and experiment with new ideas. Youandrsquo;ll actively contribute to the growth of the Catawiki platform.
Tailor-made trainings to facilitate your personal and professional growth
The fun part! Our Activity Committee plans everything from andlsquo;CataFootyandrsquo; to International Food Festivals, Friday Drinks, Board Game Nights, Pub Quizzes and Boot Camps!
And thereandrsquo;s more! Paid holidays, holiday allowance and a fantastic pension plan paid for by Catawiki.
LocationWe are based in Amsterdam and offer a fantastic relocation package. We operate in a hybrid model and have an environment of flexibility and trust.
_source.description_html:
Our Security story


Being the largest online auction platform for special objects in Europe we strive to provide a secure and trustworthy experience for our customers. Security protects the data of the business through the promotion of security expertise, awareness, and collective oversight.


Here's Paul, our Security VP


“I joined Catawiki to share my knowledge and grow the security functions with an exceptional group of people. I’m faced with a unique set of challenges in an ultra modern development environment where there are no traditional infrastructure borders. Building solutions for problems that aren’t restricted by slow processes or “checkboxes” are what make this job fun! The culture is relaxed and I have a great time getting to know the various teams that support selling some of the most sought after items on the planet.”


So what’s the job?


Help us find solutions for emerging and evolving threats within the business. You’ll perform threat hunting exercises and use that data to tune our response tooling. Respond to threats from both within our environment and looking in from the outside. Configure Security Monitoring (SIEM) tools to provide more visibility on the Catawiki platform and corporate IT. This role will primarily focus on the strategic objectives within corporate IT, Legal, and the Security teams own objectives.


Some of the daily duties include response, enrichment, and tuning of alerts generated from our endpoint systems. Contributions to our security awareness program for new and existing employees through the form of training or workshops. Additionally, report on threats mitigated, perform phishing exercises, and facilitate in closing reported security gaps. Must understand basic web application stacks and be comfortable with a duty rotation rotation with the team.


Long term, you’ll provide input adjusting security strategy, adapting to emerging threats, and new technology used at Catawiki. Provide workshops and cross-team training to promote security initiatives throughout the organization.


Experience with MacOs/Linux/ Cloud environments is preferable.


Here’s what we can offer you


This is your chance to become part of a fast but sustainable growing tech company! You will have an exciting role in a young, fast-growing, dynamic & international organisation. You'll be part of an enthusiastic, highly motivated team of 500+ international Catawikians; you'll have big responsibilities and can really create something. Additionally you can expect:



  • Significant stock options and Relocation package.

  • Working with a top notch team acting on a champions league level in a super complex dynamic environment; you will learn a lot!

  • A diverse and international team with over 50 different nationalities.

  • A great office located in the heart of Amsterdam with an easy-going atmosphere.

  • Our entrepreneurial environment encourages everyone to take initiative and experiment with new ideas. You’ll actively contribute to the growth of the Catawiki platform.

  • Tailor-made trainings to facilitate your personal and professional growth

  • The fun part! Our Activity Committee plans everything from ‘CataFooty’ to International Food Festivals, Friday Drinks, Board Game Nights, Pub Quizzes and Boot Camps!

  • And there’s more! Paid holidays, holiday allowance and a fantastic pension plan paid for by Catawiki.


Location


We are based in Amsterdam and offer a fantastic relocation package. We operate in a hybrid model and have an environment of flexibility and trust.
_source.position_name: Threat Response Engineer at Catawiki (Amsterdam, Netherlands)

_source.description:
Java Entwickler (m/w/d)andUuml;berzeugen Sie sich von unserem aktuellen Technologie Stack und dem individuellen Arbeitsumfeld mit umfangreichen Zusatzandshy;leistungen! Wir leisten mit anduuml;ber 620 Mitarbeitern Softwareandshy;entwicklung im B2B-Projektgeschandauml;ft weltweit.Kommen Sie in unser Team und unterstanduuml;tzen Sie uns als Java Entwickler (m/w/d) an den Standorten Nanduuml;rnberg, Frankfurt am Main, Duisburg, Manduuml;nchen oder Berlin.Sie sind hier in einer hochkarandauml;tigen, innovativen Enterprise-Umgebung mit sehr erfahrenen Kollegen tandauml;tig und entwerfen, realisieren, testen und mitverantworten komplexe Anwendungen sowie alle damit verbundenen Prozess-Komponenten.Wenn Sie ein agiles Mindset sowie Spaandszlig; an agiler Softwareandshy;entwicklung mitbringen und gleichzeitig Freude daran haben Ihr Wissen mit anderen im Team zu teilen, passen Sie exzellent zu unseren Teams bei der ISO-Gruppe.Ihre AufgabenSoftwareentwicklungstandauml;tigkeiten in crossfunktionalen Teams in den Bereichen Touristik oder Public Services
weiterentwickeln und implementieren hochverfanduuml;gbarer Java/JEE-Anwendungen sowie pflegen und erweitern bestehender Systeme
fachliche Beratung von Kunden hinsichtlich Anforderungskonzeption, technischer Problemstellungen und Softwareumsetzung
entwickeln eigener Ideen in internen Projekten der ISO-Gruppe
Unterstanduuml;tzung bei der kontinuierlichen Verbesserung von agilen Entwicklungsprozessen und unseres modernen Technologie-Stacks
Ihr Profilabgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung mit relevanter Berufserfahrung
Berufserfahrung in der Anwendungsentwicklung im Java/JEE Umfeld (Spring, Akka, Eclipse, SQL, Hibernate, Spring Boot)
gute Backend-Kenntnisse mit REST, JSON, Spring, SOAP, JPA (Hibernate oder EclipseLink)
idealerweise Frontend-Erfahrung mit TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, HTML and Angular
vorteilhaft sind Erfahrungen mit einschlandauml;gigen Werkzeugen wie Eclipse, IntelliJ, JUnit, Rancher, Docker, Jenkins, Maven, Git, SVN, Maven oder Hudson etc.
sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse
Unser Angebotunbefristete Anstellung in einem familiengefanduuml;hrten Unternehmen mit flachen Hierarchien
durch flexible Arbeitszeiten schaffen Sie es, Privates und Berufliches zu vereinbaren
in Zeiten der Pandemie fandauml;llt ein Jobwechsel nicht leicht. Wir bieten ein umfassendes Onboarding, auch remote, FFP2-Masken und regelmandauml;andszlig;ige Covid-19-Tests an. Fanduuml;r alle, die nicht im Homeoffice arbeiten kandouml;nnen, richten wir sichere Arbeitsplandauml;tze in unseren Banduuml;ros ein. So gelingt der Einstieg ins Team, auch in der aktuellen Zeit.
umfassende Weiterbildungsmandouml;glichkeiten fanduuml;r Ihre berufliche Entwicklung wie z. B. Fachkonferenzen, Workshops, BarCamps
spandauml;tere Wechselmandouml;glichkeiten zu anderen Geschandauml;ftsbereichen innerhalb der ISO-Gruppe sin mandouml;glich (z. B. Flugsicherung, Automatisierungs-, Medizintechnik, Mobile Solutions, SAP, Datenqualitandauml;t)
Bringen Sie Ihre Expertise, Ideen und Impulse in die ISO-Gruppe ein und bewerben Sie sich mit einem aussagekrandauml;ftigen Portfolio und unter Angabe Ihrer Kanduuml;ndigungsfrist sowie Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellung.
_source.description_html:
Java Entwickler (m/w/d)



Überzeugen Sie sich von unserem aktuellen Technologie Stack und dem individuellen Arbeitsumfeld mit umfangreichen Zusatz­leistungen! Wir leisten mit über 620 Mitarbeitern Software­entwicklung im B2B-Projektgeschäft weltweit.


Kommen Sie in unser Team und unterstützen Sie uns als Java Entwickler (m/w/d) an den Standorten Nürnberg, Frankfurt am Main, Duisburg, München oder Berlin.


Sie sind hier in einer hochkarätigen, innovativen Enterprise-Umgebung mit sehr erfahrenen Kollegen tätig und entwerfen, realisieren, testen und mitverantworten komplexe Anwendungen sowie alle damit verbundenen Prozess-Komponenten.


Wenn Sie ein agiles Mindset sowie Spaß an agiler Software­entwicklung mitbringen und gleichzeitig Freude daran haben Ihr Wissen mit anderen im Team zu teilen, passen Sie exzellent zu unseren Teams bei der ISO-Gruppe.




Ihre Aufgaben



  • Softwareentwicklungstätigkeiten in crossfunktionalen Teams in den Bereichen Touristik oder Public Services

  • weiterentwickeln und implementieren hochverfügbarer Java/JEE-Anwendungen sowie pflegen und erweitern bestehender Systeme

  • fachliche Beratung von Kunden hinsichtlich Anforderungskonzeption, technischer Problemstellungen und Softwareumsetzung

  • entwickeln eigener Ideen in internen Projekten der ISO-Gruppe

  • Unterstützung bei der kontinuierlichen Verbesserung von agilen Entwicklungsprozessen und unseres modernen Technologie-Stacks




Ihr Profil



  • abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung mit relevanter Berufserfahrung

  • Berufserfahrung in der Anwendungsentwicklung im Java/JEE Umfeld (Spring, Akka, Eclipse, SQL, Hibernate, Spring Boot)

  • gute Backend-Kenntnisse mit REST, JSON, Spring, SOAP, JPA (Hibernate oder EclipseLink)

  • idealerweise Frontend-Erfahrung mit TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, HTML & Angular

  • vorteilhaft sind Erfahrungen mit einschlägigen Werkzeugen wie Eclipse, IntelliJ, JUnit, Rancher, Docker, Jenkins, Maven, Git, SVN, Maven oder Hudson etc.

  • sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse




Unser Angebot



  • unbefristete Anstellung in einem familiengeführten Unternehmen mit flachen Hierarchien

  • durch flexible Arbeitszeiten schaffen Sie es, Privates und Berufliches zu vereinbaren

  • in Zeiten der Pandemie fällt ein Jobwechsel nicht leicht. Wir bieten ein umfassendes Onboarding, auch remote, FFP2-Masken und regelmäßige Covid-19-Tests an. Für alle, die nicht im Homeoffice arbeiten können, richten wir sichere Arbeitsplätze in unseren Büros ein. So gelingt der Einstieg ins Team, auch in der aktuellen Zeit.

  • umfassende Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten für Ihre berufliche Entwicklung wie z. B. Fachkonferenzen, Workshops, BarCamps

  • spätere Wechselmöglichkeiten zu anderen Geschäftsbereichen innerhalb der ISO-Gruppe sin möglich (z. B. Flugsicherung, Automatisierungs-, Medizintechnik, Mobile Solutions, SAP, Datenqualität)




Bringen Sie Ihre Expertise, Ideen und Impulse in die ISO-Gruppe ein und bewerben Sie sich mit einem aussagekräftigen Portfolio und unter Angabe Ihrer Kündigungsfrist sowie Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellung.

_source.description_html:
C++ Softwareentwickler (m/w/d)



Wir meistern weltweit herausfordernde Software­projekte mit zukunftsweisenden Technologien. Im Verbund der ISO-Gruppe liefern wir markt- und branchenspezifische B2B-Software. Bei uns gleicht kein Projekt dem anderen. Das heißt für Sie: Sie lernen täglich dazu und machen stets neue Erfahrungen.


Machen Sie mit uns Theorie zur Praxis und werden Sie Teil der digitalen Zukunft. Formen Sie Konzepte wie das Internet of Things zu greifbaren Produkten und Services. Wir entwickeln Software­komponenten für alle Architekturschichten der Windows-Desktop-Applikation für die Automatisierungstechnik in einem internationalen Großprojekt. Dazu suchen wir C++ Software­entwickler (m/w/d) zur Verstärkung unserer Teams und verschiedenen Projekten an den Standorten Nürnberg und Karlsruhe.




Ihre Aufgabe



  • zukünftige Generationen von Automatisierungslösungen mit modernsten Technologien nutzen sowie Standards entwerfen und realisieren

  • eigenständiges konzipieren und entwickeln neuer Ideen, Features oder ganzer Prozesse in C++

  • kommunizieren der Anforderungen mit Kunden und Kollegen

  • Aufbau und Umgang mit Continuous Integration/Delivery

  • arbeiten in einem agilen Umfeld mit hohen Qualitätsstandards (Scrum, Design-Patterns, Clean Code, Test Driven Development)




Ihr Profil



  • abgeschlossenes technisches Studium oder Ausbildung zum Fachinformatiker

  • gute Kenntnisse und erste Berufserfahrung in C++ Entwicklung (Standard 11 oder höher) und CMake

  • Kenntnisse in Visual Studio, Qt und SCADA sowie von Web-Technologien (Javascript, TypeScript, Node.js, HTML5, CSS) sind von Vorteil

  • ein agiles Mindset und Spaß an Softwareentwicklung im Team

  • gute Deutsch- & Englischkenntnisse




Unser Angebot



  • unbefristete Anstellung in einem familiengeführten Unternehmen mit flachen Hierarchien

  • umfassende Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten für Ihre berufliche Entwicklung wie z. B. Fachkonferenzen, Workshops, BarCamps

  • vielfältige innovative Themen sowie der Einsatz neuester Werkzeuge und Methoden machen die ISO-Gruppe abwechslungsreich, krisenfest und zukunftsfähig

  • profitieren Sie von unserem breit aufgestellten Arbeitsumfeld, unter anderem in der Medizintechnik, Öffentlichen Verwaltung, Touristik oder Luftfahrt




Bringen Sie Ihre Expertise, neue Ideen und Impulse in die ISO-Gruppe ein und bewerben Sie sich mit Ihren aussagekräftigen Unterlagen inkl. Angabe Ihrer Kündigungsfrist sowie Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellung.

_source.description_html:
The role


Zattoo is searching for a highly motivated Android Developer (f/m/x) with a proven track record in delivering Android applications to join our world class team. Zattoo’s mobile apps for Android are installed on millions of devices. We were among the first to bring Live and Catch Up TV to these platforms without requiring additional hardware. In addition to mobile, we put a strong focus on Android based big screen platforms such as Android TV and Amazon Fire TV and cooperate with different OEMs to build Launcher applications for Android based STBs.


We’re looking for someone who wants to push the boundaries of what’s possible on these platforms. You will find Zattoo to be a comfortable place to work with pragmatic decision making, fast approval paths and willingness to take risks. Most importantly, you’ll be surrounded by colleagues who’ll share your commitment to developing and selling world class products.



What you’ll do



  • Develop and maintain our Native Android applications that have more than a million active installations

  • Collaborate with developers, designers and product managers to conceptualize, build, test and release applications

  • Write high quality code with clean architecture and use common design patterns

  • Translate high level requirements around functionality into elegant functional solutions

  • Implement compelling device specific user interfaces and optimize performance for the applications



What you’ll bring



  • 4+ years of experience in Android application development with very good knowledge of the Android build system and application framework

  • High proficiency with Kotlin and Java

  • Write clean and testable code

  • Experience with RxJava and Kotlin Coroutines

  • Experience with dependency injection on Android

  • Have one or more successful Android applications published in Google Play store

  • Comfortable in working with remote colleagues, multidisciplinary teams and external partners

  • Fluent verbal and written English language skills

  • Bonus: Experience with


    • TV app development (Android TV and/or Fire TV, Cast API) or adaptive video streaming on Android

    • system-level features like global keys, OTA processes and private app permissions

    • Automated testing on Android (Unit Testing, Acceptance/UI Testing) and CI systems

    • Experience with multi-module app architecture




What's in it for you?



  • Reward: strong market competitive salary

  • Recharge: 30 days vacation plus public holidays

  • Regulate: trust based flexible working hours and the option for remote working 8 weeks per year



  • Plus:


    • We’re sharing: Free access to the best streaming experience on the market

    • We’re developing: your own development budget, German classes and Zattoo all-company hack days

    • We’re inclusive: ‘Zattooies’ are a fun, engaged, and diverse team made up of 40 nationalities

    • We’re healthy: yoga classes, health checks, team sports, organic fruit, vegan options and more!

    • We’re responsible: we are carbon neutral, an active employee Green team, discounted BVG tickets and free bike rentals

    • We’re sociable: a calendar of events with fireside chats, lunches, in-house bar, BBQ’s, monthly socials, summer party and an annual off-site event



We are Zattoo


Zattoo enables our users to view indiscriminately and we reflect that in our team too. Regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, disability or any other characteristic protected by law we encourage everyone to apply and will give everyone equal consideration. We are an equal opportunities employer, join us and help build a diverse team dedicated to revolutionising the way you watch TV.


You can learn more about us at: https://zattoo.com

_source.description_html:
The role


Zattoo is searching for a highly motivated Android Engineer (f/m/x) with a proven track record in delivering Android applications to join our Android TV for Operators team (ATVfO). Zattoo’s ATVfO development team builds apps beyond the usual mobile or TV experience. We deliver applications to a vast range of Connected TV devices. Some of their focal points are:



  • Performance which matters. Our apps run smoothly on every dedicated device.

  • Non-trivial user interactions. We are building UIs which could be controlled via remote control, connected smartphones or voice interaction.

  • Complex business logic. We deploy apps to different B2B customers, which results in a different feature set, different UI with dynamic or runtime branding, different language and different business rules.



Zattoo’s apps are installed on millions of devices. We were among the first to bring Live and Catch Up TV without requiring additional hardware and we put a strong focus on big screen platforms such as Android TV and Amazon Fire TV. We cooperate directly with different OEMs to build Launcher applications for Android based Set-top boxes, and dedicated Google and Amazon teams to deliver deeply integrated features on the respective platforms.


We’re looking for someone who wants to push the boundaries of what’s possible on these platforms and get a unique experience in developing applications for connected TV devices. Solving the challenges of Non-trivial user interactions, performance constraints and complex business logic. You will find Zattoo to be a comfortable place to work with pragmatic decision making, fast approval paths and willingness to take risks. Most importantly, you’ll be surrounded by colleagues who’ll share your commitment to developing and selling world class products.


What you’ll do



  • Develop and maintain our Native Android TV launcher applications for Set-top boxes.

  • Collaborate with device OEMs to incorporate custom built APIs

  • Write high quality code with clean architecture and use common design patterns

  • Work on unique features such as Local recordings, HbbTV and runtime rebranding.

  • Collaborate with developers, designers and product managers to conceptualize, build, test and release applications

  • Translate high level requirements around functionality into elegant functional solutions

  • Implement compelling device specific user interfaces and optimize performance of the applications


What you’ll bring



  • 4+ years of experience in Android application development with very good knowledge of the Android build system and application framework

  • High proficiency with Kotlin and Java

  • Write clean and testable code

  • Experience with RxJava and Kotlin Coroutines

  • Experience with dependency injection on Android

  • Have one or more successful Android applications published in Google Play store

  • Comfortable in working with remote colleagues, multidisciplinary teams and external partners

  • Fluent verbal and written English language skills

  • Bonus: Experience with


    • TV app development (Android TV and/or Fire TV, Cast API) or adaptive video streaming on Android

    • System-level features like global keys, OTA processes and private app permissions

    • Automated testing on Android (Unit Testing, Acceptance/UI Testing) and CI systems

    • Experience with multi-module app architecture



What's in it for you?



  • Reward: strong market competitive salary

  • Recharge: 30 days vacation plus public holidays

  • Regulate: trust based flexible working hours and the option for remote working 8 weeks per year



  • Plus:


    • We’re sharing: Free access to the best streaming experience on the market

    • We’re developing: your own development budget, German classes and Zattoo all-company hack days

    • We’re inclusive: ‘Zattooies’ are a fun, engaged, and diverse team made up of 40 nationalities

    • We’re healthy: yoga classes, health checks, team sports, organic fruit, vegan options and more!

    • We’re responsible: we are carbon neutral, an active employee Green team, discounted BVG tickets and free bike rentals

    • We’re sociable: a calendar of events with fireside chats, lunches, in-house bar, BBQ’s, monthly socials, summer party and an annual off-site event



We are Zattoo


Zattoo enables our users to view indiscriminately and we reflect that in our team too. Regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, disability or any other characteristic protected by law we encourage everyone to apply and will give everyone equal consideration. We are an equal opportunities employer, join us and help build a diverse team dedicated to revolutionizing the way you watch TV.


You can learn more about us at: https://zattoo.com

_source.description:
Tekninen konsultti (Microsoft pilviteknologiat)

Hei tulevaisuuden arkkitehtilupaus! Tule meille Tekniseksi konsultiksi rakentamaan itsesi nandauml;kandouml;istandauml; uraa arkkitehtuurin parissa.

Teknisenandauml; konsulttina tyandouml;si on monipuolista ja pandauml;ivittandauml;isessandauml; tyandouml;ssandauml;si tulet muun muassa konsultoimaan asiakkaita kokonaisarkkitehtuurin suunnitteluun liittyen sekandauml; toimimaan nykyisten asiakkaidemme ongelmanratkaisun ytimessandauml;. Esimerkkinandauml; tiimimme aikaisemmasta projektista tandauml;andauml;ltandauml;.

Tyandouml;nkuvasi koostuu mm. seuraavista elementeistandauml;:

andbull; Tyandouml;nkuvaasi kuuluvat erityisesti Microsoft pilviympandauml;ristandouml;jen hallinta ja yllandauml;pito, ympandauml;ristandouml;jen ja sovellusten kandauml;yttandouml;andouml;notto, koodijulkaisut ja versiopandauml;ivitykset sekandauml; tietokantakopioinnit.
andbull; Erinandauml;isten teknisten ongelmien ratkaiseminen on yksi tandauml;rkeimmistandauml; alueistasi
andbull; Osallistut asiakkaan tyandouml;pajoihin, joissa analysoit ja suunnittelet teknisiandauml; ratkaisuja
andbull; Tuet sovellustiimiandauml; liiketoimintaprosessien mandauml;andauml;rittelyjen teknisissandauml; osuuksissa ja varmistat, ettandauml; toiminnalliset ja tekniset vaatimukset kohtaavat ja tulevat mandauml;andauml;ritellyksi selkeandauml;sti, mutta tarkasti.
andbull; Suunnittelet ja dokumentoit jandauml;rjestelmien arkkitehtuurikokonaisuuksia ja dokumentoit ympandauml;ristandouml;kuvakset ja tekniset yksityiskohdat.
andbull; Integraatioiden suunnittelu, mahdollistaminen ja yllandauml;pito ovat myandouml;s osa tyandouml;tandauml;si.

Tyandouml;tandauml; on mahdollista tehdandauml; kaikista CGI Suomen toimipisteistandauml; kandauml;sin. Ja vaikka tyandouml; onkin iso osa elandauml;mandauml;andauml;, haluamme ettandauml; tyandouml;si ja vapaa-aikasi pysyvandauml;t tasapainossa. Tyandouml;skentelemme hybridisti yhdistandauml;en etandauml;ilyn ja toimistotyandouml;n parhaat puolet, ja mikandauml;li tandauml;ysi etandauml;tyandouml; sopii paremmin arkeesi, on tandauml;mandauml;kin mahdollista.

Tiimi, johon tulet

Tiimimme vastuulla on laadukkaiden Dynamics 365 ratkaisuiden tarjoaminen, toteuttaminen ja yllandauml;pito asiakkaillemme ja tiimistandauml;mme landouml;ytyy niin teknisiandauml; konsultteja, arkkitehteja kuin devaajia. Tiimimme toimii horisontaalisti landauml;pi CGI:n toimialakentandauml;n, mikandauml; mahdollistaa toimialariippumattoman tyandouml;skentelet Microsoft pilviteknologioiden huippuosaajana. Pandauml;andauml;set mukaan mielenkiintoisiin asiakastoimituksiimme vaativiin ja kansainvandauml;lisiin ratkaisuihin.

Kanssamme pandauml;andauml;set sukeltamaan mukaan etualan projekteihin Dynamics pilvimaailmassa ja osaksi Suomen taitavinta Dynamics osaajien joukkoa. Tiimiandauml;mme yhdistandauml;andauml; kunnianhimoinen ote ja kiinnostus tekniikkaa kohtaan sekandauml; halu onnistua yhdessandauml; asiakkaiden kanssa.

Onnistumisesi edellytykset

Toivomme tulevan tiimikaverimme olevan teknisesti orientoitunut osaaja, jolta landouml;ytyisi intoa kehittyandauml; kohti arkkitehdin tehtandauml;viandauml;. Kaikkea sinun ei tarvitse osata, vaan tuemme sinua kehitysaskelissasi kohti vastuullisempia tehtandauml;viandauml;.

Onnistuaksesi tulevassa tehtandauml;vandauml;ssandauml;si toivomme sinulta kokonaisuuksien hahmottamista sekandauml; hyvandauml;andauml; ongelmanratkaisukykyandauml;. Ymmandauml;rryksesi pilviteknologioiden toiminnasta ja aiempi kokemuksesi etenkin Azuren ja DevOpsin parista on toivottavaa. Myandouml;s SQL (dbadmin-taso) osaamisesi katsotaan isoksi eduksesi. Varsinainen devaaja sinun ei tarvitse olla (vaikkemme toki pistandauml; tandauml;tandauml; pahaksemme), mutta tandauml;rkeandauml;andauml; kuitenkin on, ettandauml; kykenet lukemaan koodia ja kandauml;yttandauml;mandauml;andauml;n tandauml;tandauml; tietoa hyvandauml;ksi.

Meillandauml; CGI:llandauml;andhellip;

andhellip; olet member.
Tarjoamme sinulle paitsi tyandouml;n, jossa voit kehittyandauml; haluamaasi suuntaan, myandouml;s mahdollisuuden omistaa yhtiandouml;n osakkeita. Koska yli 80 prosenttia henkilandouml;standouml;standauml;mme on myandouml;s omistajia, kutsumme henkilandouml;standouml;andauml;mme membereiksi. Membereinandauml; pandauml;andauml;semme nauttimaan CGI:n taloudellisesta menestyksestandauml; ja rakentamaan toiveidemme mukaista yhtiandouml;tandauml;.

andhellip; saat olla sellainen kuin olet.
Meitandauml; on 3 700 ympandauml;ri Suomen ja meille on tandauml;rkeandauml;andauml;, ettandauml; jokainen meistandauml; saa olla tyandouml;paikalla oma itsensandauml;. Monimuotoiset tiimimme mandauml;andauml;rittelevandauml;t itse, millaiset joustavat tyandouml;nteon tavat niille parhaiten sopivat. Meillandauml; tyandouml; myandouml;s joustaa, kun elandauml;mandauml;ntilanne sitandauml; vaatii.

andhellip; sinusta pidetandauml;andauml;n huolta.
Meille CGI:n membereille on tandauml;rkeandauml;andauml;, ettandauml; tuemme ja autamme aina toisiamme. Et ole koskaan yksin: tuhansista membereistandauml;mme landouml;ytyy aina joku, johon tukeutua. Ja tarjoamme tietysti myandouml;s laajan valikoiman henkilandouml;standouml;etuja, jotka auttavat sinua voimaan paremmin.

andhellip; innostut tyandouml;standauml;si andndash; yhandauml; uudelleen.
Meillandauml; viihdytandauml;andauml;n pitkandauml;andauml;n, koska kokoisessamme talossa on tarjolla aina uusia uramahdollisuuksia ja niihin siirtyminen on tehty helpoksi. Kun kaipaat vaihtelua, voit ottaa haltuun uuden teknologian, toimialan tai asiakkuuden andndash; ja kun kaipaat tyandouml;ltandauml; joustoa uudessa elandauml;mandauml;ntilanteessa, sekin jandauml;rjestyy. Tule meille rakentamaan itsesi nandauml;kandouml;inen ura!

Kiinnostuitko?

Ja mikandauml;li mikandauml; tahansa jandauml;i mietityttandauml;mandauml;andauml;n, antaa tuleva kollegasi Jenni Taikamandauml;ki mielellandauml;andauml;n lisandauml;tietoa tehtandauml;vandauml;standauml; ja tiimistandauml;andauml;n. _source.description_html:
Tekninen konsultti (Microsoft pilviteknologiat)

Hei tulevaisuuden arkkitehtilupaus! Tule meille Tekniseksi konsultiksi rakentamaan itsesi näköistä uraa arkkitehtuurin parissa.

Teknisenä konsulttina työsi on monipuolista ja päivittäisessä työssäsi tulet muun muassa konsultoimaan asiakkaita kokonaisarkkitehtuurin suunnitteluun liittyen sekä toimimaan nykyisten asiakkaidemme ongelmanratkaisun ytimessä. Esimerkkinä tiimimme aikaisemmasta projektista täältä.

Työnkuvasi koostuu mm. seuraavista elementeistä:

• Työnkuvaasi kuuluvat erityisesti Microsoft pilviympäristöjen hallinta ja ylläpito, ympäristöjen ja sovellusten käyttöönotto, koodijulkaisut ja versiopäivitykset sekä tietokantakopioinnit.
• Erinäisten teknisten ongelmien ratkaiseminen on yksi tärkeimmistä alueistasi
• Osallistut asiakkaan työpajoihin, joissa analysoit ja suunnittelet teknisiä ratkaisuja
• Tuet sovellustiimiä liiketoimintaprosessien määrittelyjen teknisissä osuuksissa ja varmistat, että toiminnalliset ja tekniset vaatimukset kohtaavat ja tulevat määritellyksi selkeästi, mutta tarkasti.
• Suunnittelet ja dokumentoit järjestelmien arkkitehtuurikokonaisuuksia ja dokumentoit ympäristökuvakset ja tekniset yksityiskohdat.
• Integraatioiden suunnittelu, mahdollistaminen ja ylläpito ovat myös osa työtäsi.

Työtä on mahdollista tehdä kaikista CGI Suomen toimipisteistä käsin. Ja vaikka työ onkin iso osa elämää, haluamme että työsi ja vapaa-aikasi pysyvät tasapainossa. Työskentelemme hybridisti yhdistäen etäilyn ja toimistotyön parhaat puolet, ja mikäli täysi etätyö sopii paremmin arkeesi, on tämäkin mahdollista.


Tiimi, johon tulet

Tiimimme vastuulla on laadukkaiden Dynamics 365 ratkaisuiden tarjoaminen, toteuttaminen ja ylläpito asiakkaillemme ja tiimistämme löytyy niin teknisiä konsultteja, arkkitehteja kuin devaajia. Tiimimme toimii horisontaalisti läpi CGI:n toimialakentän, mikä mahdollistaa toimialariippumattoman työskentelet Microsoft pilviteknologioiden huippuosaajana. Pääset mukaan mielenkiintoisiin asiakastoimituksiimme vaativiin ja kansainvälisiin ratkaisuihin.

Kanssamme pääset sukeltamaan mukaan etualan projekteihin Dynamics pilvimaailmassa ja osaksi Suomen taitavinta Dynamics osaajien joukkoa. Tiimiämme yhdistää kunnianhimoinen ote ja kiinnostus tekniikkaa kohtaan sekä halu onnistua yhdessä asiakkaiden kanssa.


Onnistumisesi edellytykset

Toivomme tulevan tiimikaverimme olevan teknisesti orientoitunut osaaja, jolta löytyisi intoa kehittyä kohti arkkitehdin tehtäviä. Kaikkea sinun ei tarvitse osata, vaan tuemme sinua kehitysaskelissasi kohti vastuullisempia tehtäviä.

Onnistuaksesi tulevassa tehtävässäsi toivomme sinulta kokonaisuuksien hahmottamista sekä hyvää ongelmanratkaisukykyä. Ymmärryksesi pilviteknologioiden toiminnasta ja aiempi kokemuksesi etenkin Azuren ja DevOpsin parista on toivottavaa. Myös SQL (dbadmin-taso) osaamisesi katsotaan isoksi eduksesi. Varsinainen devaaja sinun ei tarvitse olla (vaikkemme toki pistä tätä pahaksemme), mutta tärkeää kuitenkin on, että kykenet lukemaan koodia ja käyttämään tätä tietoa hyväksi.

Ennen kaikkea arvostamme oppimishaluista asennettasi, erinomaisia ongelmanratkaisutaitojasi sekä kykyäsi hallita kokonaisuuksia. Vuorovaikutustaitoisena henkilönä kommunikoit sujuvasti sekä suomeksi että englanniksi.


Meillä CGI:llä…

… olet member.
Tarjoamme sinulle paitsi työn, jossa voit kehittyä haluamaasi suuntaan, myös mahdollisuuden omistaa yhtiön osakkeita. Koska yli 80 prosenttia henkilöstöstämme on myös omistajia, kutsumme henkilöstöämme membereiksi. Membereinä pääsemme nauttimaan CGI:n taloudellisesta menestyksestä ja rakentamaan toiveidemme mukaista yhtiötä.

… saat olla sellainen kuin olet.
Meitä on 3 700 ympäri Suomen ja meille on tärkeää, että jokainen meistä saa olla työpaikalla oma itsensä. Monimuotoiset tiimimme määrittelevät itse, millaiset joustavat työnteon tavat niille parhaiten sopivat. Meillä työ myös joustaa, kun elämäntilanne sitä vaatii.

… sinusta pidetään huolta.
Meille CGI:n membereille on tärkeää, että tuemme ja autamme aina toisiamme. Et ole koskaan yksin: tuhansista membereistämme löytyy aina joku, johon tukeutua. Ja tarjoamme tietysti myös laajan valikoiman henkilöstöetuja, jotka auttavat sinua voimaan paremmin.

… innostut työstäsi – yhä uudelleen.
Meillä viihdytään pitkään, koska kokoisessamme talossa on tarjolla aina uusia uramahdollisuuksia ja niihin siirtyminen on tehty helpoksi. Kun kaipaat vaihtelua, voit ottaa haltuun uuden teknologian, toimialan tai asiakkuuden – ja kun kaipaat työltä joustoa uudessa elämäntilanteessa, sekin järjestyy. Tule meille rakentamaan itsesi näköinen ura!


Kiinnostuitko?

Hienoa, seuraavaksi kuulisimme mielellämme lisää sinusta! Ja mikäli mikä tahansa jäi mietityttämään, antaa tuleva kollegasi Jenni Taikamäki mielellään lisätietoa tehtävästä ja tiimistään. Jennin tavoitat puhelimitse numerosta 040 7527 090.

Pääset hakemaan tehtävää rekrytointijärjestelmämme kautta osoitteessa https://www.cgi.com/fi/fi/ura klikkaamalla tehtävänkuvauksen alalaidassa olevaa painiketta "I'm Interested".

Viimeinen hakupäivä on 28.02.2022. Haethan kuitenkin mahdollisimman pian, sillä käymme hakemuksia läpi jo hakuaikana ja etenemme rekrytointiprosessissa heti sopivan kandidaatin löydyttyä.

Perusmuotoinen turvallisuusselvitys tullaan tekemään tehtävän niin vaatiessa.
_source.position_name: Tekninen konsultti (Microsoft pilviteknologiat) at CGI Suomi (Helsinki, Finland)

_source.description:
THE POSITIONBoehringer Ingelheim is one of the world's leading pharmaceutical companies. We constantly improve and expand our SMART platform. 
SMART is an intuitive, AI enhanced home base for advanced models which helps to analyze and improve complex bioprocesses. This laboratory digitalization will enable Boehringer Ingelheim to leverage data effectively, to improve the drug development process which leads to higher quality and increased efficiency.Tasks and responsibilitiesDesign and development of the business logic and backend services for full-scale applications
Implement the UI and its business logic according to UX Designer and Product Owner specifications
Development of high-quality code based on defined user stories, including unit/integration tests and code documentation of suitable quality for the product increments in rapid iterations
Support, maintenance and optimization of our development and production system environments including the continuous delivery pipeline
Applying agile methodologies, the Full Stack Developer is an integral part of the product development team and works closely with the product owner to deliver a fully functioning and scalable application
RequirementsBachelorandrsquo;s degree in computer science or comparable education with 3-5 years of experience, as well as first practice of intense collaboration in an agile software development team
Expertise in state-of the art programming languages (TypeScript, JavaScript/ES6, Python is a plus) and backend technologies
Knowhow in modern libraries/frameworks, APIs, database technologies and query languages; Full-Stack experience preferred (Node.js, GraphQL, Angular, RxJS, PostgreSQL) 
Experience in continuous development and deployment tools as well as container platforms and management systems (Git) and taking adequate measures to ensure code quality
English working proficiency and communications skills (verbal and written) with a personality to be self-directed and contribute proactively
Your BenefitsPosition specific training opportunities for your personal and professional growth
Comprehensive health promotion, sustaining your health in the best possible way
Additional off-days (bridge-days) for more leisure time
Company pension scheme, because your future matters
Staff restaurant with a variety of lunch options for your daily well-being
We offer an attractive salary package in line with your qualification, experience and individual competencies. The base pay is composed of a market oriented excess payment and the respective amount according to the Austrian collective agreement (at least andeuro; 50,000 gross per year/full-time).

THE POSITION

Boehringer Ingelheim is one of the world's leading pharmaceutical companies. We constantly improve and expand our SMART platform.
SMART is an intuitive, AI enhanced home base for advanced models which helps to analyze and improve complex bioprocesses. This laboratory digitalization will enable Boehringer Ingelheim to leverage data effectively, to improve the drug development process which leads to higher quality and increased efficiency.



Tasks & responsibilities

  • Design and development of the business logic and backend services for full-scale applications

  • Implement the UI and its business logic according to UX Designer and Product Owner specifications

  • Development of high-quality code based on defined user stories, including unit/integration tests and code documentation of suitable quality for the product increments in rapid iterations

  • Support, maintenance and optimization of our development and production system environments including the continuous delivery pipeline

  • Applying agile methodologies, the Full Stack Developer is an integral part of the product development team and works closely with the product owner to deliver a fully functioning and scalable application



Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or comparable education with 3-5 years of experience, as well as first practice of intense collaboration in an agile software development team

  • Expertise in state-of the art programming languages (TypeScript, JavaScript/ES6, Python is a plus) and backend technologies

  • Knowhow in modern libraries/frameworks, APIs, database technologies and query languages; Full-Stack experience preferred (Node.js, GraphQL, Angular, RxJS, PostgreSQL)

  • Experience in continuous development and deployment tools as well as container platforms and management systems (Git) and taking adequate measures to ensure code quality

  • English working proficiency and communications skills (verbal and written) with a personality to be self-directed and contribute proactively



Your Benefits

  • Position specific training opportunities for your personal and professional growth

  • Comprehensive health promotion, sustaining your health in the best possible way

  • Additional off-days (bridge-days) for more leisure time

  • Company pension scheme, because your future matters

  • Staff restaurant with a variety of lunch options for your daily well-being



We offer an attractive salary package in line with your qualification, experience and individual competencies. The base pay is composed of a market oriented excess payment and the respective amount according to the Austrian collective agreement (at least € 50,000 gross per year/full-time).

_source.description:
Want to be a Hero? - Join one of the leading global online food ordering and delivery platforms!We are looking for a Senior Engineering Manager (f/m/d) to join our international team. The department is part of the Developer Platform tribe, with the mission to increase the leverage of Delivery Heroandrsquo;s engineering organisations by reducing complexity through streamlined, opinionated, and supported ways to build and run software, ensuring security, reliability, cost-efficiency, and productivity across the whole group. Site Reliability aims to reduce the impact of incidents, both commercially as well as on customer satisfaction, by reducing their occurrence and duration across all production systems at Delivery Hero. To achieve this, the department will work on operational tooling, mitigation, and postmortem processes for incident handling, as well as on preemptive measures like game days and stress tests to find problems and harden systems before reliability issues occur. Advocating best practices to improve system reliability as well as providing pre-instrumented hardened application blueprints will help engineers across the group to build a new generation of resilient applications.
The Senior Engineering manager Site Reliability will be expected to be an engaged thought leader in this field, a coach to his teams, and a partner for his peers and stakeholders.
 Your Mission:As a result of our fast growth and acquisitions, Delivery Hero is now home to over 4000 engineers who build and operate multiple large-scale consumer-facing platforms. Availability of our services and protecting and defending them is key to successfully achieving our vision of always delivering an amazing experience - Fast, easy, and to your door.Your job will be to scale up your team from scratch, define a product roadmap together with your product manager, deliver on the roadmap by building the product features on time, ensure stable operations, and drive adoption across the Delivery Hero group through quality and convenience instead of mandate. Your customers are thousands of software engineers distributed worldwide, from Buenos Aires, to Berlin, Istanbul, Dubai, Singapore, and Seoul. Your primary stakeholders are engineering leaders across the organization. You will work closely together with the Developer Productivity department to integrate your tools and products into the overall developer experience, as well as the Infrastructure teams. Your Northstar-KPI is the order loss ratio, with MTTR and change failure rate as key drivers. Your success is measured by how much you improved those KPIs across the whole group.Your Heroic Skills:You have led cross-functional teams for at least 3 years.
You have experience in building internal developer-facing tools and services.
You know how to Identify and propose opportunities to improve reliability, efficiency and scalability
You have solid cloud experience, preferably with AWS, Docker, and infrastructure-as-code (e.g. Terraform)
You can take architectural decisions, contribute to the task prioritization, spearhead the documentation and learnings from incidents
You foster a collaborative, inclusive and diverse team environment
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

 Nice to have:You have scaled a team from zero to high-performing from scratch. 
Good influencer, as you will need to convince engineering leaders to adopt your services.
_source.description_html:
Want to be a Hero? - Join one of the leading global online food ordering and delivery platforms!



We are looking for a Senior Engineering Manager (f/m/d) to join our international team. The department is part of the Developer Platform tribe, with the mission to increase the leverage of Delivery Hero’s engineering organisations by reducing complexity through streamlined, opinionated, and supported ways to build and run software, ensuring security, reliability, cost-efficiency, and productivity across the whole group. Site Reliability aims to reduce the impact of incidents, both commercially as well as on customer satisfaction, by reducing their occurrence and duration across all production systems at Delivery Hero. To achieve this, the department will work on operational tooling, mitigation, and postmortem processes for incident handling, as well as on preemptive measures like game days and stress tests to find problems and harden systems before reliability issues occur. Advocating best practices to improve system reliability as well as providing pre-instrumented hardened application blueprints will help engineers across the group to build a new generation of resilient applications.
The Senior Engineering manager Site Reliability will be expected to be an engaged thought leader in this field, a coach to his teams, and a partner for his peers and stakeholders.



Your Mission:


As a result of our fast growth and acquisitions, Delivery Hero is now home to over 4000 engineers who build and operate multiple large-scale consumer-facing platforms. Availability of our services and protecting and defending them is key to successfully achieving our vision of always delivering an amazing experience - Fast, easy, and to your door.


Your job will be to scale up your team from scratch, define a product roadmap together with your product manager, deliver on the roadmap by building the product features on time, ensure stable operations, and drive adoption across the Delivery Hero group through quality and convenience instead of mandate. Your customers are thousands of software engineers distributed worldwide, from Buenos Aires, to Berlin, Istanbul, Dubai, Singapore, and Seoul. Your primary stakeholders are engineering leaders across the organization. You will work closely together with the Developer Productivity department to integrate your tools and products into the overall developer experience, as well as the Infrastructure teams. Your Northstar-KPI is the order loss ratio, with MTTR and change failure rate as key drivers. Your success is measured by how much you improved those KPIs across the whole group.



Your Heroic Skills:




  • You have led cross-functional teams for at least 3 years.




  • You have experience in building internal developer-facing tools and services.




  • You know how to Identify and propose opportunities to improve reliability, efficiency and scalability




  • You have solid cloud experience, preferably with AWS, Docker, and infrastructure-as-code (e.g. Terraform)




  • You can take architectural decisions, contribute to the task prioritization, spearhead the documentation and learnings from incidents




  • You foster a collaborative, inclusive & diverse team environment




  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English





Nice to have:




  • You have scaled a team from zero to high-performing from scratch.




  • Good influencer, as you will need to convince engineering leaders to adopt your services.
_source.position_name: Senior Engineering Manager - SRE (Developer Platform) (f/m/d) at Delivery Hero SE (Berlin, Germany)

_source.description:
We are looking for a Senior Golang Software Engineer (f/m/d) to join our Site Reliability Engineering team and work on global strategic initiatives aiming to make all our services observable. So, if you're a creative problem solver who is eager to deliver solutions and hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!Your Mission:As a result of our fast growth and acquisitions, Delivery Hero is now home to over 4000 engineers who build and operate multiple large-scale consumer-facing platforms. Availability of our services and protecting and defending them is key to successfully achieving our vision of always delivering an amazing experience - Fast, easy, and to your door. You will be responsible for implementing features and services that are instrumental in establishing and expanding our SRE culture by providing tooling that compliantly delivers out-of-the-box observability and incident handling and other reliability practices. Your customers are thousands of software engineers distributed worldwide, from Buenos Aires, to Berlin, Istanbul, Dubai, Singapore, and Seoul. You will work closely together with the Developer Productivity department to integrate your tools and products into the overall developer experience, as well as the Infrastructure teams. Your Heroic Skills:You are an experienced developer with strong Golang skills with a sound understanding of CS fundamentals (algorithms and data structures).
You have at least 5 year experience in building distributed cloud-native microservices used by thousands of users
You understand how to create an efficient, reliable, scalable, and maintainable software architecture.
You are familiar with knowledge of UNIX and TCP/IP network fundamentals
You write clean, test-driven code and can teach others to do so.
You are comfortable with SRE practices and are familiar with popular observability tooling (a passion for observability and reliability ideally with experience in distributed tracing)
You have full professional English proficiency and good communication skills.

  • You have at least 5 year experience in building distributed cloud-native microservices used by thousands of users




  • You understand how to create an efficient, reliable, scalable, and maintainable software architecture.




  • You are familiar with knowledge of UNIX and TCP/IP network fundamentals




  • You write clean, test-driven code and can teach others to do so.




  • You are comfortable with SRE practices and are familiar with popular observability tooling (a passion for observability and reliability ideally with experience in distributed tracing)




  • You have full professional English proficiency and good communication skills.
_source.position_name: Senior Golang Backend Engineer - Site Reliability Engineering (f/m/d) at Delivery Hero SE (Berlin, Germany)
