_source.description:
Delivery Heroandrsquo;s mission is to always deliver an amazing experience- fast, easy, and to your door. Recommendation teams contribute to that through personalized experience by surfacing the right cuisine and items to our users. Our data-informed culture helps us continuously improve and provide highly relevant recommendations to our diverse set of users. About the roleAs the Data Engineer, You will be responsible for designing, building, and managing our Data Pipelines and APIs by keeping scalability, flexibility, and stability in mind. You will also be responsible for spreading the best practices within the team and organization.About the teamWe own and drive various recommendation strategies for all verticals and brands of Delivery Hero. The goal of the team is to continuously innovate, and provide a highly personalized user experience. We are a full stack team consisting of talented Data Scientists, ML Engineers, Backend Engineers, and Data Engineers. The team has end-to-end ownership of building ML models, deployment, and maintenance of the Recommendation service. Your MissionMake user experience seamless. Help users navigate the app easily by surfacing what they might like at the right time.
Innovate and use state-of-the-art machine learning and statistical models to create and improve different recommendation strategies.
Work closely with other data scientists and engineers to put your models into production.
Define and drive the best practices of data engineering within the Global Discovery tribe. Evangelize data science within the tribe and the wider company.
Develop and maintain ETL processing pipelines for batch and near-real-time data as well as analytical / machine learning workflows.
Build and deploy REST APIs to serve machine learning models.
Build solutions at scale and optimize for performance. Every millisecond counts.
Communicate with different teams regarding coding consistency and data availability.
Proactively make suggestions on how the team can leverage new technologies and architectures to improve the performance of our data platform.
Your heroic skillsYou are a python ninja with proven experience (3+ years).
Expert knowledge of SQL/NoSQL(PostgreSQL, BigQuery, etc.) and experience working with large data sets.
Experience with performance optimization of databases and building multi-threaded applications.
A proven track record in dealing with data ingestion/ ETL processes design and technologies.
You are a team player who loves to collaborate and work with stakeholders from different backgrounds in an international environment.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
You are a team player and love to think outside the box.
Able to empathize with stakeholders and understand the relationship between data and behaviors.
Curious and eager to learn and improve.
Nice to haveKnowledge of using terraform in GCP with a focus on data processing and machine learning model deployment.
Ability to design and maintain complex data pipelines and REST APIs
Knowledge of container technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) and CI pipelines (GitHub Actions, Jenkins).
Ability to develop strong hypotheses, solve problems independently and generate reports.
Why Delivery Hero? Exchange ideas and meet colleagues from different teams in our active guilds and through our global tech and product community.
We offer visa and relocation support globally to our permanent employees.
Enjoy our free online yoga classes and a subsidized Urban Sports Club or Gympass membership.
Take care of your mental and emotional well-being with our free Headspace subscription and unlimited access to our confidential Employee Assistance Program.
Participate in our health campaigns such as seasonal flu vaccines.
Benefit from subsidised products e.g. BVG ticket, meal vouchers, fruit or vegetable box or our bike rental program

_source.description_html:
Delivery Hero’s mission is to always deliver an amazing experience- fast, easy, and to your door. Recommendation teams contribute to that through personalized experience by surfacing the right cuisine and items to our users. Our data-informed culture helps us continuously improve and provide highly relevant recommendations to our diverse set of users.


About the role


As the Data Engineer, You will be responsible for designing, building, and managing our Data Pipelines and APIs by keeping scalability, flexibility, and stability in mind. You will also be responsible for spreading the best practices within the team and organization.


About the team


We own and drive various recommendation strategies for all verticals and brands of Delivery Hero. The goal of the team is to continuously innovate, and provide a highly personalized user experience. We are a full stack team consisting of talented Data Scientists, ML Engineers, Backend Engineers, and Data Engineers. The team has end-to-end ownership of building ML models, deployment, and maintenance of the Recommendation service.


Your Mission




  • Make user experience seamless. Help users navigate the app easily by surfacing what they might like at the right time.




  • Innovate and use state-of-the-art machine learning and statistical models to create and improve different recommendation strategies.




  • Work closely with other data scientists and engineers to put your models into production.




  • Define and drive the best practices of data engineering within the Global Discovery tribe. Evangelize data science within the tribe and the wider company.




  • Develop and maintain ETL processing pipelines for batch and near-real-time data as well as analytical / machine learning workflows.




  • Build and deploy REST APIs to serve machine learning models.




  • Build solutions at scale and optimize for performance. Every millisecond counts.




  • Communicate with different teams regarding coding consistency and data availability.




  • Proactively make suggestions on how the team can leverage new technologies and architectures to improve the performance of our data platform.




Your heroic skills




  • You are a python ninja with proven experience (3+ years).




  • Expert knowledge of SQL/NoSQL(PostgreSQL, BigQuery, etc.) and experience working with large data sets.




  • Experience with performance optimization of databases and building multi-threaded applications.




  • A proven track record in dealing with data ingestion/ ETL processes design and technologies.




  • You are a team player who loves to collaborate and work with stakeholders from different backgrounds in an international environment.




  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.




  • You are a team player and love to think outside the box.




  • Able to empathize with stakeholders and understand the relationship between data and behaviors.




  • Curious and eager to learn and improve.




Nice to have




  • Knowledge of using terraform in GCP with a focus on data processing and machine learning model deployment.




  • Ability to design and maintain complex data pipelines and REST APIs




  • Knowledge of container technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) and CI pipelines (GitHub Actions, Jenkins).




  • Ability to develop strong hypotheses, solve problems independently and generate reports.




Why Delivery Hero?




  • Exchange ideas and meet colleagues from different teams in our active guilds and through our global tech & product community.




  • We offer visa & relocation support globally to our permanent employees.




  • Enjoy our free online yoga classes and a subsidized Urban Sports Club or Gympass membership.




  • Take care of your mental and emotional well-being with our free Headspace subscription and unlimited access to our confidential Employee Assistance Program.




  • Participate in our health campaigns such as seasonal flu vaccines.




  • Benefit from subsidised products e.g. BVG ticket, meal vouchers, fruit or vegetable box or our bike rental program




  • We support child care needs where we partner with an external service to support tasks such as Kita search and application, Au Pair or childminder search




  • Join the global market leader and a publicly listed company with a competitive remuneration package.




  • Develop your skills with your personal educational budget for conferences and external trainings.




  • Access our e-learning platform MyAcademy and participate in our various inhouse trainings, including German learning options.




  • Save responsibly with our attractive corporate pension options.




  • Join company parties, team, cultural and sports events - due to the current situation on a virtual basis.




  • And much more…




Have we caught your attention? If you are looking for an environment where our company DNA is defined by our values and People Leadership Principles, please send us your CV.


We’re looking forward to your application!


About us:


Learn more about our diverse stack and what our teams are working on by visiting our Tech & Product blog and our Tech Talk Youtube channel.


Delivery Hero is building the next generation global on-demand delivery platform. We have grown rapidly from inception in 2011 to become one of the leading global online food ordering and delivery platforms and are now innovating and creating new services such as groceries, pharmacies, and other convenience articles in multiple markets.


Our awesome international team already operates in 40+ countries worldwide and we are looking for the most talented people to join us on our mission to ‘always deliver an amazing experience.


At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and representation is key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or any other aspect that makes you, you.

_source.description:
At S Group we bake quality into our digital services and solutions. Our QA professionals work together with designers, developers and business professionals aiming towards a shared mutual goal: good quality software and applications to make the daily lives easier for our customers, employees and each other. Meanwhile developing new digital solutions, we are strengthening our QA competence by recruiting a new colleague to our growing QA community.S-Kaupat is S Groupandrsquo;s new eCom platform for grocery shopping. Our goal is to make peopleandrsquo;s lives easier by providing them with a platform where they can get groceries in an easy and convenient manner. This service has been highly appreciated by our customers, especially now during the pandemic time. We want to make the service even better and need you for that!QA Engineer andndash; S-kaupat, Mobile squadS-Kaupat Mobile squad is the team of professionals, who build mobile apps (both for iOS and Android) which people use for ordering groceries. We use React Native to build the apps and strive to deliver a wonderful experience by constantly iterating and improving our apps. The APIs are written with GraphQL, and the backend of the solution relies on TypeScript, AWS Lambdas, DynamoDB and event-driven architecture.As the QA Engineer of the Mobile squad, you understand what quality means in this context. Your goal is to build the Quality related capabilities to optimize the value perceived by the end customer when using our apps for doing grocery shopping. The technical development done by this team has innovation at heart, so you help in building quality-in while prototyping and trying out ideas. You define and implement the testing capabilities in this domain and together with the developers create the testing harness and build the telemetry and observability that helps you measure quality in the apps the team builds.What we hope from youA few years of experience of mobile testing
A technical educational and professional background
Understanding in test automation, continuous testing in DevOps and software observability
A habit for active communication and collaboration with all kinds of people
Eagerness and willingness to develop yourself and your skills even more in the above-mentioned areas
In work-related matters you communicate fluently in English
We also value previous knowledge of React Native and Detox testing framework, but those are not requirements as long as you have enthusiasm to learn new technologies.Whatandrsquo;s in it for you?On top of respectful salary, superb company benefits and the finest colleagues, this is what we offer in return:An opportunity to improve and have influence on the daily lives of millions of people.
Concrete and rewarding end-results, which you can experience yourself by using S Groupandrsquo;s services, when doing your grocery shopping, fueling or staying in a hotel, for example. For many of us, the dialogue between the digital and IRL worlds makes our work extremely intriguing.
Ownership. Youandrsquo;re creating services directly for the end-users. Youandrsquo;re not visiting a project; you own the product.
Control. Our ways of working are not set in stone. You will be continuously improving how the products and services are developed in the biggest private employer in Finland.
Respect. We value your effort and trust that you get the job done within reasonable workload. You choose your daily work rhythm and location.
An opportunity to gain know-how on technical competence on wide-ranging development areas and technology domains (like web, mobile and cloud) and businesses (banking, online retail, hospitality, service stations).
The growth of our QA tribe has been immense. This network of leading experts in QA will provide you the level of support and vision only possible in SOK.
How to applyIf you recognized yourself, next it would be great to learn more about you and your hopes for your career and working environment. Please apply on Sunday 6th of February 2022, the latest. We will contact you as soon as we have processed your application, so you donandrsquo;t need to wait too long.If you want more information about the role, the team, SOK in general or something else, please contact our IT TA Specialist Anna Ruokamo (anna.ruokamo(a)sok.fi, +358 44 564 27 94).
_source.description_html:
At S Group we bake quality into our digital services and solutions. Our QA professionals work together with designers, developers and business professionals aiming towards a shared mutual goal: good quality software and applications to make the daily lives easier for our customers, employees and each other. Meanwhile developing new digital solutions, we are strengthening our QA competence by recruiting a new colleague to our growing QA community.


S-Kaupat is S Group’s new eCom platform for grocery shopping. Our goal is to make people’s lives easier by providing them with a platform where they can get groceries in an easy and convenient manner. This service has been highly appreciated by our customers, especially now during the pandemic time. We want to make the service even better and need you for that!



QA Engineer – S-kaupat, Mobile squad



S-Kaupat Mobile squad is the team of professionals, who build mobile apps (both for iOS and Android) which people use for ordering groceries. We use React Native to build the apps and strive to deliver a wonderful experience by constantly iterating and improving our apps. The APIs are written with GraphQL, and the backend of the solution relies on TypeScript, AWS Lambdas, DynamoDB and event-driven architecture.


As the QA Engineer of the Mobile squad, you understand what quality means in this context. Your goal is to build the Quality related capabilities to optimize the value perceived by the end customer when using our apps for doing grocery shopping. The technical development done by this team has innovation at heart, so you help in building quality-in while prototyping and trying out ideas. You define and implement the testing capabilities in this domain and together with the developers create the testing harness and build the telemetry and observability that helps you measure quality in the apps the team builds.



What we hope from you




  • A few years of experience of mobile testing




  • A technical educational and professional background




  • Understanding in test automation, continuous testing in DevOps and software observability




  • A habit for active communication and collaboration with all kinds of people




  • Eagerness and willingness to develop yourself and your skills even more in the above-mentioned areas




  • In work-related matters you communicate fluently in English




We also value previous knowledge of React Native and Detox testing framework, but those are not requirements as long as you have enthusiasm to learn new technologies.



What’s in it for you?


On top of respectful salary, superb company benefits and the finest colleagues, this is what we offer in return:




  • An opportunity to improve and have influence on the daily lives of millions of people.




  • Concrete and rewarding end-results, which you can experience yourself by using S Group’s services, when doing your grocery shopping, fueling or staying in a hotel, for example. For many of us, the dialogue between the digital and IRL worlds makes our work extremely intriguing.




  • Ownership. You’re creating services directly for the end-users. You’re not visiting a project; you own the product.




  • Control. Our ways of working are not set in stone. You will be continuously improving how the products and services are developed in the biggest private employer in Finland.




  • Respect. We value your effort and trust that you get the job done within reasonable workload. You choose your daily work rhythm and location.




  • An opportunity to gain know-how on technical competence on wide-ranging development areas and technology domains (like web, mobile and cloud) and businesses (banking, online retail, hospitality, service stations).




  • The growth of our QA tribe has been immense. This network of leading experts in QA will provide you the level of support and vision only possible in SOK.





How to apply


If you recognized yourself, next it would be great to learn more about you and your hopes for your career and working environment. Please apply on Sunday 6th of February 2022, the latest. We will contact you as soon as we have processed your application, so you don’t need to wait too long.


If you want more information about the role, the team, SOK in general or something else, please contact our IT TA Specialist Anna Ruokamo (anna.ruokamo(a)sok.fi, +358 44 564 27 94).

_source.description_html:
At Jack Henry & Associates, we deliver technology solutions that are digitally transforming and empowering community banks and credit unions to provide enhanced and streamlined user experiences to their customers and members. Our best-in-class products are just the start as we lay the groundwork for the future of digital banking and payments. We hope you’ll join us. We can’t do it without you.


You would be a part of a team of application developers & BI developers that enhance, maintain, and develop data products for our clients. This tight-knit group of like-minded individuals share knowledge and skills with each other to help solve problems and enhance our data products. You will be working closely with product development team to build a new data platform.


This position will be filled to work at the Allen TX Jack Henry office location.


What you’ll be responsible for:



  • Design data pipeline to process batch / streaming data using Kafka , Spark and Azure Data tools.

  • Build and maintain secure and compliant data processing pipelines and ensure the data pipelines & data stores are high-performing, efficient, organized, and reliable

  • Enjoy working in Agile as part of a scrum team and deliver high-quality products incrementally in an interactive manner.

  • Estimates tasks with a level of granularity and accuracy commensurate with the information provided.

  • Write Test Driven Development-based code to meet overall data quality standards

  • Collaborate with business analysts, product owner and other data teams to define, build, and deliver solutions to challenging data problems

  • Design and manage data pipeline orchestration.

  • Acts a subject matter expert for mobile platform related data.

  • May perform other job duties as assigned.


What you’ll need to have:



  • Must have at least 6 year of professional experience as a Data Engineer.

  • Experienced with Spark framework and related tools (PySpark, Scala, SparkR, Spark SQL, Spark UI).

  • Experienced in implementing Azure data solution using Azure Data Factory, Event Hubs, Azure Stream Analytics/Kafka, Azure Functions, Azure SQL, and/or ADLS Gen2/Azure Data Lake.

  • Bachelor’s degree.


What would be nice for you to have:



  • Advanced Degree in Computer Science/Data Science/Information Technology or related field of study.

  • Excellent knowledge of Messaging/Streaming Platforms (e.g. Kafka or similar).

  • Experience in ETL processes and tools like SSIS

  • Experience in data visualization tools like Tableau or PowerBI

  • Experience in designing and developing Data warehouses & Data Marts

  • Excellent knowledge on building analytical solutions on Azure Synapse

  • Excellent knowledge on open-source data processing pipelines and platform (Apache AirFlow/Apache Beam/etc.)



  • Excellent communication and customer interaction skills

  • Able to use independent judgment to plan, prioritize and organize a diversified workload.

  • Understands and respects chain of command in a professional work environment.

  • Understand the need to regard confidential customer and company information with the highest regard.

  • Berufserfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung.

  • Nachweisbar gute Kenntnisse des .NET Frameworks.

  • Erfahrungen mit Docker (.NET-Anwendungen laufen in Linux-Docker-Containern).

  • SQL-Server und Kerberos-Authentifizierungen sind keine Fremdwörter für Dich.

  • Erste Erfahrung mit NuGet Packages und Octupus Deploy sind von Vorteil.

  • Interesse an agilem Arbeiten nach SCRUM.

  • Einen sicheren Umgang mit JavaScript-Frameworks (z. B. jQuery).

  • Umfassende Kenntnisse im Bereich Datenbanksysteme: MS SQL Server, MySQL, oder Oracle.

  • Zwingende Voraussetzung sind sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift für den Projekteinsatz bei z. T. international agierenden Kunden.

  • Kommunikationsstärke, sicheres Auftreten und Durchsetzungsvermögen.




Das bieten wir



  • Mentorenprogramm: intensive Begleitung und qualifiziertes Feedback in der Einarbeitung und darüber hinaus.

  • Weiterbildung: umfangreiche fachliche und methodische Trainings inkl. Zertifizierungen.

  • Freie Wahl der Hardware.

  • Karriereperspektiven: Möglichkeit der Übernahme von Führungsaufgaben.

  • Wir leben aktiv Innovation und haben das Ohr an den Trends unserer Zeit.

  • Work-Life-Balance: mobiles Arbeiten, Sabbatical, Angebote in Sport und Gesundheit.

  • Tolle psX Events mit motivierten und sympathischen Kollegen.

  • Unsere Kultur: flache Hierarchien, Teamspirit, offene Türen, Wertschätzung über alle Ebenen.




Möchtest Du mit uns Deine Zukunft gestalten?


Dann sende Deine Bewerbungs­unterlagen per E-Mail an:


Kerstin Behrends
career@psx-gmbh.com


Du hast offene Fragen? Kontaktiere mich gern direkt unter kerstin.behrends@psx-gmbh.com.


Wir freuen uns auf Dich!


psX GmbH • Arndtstraße 11a • D22085 Hamburg • www.psx-gmbh.com






www.psx-gmbh.com

_source.description:
Percona takes pride in delivering stable and reliable software to our users. Our Solution Stack consists of various open source components that are maintained and developed by several engineering teams including our own and we take quality very seriously!The goal of our QA teams is to ensure that all components are well tested and interact with each other properly. We test and validate both our individual products as well as the interoperability of all components of our stack to avoid any regressions for our end users.Weandrsquo;re looking for a Senior Manager of QA to join our team to lead and manage our distributed QA teams, supporting them in maintaining and improving the quality of our solution stack and its individual components as part of the release process and in an ongoing fashion. We need someone that has a background in developing efficient processes, ensuring a high level of quality and has a demonstrated track record of working across multiple teams and products as well as with the broader open-source community.The Percona people are our most vital asset, so you should be someone that looks to continually invest in helping them be better every day.What Will Make You Stand OutTo truly stand out you should be passionate and unwavering with regards to software quality and leading teams. You should be able to point to the obstacles youandrsquo;ve overcome to build amazing teams who in turn ensure a high level of confidence in the software! Your past experiences will help you land the interview, but our attitude and aptitude are truly what will get you the role!What You Will DoHire and lead a globally-distributed, empowered team of both QA managers as well as individual contributors including QA engineers and testers
Support the product engineering teams by owning and driving software quality through automation, predictability, and accountability
Develop managers and individual contributors through coaching, mentoring, and management support ensuring team health and individual growth
Work with development and release engineering teams, product managers and others across team boundaries to maintain high levels of transparency, efficiency, collaboration and set context with the team so they are empowered and equipped to make great business and engineering informed decisions
Continually find ways to improve quality, processes and efficiencies through technology and automation
Ownership of the teamsandrsquo; results, building on the good and taking corrective action on the bad
What You Have Done4+ years of experience leading and managing agile QA teams that have been responsible for multiple products
A cross-team facilitator and collaborator: working with other teams and figuring out how to get things running more smoothly
Experience with open source software and testing processes and frameworks
Familiarity with Molecule, Ansible and/or Jenkins a plus High level of organization with a proven ability to prioritize, manage, budget, and deliver on time
Experience in project management with the ability to decompose complicated projects into simple tasks, estimates and manage risks
Self directed with the ability to operate independently without needing everyday input
Maturity to build relationships and operate across the organization (not locked to only operate in the vertical chain)Excellent English communication skills both verbally and written
Location: Remote work from home anywhere however a large portion of the broader team is located in Eastern Europe and India.Percona is a highly respected thought leader in the global open-source community. Our mission is to Keep Open Source Open. We provide services and software for MySQL, MongoDB, PostgreSQL and MariaDB.Percona is remote-only and globally dispersed andndash; we have colleagues in more than 40 countries! We offer a collaborative, highly-engaged culture where your ideas are welcome and your voice is heard.Our staff receives generous benefits including flexible work hours and paid time off, all your equipment for your remote office, funds for career development (external training, certifications, conferences) and the opportunity to participate in an equity incentive plan.If you love the idea of working with a high-growth tech company that is one of the best in the business and known globally as a go-to in the open-source database space, letandrsquo;s talk.
_source.description_html:
Percona takes pride in delivering stable and reliable software to our users. Our Solution Stack consists of various open source components that are maintained and developed by several engineering teams including our own and we take quality very seriously!

The goal of our QA teams is to ensure that all components are well tested and interact with each other properly. We test and validate both our individual products as well as the interoperability of all components of our stack to avoid any regressions for our end users.

We’re looking for a Senior Manager of QA to join our team to lead and manage our distributed QA teams, supporting them in maintaining and improving the quality of our solution stack and its individual components as part of the release process and in an ongoing fashion. We need someone that has a background in developing efficient processes, ensuring a high level of quality and has a demonstrated track record of working across multiple teams and products as well as with the broader open-source community.

The Percona people are our most vital asset, so you should be someone that looks to continually invest in helping them be better every day.

What Will Make You Stand Out
To truly stand out you should be passionate and unwavering with regards to software quality and leading teams. You should be able to point to the obstacles you’ve overcome to build amazing teams who in turn ensure a high level of confidence in the software! Your past experiences will help you land the interview, but our attitude and aptitude are truly what will get you the role!

What You Will Do



  • Hire and lead a globally-distributed, empowered team of both QA managers as well as individual contributors including QA engineers and testers

  • Support the product engineering teams by owning and driving software quality through automation, predictability, and accountability

  • Develop managers and individual contributors through coaching, mentoring, and management support ensuring team health and individual growth

  • Work with development and release engineering teams, product managers and others across team boundaries to maintain high levels of transparency, efficiency, collaboration and set context with the team so they are empowered and equipped to make great business and engineering informed decisions

  • Continually find ways to improve quality, processes and efficiencies through technology and automation

  • Ownership of the teams’ results, building on the good and taking corrective action on the bad


What You Have Done



  • 4+ years of experience leading and managing agile QA teams that have been responsible for multiple products

  • A cross-team facilitator and collaborator: working with other teams and figuring out how to get things running more smoothly

  • Experience with open source software and testing processes and frameworks

  • Familiarity with Molecule, Ansible and/or Jenkins a plus High level of organization with a proven ability to prioritize, manage, budget, and deliver on time

  • Experience in project management with the ability to decompose complicated projects into simple tasks, estimates and manage risks

  • Self directed with the ability to operate independently without needing everyday input

  • Maturity to build relationships and operate across the organization (not locked to only operate in the vertical chain)Excellent English communication skills both verbally and written



Location: Remote work from home anywhere however a large portion of the broader team is located in Eastern Europe and India.

Percona is a highly respected thought leader in the global open-source community. Our mission is to Keep Open Source Open. We provide services and software for MySQL, MongoDB, PostgreSQL and MariaDB.

Percona is remote-only and globally dispersed – we have colleagues in more than 40 countries! We offer a collaborative, highly-engaged culture where your ideas are welcome and your voice is heard.

Our staff receives generous benefits including flexible work hours and paid time off, all your equipment for your remote office, funds for career development (external training, certifications, conferences) and the opportunity to participate in an equity incentive plan.

If you love the idea of working with a high-growth tech company that is one of the best in the business and known globally as a go-to in the open-source database space, let’s talk.

_source.description:
Percona is looking for a remote full-time Senior Backend Software Engineer developing in Golang to join its Open Source Software Development team and help continue building Percona Monitoring and Management (PMM). You will be contributing to further enhancing and extending PMM product, which is a free and open-source platform for monitoring and managing the performance of SQL/NoSQL based databases and servers or cloud instances. Youandrsquo;ll predominantly be responsible for enabling all new functionalities in our client/server PMM product using Golang. This is an amazing opportunity to build something from the ground up and integrate our existing Client Server products with Cloud to deliver a new wave of services and functionality to our users. The work is challenging, but thatandrsquo;s why itandrsquo;s also fun and rewarding! Plus, our team is small, so you and your work will have a large impact.What You Will DoDevelop scalable, high-volume, performant applications focused on simplicity and user delight
Produce high-quality software that is unit tested, code reviewed and checked in regularly for continuous integration
Brainstorm with designers, architects and product managers to build and tweak functionalities
Participate in code and design reviews, teaching and learning from other engineers
Identify and uphold engineering best practices
Identify, leverage, and successfully evangelize opportunities to improve engineering productivity
Train, mentor and support engineers
Your Experience3+ years programming in Golang with strong programming fundamentals
Test-driven and test automation first advocate
Experience with MongoDB, MySQL or PostgreSQL
Comfortable with Linux (basic usage as a programmer)
Fluent English written and verbal language skills
Ability to work as a teamplayer as we sell as independently in a fully remote environment
Development experience on cloud computing platform (AWS, Azure or OpenShift)
Familiarity with version control systems (Git)
Experience designing, building, and documenting APIs
Knowledge of asynchronous programming
What Will Make You Stand OutKnowledge of other databases/data stores (Memcached, ClickHouse)
Deep knowledge security and encryption techniques for transmitting and storing sensitive data
Experience with continuous deployment to cloud / virtualized environments (DevOps)
Experience with Docker and Kubernetes
Experience with Prometheus or VictoriaMetrics
BS/MS/PhD in an engineering field or equivalent experience
Experience writing and maintaining unit tests
Open source development experience
Percona is a respected thought leader in the open source community. We provide services and software for MySQL, MongoDB, PostgreSQL and MariaDB to open source users globally.Percona is remote-first and globally dispersed; we have colleagues in more than 40 countries! We offer a collaborative, highly-engaged culture where your ideas are welcome and your voice is heard. The growth and development of our staff is a top priority; we provide funding for training, certifications, conferences and more.Discover what it means to work with some of the smartest people in the industry, who also know how to have fun and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We offer flexible hours, the ability to work remotely and the amazing experience of working with a multinational team of experts.
_source.description_html:
Percona is looking for a remote full-time Senior Backend Software Engineer developing in Golang to join its Open Source Software Development team and help continue building Percona Monitoring and Management (PMM).

You will be contributing to further enhancing and extending PMM product, which is a free and open-source platform for monitoring and managing the performance of SQL/NoSQL based databases and servers or cloud instances.

You’ll predominantly be responsible for enabling all new functionalities in our client/server PMM product using Golang. This is an amazing opportunity to build something from the ground up and integrate our existing Client <--> Server products with Cloud to deliver a new wave of services and functionality to our users.

The work is challenging, but that’s why it’s also fun and rewarding! Plus, our team is small, so you and your work will have a large impact.

What You Will Do



  • Develop scalable, high-volume, performant applications focused on simplicity and user delight

  • Produce high-quality software that is unit tested, code reviewed and checked in regularly for continuous integration

  • Brainstorm with designers, architects and product managers to build and tweak functionalities

  • Participate in code and design reviews, teaching and learning from other engineers

  • Identify and uphold engineering best practices

  • Identify, leverage, and successfully evangelize opportunities to improve engineering productivity

  • Train, mentor and support engineers


Your Experience



  • 3+ years programming in Golang with strong programming fundamentals

  • Test-driven and test automation first advocate

  • Experience with MongoDB, MySQL or PostgreSQL

  • Comfortable with Linux (basic usage as a programmer)

  • Fluent English written and verbal language skills

  • Ability to work as a teamplayer as we sell as independently in a fully remote environment

  • Development experience on cloud computing platform (AWS, Azure or OpenShift)

  • Familiarity with version control systems (Git)

  • Experience designing, building, and documenting APIs

  • Knowledge of asynchronous programming


What Will Make You Stand Out



  • Knowledge of other databases/data stores (Memcached, ClickHouse)

  • Deep knowledge security and encryption techniques for transmitting and storing sensitive data

  • Experience with continuous deployment to cloud / virtualized environments (DevOps)

  • Experience with Docker and Kubernetes

  • Experience with Prometheus or VictoriaMetrics

  • BS/MS/PhD in an engineering field or equivalent experience

  • Experience writing and maintaining unit tests

  • Open source development experience



Percona is a respected thought leader in the open source community. We provide services and software for MySQL, MongoDB, PostgreSQL and MariaDB to open source users globally.

Percona is remote-first and globally dispersed; we have colleagues in more than 40 countries! We offer a collaborative, highly-engaged culture where your ideas are welcome and your voice is heard. The growth and development of our staff is a top priority; we provide funding for training, certifications, conferences and more.

Discover what it means to work with some of the smartest people in the industry, who also know how to have fun and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We offer flexible hours, the ability to work remotely and the amazing experience of working with a multinational team of experts.

_source.description:
At Scoville, we focus on creating and improving new products in the field of human resources. We're always trying to find better solutions to help students find their dream job and help companies find the best candidate. Currently we are looking to expand our Web team to help us build products that will shape the market. For this purpose we are hiring an experienced Front-end Web Engineer to develop new and exciting features that improve the usersandrsquo; experience. We're looking for people who share our aptitude for work to help us develop smart and well designed applications for our clients.Project ChallengesOur team is currently looking for ways to solve the existing challenges:Make the application simpler and easier to engage with to reduce time spent on recruitment and job-hunting for clients and candidates respectively.

Allow candidates and clients to create appealing profiles to improve the acquisition and activation points for the system.

Improve workflows for our customer success and business teams to better communicate with the clients and candidates.

Work towards creating an application that is secure when handling personal information.
What You Will DoThis is a hands-on technical role, day to day activities include:Delivering working web-based software
Giving advice on technology adoption and selection as it pertains to web solutions. Itandrsquo;s not a project management role although mentoring is encouraged
Influence and guide the direction of the web-based solutions and ramp up the rest of the teamandrsquo;s web knowledge
Work with cross-functional teams to help shape and define key features
What We Can Expect from YouEnglish language proficiency (no Japanese required) 
Hold a degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
3+ years recent commercial programming with a strong emphasis towards delivering Web solutions
Expert understanding of a wide variety of web technologies, how to design and build websites and web based applications
Expert understanding of JavaScript
Experience with TypeScript
Expert understanding of server side rendering, ideally using Next.js with React
Significant experience using React (or another big framework like Vue)
Good understanding of Design system and Component Driven Development
Experience with Frontend testing(unit to e2e)
Experience explaining complex, technological limitations to team members with a non-technical background
Status of residence
For those in Japan: must have a working visa valid for more than six months
For those outside of Japan: remote contract work is available until a visa can be prepared
Bonus PointsReScript is a strong nice-to-have, will need to learn on the job
Experience working with Designers and exposure to tools such as Figma, Framer, etc.
Japanese language proficiency
Experience working with HR-related applications
Strong experience in using one of the big functional programming languages (OCaml, Haskell, Erlang), ReScript/ReasonML is a big plus

What You Can Expect from Us.0 - 9.0 million/year (negotiable based on experience)
10+ paid days off per year
Flexible work hours, opportunity to work remotely
Social and health insurance
Commuting subsidy and work equipment provided
An international team of talented and engaged creators who will value your input
Visa sponsorship (after 6-month trial period)
_source.description_html:
At Scoville, we focus on creating and improving new products in the field of human resources. We're always trying to find better solutions to help students find their dream job and help companies find the best candidate. Currently we are looking to expand our Web team to help us build products that will shape the market. For this purpose we are hiring an experienced Front-end Web Engineer to develop new and exciting features that improve the users’ experience. We're looking for people who share our aptitude for work to help us develop smart and well designed applications for our clients.


Project Challenges


Our team is currently looking for ways to solve the existing challenges:



  • Make the application simpler and easier to engage with to reduce time spent on recruitment and job-hunting for clients and candidates respectively.

  • Allow candidates and clients to create appealing profiles to improve the acquisition and activation points for the system.

  • Improve workflows for our customer success and business teams to better communicate with the clients and candidates.

  • Work towards creating an application that is secure when handling personal information.


What You Will Do


This is a hands-on technical role, day to day activities include:



  • Delivering working web-based software

  • Giving advice on technology adoption and selection as it pertains to web solutions. It’s not a project management role although mentoring is encouraged

  • Influence and guide the direction of the web-based solutions and ramp up the rest of the team’s web knowledge

  • Work with cross-functional teams to help shape and define key features


What We Can Expect from You



  • English language proficiency (no Japanese required)

  • Hold a degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience

  • 3+ years recent commercial programming with a strong emphasis towards delivering Web solutions

  • Expert understanding of a wide variety of web technologies, how to design and build websites and web based applications

  • Expert understanding of JavaScript

  • Experience with TypeScript

  • Expert understanding of server side rendering, ideally using Next.js with React

  • Significant experience using React (or another big framework like Vue)

  • Good understanding of Design system and Component Driven Development

  • Experience with Frontend testing(unit to e2e)

  • Experience explaining complex, technological limitations to team members with a non-technical background

  • Status of residence


    • For those in Japan: must have a working visa valid for more than six months

    • For those outside of Japan: remote contract work is available until a visa can be prepared



Bonus Points



  • ReScript is a strong nice-to-have, will need to learn on the job

  • Experience working with Designers & exposure to tools such as Figma, Framer, etc.

  • Japanese language proficiency

  • Experience working with HR-related applications

  • Strong experience in using one of the big functional programming languages (OCaml, Haskell, Erlang), ReScript/ReasonML is a big plus



What You Can Expect from Us



  • .0 - 9.0 million/year (negotiable based on experience)

  • 10+ paid days off per year

  • Flexible work hours, opportunity to work remotely

  • Social and health insurance

  • Commuting subsidy and work equipment provided

  • An international team of talented and engaged creators who will value your input

  • Visa sponsorship (after 6-month trial period)

_source.description_html:
Leidenschaft für neue Technologien, agiles Mindset, Kreativität und Kommunikationsgeschick – das beschreibt Sie mehr als gut? Sie verbinden Oracle-Know-how mit Prozessverständnis und möchten Ihre Skills in einem internationalen Finanzkonzern vertiefen und erweitern? Perfekt! Verstärken Sie unsere IT in Nürnberg und schrauben Sie mit am Backend für unsere bankinternen Geschäftsprozesse!


Ihre Aufgaben


Fachliche und technische Abläufe bringen Sie gekonnt unter einen Hut, wenn Sie Systeme, Anwendungen und Schnittstellen konzipieren, implementieren und weiterentwickeln. Klar, dass Sie dabei auf Vorgaben, Standards und Richtlinien achten und die Qualität z. B. via Code Reviews und Testautomatisierung sichern. Ihre konzeptionellen und kommunikativen Stärken spielen Sie an der Schnittstelle zwischen IT und Fachbereich voll aus. Sie steigen mit ein in die Analyse, begleiten Umsetzung und Betrieb, unterstützen auch bei der Planung und kontern technisch versiert regulatorische Fragen. Apropos Betrieb: Sie betreuen unsere Anwendungen, sind verlässliche Ansprechperson im 3rd-Level-Support und lassen in puncto Prozessautomatisierung kein Skript aus.


Ihr Profil



  • Studium oder Ausbildung in der IT

  • Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung

  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL, PL/SQL, Automic UC4, im Shell-Skripting Linux / Unix, Basiskenntnisse in Java von Vorteil

  • Vertraut mit Refactoring, Code Reviews, komplexen Projekten

  • Strukturierter und lösungsorientierter Arbeitsstil

  • Hoch motiviert und Spaß an persönlicher Weiterentwicklung in einem agilen Team

  • Sehr gutes Deutsch und Englisch



Wir bieten zahlreiche Benefits



  • Betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Vermögenswirksame Leistungen, regionales Jobticket, Betriebsrestaurant

  • Mobiles Arbeiten je nach Position und Abteilung im Rahmen von betrieblichen, regulatorischen und gesetzlichen Anforderungen, individuelle Arbeitszeitmodelle, Sabbatical, Bezuschussung von Pflege- & Kinderbetreuungskosten

  • Eigene Budgets fur persönliche Entwicklung und Gesundheit plus persönliches Ausstattungsbudget fur Ihren mobilen Arbeitsplatz



Ihre Bewerbung


Bei der ING sind wir bunt und vielfältig: unterschiedliche Persönlichkeiten mit verschiedenen Perspektiven - in einer internationalen Kultur, in der wir uns wertschätzen. Dabei tragen wir Sneaker und Pumps, Hoodies und Anzüge. Weil Menschen nicht in Schubladen passen.

_source.description_html:
.NET Developer


Pro vývoj webových aplikací postavených na technologiích od Microsoftu, hledáme nové kolegy/n v rozmezí zkušeností junior – senior, s chutí uit se a zájmem posouvat se do rolí analytika i architekta.


Co t v této roli eká?



  • rznorodost s moností podílet se na agilních i fix time – fix price projektech v oblasti banking, industry nebo digitalizace

  • vyjma programování se budeš podílet i na testování a tvorb technologické dokumentace

  • pokud ji máš zkušenosti z analýzy i ambice ešit architekturu, dostaneš prostor se v tchto oblastech realizovat


Jaké znalosti a zkušenosti u nás zúroíš?



  • alespo 2 roky zkušeností s vývojem zameným na technologie C#, .NET 4.x, ASP.NET, MVC, .NET CORE

  • budou se ti hodit zkušenosti s MS SQL, REST API, WCF, GIT/TFS, HTML, JS, CSS

  • oceníme znalost kontejnerizace Kubernetes, Docker a zaboduješ i znalostí cloudové platformy – Azure

  • pro komunikaci v týmu je poteba J/SJ, na zahraniních projektech je nutná anglitina, nmina výhodou

  • osobnostn oceníme profesionalitu a proaktivní pístup

  • pro odborný rozvoj se bude hodit zdravá ctiádostivost a chu se rozvíjet


Co ti nabízíme?



  • píjemné pracovní prostedí a stabilní zázemí dobe prosperující eské IT firmy, psobící na trhu ji od roku 2000

  • prostor pro samostatnou a kreativní práci s moností realizace vlastních nápad a píleitostmi se stále uit nové vci a pístupy

  • u nás máš monost ovlivovat své smrování ve firm

  • kvalitní HW i SW vybavení, pístup k nejmodernjším technologiím a specifickým projektm

  • v Cleverlance získáš ve svém rozvoji kvalitní podporu i díky bohaté nabídce interních a externích školení

  • moderní kanceláe se zázemím pro sportovce a milovníky kvalitního jídla i kávy v Praze, v Brn nebo v Ostrav

  • u vybraných projekt monost práce remote

  • nabízíme ti benefity jako jsou píspvek na penzijní pipojištní, píspvek na stravné, sick days, slevy na IT produkty, výhodné telefonní tarify, a to i pro rodinné píslušníky, firemní sportovní a spoleenské aktivity, nabídku vzdlávacích akcí

_source.description:
The OpportunityOur work in education is aimed at ensuring that every student andmdash; not just a lucky few andmdash; can get an education thatandrsquo;s tailored to their individual needs and supports every aspect of their development. An example of our work is our partnership with Summit Learning andmdash; a personalized approach to education developed by Summit Public Schools in partnership with learning scientists, researchers, and academics. With Summit Learning, students gain the skills, knowledge and habits to succeed in college and enter adulthood with a clear vision for achieving purpose and wellbeing in life. The Education Infrastructure team supports the development and operations of the Summit Learning Platform, currently serving hundreds of schools across 39 states and the District of Columbia. By building shared tools, infrastructure, and APIs, we ensure that the platform is reliable, performant, and secure. In this role, you will partner closely with members of the product engineering team and the core infrastructure team to cultivate shared best practices that allow the entire team to rapidly improve our product.You willAnalyze and improve reliability, performance, and security of CZI Educationandrsquo;s products and build shared components that benefit multiple teams and products at once
Build, and maintain core infrastructure services in AWS and Heroku, in the process managing infrastructure as code using Terraform
Contribute to redesigns of our infrastructure and platform to enable future product development
Improve developer infrastructure including including CI pipelines, continuous deployment processes, monitoring and observability tools, and development environments
Improve developer experience through tooling and platform innovation
Identify and automate critical workflows improving team efficiency and software quality
Build off of and contribute back to the open-source ecosystem

You have2+ years relevant coding experience
Experience with Amazon Web Services or similar cloud services
Experience building tools for application performance, continuous integration and deployment, or developer environments
Experience with a scripting language such as Ruby or Python
Shown ability to independently define project requirements and ship high-quality software

CZI believes that vaccines are one of the most powerful tools to fight COVID-19 and save lives. It aligns to our mission and work to cure, manage, and prevent disease. Proof of completed COVID-19 vaccination will be required for all employees (with the exception of reasonable accommodations due to medical or religious beliefs). All applicants coming onsite to a CZI facility are required to show proof of COVID vaccination or take an onsite COVID test.
_source.description_html:
The Opportunity


Our work in education is aimed at ensuring that every student — not just a lucky few — can get an education that’s tailored to their individual needs and supports every aspect of their development. An example of our work is our partnership with Summit Learning — a personalized approach to education developed by Summit Public Schools in partnership with learning scientists, researchers, and academics. With Summit Learning, students gain the skills, knowledge and habits to succeed in college and enter adulthood with a clear vision for achieving purpose and wellbeing in life.


The Education Infrastructure team supports the development and operations of the Summit Learning Platform, currently serving hundreds of schools across 39 states and the District of Columbia. By building shared tools, infrastructure, and APIs, we ensure that the platform is reliable, performant, and secure. In this role, you will partner closely with members of the product engineering team and the core infrastructure team to cultivate shared best practices that allow the entire team to rapidly improve our product.


You will





    • Analyze and improve reliability, performance, and security of CZI Education’s products and build shared components that benefit multiple teams and products at once

    • Build, and maintain core infrastructure services in AWS and Heroku, in the process managing infrastructure as code using Terraform



    • Contribute to redesigns of our infrastructure and platform to enable future product development



    • Improve developer infrastructure including including CI pipelines, continuous deployment processes, monitoring and observability tools, and development environments

    • Improve developer experience through tooling and platform innovation

    • Identify and automate critical workflows improving team efficiency and software quality

    • Build off of and contribute back to the open-source ecosystem




You have





    • 2+ years relevant coding experience

    • Experience with Amazon Web Services or similar cloud services

    • Experience building tools for application performance, continuous integration and deployment, or developer environments

    • Experience with a scripting language such as Ruby or Python



    • Shown ability to independently define project requirements and ship high-quality software





CZI believes that vaccines are one of the most powerful tools to fight COVID-19 and save lives. It aligns to our mission and work to cure, manage, and prevent disease. Proof of completed COVID-19 vaccination will be required for all employees (with the exception of reasonable accommodations due to medical or religious beliefs). All applicants coming onsite to a CZI facility are required to show proof of COVID vaccination or take an onsite COVID test.

_source.description:
The OpportunityOur work in education is aimed at ensuring that every student andmdash; not just a lucky few andmdash; can get an education thatandrsquo;s tailored to their individual needs and supports every aspect of their development. Weandrsquo;re pairing engineering with grantmaking, impact investing, policy, and advocacy work to help every young person enter adulthood with the skills and abilities they need to reach their full potential andmdash; and equip every teacher with the tools and research they need to help students get there.We know that when students feel supported, cared for, and understood, they thrive. Now more than ever, teachers and students need efficient and supportive tools to ensure education is anchored in relationships and well-being. Along is a new tool designed to achieve exactly that andndash; a free, interactive video journal designed to foster meaningful connections between teachers and students.Along provides a meaningful space where teachers and students can share one-on-one reflections via recorded video or text conversations and dive into important topics andmdash; such as managing stress, staying motivated, and navigating the new challenges these times present. The Along team is looking for a Software Engineer to build scalable and engaging experiences.You willDrive user impact and delight by working on full-stack projects
Collaborate with a cross-functional team to develop and quickly iterate on products and features
Support Education team-wide initiatives such as accessibility, performance, and reliability
Identify and drive Along team-wide programs to improve product quality, engineering efficiency, and user impact
Provide technical leadership and mentoring to other engineers
You haveStrong experience as a web developer shipping complex products end-to-end with minimal guidance (5+ years)
Proficiency in frontend development (JavaScript, React)
Proficiency in server-side web frameworks (Rails a plus)
Familiarity with Amazon Web Services a plus
Ability and desire to mentor others in achieving engineering excellence and to be a catalyst on the team
Eagerness to learn and grow as a software engineer
CZI believes that vaccines are one of the most powerful tools to fight COVID-19 and save lives. It aligns to our mission and work to cure, manage, and prevent disease. Proof of completed COVID-19 vaccination will be required for all employees (with the exception of reasonable accommodations due to medical or religious beliefs). All applicants coming onsite to a CZI facility are required to show proof of COVID vaccination or take an onsite COVID test.
_source.description_html:
The Opportunity


Our work in education is aimed at ensuring that every student — not just a lucky few — can get an education that’s tailored to their individual needs and supports every aspect of their development. We’re pairing engineering with grantmaking, impact investing, policy, and advocacy work to help every young person enter adulthood with the skills and abilities they need to reach their full potential — and equip every teacher with the tools and research they need to help students get there.


We know that when students feel supported, cared for, and understood, they thrive. Now more than ever, teachers and students need efficient and supportive tools to ensure education is anchored in relationships and well-being. Along is a new tool designed to achieve exactly that – a free, interactive video journal designed to foster meaningful connections between teachers and students.


Along provides a meaningful space where teachers and students can share one-on-one reflections via recorded video or text conversations and dive into important topics — such as managing stress, staying motivated, and navigating the new challenges these times present. The Along team is looking for a Software Engineer to build scalable and engaging experiences.



You will



  • Drive user impact and delight by working on full-stack projects

  • Collaborate with a cross-functional team to develop and quickly iterate on products and features

  • Support Education team-wide initiatives such as accessibility, performance, and reliability

  • Identify and drive Along team-wide programs to improve product quality, engineering efficiency, and user impact

  • Provide technical leadership and mentoring to other engineers


You have



  • Strong experience as a web developer shipping complex products end-to-end with minimal guidance (5+ years)

  • Proficiency in frontend development (JavaScript, React)

  • Proficiency in server-side web frameworks (Rails a plus)

  • Familiarity with Amazon Web Services a plus

  • Ability and desire to mentor others in achieving engineering excellence and to be a catalyst on the team

  • Eagerness to learn and grow as a software engineer



CZI believes that vaccines are one of the most powerful tools to fight COVID-19 and save lives. It aligns to our mission and work to cure, manage, and prevent disease. Proof of completed COVID-19 vaccination will be required for all employees (with the exception of reasonable accommodations due to medical or religious beliefs). All applicants coming onsite to a CZI facility are required to show proof of COVID vaccination or take an onsite COVID test.

_source.description:
The OpportunityOur goal is to provide every student, and every teacher, the opportunity to reach his or her full potential. The Chan Zuckerberg Initiative supports and develops personalized learning experiences that are passionate about and led by the learner - meeting them where they are cognitively, physically, socially and emotionally. We're looking for engineers to help bring a new personalized learning platform to the globe's generation of students and help advance the potential of humanity.You willDesign, build, and maintain a data platform to support work across multiple products and scrums
Develop pipelines and data products to power research by data scientists with access to data that is accurate, easy to access, and reliable
Scale and maintain our warehouse and associated infrastructure, with a focus on data accuracy, privacy, and security
Partner with cross-functional stakeholders and help members of the initiative adopt and use tools that improve their access to data needed for their work
Be a steward for data at the initiative by improving data usability and data quality in our data warehouse, and educating initiative members about standard methodologies for use of data
You have6+ years Experience in Software Engineering or Data Engineering, working on large-scale data challenges
Experience working on data warehouse and data analytics projects, leveraging platforms like Snowflake, Redshift, Kafka, Hadoop, Airflow, DBT, Amundsen or other data technologies
Expertise with scripting languages such as Python and writing efficient and optimized SQL
Experience with dimensional data modeling and schema design in a database or data warehouse
Experience working with cross-functional partners, evangelizing change and communicating effectively across different teams
Experience working with complex and sensitive data in education space or a related space like healthcare or finance
Passion for education and bringing technology to improving education
_source.description_html:
The Opportunity


Our goal is to provide every student, and every teacher, the opportunity to reach his or her full potential. The Chan Zuckerberg Initiative supports and develops personalized learning experiences that are passionate about and led by the learner - meeting them where they are cognitively, physically, socially and emotionally. We're looking for engineers to help bring a new personalized learning platform to the globe's generation of students and help advance the potential of humanity.


You will



  • Design, build, and maintain a data platform to support work across multiple products and scrums

  • Develop pipelines and data products to power research by data scientists with access to data that is accurate, easy to access, and reliable

  • Scale and maintain our warehouse and associated infrastructure, with a focus on data accuracy, privacy, and security

  • Partner with cross-functional stakeholders and help members of the initiative adopt and use tools that improve their access to data needed for their work

  • Be a steward for data at the initiative by improving data usability and data quality in our data warehouse, and educating initiative members about standard methodologies for use of data


You have



  • 6+ years Experience in Software Engineering or Data Engineering, working on large-scale data challenges

  • Experience working on data warehouse and data analytics projects, leveraging platforms like Snowflake, Redshift, Kafka, Hadoop, Airflow, DBT, Amundsen or other data technologies

  • Expertise with scripting languages such as Python and writing efficient and optimized SQL

  • Experience with dimensional data modeling and schema design in a database or data warehouse

  • Experience working with cross-functional partners, evangelizing change and communicating effectively across different teams

  • Experience working with complex and sensitive data in education space or a related space like healthcare or finance

  • Passion for education and bringing technology to improving education
