_source.position_name: Senior Software Engineer Developer Experience

_source.description:
Linkwell Health, the premier consumer experience company serving health plans and health services organizations, seeks a Senior Software Developer focused on client integrations. The Senior Software Developer will work with Linkwells technology and product teams to build the solutions that support our content marketing and consumer engagement programs. In this position, your Key Performance Areas (KPAs) will include: Innovation Build the next generation of Linkwells content distribution APIs and client integration offerings. 
Advocate for modern solutions that use forward-thinking approaches to deliver content and data. 
Approach business problems with a fresh perspective and informed thinking. 
Identify opportunities to test new approaches, prove value, and roll out winning formulas. 
 Technical Expertise Deliver on product requirements within agreed upon schedules. 
Assess the current development process and offer ideas for improvement. 
Help others on the team to elevate their ideas 
Solve problems when possible, seek answers when necessary.
 Teamwork Contribute to the improvement of the current software in a team-first environment. 
Work with a cross functional team on new features that will make our clients programs more effective. 
Add new tools to increase the impact of our content creators. 
 In this position, your Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) will be: Make it easier for clients to integrate with Linkwells content management system. 
Deliver stable, tested, production-ready code. 
Maintain an understanding of the current product and tech stack.
Assist in software updates and patches as needed. 
Transparency regarding timelines, obstacles, and resources.
Our ideal candidate will have: Bachelors degree in IS, CS or related field. 
5 + Years professional experience as a developer.
Professional experience building APIs or similar content distribution solutions. 
Expert understanding of APIs, REST, JSON:API, feeds, web publishing, and content management. 
Experience working with Drupal and PHP, or an excited willingness to learn Drupal. 
Experience developing content management systems, web-centric software, and/or SaaS applications. 
Prior work in content marketing or publishing a plus. 
An entrepreneurial spirit and team-first attitude. 
This position is fully remote but could require occasional travel to client locations and Linkwells New York office, post-pandemic. Salary commensurate with experience. Linkwell Health is an equal opportunity employer offering competitive benefit packages, including healthcare, 401(k), and stipends for wellness and remote work. ABOUT US:Linkwell Health is a content- and technology-driven company that creates digital content marketing solutions to help health plans and health services companies better engage and build trust with their audiences. We create, develop, and deliver best-in-class health and wellness content across video, web, email, mobile, social, and print. Our mission? To drive brand awareness, audience development, and digital engagement for our clients, while simultaneously creating healthy experiences for consumers.Our core capabilities are Content + Technology + Talent, and our unique expertise is moving the needle with consumers and helping them to do things to improve their health
_source.description_html:
Linkwell Health, the premier consumer experience company serving health plans and health services organizations, seeks a Senior Software Developer focused on client integrations. The Senior Software Developer will work with Linkwells technology and product teams to build the solutions that support our content marketing and consumer engagement programs.

In this position, your Key Performance Areas (KPAs) will include:

Innovation


  • Build the next generation of Linkwells content distribution APIs and client integration offerings.


  • Advocate for modern solutions that use forward-thinking approaches to deliver content and data.


  • Approach business problems with a fresh perspective and informed thinking.


  • Identify opportunities to test new approaches, prove value, and roll out winning formulas.


Technical Expertise


  • Deliver on product requirements within agreed upon schedules.


  • Assess the current development process and offer ideas for improvement.


  • Help others on the team to elevate their ideas


  • Solve problems when possible, seek answers when necessary.


Teamwork


  • Contribute to the improvement of the current software in a team-first environment.


  • Work with a cross functional team on new features that will make our clients programs more effective.


  • Add new tools to increase the impact of our content creators.


In this position, your Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) will be:


  • Make it easier for clients to integrate with Linkwells content management system.

  • Deliver stable, tested, production-ready code.

  • Maintain an understanding of the current product and tech stack.

  • Assist in software updates and patches as needed.

  • Transparency regarding timelines, obstacles, and resources.

Our ideal candidate will have:


  • Bachelors degree in IS, CS or related field.

  • 5 + Years professional experience as a developer.

  • Professional experience building APIs or similar content distribution solutions.

  • Expert understanding of APIs, REST, JSON:API, feeds, web publishing, and content management.

  • Experience working with Drupal and PHP, or an excited willingness to learn Drupal.

  • Experience developing content management systems, web-centric software, and/or SaaS applications.

  • Prior work in content marketing or publishing a plus.

  • An entrepreneurial spirit and team-first attitude.

This position is fully remote but could require occasional travel to client locations and Linkwells New York office, post-pandemic. Salary commensurate with experience.

Linkwell Health is an equal opportunity employer offering competitive benefit packages, including healthcare, 401(k), and stipends for wellness and remote work.

ABOUT US:

Linkwell Health is a content- and technology-driven company that creates digital content marketing solutions to help health plans and health services companies better engage and build trust with their audiences. We create, develop, and deliver best-in-class health and wellness content across video, web, email, mobile, social, and print. Our mission? To drive brand awareness, audience development, and digital engagement for our clients, while simultaneously creating healthy experiences for consumers.

Our core capabilities are Content + Technology + Talent, and our unique expertise is moving the needle with consumers and helping them to do things to improve their health
_source.position_name: Senior Software Developer

_source.description:
ABOUT BLUEMODUS:We are a fully remote technology agency - composed of colleagues who bring a daily commitment to transparency, efficiency, and helping. We approach our clients and colleagues with sincerity - and recognize that innovative tech solutions pair best with wholehearted teams.Many companies talk about their awesome offices, flexible schedules, and cool events. We can, too. Great benefits, a 100% remote culture, ongoing training, and learning are part of BlueModus. But when you come to work here, you also become a part of an incredible team that we think separates us from other tech companies. We have created a culture that attracts bright, passionate, caring people who sincerely want to do their best for clients and each other.WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:Maintaining and growing mutually valuable relationships with our clients, whose projects include medium to large website, webstore, and intranet builds leveraging content management systems (CMS), including Kentico, Sitecore, Umbraco, Sitefinity, and Contentstack.
Owning 10 andndash; 12 mid-large client relationships and ensuring frequent communication and deep understanding of their needs.
Working closely with clients to identify their specific needs and business objectives to determine products and services that help achieve those goals.
Contributing to an agile project team consisting of Designers, UX/UI Developers, Web Developers, Solution Leads, Projects Managers, and Strategists to help understand and document client requirements, estimate work, develop new solutions, and enhance existing solutions.
Working with the project team to ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget, adhere to high-quality standards, and meet customer expectations.
Leading client discovery sessions and providing support and guidance for content modeling, sitemap development, and wireframing.
Actively leading or participating in regular update meetings, roadmap sessions and acting as the first point of escalation for client concerns regarding projects and services.
Consistently developing new business within assigned existing clients, including meeting or exceeding mutually agreed upon revenue targets and strategic objectives.
Assisting the business development team in pre-sales activity (RFPs, Proposals, ROMs, LOEs) to capture new accounts, as needed.
Promoting and collaborating on our development and coding best practices.
WHAT YOU NEED:5+ years of experience in account management, project management, or similar work.
3+ years of experience in enterprise-level application development projects.
2+ years of experience working in an agency environment with multiple clients.
Balance of business and technology backgrounds.
Ability to interface and communicate with clients, including top-level management and key stakeholders.
Strong organizational skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to have intelligent conversations regarding project requirements and objectives with technical and non-technical staff; conveying requirements to the technical team to set development objectives and technical terms to non-technical clients.
Experience managing and organizing several work streams with different priorities.
Willingness and ability to make difficult, complex decisions.
Willingness assumes responsibility and ownership.
Ability to maintain a positive work attitude.
Ability to work with other people and teams.
Ability to work collaboratively with a team and project stakeholders.
WHAT WE LOVE FINDING:Moderate-to-high technical skills, as you must be able to act as a strategic consultant in development engagements.
Self-starter, who demonstrates personal initiative.
High personal work standards, honest, and trustworthiness.
Strong negotiation, mediation, and conflict resolution skills.
Fun, enthusiastic, dynamic personality.
Willingness to help others.
Experience in product management.
Some experience with C# and .Net in general.
BENEFITS:Competitive salary between $105,000 to $125,000, with annual increases based on performance.
Ability to work fully remote at home andndash; we are a 100% virtual company.
Get the checkup you and your family need with excellent health, dental, vision, and disability coverage.
Recharge your batteries with ample paid time off, including 9 holidays and 20 vacation/flex days.
Plan for your future with our 401(k) plan and 3% employer match.
Team building andldquo;funandrdquo; days and other company-sponsored activities in different cities throughout the year.
Whether you are an early riser or a snooze master, pick a schedule that works for you with flexible working hours.
Tuition reimbursement and professional development opportunities with conferences and training.
_source.description_html:
ABOUT BLUEMODUS:


We are a fully remote technology agency - composed of colleagues who bring a daily commitment to transparency, efficiency, and helping. We approach our clients and colleagues with sincerity - and recognize that innovative tech solutions pair best with wholehearted teams.


Many companies talk about their awesome offices, flexible schedules, and cool events. We can, too. Great benefits, a 100% remote culture, ongoing training, and learning are part of BlueModus. But when you come to work here, you also become a part of an incredible team that we think separates us from other tech companies. We have created a culture that attracts bright, passionate, caring people who sincerely want to do their best for clients and each other.


WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:



  • Maintaining and growing mutually valuable relationships with our clients, whose projects include medium to large website, webstore, and intranet builds leveraging content management systems (CMS), including Kentico, Sitecore, Umbraco, Sitefinity, and Contentstack.

  • Owning 10 – 12 mid-large client relationships and ensuring frequent communication and deep understanding of their needs.

  • Working closely with clients to identify their specific needs and business objectives to determine products and services that help achieve those goals.

  • Contributing to an agile project team consisting of Designers, UX/UI Developers, Web Developers, Solution Leads, Projects Managers, and Strategists to help understand and document client requirements, estimate work, develop new solutions, and enhance existing solutions.

  • Working with the project team to ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget, adhere to high-quality standards, and meet customer expectations.

  • Leading client discovery sessions and providing support and guidance for content modeling, sitemap development, and wireframing.

  • Actively leading or participating in regular update meetings, roadmap sessions and acting as the first point of escalation for client concerns regarding projects and services.

  • Consistently developing new business within assigned existing clients, including meeting or exceeding mutually agreed upon revenue targets and strategic objectives.

  • Assisting the business development team in pre-sales activity (RFPs, Proposals, ROMs, LOEs) to capture new accounts, as needed.

  • Promoting and collaborating on our development and coding best practices.


WHAT YOU NEED:



  • 5+ years of experience in account management, project management, or similar work.

  • 3+ years of experience in enterprise-level application development projects.

  • 2+ years of experience working in an agency environment with multiple clients.

  • Balance of business and technology backgrounds.

  • Ability to interface and communicate with clients, including top-level management and key stakeholders.

  • Strong organizational skills.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

  • Ability to have intelligent conversations regarding project requirements and objectives with technical and non-technical staff; conveying requirements to the technical team to set development objectives and technical terms to non-technical clients.

  • Experience managing and organizing several work streams with different priorities.

  • Willingness and ability to make difficult, complex decisions.

  • Willingness assumes responsibility and ownership.

  • Ability to maintain a positive work attitude.

  • Ability to work with other people and teams.

  • Ability to work collaboratively with a team and project stakeholders.


WHAT WE LOVE FINDING:



  • Moderate-to-high technical skills, as you must be able to act as a strategic consultant in development engagements.

  • Self-starter, who demonstrates personal initiative.

  • High personal work standards, honest, and trustworthiness.

  • Strong negotiation, mediation, and conflict resolution skills.

  • Fun, enthusiastic, dynamic personality.

  • Willingness to help others.

  • Experience in product management.

  • Some experience with C# and .Net in general.


BENEFITS:



  • Competitive salary between $105,000 to $125,000, with annual increases based on performance.

  • Ability to work fully remote at home – we are a 100% virtual company.

  • Get the checkup you and your family need with excellent health, dental, vision, and disability coverage.

  • Recharge your batteries with ample paid time off, including 9 holidays and 20 vacation/flex days.

  • Plan for your future with our 401(k) plan and 3% employer match.

  • Team building “fun” days and other company-sponsored activities in different cities throughout the year.

  • Whether you are an early riser or a snooze master, pick a schedule that works for you with flexible working hours.

  • Tuition reimbursement and professional development opportunities with conferences & training.

_source.description:
This engineering role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux to build a career with Canonical and drive the success with those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have an affinity for open source development and a passion for technology with an interest in business operations, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.The Commercial Systems engineering team's mission is seamless access and integration to Canonical services that provide added value to the already rich open-source universe. Building a combination of home-grown systems and integration with existing open-source technologies, off-the shelf SaaS such as Salesforce and public cloud marketplaces, the team enables sales, operations, support and delivery at Canonical to scale.As a member of the team and in cooperation with internal stakeholders you will be challenged to identify, design and implement or improve internal business processes and deliver solutions at scale the highest engineering quality. As part of an established and fully remote team your daily tasks will be mostly focused on coding, reviewing, testing, delivery and maintenance of solutions across a range of products/solutions including Salesforce.Key ResponsibilitiesDevelop services, features, and enhancements in Go or Python.
Analyze, design, implement, deploy and maintain distributed systems responsible for financial transactions and product entitlements.
Integrate our commercial solutions with public cloud marketplaces and APIs.
Stay up-to-date on and apply the latest developments in public cloud marketplaces, APIs and features.
Work within a team in an agile manner on design, implementation, testing and code reviews in an iterative manner.
Take ownership of services deployed to production that satisfy diverse interests across our company.
Assist in meeting with internal stakeholders to help gather requirements and set priorities.
Required Skills and ExperienceBachelor's degree or equivalent in Computer Science or related engineering field.
5+ years of experience as a software developer in Go, Python, C/C++, Java, or another high-level language.
Proven ability to consistently deliver robust code to production.
Experience with building and evolving distributed systems and APIs.
Experience with developing and deploying for Ubuntu Linux in public clouds is a plus.
Experience with integrating authentication and authorization, financial, public cloud or marketplace systems is a plus.
Experience with SalesForce or APEX is a plus.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
Ability to collaborate remotely with a diverse set of team members and stakeholders and remain highly motivated, productive, and organized.
Able to travel to international destinations for 1 week at a time, approximately 2-4 times per year. Locations prior to the global pandemic included New York, Seattle, London, Cape Town, Budapest, Berlin, Montreal, and Brussels.
About CanonicalCanonical is a growing, international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu -- the worlds #1 cloud operating system. Our mission is to realize the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu. We offer: Learning and Development
Annual Compensation Review
Recognition Rewards
Annual Leave
Priority Pass for travel
Flexible working option
Canonical believes a diverse workforce enhances our ability to deliver world class software and services which meet the worlds computing needs. We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.#LI-Remote #stack
_source.description_html:
This engineering role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux to build a career with Canonical and drive the success with those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have an affinity for open source development and a passion for technology with an interest in business operations, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.


The Commercial Systems engineering team's mission is seamless access and integration to Canonical services that provide added value to the already rich open-source universe. Building a combination of home-grown systems and integration with existing open-source technologies, off-the shelf SaaS such as Salesforce and public cloud marketplaces, the team enables sales, operations, support and delivery at Canonical to scale.


As a member of the team and in cooperation with internal stakeholders you will be challenged to identify, design and implement or improve internal business processes and deliver solutions at scale the highest engineering quality. As part of an established and fully remote team your daily tasks will be mostly focused on coding, reviewing, testing, delivery and maintenance of solutions across a range of products/solutions including Salesforce.


Key Responsibilities



  • Develop services, features, and enhancements in Go or Python.

  • Analyze, design, implement, deploy and maintain distributed systems responsible for financial transactions and product entitlements.

  • Integrate our commercial solutions with public cloud marketplaces and APIs.

  • Stay up-to-date on and apply the latest developments in public cloud marketplaces, APIs and features.

  • Work within a team in an agile manner on design, implementation, testing and code reviews in an iterative manner.

  • Take ownership of services deployed to production that satisfy diverse interests across our company.

  • Assist in meeting with internal stakeholders to help gather requirements and set priorities.


Required Skills and Experience



  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Computer Science or related engineering field.

  • 5+ years of experience as a software developer in Go, Python, C/C++, Java, or another high-level language.

  • Proven ability to consistently deliver robust code to production.

  • Experience with building and evolving distributed systems and APIs.

  • Experience with developing and deploying for Ubuntu Linux in public clouds is a plus.

  • Experience with integrating authentication & authorization, financial, public cloud or marketplace systems is a plus.

  • Experience with SalesForce or APEX is a plus.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.

  • Ability to collaborate remotely with a diverse set of team members and stakeholders and remain highly motivated, productive, and organized.

  • Able to travel to international destinations for 1 week at a time, approximately 2-4 times per year. Locations prior to the global pandemic included New York, Seattle, London, Cape Town, Budapest, Berlin, Montreal, and Brussels.


About Canonical


Canonical is a growing, international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu -- the worlds #1 cloud operating system. Our mission is to realize the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.


We offer:



  • Learning and Development

  • Annual Compensation Review

  • Recognition Rewards

  • Annual Leave

  • Priority Pass for travel

  • Flexible working option


Canonical believes a diverse workforce enhances our ability to deliver world class software and services which meet the worlds computing needs. We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

_source.description:
About SideroWe've created Ireland's best team of software developers to build the mission critical software that powers some of the world's most successful companies. We solve their business problems through agile and cloud native software innovation. They choose us because we offer the cutting-edge talent they need to change faster, easier and more profitably; but they stay with us long term because we deliver every time.
DescriptionSidero have a fantastic opportunity for Java Engineers who want to explore the world of innovative software product development within a next generation enterprise platform. The project involves both transformation and building new services to be offered to customers. We are looking for team players who wants to be part of this challenging project working in a high-performance Agile Engineering team.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: On a day to day basis you will be creating, modifying and testing code. You will be working within a Software Engineering Scrum Team on innovative projects.Some of the latest technologies we work with include Enterprise Java, EJB, Microservices, Docker, Kubernetes and Helm.It is expected that you are able to work with agile methodology and handle issues in a manner that complies with the way of working and java design guidelines set out by the Product Owner, Scrum Master and the client.It is expected that you bring your own experience and ideas to the development process and you will be responsible for developing high-quality java code in an agile environment. Your work will include unit testing and other types of functional and non-functional testing. You will be required to interface with customers and stakeholders and mitigate risk.BASIC REQUIREMENTS:
A 3rd level degree in Computer Science / IT or related discipline
Object oriented analysis and design experience
Excellent level of English is essential
TECHNICAL SKILLS:Essential:Knowledge of software design to ensure code is of a high standard
Ability to develop solutions for user stories by writing the code and then testing the solution
Development of code which is bug free using knowledge of Core Java
Ability to debug applications to find the root cause of issues
Industry experience working with: Java/Java EE, Junit, JMeter, Maven, ANT, GIT, SVN, BitBucket, Jenkins etc.
Experience working withDocker, Kubernetes and Helm
Fundamental understanding of web-based programming and development systems; experience with Ruby on Rails is desirable.
Knowledge in developing scalable and highly available software
Experience of working in an Agile environment with scrum software development teams
Analytical skills in order to ensure high standard of the code produced
Desirable:Java Certification such as OCA/OCP/OCM
Experience with Front-end Web Technologies like JavaScript OR AngularJS
Knowledge in building cloud native applications
Knowledge of CI/CD
OTHER SKILLS:Displays ability to collaborate with other team members in order to reach the best solution to a problem
Shows ability to prioritise issues during busy periods in order to ensure optimum performance
Shows willingness to learn from others in order to ensure that solution proposed is the best solution
Excellent communication skills
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to work on own initiative
Ability to work consistently as part of a team in order to provide adequate support to all staff members when completing tasks
Displays ability to receive feedback in order to foster a learning environment within the workplace
Ability to work efficiently in a timely manner when solving customer issues
Ability to assist and coach new team members to maximise team performance
Displays willingness to actively listen and give full attention to what others are saying
Fosters a culture of self-improvement throughout the team
BenefitsRemote working options - Flexible working options -Learning and Development support - English lessons -Employee Wellness and Wellbeing - Health Insurance - Life Assurance - Pension - and more...

Looking for your next challenge? Would you like mentoring other engineers while contributing to and developing the product that aspires to deliver 100% relevant content?


We are looking for you!


Join us and lead our Platform team in delivering front-end and middle-tier solutions for internal and external customers by adhering to software development best practices, dealing with roadblocks in a timely manner, coaching and mentoring your team as you help them develop the skills and abilities they need to excel in their role(s).


If you join us, what will you do?



  • Lead and inspire current team members to develop the best possible software solutions. Be in charge of their current day to day while making sure they are growing in their careers.

  • Ensure team capacity and follow through on commitments.

  • Work closely with internal stakeholders such as product, quality, architects, and other team leads.

  • Deliver weekly status for ongoing projects.

  • Strive for delivering the highest quality code and solutions.


In order to be great at your job, you’ll need to have:



  • 2+ years of experience managing a team

  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to discuss technical issues with team members of varied technical backgrounds

  • Expert in C#/DotNet

  • The ability to value different opinions and be open to feedback

  • Computer science knowledge

  • Azure experience

  • Experience working remotely - advantage
_source.position_name: Software Engineering Manager - Remote - US Only at Jeeng () (allows remote)

_source.description:
Linkwell Health, the premier consumer experience company serving health plans and health services organizations, seeks a Senior Software Developer focused on client integrations. The Senior Software Developer will work with Linkwells technology and product teams to build the solutions that support our content marketing and consumer engagement programs. In this position, your Key Performance Areas (KPAs) will include: Innovation Build the next generation of Linkwells content distribution APIs and client integration offerings. 
Advocate for modern solutions that use forward-thinking approaches to deliver content and data. 
Approach business problems with a fresh perspective and informed thinking. 
Identify opportunities to test new approaches, prove value, and roll out winning formulas. 
 Technical Expertise Deliver on product requirements within agreed upon schedules. 
Assess the current development process and offer ideas for improvement. 
Help others on the team to elevate their ideas 
Solve problems when possible, seek answers when necessary.
 Teamwork Contribute to the improvement of the current software in a team-first environment. 
Work with a cross functional team on new features that will make our clients programs more effective. 
Add new tools to increase the impact of our content creators. 
 In this position, your Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) will be: Make it easier for clients to integrate with Linkwells content management system. 
Deliver stable, tested, production-ready code. 
Maintain an understanding of the current product and tech stack.
Assist in software updates and patches as needed. 
Transparency regarding timelines, obstacles, and resources.
Our ideal candidate will have: Bachelors degree in IS, CS or related field. 
5 + Years professional experience as a developer.
Professional experience building APIs or similar content distribution solutions. 
Expert understanding of APIs, REST, JSON:API, feeds, web publishing, and content management. 
Experience working with Drupal and PHP, or an excited willingness to learn Drupal. 
Experience developing content management systems, web-centric software, and/or SaaS applications. 
Prior work in content marketing or publishing a plus. 
An entrepreneurial spirit and team-first attitude. 
This position is fully remote but could require occasional travel to client locations and Linkwells New York office, post-pandemic. Salary commensurate with experience. Linkwell Health is an equal opportunity employer offering competitive benefit packages, including healthcare, 401(k), and stipends for wellness and remote work. ABOUT US:Linkwell Health is a content- and technology-driven company that creates digital content marketing solutions to help health plans and health services companies better engage and build trust with their audiences. We create, develop, and deliver best-in-class health and wellness content across video, web, email, mobile, social, and print. Our mission? To drive brand awareness, audience development, and digital engagement for our clients, while simultaneously creating healthy experiences for consumers.Our core capabilities are Content + Technology + Talent, and our unique expertise is moving the needle with consumers and helping them to do things to improve their health

Linkwell Health, the premier consumer experience company serving health plans and health services organizations, seeks a Senior Software Developer focused on client integrations. The Senior Software Developer will work with Linkwells technology and product teams to build the solutions that support our content marketing and consumer engagement programs.

In this position, your Key Performance Areas (KPAs) will include:

Innovation


  • Build the next generation of Linkwells content distribution APIs and client integration offerings.


  • Advocate for modern solutions that use forward-thinking approaches to deliver content and data.


  • Approach business problems with a fresh perspective and informed thinking.


  • Identify opportunities to test new approaches, prove value, and roll out winning formulas.


Technical Expertise


  • Deliver on product requirements within agreed upon schedules.


  • Assess the current development process and offer ideas for improvement.


  • Help others on the team to elevate their ideas


  • Solve problems when possible, seek answers when necessary.


Teamwork


  • Contribute to the improvement of the current software in a team-first environment.


  • Work with a cross functional team on new features that will make our clients programs more effective.


  • Add new tools to increase the impact of our content creators.


In this position, your Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) will be:


  • Make it easier for clients to integrate with Linkwells content management system.

  • Deliver stable, tested, production-ready code.

  • Maintain an understanding of the current product and tech stack.

  • Assist in software updates and patches as needed.

  • Transparency regarding timelines, obstacles, and resources.

Our ideal candidate will have:


  • Bachelors degree in IS, CS or related field.

  • 5 + Years professional experience as a developer.

  • Professional experience building APIs or similar content distribution solutions.

  • Expert understanding of APIs, REST, JSON:API, feeds, web publishing, and content management.

  • Experience working with Drupal and PHP, or an excited willingness to learn Drupal.

  • Experience developing content management systems, web-centric software, and/or SaaS applications.

  • Prior work in content marketing or publishing a plus.

  • An entrepreneurial spirit and team-first attitude.

This position is fully remote but could require occasional travel to client locations and Linkwells New York office, post-pandemic. Salary commensurate with experience.

Linkwell Health is an equal opportunity employer offering competitive benefit packages, including healthcare, 401(k), and stipends for wellness and remote work.

ABOUT US:

Linkwell Health is a content- and technology-driven company that creates digital content marketing solutions to help health plans and health services companies better engage and build trust with their audiences. We create, develop, and deliver best-in-class health and wellness content across video, web, email, mobile, social, and print. Our mission? To drive brand awareness, audience development, and digital engagement for our clients, while simultaneously creating healthy experiences for consumers.

Our core capabilities are Content + Technology + Talent, and our unique expertise is moving the needle with consumers and helping them to do things to improve their health

_source.description_html:
Position: Senior or Lead Full Stack Engineer


Comp: $140K - $210K (heavily dependent on experience level and work location) + Cisco RSUs + 12-15% performance bonus + 401k matching (up to 4.5%) + sign-on bonus


Location: Fully Remote anywhere in the US or Canada


At Meraki, we’re making IT easier, faster, and smarter. Our full-stack teams build and maintain our web applications, which manages millions of network devices from our cloud. Our customers use the Meraki dashboard to monitor and configure critical IT infrastructure that serves tens of millions of people every single day.


Meraki’s product Dashboard teams are small, fast-moving teams striving to make our products unique by balancing feature-rich abilities and simplicity. Our full-stack engineers are well versed in a wide array of CS concepts and excited to jump around languages, platforms, and all levels of the Meraki stack!


WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:



  • Develop tools for customers to configure and monitor networking devices all over the world.

  • Build intuitive and powerful workflows to solve important problems for IT professionals around the world, by collaborating with product managers and UX designers.

  • Be a technical leader by helping other engineers make architectural design decisions while evangelizing engineering best practices.


WHAT YOU MAY HAVE:



  • 5+ years of experience writing professional production code and tests.

  • 3+ years of experience in building rich web UIs with React (and Redux).

  • 3+ years of experience in web backend technologies, like Ruby on Rails or Go.

  • Would thrive in a small engineering team and are excited to solve open-ended problems across the stack.

  • Are a strong leading individual contributor and want to grow into a tech lead role.


BONUS IF YOU HAVE:



  • Experience with Ruby on Rails, React, and Postgres.

  • Experience or willing to work in an agile environment (Scrum, Kanban, etc.).

  • Have working knowledge of network protocols used on both local and wide-area networks.

_source.description:
Your New CompanyAt Frontify, our mission is simple. We create the best and most user-friendly brand management platform - a platform that enables anyone to deliver compelling and consistent brand experiences. Today, Frontify is empowering thousands of different-sized companies around the world, including Facebook, Lufthansa, Vodafone, and Allianz.Frontify is a scaleup company with over 200 employees. Weandrsquo;re an international team andndash; with our headquarters in St. Gallen, Switzerland a growing team in the US; and colleagues working remotely from all over Europe. Frontify is built on a collaborative culture of experimentation, trust, and transparency. We believe in being happy and fulfilled at work, and let our personalities shine through everything we do. Does this sound like the place for you? Then read on.Your TeamYour new team is a group of motivated, collaborative, and innovative people. They are designers, product managers, and developers from more than seven different countries. They enjoy working together to create and evolve a well-loved product but always keep room for new ideas and approaches. Aside from work, some of them are parents, gamers, bookworms, adrenaline junkies, and so much more! 
Your MissionYouandrsquo;ll join our mission to make Frontify a place for all brands to thrive. Youandrsquo;ll take our brand management platform to new heights by building and enhancing the platform used by Lufthansa, Facebook, and many more.Do you want to have a visible impact on a fast-growing platform? Come start a brand new journey with our dynamic, interdisciplinary team.Your StoryRemote work is possible if: Youandrsquo;re located in Europe and hold a valid working permit for the country you live in.
Youandrsquo;re a master in either PHP or Javascript andndash; and youandrsquo;re comfortable with the other.
You have andndash; at one point in your life andndash; heard about Nginx webservers, MySQL databases, and Linux (CentOS/RedHat).
You love to write clean, structured, and well-tested code.
When faced with limits and ambiguity, you become more andndash; not less andndash; creative.
You care about performance.
Your friends would describe you as driven, motivated, and honest.
You speak English.
GoodiesFrontify is more than a dynamic company with plenty of opportunities to build a collective future. Itandrsquo;s a vibrant, united community thatandrsquo;ll support you as you strike out on your journey. Our office is pretty great (we canandrsquo;t wait to show you), although, itandrsquo;s our culture of innovation, learning, freedom, and happiness that we canandrsquo;t wait to share with you. Our word only counts for so much andndash; start the conversation.Next stepsSend us your CV and some nice words: Weandrsquo;ll get back to you within a week.
Virtual call with Marc: Youandrsquo;ll meet Marc, our Head Engineer, to discuss Frontify, the role, and you andndash; your passions, your skills, you.
Virtually meet the team: Youandrsquo;ll meet your new team over a few calls. Youandrsquo;ll discuss the role, showcase your skills through your answers or a case study (or both), and get a feel for the brand new journey thatandrsquo;s awaiting you.
Join us: If all goes well, youandrsquo;ll join Frontifyandrsquo;s journey soon.
_source.description_html:
Your New Company


At Frontify, our mission is simple. We create the best and most user-friendly brand management platform - a platform that enables anyone to deliver compelling and consistent brand experiences. Today, Frontify is empowering thousands of different-sized companies around the world, including Facebook, Lufthansa, Vodafone, and Allianz.


Frontify is a scaleup company with over 200 employees. We’re an international team – with our headquarters in St. Gallen, Switzerland; a growing team in the US; and colleagues working remotely from all over Europe. Frontify is built on a collaborative culture of experimentation, trust, and transparency. We believe in being happy and fulfilled at work, and let our personalities shine through everything we do. Does this sound like the place for you? Then read on.


Your Team


Your new team is a group of motivated, collaborative, and innovative people. They are designers, product managers, and developers from more than seven different countries. They enjoy working together to create and evolve a well-loved product but always keep room for new ideas and approaches. Aside from work, some of them are parents, gamers, bookworms, adrenaline junkies, and so much more!


Your Mission


You’ll join our mission to make Frontify a place for all brands to thrive. You’ll take our brand management platform to new heights by building and enhancing the platform used by Lufthansa, Facebook, and many more.


Do you want to have a visible impact on a fast-growing platform? Come start a brand new journey with our dynamic, interdisciplinary team.


Your Story



  • Remote work is possible if: You’re located in Europe and hold a valid working permit for the country you live in.

  • You’re a master in either PHP or Javascript – and you’re comfortable with the other.

  • You have – at one point in your life – heard about Nginx webservers, MySQL databases, and Linux (CentOS/RedHat).

  • You love to write clean, structured, and well-tested code.

  • When faced with limits and ambiguity, you become more – not less – creative.

  • You care about performance.

  • Your friends would describe you as driven, motivated, and honest.

  • You speak English.


Goodies


Frontify is more than a dynamic company with plenty of opportunities to build a collective future. It’s a vibrant, united community that’ll support you as you strike out on your journey. Our office is pretty great (we can’t wait to show you), although, it’s our culture of innovation, learning, freedom, and happiness that we can’t wait to share with you. Our word only counts for so much – start the conversation.


Next steps




  1. Send us your CV and some nice words: We’ll get back to you within a week.




  2. Virtual call with Marc: You’ll meet Marc, our Head Engineer, to discuss Frontify, the role, and you – your passions, your skills, you.




  3. Virtually meet the team: You’ll meet your new team over a few calls. You’ll discuss the role, showcase your skills through your answers or a case study (or both), and get a feel for the brand new journey that’s awaiting you.




  4. Join us: If all goes well, you’ll join Frontify’s journey soon.
_source.position_name: Senior Full Stack Developer at Frontify AG (St. Gallen, Switzerland) (allows remote)

Have you always wanted to make a difference in millions of peopleandrsquo;s everyday lives? To work with the brightest minds in the most technologically advanced unit in Finlandandrsquo;s biggest private employer? To enjoy benefits that no other company in this nation can offer to its employees? Look no further! SOK is looking for QA Engineer to strengthen its rapidly growing QA community, and start building a team that builds end-to-end automated QA solutions for the whole SOK SAP S/4HANA community e.g. retail and FICO.QA Engineer, SAP (two positions)If we fast-forward the actual recruitment process, here is how your role as a QA Engineer at SOK would look like:First we expect you to get to know the domain, tech and people.
Then you start to understand objectives and requirements for test automation across SOK's business areas.
Eventually you choose, design and take ownership on test automation solutions and tools that have the best fit for SOK's business critical SAP solutions and processes.
You will also lead the deployment of test automation and expand the coverage together with the teams working with SAP solutions and processes.
As this is a team effort, youandrsquo;ll be working closely with experts and specialists from development, design, business, operations and QA - all eager, waiting and willing to get to work with you!Hello, is it you weandrsquo;re looking for?We value well-rounded QA professionals, who are also willing to break out from the conventional QA mold when needed. The ideal candidate would have following experience and personal qualities:Capability to manage large entities and experience on quality assurance of long end-to-end processes.
Passion to build and lead QA automation efforts all across SOK within SAP context.
History in building and maintaining end-to-end test automation solutions in SAP ERP environments. Experience on SAP S/4HANA and e.g. SAP Retail is an asset.
Hands-on skills in test automation technologies and methodologies that are used to bring visibility to different quality dimensions in development and production.
A habit for active communication and collaboration with all kinds of people.
Ability to comprehend new technologies and working models rapidly.
Academic and/or work-related background in coding.
In work-related matter you communicate fluently in English.
Whatandrsquo;s in it for you?On top of respectful salary, superb company benefits and the finest colleagues, this is what we offer in return:An opportunity to improve and have influence on the daily lives of millions of people. The SAP environment at SOK is one of the most extensive in Finland and it interfaces with hundreds of other business critical systems.
Concrete and rewarding end-results, which you can experience yourself by using S Groupandrsquo;s services, when doing your grocery shopping, fueling or staying in a hotel, for example.
Control. Our ways of working are not set in stone. You will be continuously improving how the products and services are developed in the biggest private employer in Finland.
Respect. We value your effort and trust that you get the job done within reasonable workload. You choose your daily work rhythm and location.
An opportunity to gain know-how on technical competence on wide-ranging development areas and technology domains (like web, mobile and cloud) and businesses (banking, online retail, hospitality, service stations).

_source.description_html:
Have you always wanted to make a difference in millions of people’s everyday lives? To work with the brightest minds in the most technologically advanced unit in Finland’s biggest private employer? To enjoy benefits that no other company in this nation can offer to its employees? Look no further! SOK is looking for QA Engineer to strengthen its rapidly growing QA community, and start building a team that builds end-to-end automated QA solutions for the whole SOK SAP S/4HANA community e.g. retail and FICO.



QA Engineer, SAP (two positions)



If we fast-forward the actual recruitment process, here is how your role as a QA Engineer at SOK would look like:




  • First we expect you to get to know the domain, tech and people.




  • Then you start to understand objectives and requirements for test automation across SOK's business areas.




  • Eventually you choose, design and take ownership on test automation solutions and tools that have the best fit for SOK's business critical SAP solutions and processes.




  • You will also lead the deployment of test automation and expand the coverage together with the teams working with SAP solutions and processes.




As this is a team effort, you’ll be working closely with experts and specialists from development, design, business, operations and QA - all eager, waiting and willing to get to work with you!



Hello, is it you we’re looking for?


We value well-rounded QA professionals, who are also willing to break out from the conventional QA mold when needed. The ideal candidate would have following experience and personal qualities:




  • Capability to manage large entities and experience on quality assurance of long end-to-end processes.




  • Passion to build and lead QA automation efforts all across SOK within SAP context.




  • History in building and maintaining end-to-end test automation solutions in SAP ERP environments. Experience on SAP S/4HANA and e.g. SAP Retail is an asset.




  • Hands-on skills in test automation technologies and methodologies that are used to bring visibility to different quality dimensions in development and production.




  • A habit for active communication and collaboration with all kinds of people.




  • Ability to comprehend new technologies and working models rapidly.




  • Academic and/or work-related background in coding.




  • In work-related matter you communicate fluently in English.





What’s in it for you?


On top of respectful salary, superb company benefits and the finest colleagues, this is what we offer in return:




  • An opportunity to improve and have influence on the daily lives of millions of people. The SAP environment at SOK is one of the most extensive in Finland and it interfaces with hundreds of other business critical systems.




  • Concrete and rewarding end-results, which you can experience yourself by using S Group’s services, when doing your grocery shopping, fueling or staying in a hotel, for example.




  • Control. Our ways of working are not set in stone. You will be continuously improving how the products and services are developed in the biggest private employer in Finland.




  • Respect. We value your effort and trust that you get the job done within reasonable workload. You choose your daily work rhythm and location.




  • An opportunity to gain know-how on technical competence on wide-ranging development areas and technology domains (like web, mobile and cloud) and businesses (banking, online retail, hospitality, service stations).




  • The growth of our QA tribe has been immense. This network of leading experts in QA will provide you the level of support and vision only possible in SOK.





How to apply


Are you what we are looking for? In that case we would be glad to talk with you and entertain the idea of you joining our ranks! Please apply on Sunday, 6th of February 2022, the latest. We will contact you as soon as we have processed your application, so you don’t need to wait too long.


If you want more information about the role, the team, SOK in general or something else, please contact IT Talent Acquisition Specialist Anna Ruokamo (anna.ruokamo(a)sok.fi or +358 44 564 2794).
_source.position_name: QA Engineer, SAP at Suomen Osuuskauppojen Keskuskunta (SOK) (Helsinki, Finland)

_source.description:
As a Backend Software Engineer, you will predominantly be responsible for enabling all new functionality in our client/server PMM product using Golang. This is an amazing opportunity to build something from the ground up and integrate our existing Client Server products with Cloud to deliver a new wave of services and functionality to our users.Percona Monitoring and Management (PMM) is a free and open-source platform for monitoring and managing the performance of SQL/NoSQL based databases and servers or cloud instances.
https://www.percona.com/doc/percona-monitoring-and-management/2.x/index.html
https://github.com/percona/pmmWhat You Will Do
 Develop scalable, high-volume, performant applications focused on simplicity and user delight
 Produce high-quality software that is unit tested, code reviewed and checked in regularly for
continuous integration
 Brainstorm with designers, architects and product managers to build and tweak functionality
 Participate in code and design reviews, teaching and learning from other engineers
 Identify and uphold engineering best practices
 Identify, leverage, and successfully evangelize opportunities to improve engineering productivityYour Experience
 2+ years programming in Go with excellent programming fundamentals
 Test-driven and zealous about testing
 Experience with MongoDB, MySQL or PostgreSQL
 Comfortable with Linux (basic usage as a programmer)
 Excellent English written and verbal language skills
 Ability to work with others we sell as independently in a fully remote environment
 Development experience on cloud computing platform (AWS, Azure, or OpenShift)
 Familiarity with version control systems (Git)
 Experience designing, building, and documenting APIs
What Will Make You Stand Out
 Knowledge of other databases/data stores (memcached, clickhouse)
 Deep knowledge security and encryption techniques for transmitting and storing sensitive data
 Experience with continuous deployment to cloud / virtualized environments (andldquo;DevOpsandrdquo;)
 Experience with Docker and Kubernetes
DocuSign Envelope ID: 844E4042-AAB6-413E-B9B7-63FDB7DAFDB1
 Experience with Prometheus or VictoriaMetrics
 BS/MS/PhD in an engineering field or equivalent experience
 Experience writing and maintaining unit tests
 Open Source development experiencePercona is a respected thought leader in the open source community. We provide services and software for MySQL, MongoDB, PostgreSQL and MariaDB to open source users globally.
Percona is remote-first and globally dispersed - we have colleagues in more than 40 countries! We offer a collaborative, highly-engaged culture where your ideas are welcome and your voice is heard. The growth and development of our staff is a top priority - we provide funding for training, certifications, conferences and more.Discover what it means to work with some of the smartest people in the industry, who also know how to have fun and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We offer flexible hours, the ability to work remotely and the amazing experience of working with a multinational team of experts.

Identify, leverage, and successfully evangelize opportunities to improve engineering productivity

Test-driven and zealous about testing
Experience with MongoDB, MySQL or PostgreSQL

You can expect a respectful and caring culture, where you can grow and learn in a flexible work environment (see for yourself by checking our Glassdoor rating). We are a certified Great Place to Work®, an award that proves our dedication towards building a Human-Centric World from within.


At Imaginary Cloud you will find:



  • A remote-first company. We seek team members who live in Portugal or are willing and legally qualified to live and work in the country.

  • Flexible working hours

  • Global projects with industry-leading clients

  • Career plan with strong growth potential

  • Health & Dental insurance

  • Paid sick days

  • Informal environment

  • Team events

  • Caring, respectful and human-centric culture

  • Comfort budget

  • Fair compensation according to your experience

  • No Outsourcing, as an Imaginaree you will always be part of Imaginary Cloud


We would love to have you on board if you have hands-on experience in the following areas:


1+ years of working experience in Javascript Development (React.js, Angular.js, Vue.js, Node.js)



  • 2+ years of experience in Software Development

  • A clear understanding of Object-Oriented Programming (OOP)

  • Git

If this sounds exactly what you're looking for, we would like to meet you and discuss this opportunity. Please apply here.


Want to get to know us a little bit better? Check out our blog to see who we are and what to expect from our recruitment process.

Engagement and Inclusion Consultant Are you looking to build a career, while making an impact"in"the world?" Do you like"rolling up your"sleeves"to"solve"complex"problems"AND value work-life balance?" If so, Wheelhouse may be just the place for you!" At Wheelhouse Group, we guide organizations through transformational change, including creating brand new programs to meet mission goals."To do this, we build teams"with"diverse"perspectives"and"experience"in organizational change management,"stakeholder"engagement and"communications,"workforce"transformation and"business"optimization." We know that work is"about"more than"what we do for our"clients. It is about"working together to build"community"and"culture."It is"about"supporting"and trusting"each other to deliver on our commitments."At"Wheelhouse, we"ensure"each of"our team"members"have what they need"thrive"and"to be successful." The Position" Wheelhouse Group is looking for professionals"to help support federal initiatives to build back the economy and support under-represented communities gain access to fulfilling careers. Wheelhouse Group leads the Partnership on Inclusive Apprenticeship (PIA) to create opportunities that lead to careers in high-growth, high-demand sectors of the U.S. economy for people with disabilities, women, veterans, youth, BIPOC and other underrepresented communities. We focus on industries like technology, finance, healthcare and clean energy. We are looking for people to help support this team in the areas of communications, stakeholder engagement and program management. We are looking for"top performers"with"5-15"years of experience with the following mix of"qualifications:"" Interest and Attitude" A"self-starter with an"exceptionally strong work ethic, curiosity and drive 
A growth mindset"with"a"willingness to build expertise and a desire to share what"you"know 
Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written; excellent active listening skills 
Ability to establish and maintain strong relationships in government, academia, industry and the advocacy community 
An affinity for working in teams, networking and bringing new people to the table 
Skills"and Experience" Experience in one or more of the following areas: Diversity equity, inclusion, and accessibility (DEIA)" 
Workforce development, apprenticeship, labor unions 
Clean energy 
Emerging technology 

Ability to"lead and facilitate"others"to"move toward a common vision or goal" 
Knowledge of"the design, development, delivery and management of"strategic"communications 
Experience starting new initiatives, building a vision and driving momentum among diverse stakeholders"preferred 
Organized with natural agility to move seamlessly from strategic tasks (developing a strategic plan) to tactical tasks (preparing PowerPoint briefings) 
Familiarity with project management approaches, tools and phases of the project lifecycle; proven experience managing multiple projects 
Government ecosystem experience is a plus 
Must"be a team player and able to work collaboratively with and through others 
Advanced experience with Microsoft Office Suite (PowerPoint, Word, and Excel) and a gift for creating briefings and documents that tell a compelling, relevant and data-driven story 
This is a remote position that may require occasional travel once current restrictions related to the pandemic are lifted. The majority of the team is located in the Washington, DC metropolitan area. People with disabilities and veterans are highly encouraged to apply. TO APPLY 
If interested, please submit an application for "Inclusion Consultants" on the Wheelhouse Group website: http://wheelhousegroup.com/join-our-team/. If you have any questions, please email contact@wheelhousegroup.com.

_source.description:
About the TeamAt DoorDash we're building the industry's most scalable and reliable delivery network to support our three-sided marketplace of consumers, merchants, and dashers. TPMs on our Engineering teams provide fundamental support to the underlying technology services as well as the engineers building these services. It's no simple task, but it wouldn't be interesting if it was!About the RoleOur team is looking for a Technical Program Manager for our Marketplace Engineering Team to drive important engineering-wide initiatives related to next gen Menus, Stores, and Order services. Programs will require a strong technical understanding, general cross organization coordination/facilitation, stakeholder management, and ownership of results.You will report to the Senior Manager of TPM on our TPM team in our Engineering Operations organization. Once our offices reopen, we expect this role to be 100% remote, or hybrid for employees who want to work in a DoorDash office location. You're excited about this opportunity because you will...Owning Marketplace Programs - Partner closely with Merchant, Drive, and New Verticals partners, as well as key engineering and product leaders to establish the vision, strategy, technical direction and success metrics for the Marketplace Menu, Stores, and Order teams. Focus areas for your programs will include building partnerships with product engineering teams, evangelizing platform visions, and executing strategic projects to enable multi-vertical scale.
Planning and Execution Optimization - Drive optimizations related to planning Engineering objectives and key results, develop frameworks for team execution/tracking and provide visibility to resource allocation and prioritization.
Technical - You will develop a full understanding of our technical stack and interdependencies, allowing you to contribute to designs and ensure they are scalable, reliable, and efficient.
Stakeholder Management - Manage expectations for all stakeholders from leadership to individual teams, possess strong problem solving and negotiation skills, and earn trust of partners and teams. 
Navigating the Organization - Understand engineers and enjoy working with them, building trust by developing strong technical domain knowledge that adds value beyond project management. 
Communications - Manage timely and succinct communications to leadership and across teams to ensure accountability and timeline management.
Process - Develop processes to ensure teamwork is streamlined to manage complexity and optimized velocity. You are thoughtful about how and when to implement processes with a light touch and clear understanding of success within DoorDash's culture.
Time Management - Balance urgency and priority while moving the needle on multiple initiatives.
We're excited about you because...You are highly organized and care about the details.
You celebrate your successes, but also admit your missteps and learn from feedback -- we're all human.
You are curious, growth-minded, and eager to expand your skill set. You have a passion for building scalable systems, enabling product efficiency, and moving teams forward.
You understand both the big picture and the details.
You are a self starter and can demonstrate adaptability, resilience, and ability to thrive in ambiguity -- things change quickly!
You lead and influence teams to make the right trade offs.
You are pragmatic in your approach and focus on progress, not perfection.
QualificationsBachelor's Degree
5+ years recent experience as a Technical Program Manager or similar role at a technology company.
Experience working with platform engineers and large-scale distributed systems. You can speak to system architecture, scalability and reliability decisions, and design trade offs.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate with confidence, clarity, and focus. Able to convey concepts and considerations to non-experts and experts alike.
Strong leadership skills with the ability to collaborate and build relationships across organizations, bridge gaps between teams, and successfully influence without authority.
Strong sense of ownership, urgency, and drive. A willingness to roll up your sleeves and dive into the details to understand and drive your programs.
Direct engagement with Engineering teams on product development with a thorough understanding of software development processes. Project planning and execution skills that include reviewing technical design documents, estimating, and scheduling.
Excellent attention to detail and understanding of impact when changes occur to scope or timeline.
Experience working in a startup environment desired.
Experience in Computer Science, Software Engineering or other related discipline desired.
About DoorDashAt DoorDash, our mission to empower local economies shapes how our team members move quickly, learn, and reiterate in order to make impactful decisions that display empathy for our range of users-from Dashers to merchant partners to consumers. We are a technology and logistics company that started with door-to-door delivery, and we are looking for team members who can help us go from a company that is known for delivering food to a company that people turn to for any and all goods. 

DoorDash is growing rapidly and changing constantly, which gives our team members the opportunity to share their unique perspectives, solve new challenges, and own their careers. We're committed to supporting employees' happiness, healthiness, and overall well-being by providing comprehensive benefits and perks including premium healthcare, wellness expense reimbursement, paid parental leave and more.Our Commitment to Diversity and InclusionWe're committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That's why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.Statement of Non-Discrimination: In keeping with our beliefs and goals, no employee or applicant will face discrimination or harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital/domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination and harassment based on "protected categories," we also strive to prevent other subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (i.e., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our office. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at DoorDash. We value a diverse workforce - people who identify as women, non-binary or gender non-conforming, LGBTQIA+, American Indian or Native Alaskan, Black or African American, Hispanic or Latinx, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, differently-abled, caretakers and parents, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Thank you to the Level Playing Field Institute for this statement of non-discrimination.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, and any other state or local hiring regulations, we will consider for employment any qualified applicant, including those with arrest and conviction records, in a manner consistent with the applicable regulation.Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, the base salary range in Colorado for this position is $122,000 - $182,000, plus opportunities for equity and commission. Compensation in other geographies may vary. If you need any accommodations, please inform your recruiting contact upon initial connection.

About the Team

At DoorDash weâre building the industryâs most scalable and reliable delivery network to support our three-sided marketplace of consumers, merchants, and dashers. TPMs on our Engineering teams provide fundamental support to the underlying technology services as well as the engineers building these services. Itâs no simple task, but it wouldnât be interesting if it was!

About the Role

Our team is looking for a Technical Program Manager for our Marketplace Engineering Team to drive important engineering-wide initiatives related to next gen Menus, Stores, and Order services. Programs will require a strong technical understanding, general cross organization coordination/facilitation, stakeholder management, and ownership of results.

You will report to the Senior Manager of TPM on our TPM team in our Engineering Operations organization. Once our offices reopen, we expect this role to be 100% remote, or hybrid for employees who want to work in a DoorDash office location.  

Youâre excited about this opportunity because you willâ¦

  • Owning Marketplace Programs  - Partner closely with Merchant, Drive, and New Verticals partners, as well as key engineering and product leaders to establish the vision, strategy, technical direction and success metrics for the Marketplace Menu, Stores, and Order teams. Focus areas for your programs will include building partnerships with product engineering teams, evangelizing platform visions, and executing strategic projects to enable multi-vertical scale.
  • Planning & Execution Optimization - Drive optimizations related to planning Engineering objectives and key results, develop frameworks for team execution/tracking and provide visibility to resource allocation and prioritization.
  • Technical - You will develop a full understanding of our technical stack and interdependencies, allowing you to contribute to designs and ensure they are scalable, reliable, and efficient.
  • Stakeholder Management - Manage expectations for all stakeholders from leadership to individual teams, possess strong problem solving and negotiation skills, and earn trust of partners and teams. 
  • Navigating the Organization - Understand engineers and enjoy working with them, building trust by developing strong technical domain knowledge that adds value beyond project management. 
  • Communications - Manage timely and succinct communications to leadership and across teams to ensure accountability and timeline management.
  • Process - Develop processes to ensure teamwork is streamlined to manage complexity and optimized velocity. You are thoughtful about how and when to implement processes with a light touch and clear understanding of success within DoorDashâs culture.
  • Time Management - Balance urgency and priority while moving the needle on multiple initiatives.

Weâre excited about you becauseâ¦

  • You are highly organized and care about the details.
  • You celebrate your successes, but also admit your missteps and learn from feedback -- weâre all human.
  • You are curious, growth-minded, and eager to expand your skill set. You have a passion for building scalable systems, enabling product efficiency, and moving teams forward.
  • You understand both the big picture and the details.
  • You are a self starter and can demonstrate adaptability, resilience, and ability to thrive in ambiguity -- things change quickly!
  • You lead and influence teams to make the right trade offs.
  • You are pragmatic in your approach and focus on progress, not perfection.

Qualifications

  • Bachelorâs Degree
  • 5+ years recent experience as a Technical Program Manager or similar role at a technology company.
  • Experience working with platform engineers and large-scale distributed systems. You can speak to system architecture, scalability and reliability decisions, and design trade offs.
  • Excellent written & verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate with confidence, clarity, and focus. Able to convey concepts and considerations to non-experts and experts alike.
  • Strong leadership skills with the ability to collaborate and build relationships across organizations, bridge gaps between teams, and successfully influence without authority.
  • Strong sense of ownership, urgency, and drive. A willingness to roll up your sleeves and dive into the details to understand and drive your programs.
  • Direct engagement with Engineering teams on product development with a thorough understanding of software development processes. Project planning and execution skills that include reviewing technical design documents, estimating, and scheduling.
  • Excellent attention to detail and understanding of impact when changes occur to scope or timeline.
  • Experience working in a startup environment desired.
  • Experience in Computer Science, Software Engineering or other related discipline desired.

About DoorDash

At DoorDash, our mission to empower local economies shapes how our team members move quickly, learn, and reiterate in order to make impactful decisions that display empathy for our range of usersâfrom Dashers to merchant partners to consumers. We are a technology and logistics company that started with door-to-door delivery, and we are looking for team members who can help us go from a company that is known for delivering food to a company that people turn to for any and all goods.

DoorDash is growing rapidly and changing constantly, which gives our team members the opportunity to share their unique perspectives, solve new challenges, and own their careers. We're committed to supporting employeesâ happiness, healthiness, and overall well-being by providing comprehensive benefits and perks including premium healthcare, wellness expense reimbursement, paid parental leave and more.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Weâre committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. Thatâs why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Statement of Non-Discrimination: In keeping with our beliefs and goals, no employee or applicant will face discrimination or harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital/domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination and harassment based on âprotected categories,â we also strive to prevent other subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (i.e., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our office. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at DoorDash. We value a diverse workforce â people who identify as women, non-binary or gender non-conforming, LGBTQIA+, American Indian or Native Alaskan, Black or African American, Hispanic or Latinx, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, differently-abled, caretakers and parents, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Thank you to the Level Playing Field Institute for this statement of non-discrimination.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, and any other state or local hiring regulations, we will consider for employment any qualified applicant, including those with arrest and conviction records, in a manner consistent with the applicable regulation.

Pursuant to the Colorado Fair Pay Act, the base salary range in Colorado for this position is $122,000 - $182,000, plus opportunities for equity and commission. Compensation in other geographies may vary. 

If you need any accommodations, please inform your recruiting contact upon initial connection.
