_source.description_html:
Experience level: Consultant / Architect


Hello! Are you ready to work from home and transform your career?


We're looking for an experienced and enthusiastic DevOps Architect (AWS) to join the team at Modus. Want to build awesome solutions? Are you interested in working from home with the best talent on the planet? Then keep reading.


About You


You love optimization and automation. Building and deploying consistently is second nature for you. You walk the line between software development and system administration.


This is a senior-level position. That means you enjoy working with people and mentoring others. Your technical skills are top-notch but you know that the social ones are just as important. You're an excellent communicator who has a knack for knowing when everyone isn't on the same page and getting them there. You can deal with stress and uncertainty, and lead the team away from them. You don't need to be told what to do, because when you see something that needs doing, you do it.


As an architect, you gather and document requirements from stakeholders to turn them into actionable battle plans. You don't make all the technology choices, but you ensure that they get made, facilitating discussion and consensus. You understand the parts of the whole, how they fit together, and how to orchestrate it so large teams can build large things in parallel.


You have experience in one or more of these areas:



  • Must have expertise in Jenkins CI/CD pipeline setup and configuration to support full end-to-end installation and change delivery
    background in cloud formation template design and scripting to support automation to cover pipeline/deployment, LZ builds, and FAC migration support.

  • Amazon Web Services (AWS)

  • Provisioning and deployment with tools like Ansible, Chef, Puppet, Salt

  • Background in cloud formation template design and scripting to support automation

  • Infrastructure-as-Code with tools like terraform, CloudFormation

  • Logging, monitoring, and alerts

  • Best practices for security and high availability in the cloud


You are comfortable working in an agile environment with a globally-distributed team. You’ve got the discipline to work autonomously, and the communication skills to collaborate with your team. Having overlap with your team is critical when working in a global remote team. This project requires to overlap with EDT and other projects US Eastern timezone. Reliable high-speed internet is a must.


Things You Might Do


Modus is a fast-growing, and remote-first company, so you'll likely get experience on many different projects across the organization. That said, here are some things you'll probably do:



  • Give back to the community via open source and blog posts

  • Travel and meet great people- as part of our remote-first lifestyle, it's important that we come together as needed to work together, meet each other in person and have fun together. Please keep that in mind when you apply.

  • Teach and be taught: Modus creates active teams that work on internal and external projects together, giving opportunities to stay relevant with the latest technologies and learning from experts worldwide

  • Interact directly with internal and external clients to represent Modus and its values


Why Modus Create:


Our Benefits may vary according to the country you are located in, so please reach out to our recruiter in case you have any questions.


If you become a full time US employee we offer:



  • Competitive compensation

  • Health insurance (medical, vision, and dental) and other benefits (FSA and HSA)

  • 401(K) match to up to 3.5% of your annual salary

  • Remote work

  • The chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech

  • Flexible Time Off/PTO


If you become a contractor we offer:



  • Competitive compensation

  • 100% Remote work (could vary according to the client's needs)

  • The chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech
_source.position_name: DevOps Architect (AWS)- US, Latam at Modus Create () (allows remote)

_source.description_html:
Job Description:

RV Life is looking for a senior full-stack engineer to work on a rapidly expanding ecosystem of RV-related apps. The developer will maintain a react app and implement new features on a web-based single-page application. The company is fully remote, so no relocation is necessary. You will just need a steady internet connection. We have several full-time developers that extensively travel while working.

Why Work for Us:

We are a laid-back company that focuses on nurturing our employees and working together to make the RVing experience as easy as possible for our users.

We offer:


  • Comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision coverage, and 401(k)


  • Monthly stipends for coffee, gyms, mental health, and high-speed internet.


  • Complimentary high-end gear for development and testing.


  • Unlimited, Flexible Vacation


  • Competitive Salary


  • Team Retreats and Team Meetups


Responsibilities:


  • Integrate new features and develop new components using React


  • Develop software in a fast-paced agile development environment using the latest frameworks and patterns


  • Collaborate with engineers, product owners and designers on new product features


  • Make recommendations for the adoption of new technologies based on your experience


  • Pair with and mentor teammates to develop and design prototypes to improve the customer journey interactively


  • Work through the software development agile process and its best practices, from continuously integrating code to production deployment


  • Code review pull requests in a CI/CD environment


  • Review requirements and provide input


Minimum Experience:


  • 7+ years of software development


  • 4+ years of experience on a team developing scalable web apps in a modern Javascript framework (React, NestJS) and with a state management tool (Redux, Mobx)


  • Experience working with MySQL


  • BS in Computer Science or other related fields of study or applicable work experience


  • Familiarity with SCRUM as a development method for Agile Development


  • Familiarity with standard security practices protecting customer data



Preferred Experience:


  • Experience with React


  • Experience with Laravel


  • Experience with Node.js


  • Experience developing location-based services with HERE Maps or a similar framework


  • Demonstrated knowledge and practical application of design patterns


  • Familiarity with Atomic Design, Responsive Web Design, and Mobile-First principles


  • Experience with Typescript


  • Experience with testing frameworks like Jest and Cypress


  • Experience with Axios


  • Experience with Microframeworks


  • Proficient with building and consuming microservices such as Rest


  • Strong administrative/organizational skills (ability to effectively prioritize, manage time, and meet deadlines)


Bonus Points:


  • Passion for RVing


  • Strong sense of ownership for creating great products


  • Highly developed ability to analyze and understand business context and logic behind the software solution


  • You care about performance and understanding the impacts on customers

_source.description:
Exodus is looking for a meticulous Backend Engineer to focus on our backend Assets Services. As an Engineer on the Assets Integration Team, you believe strongly in testing and using your analytical skills to solve complex problems. You also love finding efficiencies in how data is stored and retrieved, and love Blockchain Technology.What You Will DoSubmit pull requests for critical back-end assets core services coded in Node.js, which talk to Exodus Wallet clients.
Write loads of tests to ensure code performs as expected.
Feature development work on Core Assets Services (With a focus on History Server and complex data organization).
Support, Maintain, and improve our Assets Core Services Applications.
Open dialogues with our community support engineers to understand what can be improved about the exchange experience in Exodus, and act on that understanding.
Monitor and respond with timeliness to support inquiries.
Frameworks and LanguagesNode.js
Javascript
REST/ GraphQL
PostgreSQL
Redis
Who You AreYou have a history and track record of Node.js development that can be demonstrated via Github.
You have 3 to 5 years of professional work experience.
You take initiative and don't wait for direction.
You have a passion for cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and a demonstrated ability to solve problems.
A strong understanding of Performance Optimization.
You have an understanding of relational database concepts and have designed some relational database schemas in the past.
You have a strong understanding of document based data structures.
You are willing to be available regardless of when server issues occur.
Professional experience in Blockchain and Cryptocurrency is a huge plus.
About ExodusExodus is a multi-asset cryptocurrency wallet with a built-in exchange feature. We started our movement in 2015 and have been a distributed team since then. Our mission is to help half of the world exit the traditional financial system and move into the crypto financial system by the year 2030. To do that we want to make sure we hire the best of the best: people who are intrinsically motivated by what we are trying to achieve and who love what they do professionally.What We OfferFreedom to work wherever you want, whenever you want.
Building the future. Cryptocurrencies lay the foundation to the internet of value, the next major wave in application technology and personal finance.
Collaborative and feedback-driven culture.
Opportunity to grow.
Fair pay, no matter where you live along with a competitive benefits package.
100% pay in Bitcoin with a buffer to account for price changes and exchange fees.
Brand new tech package for your work from home space.
BenefitsHealth: Most of our health insurance plans are covered 100% for you and covered 50% for your dependents. Weandrsquo;ll also cover dental insurance. If you are outside of the United States, we will reimburse you up to $500 per month for any medical and dental insurance for you and your dependents.PTO: 30 days of paid time off per year on top of a flexible schedule where you can work wherever and whenever. If youandrsquo;re part-time with us, youandrsquo;ll still receive 15 days of paid time off.Unlimited Bereavement: We will pay you your full salary for the first two weeks for the loss of any immediate family members but we allow you to take all the time you need to grieve outside of that.Parental Leave: 12 weeks of fully paid leave with a month of flexible work for the primary caregiver.Tax Help: Getting paid in Bitcoin new to you? Donandrsquo;t worry! We will reimburse you for speaking with a professional tax specialist in your state/country to make sure everything is taken care of.Perks: Exodus offers a variety of seasonal perks including free subscriptions to services like Calm and Masterclass, coverage for gym memberships and therapy. We want to make sure all of our employees know they are our priority and we give back for your hard work often.
_source.description_html:
Exodus is looking for a meticulous Backend Engineer to focus on our backend Assets Services. As an Engineer on the Assets Integration Team, you believe strongly in testing and using your analytical skills to solve complex problems. You also love finding efficiencies in how data is stored and retrieved, and love Blockchain Technology.


What You Will Do



  • Submit pull requests for critical back-end assets core services coded in Node.js, which talk to Exodus Wallet clients.

  • Write loads of tests to ensure code performs as expected.

  • Feature development work on Core Assets Services (With a focus on History Server and complex data organization).

  • Support, Maintain, and improve our Assets Core Services Applications.

  • Open dialogues with our community support engineers to understand what can be improved about the exchange experience in Exodus, and act on that understanding.

  • Monitor and respond with timeliness to support inquiries.


Frameworks & Languages



  • Node.js

  • Javascript

  • REST/ GraphQL

  • PostgreSQL

  • Redis


Who You Are



  • You have a history and track record of Node.js development that can be demonstrated via Github.

  • You have 3 to 5 years of professional work experience.

  • You take initiative and don't wait for direction.

  • You have a passion for cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and a demonstrated ability to solve problems.

  • A strong understanding of Performance Optimization.

  • You have an understanding of relational database concepts and have designed some relational database schemas in the past.

  • You have a strong understanding of document based data structures.

  • You are willing to be available regardless of when server issues occur.

  • Professional experience in Blockchain and Cryptocurrency is a huge plus.


About Exodus


Exodus is a multi-asset cryptocurrency wallet with a built-in exchange feature. We started our movement in 2015 and have been a distributed team since then. Our mission is to help half of the world exit the traditional financial system and move into the crypto financial system by the year 2030. To do that we want to make sure we hire the best of the best: people who are intrinsically motivated by what we are trying to achieve and who love what they do professionally.


What We Offer



  • Freedom to work wherever you want, whenever you want.

  • Building the future. Cryptocurrencies lay the foundation to the internet of value, the next major wave in application technology and personal finance.

  • Collaborative and feedback-driven culture.

  • Opportunity to grow.

  • Fair pay, no matter where you live along with a competitive benefits package.

  • 100% pay in Bitcoin with a buffer to account for price changes and exchange fees.

  • Brand new tech package for your work from home space.


Benefits


Health: Most of our health insurance plans are covered 100% for you and covered 50% for your dependents. We’ll also cover dental insurance. If you are outside of the United States, we will reimburse you up to $500 per month for any medical and dental insurance for you and your dependents.


PTO: 30 days of paid time off per year on top of a flexible schedule where you can work wherever and whenever. If you’re part-time with us, you’ll still receive 15 days of paid time off.


Unlimited Bereavement: We will pay you your full salary for the first two weeks for the loss of any immediate family members but we allow you to take all the time you need to grieve outside of that.


Parental Leave: 12 weeks of fully paid leave with a month of flexible work for the primary caregiver.


Tax Help: Getting paid in Bitcoin new to you? Don’t worry! We will reimburse you for speaking with a professional tax specialist in your state/country to make sure everything is taken care of.


Perks: Exodus offers a variety of seasonal perks including free subscriptions to services like Calm and Masterclass, coverage for gym memberships and therapy. We want to make sure all of our employees know they are our priority and we give back for your hard work often.
_source.position_name: Senior Node.js Engineer - Assets at Exodus.io () (allows remote)

_source.description:
Food Revolution Network (FRN) is committed to healthy, ethical, and sustainable food for all. With more than 750,000 members, FRN provides online-based education and advocacy with the goal of transforming food systems to support healthy people and a healthy planet.Dedicated to building a sustainable, diverse and inclusive team and business that makes a massive positive impact on people and the planet, FRN is a fully remote company (work from anywhere), offering a 4-day (10 hour day) work week, flexible schedules, and a commitment to team member development, wellness and sustainability. Read more about us below.----------FRN is looking for a Full-Stack Developer (FSD) to join our growing technology team. The FSD supports the implementation of the organizations technology strategy by architecting, creating and maintaining frontend and backend software systems. The Full-Stack Developer has a high-level understanding of crafting online systems from a technical perspective to ensure that code is created in a reusable and efficient manner. The Full-Stack Developer works hands-on to shape and implement the technology strategy into an easy to use, performant, mobile-first user experience.

 Reports to: Head of Technology
Benefits

About UsOur mission is healthy, ethical, and sustainable food for all.Food Revolution Network is an online-based education and advocacy-driven organization committed to healthy, ethical, and sustainable food for all. Guided by John and Ocean Robbins, we have more than 750,000 members and collaborate with many of the top food revolutionary leaders of our times. Food Revolution Network aims to empower individuals, build community, and transform food systems to support healthy people and a healthy planet. We believe that everyone, regardless of the color of their skin or how much money they have, deserves the knowledge and the means to healthfully feed themselves and their family. Were committed to a world with a true opportunity for everyone to be healthy.

About YouYou believe in the power of healthy, organic, fair trade, local, plant-strong food to change the world. Youre passionate about supporting the food revolution and movements for a more healthy, ethical, and sustainable world. You support our scientifically grounded, fact-driven, and welcoming approach, which promotes a whole foods, plant-based diet and is inclusive of a broad range of eaters.Youre values-driven, highly motivated, self-aware, ethical, emotionally intelligent, multiculturally competent, compassionate, socially conscious, constantly learning, and respectful of yourself and others. Youre reliable, dedicated, undaunted, persistent, friendly, and forthright. You admit your mistakes, clean up your messes, and learn from everything.

Our Commitment to Equal OpportunityFood Revolution Network is a committed equal opportunity employer. FRN recruits, employs, trains, compensates, and promotes regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, veteran status, and other protected status as required by applicable law. At FRN, we aim to be a place where a diverse mix of talented people bring their skills, life experience, passion, and creativity to create a whole that is greater than the sum of its parts. We are committed to healthy, ethical, and sustainable food for ALL, and that requires a proactive dedication to advocating for equity, inclusion, and opportunity including for those communities that have been most negatively impacted by our toxic food culture. We are committed to equality and believe in diversity of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, national origin, and all the other characteristics that enable each person to bring unique talents, insights, and skills.

Work LocationFRN is a fully remote team, with team members in multiple North American time zones. This position may be performed from anywhere, but we strongly prefer North America-compatible time zones, with a required availability from 9 am - 3 pm Pacific Time Monday through Thursday.

CompensationCompetitive annual salary based on experience, with potential performance bonuses.Permanent full-time employees also receive paid time off, flexible time off for holidays, wellness time off, health, vision, and dental insurance, opportunities for bonuses, and other benefits.
_source.description_html:
Food Revolution Network (FRN) is committed to healthy, ethical, and sustainable food for all. With more than 750,000 members, FRN provides online-based education and advocacy with the goal of transforming food systems to support healthy people and a healthy planet.

Dedicated to building a sustainable, diverse and inclusive team and business that makes a massive positive impact on people and the planet, FRN is a fully remote company (work from anywhere), offering a 4-day (10 hour day) work week, flexible schedules, and a commitment to team member development, wellness and sustainability. Read more about us below.

----------

FRN is looking for a Full-Stack Developer (FSD) to join our growing technology team. The FSD supports the implementation of the organizations technology strategy by architecting, creating and maintaining frontend and backend software systems. The Full-Stack Developer has a high-level understanding of crafting online systems from a technical perspective to ensure that code is created in a reusable and efficient manner. The Full-Stack Developer works hands-on to shape and implement the technology strategy into an easy to use, performant, mobile-first user experience.

Reports to: Head of Technology


Benefits



About Us

Our mission is healthy, ethical, and sustainable food for all.

Food Revolution Network is an online-based education and advocacy-driven organization committed to healthy, ethical, and sustainable food for all. Guided by John and Ocean Robbins, we have more than 750,000 members and collaborate with many of the top food revolutionary leaders of our times. Food Revolution Network aims to empower individuals, build community, and transform food systems to support healthy people and a healthy planet.

We believe that everyone, regardless of the color of their skin or how much money they have, deserves the knowledge and the means to healthfully feed themselves and their family. Were committed to a world with a true opportunity for everyone to be healthy.

About You

You believe in the power of healthy, organic, fair trade, local, plant-strong food to change the world. Youre passionate about supporting the food revolution and movements for a more healthy, ethical, and sustainable world. You support our scientifically grounded, fact-driven, and welcoming approach, which promotes a whole foods, plant-based diet and is inclusive of a broad range of eaters.

Youre values-driven, highly motivated, self-aware, ethical, emotionally intelligent, multiculturally competent, compassionate, socially conscious, constantly learning, and respectful of yourself and others. Youre reliable, dedicated, undaunted, persistent, friendly, and forthright. You admit your mistakes, clean up your messes, and learn from everything.

Our Commitment to Equal Opportunity

Food Revolution Network is a committed equal opportunity employer. FRN recruits, employs, trains, compensates, and promotes regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, veteran status, and other protected status as required by applicable law. At FRN, we aim to be a place where a diverse mix of talented people bring their skills, life experience, passion, and creativity to create a whole that is greater than the sum of its parts. We are committed to healthy, ethical, and sustainable food for ALL, and that requires a proactive dedication to advocating for equity, inclusion, and opportunity including for those communities that have been most negatively impacted by our toxic food culture. We are committed to equality and believe in diversity of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, national origin, and all the other characteristics that enable each person to bring unique talents, insights, and skills.

Work Location

FRN is a fully remote team, with team members in multiple North American time zones. This position may be performed from anywhere, but we strongly prefer North America-compatible time zones, with a required availability from 9 am - 3 pm Pacific Time Monday through Thursday.

Compensation

Competitive annual salary based on experience, with potential performance bonuses.

Permanent full-time employees also receive paid time off, flexible time off for holidays, wellness time off, health, vision, and dental insurance, opportunities for bonuses, and other benefits.

_source.description_html:
Company: MariaDB


Position: Senior Software Engineer (Cloud Platform Engineering team)


Location: Fully remote anywhere in the U.S.


Work Visa's: No sponsorships are available at this time


Comp: $150K - $200K (dependent on seniority & location) + attractive equity + 25 days PTO, private medical


Are you interested in working in a dynamic and growing international company whose products are used by big Internet and other companies all over the world? Company is the fastest-growing open source database worldwide, with more than 12 million users. We power applications at companies like Deutsche Bank, DBS Bank, Nasdaq, Red Hat, ServiceNow and Verizon, and we partner with companies like Alibaba and Facebook. The company was founded by the team that created MySQL and enjoys unprecedented technical depth for a startup.


What You’ll Do


As a member of the Cloud Platform development team, you will be responsible for design and implementation of features in MariaDB Cloud that includes Kubernetes Operator, infrastructure automation and performance tests in K8S platform.


Responsibilities



  • Design and develop features in MariaDB K8S operator framework.

  • Develop various components of cloud based DBaaS infrastructure.

  • Identify performance problems and develop solutions to fix them.

  • Collaborate with Product, Support, DevOps, QA and architects in designing highly secure infrastructure.

  • Implement high quality, secure and robust applications with optimal performance in a fast-paced environment.

  • Lead and mentor junior team members.


What we're looking for:



  • BS/MS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or higher

  • 10+ years of experience in software development with 5+ years in distributed software development

  • Deep understanding of algorithms & data structures and their runtime complexities

  • Solid understanding of OS Internals and networking

  • Experience with containers and Kubernetes in public cloud is a must

  • Proficiency in any of C/C++, Java, Python or Go

  • Experience working with any of cloud platforms: GCP/AWS/Azure

  • Development experience in the Unix/Linux environment


Bonus if you have:



  • Experience building Kubernetes operators

  • Excellent knowledge of RDBMSs, experience with MariaDB/MySQL

  • Familiarity with ServiceNow development

_source.description:
DescriptionWe are looking for a talented fully remote front-end engineer to help us transition our marketing site to a Git based CMS coupled with a static site generator. You'll be playing a core role in our marketing development team and youandrsquo;ll report directly to the front-end lead.What Youandrsquo;ll Do:Help transition our marketing site at hubstaff.com from a rails application to a Git based CMS coupled with a Static site generator (preferably based on Vue.js)
Define the data structures in the CMS based on our Design system components.
Translate the current Design system components from our rails views to the Static site generator templates. (Our rails views are written in slim, which is very easy to understand, and youandrsquo;ll need to transition them to Vue.js view files)
Create documentation along the way on how to use the system, as it will be used by non developers in creating new pages and editing the existing ones.
RequirementsVue.js and JavaScript.
Expert knowledge and experience using HTML and CSS.
Experience working with Wordpress and headless CMS systems is highly valued. Bonus points for experience with Git based CMS.
Understanding of SEO and accessibility best practices.
Experience building high-quality, responsive layouts.
Great communication skills, focused on solutions, thinking independently
_source.description_html:
Description


We are looking for a talented fully remote front-end engineer to help us transition our marketing site to a Git based CMS coupled with a static site generator. You'll be playing a core role in our marketing development team and you’ll report directly to the front-end lead.


What You’ll Do:



  • Help transition our marketing site at hubstaff.com from a rails application to a Git based CMS coupled with a Static site generator (preferably based on Vue.js)

  • Define the data structures in the CMS based on our Design system components.

  • Translate the current Design system components from our rails views to the Static site generator templates. (Our rails views are written in slim, which is very easy to understand, and you’ll need to transition them to Vue.js view files)

  • Create documentation along the way on how to use the system, as it will be used by non developers in creating new pages and editing the existing ones.


Requirements



  • Vue.js & JavaScript.

  • Expert knowledge & experience using HTML and CSS.

  • Experience working with Wordpress and headless CMS systems is highly valued. Bonus points for experience with Git based CMS.

  • Understanding of SEO and accessibility best practices.

  • Experience building high-quality, responsive layouts.

  • Great communication skills, focused on solutions, thinking independently

_source.description:
At OpenUnited, we are creating a new platform and innovative model that helps digital talent around the world to develop skills, and to have long-term paying digital work whilst ensuring the sustainability of the open source ecosystem.We are now live in our beta phase whereby the platform is live at https://openunited.com/ and we have made our code repositories public at: https://github.com/OpenUnited/product-factory-composerHelp us build the future of digital work at OpenUnited. Getting Started

1) Join our discord server: https://discord.gg/T3xevYvWey 2) Register at https://openunited.com/ and create your profile 3) Fork our repos on GitHub https://github.com/OpenUnited/product-factory-composer andzwj;4) Get OpenUnited running on your development machine (see the README in the repo) 

5) Claim and complete a task on OpenUnited https://openunited.com/meta/openunited-product-factory/tasks When you are done with the task, issue a pull request and (IMPORTANT) make sure you complete the steps in OpenUnited to have this added to your portfolio. 

After you have collected 50 non-liquid points by working on tasks on Open Products like OpenUnited itself (https://openunited.com/meta/openunited-product-factory/tasks), you are eligible to claim tasks with liquid points that are convertible into payment.andzwj; Questions?Here are our FAQs

We are now live in our beta phase whereby the platform is live at https://openunited.com/ and we have made our code repositories public at: https://github.com/OpenUnited/product-factory-composer

Getting Started

1) Join our discord server: https://discord.gg/T3xevYvWey


2) Register at https://openunited.com/ and create your profile


3) Fork our repos on GitHub https://github.com/OpenUnited/product-factory-composer ‍


4) Get OpenUnited running on your development machine (see the README in the repo)

5) Claim and complete a task on OpenUnited https://openunited.com/meta/openunited-product-factory/tasks When you are done with the task, issue a pull request and (IMPORTANT) make sure you complete the steps in OpenUnited to have this added to your portfolio.


After you have collected 50 non-liquid points by working on tasks on Open Products like OpenUnited itself (https://openunited.com/meta/openunited-product-factory/tasks), you are eligible to claim tasks with liquid points that are convertible into payment.


‍ Questions?


Here are our FAQs

The developer will maintain a react app and implement new features on a web-based single-page application. The company is fully remote, so no relocation is necessary. You will just need a steady internet connection. We have several full-time developers that extensively travel while working.Why Work for Us:We are a laid-back company that focuses on nurturing our employees and working together to make the RVing experience as easy as possible for our users. Monthly stipends for coffee, gyms, mental health, and high-speed internet. 
Complimentary high-end gear for development and testing.
Unlimited, Flexible Vacation
Competitive Salary
Team Retreats and Team Meetups
Responsibilities:Integrate new features and develop new components using React
Develop software in a fast-paced agile development environment using the latest frameworks and patterns
Collaborate with engineers, product owners and designers on new product features
Make recommendations for the adoption of new technologies based on your experience
Pair with and mentor teammates to develop and design prototypes to improve the customer journey interactively
Work through the software development agile process and its best practices, from continuously integrating code to production deployment
Code review pull requests in a CI/CD environment
Review requirements and provide input

4+ years of experience on a team developing scalable web apps in a modern Javascript framework (React, NestJS) and with a state management tool (Redux, Mobx)
Experience working with MySQL
BS in Computer Science or other related fields of study or applicable work experience
Familiarity with SCRUM as a development method for Agile Development
Familiarity with standard security practices protecting customer data

Experience with Laravel
Experience with Node.js
Experience developing location-based services with HERE Maps or a similar framework
Demonstrated knowledge and practical application of design patterns
Familiarity with Atomic Design, Responsive Web Design, and Mobile-First principles
Experience with Typescript
Experience with testing frameworks like Jest and Cypress
Experience with Axios
Experience with Microframeworks
Proficient with building and consuming microservices such as Rest
Strong administrative/organizational skills (ability to effectively prioritize, manage time, and meet deadlines)

Strong sense of ownership for creating great products
Highly developed ability to analyze and understand business context and logic behind the software solution
You care about performance and understanding the impacts on customers

Job Description:

RV Life is looking for a senior full-stack engineer to work on a rapidly expanding ecosystem of RV-related apps. The developer will maintain a react app and implement new features on a web-based single-page application. The company is fully remote, so no relocation is necessary. You will just need a steady internet connection. We have several full-time developers that extensively travel while working.

Why Work for Us:

We are a laid-back company that focuses on nurturing our employees and working together to make the RVing experience as easy as possible for our users.

We offer:


  • Comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision coverage, and 401(k)


  • Monthly stipends for coffee, gyms, mental health, and high-speed internet.


  • Complimentary high-end gear for development and testing.


  • Unlimited, Flexible Vacation


  • Competitive Salary


  • Team Retreats and Team Meetups


Responsibilities:


  • Integrate new features and develop new components using React


  • Develop software in a fast-paced agile development environment using the latest frameworks and patterns


  • Collaborate with engineers, product owners and designers on new product features


  • Make recommendations for the adoption of new technologies based on your experience


  • Pair with and mentor teammates to develop and design prototypes to improve the customer journey interactively


  • Work through the software development agile process and its best practices, from continuously integrating code to production deployment


  • Code review pull requests in a CI/CD environment


  • Review requirements and provide input


Minimum Experience:


  • 7+ years of software development


  • 4+ years of experience on a team developing scalable web apps in a modern Javascript framework (React, NestJS) and with a state management tool (Redux, Mobx)


  • Experience working with MySQL


  • BS in Computer Science or other related fields of study or applicable work experience


  • Familiarity with SCRUM as a development method for Agile Development


  • Familiarity with standard security practices protecting customer data



Preferred Experience:


  • Experience with React


  • Experience with Laravel


  • Experience with Node.js


  • Experience developing location-based services with HERE Maps or a similar framework


  • Demonstrated knowledge and practical application of design patterns


  • Familiarity with Atomic Design, Responsive Web Design, and Mobile-First principles


  • Experience with Typescript


  • Experience with testing frameworks like Jest and Cypress


  • Experience with Axios


  • Experience with Microframeworks


  • Proficient with building and consuming microservices such as Rest


  • Strong administrative/organizational skills (ability to effectively prioritize, manage time, and meet deadlines)


Bonus Points:


  • Passion for RVing


  • Strong sense of ownership for creating great products


  • Highly developed ability to analyze and understand business context and logic behind the software solution


  • You care about performance and understanding the impacts on customers

_source.description:
We are looking for a full-stack expert. You have taken multiple apps from conception to deployment, and have experience and opinions on the best technologies to use and why. You should be comfortable implementing new features from scratch, making changes to existing features and writing complex migrations on production data. You should be able to hit the ground running and be able to read code to figure out how it should work, how it currently works, and how best to improve it.Enzyme is a Y Combinator company (YC S17) with industry traction; we are growing our team to keep up with demand. This is an opportunity to be an early engineer at a startup that has found its feet and shape the engineering culture, and you should have opinions on how to do that.If you enjoy working with smart and kind people, want to work for a company with a goal to improve peoples' lives and want an opportunity to both grow with a company and shape that company's growth, we want to hear from you.
Benefits
We are a remote-first company with a 20-person team all over the world. When there is no global pandemic, we meet up for offsite retreats bi-annually, previously we have skied near Tahoe and tasted wine in Sonoma. Our Employee Handbook with the complete list of benefits is published here: https://github.com/EnzymeCorp/handbook

_source.description_html:
The Constant Company, LLC, the creator of Vultr, is a rapidly growing cloud infrastructure provider with 21 global data center locations and counting. Constant's flagship product, Vultr® is a favorite among developers, serving over 1.5 million customers with flexible, scalable bare metal, cloud compute, and cloud storage solutions.

As a Platform Engineer at Constant, you will be able to take your technical skills to the next level by tackling challenging issues as you support our ever-expanding global customer base in a new and expanding offering. We are searching for technology driven, detail oriented, team player who is looking to help strengthen our exceptional engineering teams. At Constant, you will push your technical skills to their limits and grow to new heights.

What you will take on:

  • Contribute to the code base that runs the Vultr Control Plane
  • Work with various operating systems to build images that will be deployed millions of time on the platform
  • Contribute to DB Table design with efficient queries
  • Enhance efficiency of our custom deployment microservices
  • Advance the automation of our QEMU/KVM virtualization platform
  • Create cloud networking features based on VXlan
  • Create systems for improved observability and reliability

Benefits


Competitive Compensation and Benefits which include:

  • Health/ Dental/ Vision/ Flex Spending Benefits
  • 401(k) plan with up to 3% contribution matching
  • Looking to grow? Continuing Education Reimbursement each year!
  • PTO + Sick + Personal Days + Holidays
  • Initial and quarterly allowances for remote office setup, upgrades and replacements
  • Monthly internet reimbursement available for remote employees

Salary Range: $75,000 - $125,000

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: equal opportunity employer

_source.description_html:
We are looking for a confident and experienced technical lead with excellent people skills and evidence of managing high pace development teams and complex software systems to join our Enterprise team. The team is well established and is crucial in providing multiple channels for our clients to engage with us, whether this is via API integrations or progressive web apps.


We have embarked on an ambitious product and technology strategy to drive our mission of simplifying healthcare and saving lives. This will be a challenging but rewarding role with huge scope for making an enormous impact and defining the products we build, as well as how we grow and evolve as a company.


What you will be doing


The role will require a highly motivated person who is comfortable wearing many hats as they will be the primary technical contact for the wider business and will work very closely with management stakeholders and other teams across the HealthHero group including product, support, governance, and operations.


Candidates must have a strong preference for hands-on problem solving. You will be responsible for mentoring and supporting team members, iterating procedures and practices to create an ideal environment for world-class development. Supported by our burgeoning SOC team, you and your team will be expected to own and run your team's software, focussing on quality, but making up the last line of support if required.


You will lead architectural discussions, championing best practices where appropriate and drive the design and execution of our solutions.


Establishing and maintaining collaboration between your team and the rest of the engineering teams is important to ensure a coherent technical vision for the business.


At HealthHero we expect our developers to own the entire software development lifecycle including refining business requirements, design, development, deployment, monitoring, continuous support and maintenance. Owning the whole process empowers developers to contribute to a wider context in the business and breaks down silos. As the role implies you will need to lead by example and mentor other developers whilst applying your knowledge to create industry-leading software as the business requires.


We are a collaborative and growing organisation, and we strongly encourage participation in our cross-tribe guilds (e.g. architecture, data). You will also be expected to present your teams work at cross-team knowledge sharing sessions and regular stakeholder briefings.


Our Tech Stack


C#, ASP.NET Core, React, JavaScript/TypeScript, Azure, Kubernetes, Event Driven Microservices, MSSQL, MongoDb, Elasticsearch, Terraform, Git, Azure Dev Ops.





Requirements



On the technical side this will require an understanding of best practice in several key areas including:



  • Software quality management (automated testing, shift left testing)

  • Event driven microservices

  • Modern C# & Dotnet

  • JavaScript & TypeScript

  • SQL & NoSQL databases

  • Cloud (Azure)

  • DevOps
_source.position_name: Tech Lead (Enterprise) at HealthHero (London, UK)

_source.description:
An excellent opportunity has arisen for an experience Backend Developer to join a growing company and develop a wide range of services and infrastructures. You have a passion for development and be ambitious, youandrsquo;ll enjoy hand on coding, be experienced with design and architecture, and have excellent exposure to working across the full development lifecycle. The technological stack is very rich, with focus on Node.js, Postgres, seasoned with some Go and a touch of Python. They are versed in the most up-to-date modern backend tooling, libraries, and frameworks. My client loves all things cloud and are 100% Dockerized and orchestrated using Kubernetes.Requirements:4+ years of experience developing backend infrastructure and services, ideally in Node.js using ES2017 standards.
Proficiency in databases (MySQL, Postgres, NoSQL).
Experience with Docker and container orchestration platforms
B.Sc. in CS or a similar degree - major advantage.
Experience with cloud development and maintenance - advantage.
Role and Responsibilities:Own integration pipelines and support our US-based healthcare partners and CS personnel.
Be responsible, deliver on time, and own your projects.
Keep up to date with the best practices and patterns in backend design and development.
Be ready to acquire an in-depth understanding of our technical challenges - from mobile/web APIs via security thinking to data management and BI requirements.
Collaborate effectively with a multidisciplinary team of developers, researchers, product managers, designers, sales and marketing, and other stakeholders to deliver the best outcomes.
What the role offers:A friendly, creative and dynamic work environment
Opportunity to work on cutting edge technology
Career progression into a key role at a fast growing start-up
Competitive salary and generous company equity options
Equal opportunities - we celebrate diversity
From an engineering standpoint, my client hold themselves to the highest standards. There services are robust, resilient, secure, performant, and scalable. They build an array of services that support the entire company's technical endeavors- everything from mobile and web applications to their internal research tools.

About the teamOur Salesforce Engineering team is responsible for the design, development, testing and maintenance of all custom development in our Salesforce instance, which acts as the central operating system for our Marketing, Sales, Operations and Service processes. Its mission is to present our customers with an intuitive onboarding and dashboard experience in a custom Salesforce Community while delivering to the operational needs of internal stakeholders and partners. In pursuit of this mission, the team implements best-in-class coding and development standards, systematic release processes, reliable testing and thorough quality assurance. It holds itself accountable not only for the timely delivery of high-quality software, but also for its close alignment with customers and stakeholder needs. As a member of the Salesforce Engineering team, you get to work closely with teams across LIQID andndash; in particular Front-End, Back-End, DevOps, QA and Salesforce Administration andndash; as well as with key external partners such as the Salesforce Customer Success Group.What makes our Salesforce Engineering team special? As part of a combined on-site and remote team and liaising closely with the Salesforce Customer Success Group, you get to work on an innovative custom Community implementation that employs a unique stack of React components, built and wrapped on LWC. From day one, our use of the latest Salesforce technologies and tech stack provide a unique learning opportunity while your ideas and expertise will find their way into a market-leading technical product that is reshaping the way affluent clients think about investing. As we firmly believe that great software can only be built by great professionals, we pay close attention to the mentoring, certification and training of our team members.About the roleAs a Salesforce Engineer (m/f/d) you play a leading role in designing and delivering our Salesforce implementations and projects. Working closely not only with your fellow Salesforce Engineers and Tech Lead, but also with our Product. Frontend, Backend, QA Teams to develop new solutions using our Salesforce platform and other in-house technologies, to support the automation of sales and operations business processes into our platform.What are some of your focus areas?1. Implementing new solutionsYou are in constant exchange with our Salesforce analysts in order to specify, design, develop, test and deploy solutions using the Salesforce platform. You make sure that all requirements are translated into clearly defined technical tasks, while ensuring expedient delivery across teams by interfacing with other engineers.2. Designing and automating new solutionsStarting with our clientsandrsquo; needs, you will design and deliver new Salesforce implementations. To further improve our ways of working, you will support the automation and integration of sales and operations business processes into our Salesforce platform. 3. Identifying opportunities for continuous improvement
You identify potentials for process improvement and automation - you challenge the status quo and take responsibility until the implementation is completed.About youWhat background are we looking for?You have between 1-3 years of working experience as a Salesforce Engineer writing Apex and Javascript code, and you feel comfortable building UI components in LWC and Aura.What skills and qualifications are we looking for?A good understanding of computer systems and how a large software-as-a-service system like Salesforce provides its services.You have a good knowledge of object oriented programming and what makes for a good maintainable code.You have some experience with Lightning framework: LWC and Aura, but would like to get deeper.You have experience in integration of Salesforce (REST API, SOAP API, etc.) and with other enterprise systems.You are fluent in English: spoken and written.What attitude are we looking for?You are a self-driven, analytical mind with the excellent ability of problem solving: you enjoy coming up with creative solutions in a fast paced environment.You are comfortable working in the challenging but informal environment of a scale-up.What we offerYou will join a world-class team with an extraordinary concentration of talent. We are international with diverse backgrounds, experiences and personalities. Cross-functional collaboration and client-centric thinking align us on our shared goals. We are driven by excellence and challenge the status quo. Join us in shaping the future of digital wealth management and start to write your personal growth story. Want to learn more about our benefits and perks? Visit our career page.What happens nextCandidate experience and transparency are at the heart of our interview process, which is designed to help us understand what working with each other would look and feel like.Brief get-to-know phone call with one of our recruiters: to clarify the basics.
Initial video interview with the hiring manager: to discuss how your experience and expectations match with what we are looking for.
Case study with the hiring manager and other members of the team: to dig into a typical problem you might encounter in your role.
Get to know the team: to take potential leaders, peers and stakeholders through your case study and to discuss any questions either of us might still have.
LIQID is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
_source.description_html:
About the team


Our Salesforce Engineering team is responsible for the design, development, testing and maintenance of all custom development in our Salesforce instance, which acts as the central operating system for our Marketing, Sales, Operations and Service processes.


Its mission is to present our customers with an intuitive onboarding and dashboard experience in a custom Salesforce Community while delivering to the operational needs of internal stakeholders and partners. In pursuit of this mission, the team implements best-in-class coding and development standards, systematic release processes, reliable testing and thorough quality assurance. It holds itself accountable not only for the timely delivery of high-quality software, but also for its close alignment with customers and stakeholder needs. As a member of the Salesforce Engineering team, you get to work closely with teams across LIQID – in particular Front-End, Back-End, DevOps, QA and Salesforce Administration – as well as with key external partners such as the Salesforce Customer Success Group.


What makes our Salesforce Engineering team special?


As part of a combined on-site and remote team and liaising closely with the Salesforce Customer Success Group, you get to work on an innovative custom Community implementation that employs a unique stack of React components, built and wrapped on LWC. From day one, our use of the latest Salesforce technologies and tech stack provide a unique learning opportunity while your ideas and expertise will find their way into a market-leading technical product that is reshaping the way affluent clients think about investing. As we firmly believe that great software can only be built by great professionals, we pay close attention to the mentoring, certification and training of our team members.


About the role


As a Salesforce Engineer (m/f/d) you play a leading role in designing and delivering our Salesforce implementations and projects. Working closely not only with your fellow Salesforce Engineers & Tech Lead, but also with our Product. Frontend, Backend, QA Teams to develop new solutions using our Salesforce platform and other in-house technologies, to support the automation of sales and operations business processes into our platform.



What are some of your focus areas?


1. Implementing new solutions


You are in constant exchange with our Salesforce analysts in order to specify, design, develop, test and deploy solutions using the Salesforce platform. You make sure that all requirements are translated into clearly defined technical tasks, while ensuring expedient delivery across teams by interfacing with other engineers.


2. Designing and automating new solutions


Starting with our clients’ needs, you will design and deliver new Salesforce implementations. To further improve our ways of working, you will support the automation and integration of sales and operations business processes into our Salesforce platform.


3. Identifying opportunities for continuous improvement
You identify potentials for process improvement and automation - you challenge the status quo and take responsibility until the implementation is completed.


About you


What background are we looking for?


You have between 1-3 years of working experience as a Salesforce Engineer writing Apex & Javascript code, and you feel comfortable building UI components in LWC & Aura.


What skills and qualifications are we looking for?


A good understanding of computer systems and how a large software-as-a-service system like Salesforce provides its services.


You have a good knowledge of object oriented programming & what makes for a good maintainable code.


You have some experience with Lightning framework: LWC & Aura, but would like to get deeper.


You have experience in integration of Salesforce (REST API, SOAP API, etc.) and with other enterprise systems.


You are fluent in English: spoken and written.


What attitude are we looking for?


You are a self-driven, analytical mind with the excellent ability of problem solving: you enjoy coming up with creative solutions in a fast paced environment.


You are comfortable working in the challenging but informal environment of a scale-up.


What we offer


You will join a world-class team with an extraordinary concentration of talent. We are international with diverse backgrounds, experiences and personalities. Cross-functional collaboration and client-centric thinking align us on our shared goals. We are driven by excellence and challenge the status quo. Join us in shaping the future of digital wealth management and start to write your personal growth story. Want to learn more about our benefits and perks? Visit our career page.


What happens next


Candidate experience and transparency are at the heart of our interview process, which is designed to help us understand what working with each other would look and feel like.



  1. Brief get-to-know phone call with one of our recruiters: to clarify the basics.

  2. Initial video interview with the hiring manager: to discuss how your experience and expectations match with what we are looking for.

  3. Case study with the hiring manager & other members of the team: to dig into a typical problem you might encounter in your role.

  4. Get to know the team: to take potential leaders, peers and stakeholders through your case study and to discuss any questions either of us might still have.


LIQID is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
_source.position_name: Salesforce Engineer (m/f/d) at LIQID Investments GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)

_source.description:
Software Developer*bTrace Tomorrow is a newly founded company within BAADER. The focus is on an interdisciplinary team of digitization experts who are committed to using digital possibilities and a global network of partners to improve the entire food value chain for all stakeholders involved andndash; for an innovative, transparent and safe food supply.Your role:You will develop IoT, cloud and Industry 4.0 software projects, which includes the integration of various data sources.
In this role, you will work in an agile software development team and will participate in the sub-project management of big data and advanced analytics projects.
Analysing problems and creating corresponding technical specifications will also be part of your responsibilities.
You will manage microservices and event sourcing and will use various technologies such as Apache Kafka, Angular, MongoDB, AWS, Siemens MindSphere.
Your profile:You have successfully completed studies in computer science or have a comparable qualification.
This position requires relevant work experience in software development alongside knowledge of programming languages such as Node.js, Java, Go or R as well as very good knowledge of current frameworks and software development techniques.
Experience in developing software for Windows and Linux and knowledge of Git and TDD are desirable.
You have experience in the application of software development process models, preferably in agile development (Scrum).
Good communication skills in English andndash; and ideally also in German andndash;, a solution-oriented working style as well as persuasiveness and the willingness to travel are also necessary.
What you can expect: Internationality
Permanent employment contract
Start-up atmosphere with the security of a successful group of companies behind you
Interesting and varied job
Attractive income
30 days vacation/year
Flexible working hours
Mobile working
Free mineral water and coffee
Company sports offers
Workplace health promotion
Further qualification and education offers
Contact:Are you interested in this challenge and would you like to become part of our team? Then please apply online here. We are looking forward to hearing from you!Apply nowbaader.com

* All terms refer to people of any gender.
_source.description_html:
Software Developer*


bTrace Tomorrow is a newly founded company within BAADER. The focus is on an interdisciplinary team of digitization experts who are committed to using digital possibilities and a global network of partners to improve the entire food value chain for all stakeholders involved – for an innovative, transparent and safe food supply.


Your role:



  • You will develop IoT, cloud and Industry 4.0 software projects, which includes the integration of various data sources.

  • In this role, you will work in an agile software development team and will participate in the sub-project management of big data and advanced analytics projects.

  • Analysing problems and creating corresponding technical specifications will also be part of your responsibilities.

  • You will manage microservices and event sourcing and will use various technologies such as Apache Kafka, Angular, MongoDB, AWS, Siemens MindSphere.


Your profile:



  • You have successfully completed studies in computer science or have a comparable qualification.

  • This position requires relevant work experience in software development alongside knowledge of programming languages such as Node.js, Java, Go or R as well as very good knowledge of current frameworks and software development techniques.

  • Experience in developing software for Windows and Linux and knowledge of Git and TDD are desirable.

  • You have experience in the application of software development process models, preferably in agile development (Scrum).

  • Good communication skills in English – and ideally also in German –, a solution-oriented working style as well as persuasiveness and the willingness to travel are also necessary.


What you can expect:



  • Internationality

  • Permanent employment contract

  • Start-up atmosphere with the security of a successful group of companies behind you

  • Interesting and varied job

  • Attractive income

  • 30 days vacation/year

  • Flexible working hours

  • Mobile working

  • Free mineral water and coffee

  • Company sports offers

Apply now

_source.description:
In the Customer Fulfilment domain, you will be part of our Partner Connectivity Product Area responsible for fulfilling customer deliveries through a flexible and sustainable partner ecosystem.You will join a team with a true team spirit, who work together cohesively andndash; across the globe andndash; with a positive working atmosphere and always supporting each other. Together you will take direction and play an important role in our integration journey andndash; and to shape the future of logistics.As a Solution Architect you will create solutions for all brands within the HandM group, which are simple yet powerful for the end user. Our small and cross-competent product teams offer great individual responsibilities where you will be accountable for the whole product.Responsibilities
You will work alongside a Product Owner, Business Experts and Software Engineers in an agile team, with the responsibility for creating and designing solutions that fulfil our customers' shopping experience. Some of your daily work includes:Translate product strategy and requirements into suitable, maintainable and scalable solutions
Collaborate closely with Product Owner and other cross-functional teams and suppliers, share best practice as well as discuss and motivate design solutions
Work with innovative, sustainable and new business models
If needed, you will participate in troubleshooting alongside with the team
We are looking for you who:
Have previous experience from working with many stakeholders, have worked with distributed teams, and with integration platforms and who knows how to translate business requirements and visualise technical roadmaps.As a Solution Architect at HandM Group you will embark on a journey that will lead to something new and exciting - we will test, fail and learn. You are an important player in this transformation, and so we believe you are communicative, flexible and a team player.We also believe that you have:Bachelorandrsquo;s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Economics or related field
5 + years of work experience working in different areas such as requirements, test, architecture or programming (preferably Microsoft stack)
Previous experience within warehouse or logistics is a great advantage
Experience from cloud platforms, preferably Azure or Google cloud
andldquo;You build it you run itandrdquo; mindset andndash; with hands-on experience of DevOps and Jira is nice
Experience in process modelling and information architecture
Worked with agile practices
Good communication capabilities and a pedagogic mindset
Good knowledge, both written and oral, in English
What we can offer
At HandM Group we have a strong, value-driven culture characterised by believing in people, teamwork and an entrepreneurial spirit. Here you can be yourself and develop. You will be part of an important project at HandM Group with significant opportunities to influence and make a difference. With the right mindset and ambition, you will find plenty of room to grow. If this sounds exciting to you, come join the journey and build the future with us!
This is a full-time position with placement in Stockholm. Please apply with your CV and Personal letter as soon as possible, no later than 31th of January. If you have any questions about the role, please contact Marta Wieczorek, at marta.wieczorek@hm.com.We are looking forward to your application!
_source.description_html:
In the Customer Fulfilment domain, you will be part of our Partner Connectivity Product Area responsible for fulfilling customer deliveries through a flexible and sustainable partner ecosystem.






You will join a team with a true team spirit, who work together cohesively – across the globe – with a positive working atmosphere and always supporting each other. Together you will take direction and play an important role in our integration journey – and to shape the future of logistics.


As a Solution Architect you will create solutions for all brands within the H&M group, which are simple yet powerful for the end user. Our small and cross-competent product teams offer great individual responsibilities where you will be accountable for the whole product.


Responsibilities
You will work alongside a Product Owner, Business Experts and Software Engineers in an agile team, with the responsibility for creating and designing solutions that fulfil our customers' shopping experience. Some of your daily work includes:



  • Translate product strategy and requirements into suitable, maintainable and scalable solutions

  • Collaborate closely with Product Owner and other cross-functional teams and suppliers, share best practice as well as discuss and motivate design solutions

  • Work with innovative, sustainable and new business models

  • If needed, you will participate in troubleshooting alongside with the team







We are looking for you who:
Have previous experience from working with many stakeholders, have worked with distributed teams, and with integration platforms and who knows how to translate business requirements and visualise technical roadmaps.


As a Solution Architect at H&M Group you will embark on a journey that will lead to something new and exciting - we will test, fail and learn. You are an important player in this transformation, and so we believe you are communicative, flexible and a team player.


We also believe that you have:



  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Economics or related field

  • 5 + years of work experience working in different areas such as requirements, test, architecture or programming (preferably Microsoft stack)

  • Previous experience within warehouse or logistics is a great advantage

  • Experience from cloud platforms, preferably Azure or Google cloud

  • “You build it you run it” mindset – with hands-on experience of DevOps and Jira is nice

  • Experience in process modelling and information architecture

  • Worked with agile practices

  • Good communication capabilities and a pedagogic mindset

  • Good knowledge, both written and oral, in English







What we can offer
At H&M Group we have a strong, value-driven culture characterised by believing in people, teamwork and an entrepreneurial spirit. Here you can be yourself and develop. You will be part of an important project at H&M Group with significant opportunities to influence and make a difference. With the right mindset and ambition, you will find plenty of room to grow.


If this sounds exciting to you, come join the journey and build the future with us!
This is a full-time position with placement in Stockholm. Please apply with your CV and Personal letter as soon as possible, no later than 31th of January. If you have any questions about the role, please contact Marta Wieczorek, at marta.wieczorek@hm.com.


We are looking forward to your application!
_source.position_name: Solution Architect in Partner Connectivity team within H&M Group at H&M Hennes & Mauritz GBC AB (Stockholm, Sweden)

_source.description_html:
Ihre Aufgabenschwerpunkte:



  • Sie haben den Überblick über sicherheitsrelevante Themen, wie IT-Sicherheit, Lizenzrecht, DSGVO, Rechtssicherheit, Ausfallsicherheit und Zutrittskontrolle.

  • Sie verantworten die Identifikation und Analyse von Security Incidents

  • Sie wirken an Ausschreibungen mit und berücksichtigen dabei den Sicherheitsaspekt.

  • Sie führen Risikoanalysen in bestehenden Projekten oder Produkten durch und geben Handlungsempfehlungen.

  • Sie kennen die branchenüblichen Zertifizierungen und bereiten Projekte darauf vor



Weiterhin verfügen Sie über:



  • sehr gute Kenntnisse in Authentifizierung, Identifizierung, Verschlüsselung, Signaturen, Schlüssel- und Zertifikatsmanagement, Rollen und Rechtemanagement

  • einen sicheren Umgang in Quellcodeanalyse, Black-Box-Tests, Penetration Testing

  • Kenntnisse in bewährten Praktiken für Sicherheit bei IT-Projekten

  • ein hohes Verständnis für IT-Bausteine, die für IT-Sicherheit notwendig sind

  • Erfahrungen in Vorgehensweisen zur Integration der IT-Sicherheit in den Softwareentwicklungsprozess

  • Verständnis für Cloud-Sicherheitsarchitektur

  • ein hohes Niveau in der Risikobewertung von Sicherheitsthemen

  • sicherer Umgang mit Tools zur Bewertung von IT-Sicherheit als auch zum Erkennen/ zur Vermeidung von Sicherheitslücken

  • Lust an der Arbeit im Team und der Wissensvermittlung

_source.description_html:
Want to join the #1 marketing data pipeline company and one of Europe’s fastest-growing tech companies?


We’re looking for Senior Full-Stack Developer to join the Sales Operations team!


You will make an impact by…
Helping our Sales Operations team to reach their targets by designing and implementing solutions to bring all the necessary prospects and customer data from our databases to our sales team and platforms like Salesforce. Developing these solutions in a scalable way to support our sales processes as the team and revenue doubles or triples. You’ll be working closely with Sales Operations, Sales, and Engineering teams.


Ideally, you’ll be located in Finland


Technologies you’ll be working with



  • React.js

  • Vue.js

  • PHP and/or Typescript (willing to learn PHP)


This role is for you if you have:



  • Strong back-end programming skills (PHP, Typescript/Javascript)

  • Solid experience and up to date knowledge of React

  • Familiarity with other JavaScript frameworks, such as Vue.js

  • Familiarity with different databases, such as MySQL, Redis, Google BigQuery

  • An interest in sales operations

  • Excellent English skills (written and spoken)

  • Gained these skills over several years of work in challenging projects and positions


Read more about our engineering team


What’s in it for you?


The reason people love to work at Supermetrics is that we all work towards the same goal using our own individual strengths. We’re determined to achieve our vision of being the best business data pipeline company in the world.


At Supermetrics, we have unrivaled team spirit and a shared thirst for continuous learning and sharing our knowledge. We take our work seriously - not so much ourselves. We recognize our team as our greatest asset and take good care of our people.


Here’s more info about our culture and benefits!


And in case we haven’t met before, here’s Supermetrics in a nutshell:


It all started from a Google t-shirt...


Supermetrics was founded in 2013 as a result of one data geek’s will to win a Google t-shirt, and we have been profitable and growing ever since!


We build products that are used by 500k people worldwide in small and big companies alike (BBC, Dyson, and WarnerBros, to name a few). Marketers, data analysts, and engineers use Supermetrics to move data from popular marketing platforms (such as Facebook, Google Ads, and HubSpot) to destinations like Google Sheets, Google Data Studio, Excel, various BI tools, and data warehouses.


We are a diverse community of curious minds excited to build the best business data solutions ever. Kindness, humility, openness, and dedication to our respective crafts are our most prevalent traits.


Does this sound like your next adventure? Apply now! We’ll fill the role as soon as we find the right person.
_source.position_name: Senior Full-Stack Developer at Supermetrics Oy (Helsinki, Finland)
