_source.description_html:
Senior Front-end Software Engineer

Looking for a company where you can shape how the world buys, sells, and gives? Where you'll be supported in challenging convention, taking risks, and innovating? Where you'll form part of a work culture that's been genuinely committed to diversity and inclusion since its founding more than 25 years ago? Where you can just be yourself, do your best work, and have a meaningful impact? If so, we'd love to talk to you.

Every day, millions of users sell and ship their wares using eBay. Our team supports this varied community by building shipping products around the globe, helping individual sellers and small businesses to meet the growing expectations of online buyers. We are a product-first team who move fast and stay curious. Join us to make an impact on one of the world's largest e-commerce websites.

WHAT YOU BRING:

- Agile: Test-Driven Development, collaboration and continuous delivery are your preferred engineering practices. We take the best bits of Lean, Scrum and Kanban too.

- Architecture: In a large scale distributed web-application, you choose the right tool for the job at hand. You know when to break something out into a new component and the best way to wire it in, when to go with the simplest fit into the current system and when to rethink the existing approach.

- Experience: You have 4+ years of experience working at a high level, confident working on a range of languages and frameworks and are happy to pick up new ones. You like working on established technology stacks as well as continuously changing platforms.

WHAT WE BRING:

- Rewarding technical challenges - fixing eCommerce delivery requires solving difficult technical problems: building unified shipping platforms for diverse customers, iterating fast while providing the best customer experience, constantly improving our technology while dealing with the eBay volume is what we do best.

- Wonderful, bright, air-conditioned offices in Shoreditch, with bike racks (and shower!), right next to Liverpool St and Shoreditch High Street stations for super easy commuting, and lots of great food options nearby.

- Great company culture - we have a culture of respect and high expectations of others. We love sharing a drink during our Friday All Hands, play board games and enjoy free lunch on our demo day.

- Flexible working - really great support for working from home (we've got good video conferencing facilities) and a great holiday package.

- Competitive salary and generous benefits.

WHAT YOU'LL DO/LEARN:

- You will be a member of one of eBay's Shipping agile teams. You will work across the full development cycle, from helping to define the roadmap to deploying and monitoring your work in production.

- You'll mainly be working with React on our front-end clients, including TypeScript, Webpack, CSS Modules, Less, and Sass. A willingness to do occasional work on our back-end systems (written in Node.js, Java, and Kotlin) is a bonus.

- Apply TDD/BDD and other agile practices on all the code you deliver.

- Constantly improve quality: refactoring code, proposing new tools and changing processes.

- Pair with team members and collaborate with remote teams to share knowledge and give/get constant feedback.

- Previous experience on mature agile teams delivering continuously is preferred.

Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether youre single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs. Including maternal & paternal leave, paid sabbatical, and plans to help ensure your financial security today and in the years ahead because we know feeling financially secure during your working years and through retirement is important.

Here at eBay, we love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isnt just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel eBay is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work. To learn about eBays Diversity & Inclusion click here: https://www.ebayinc.com/company/diversity-inclusion/

#LI-AZ1

#SO #Premium

eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible. Jobs posted with location as "Remote - United States (Excludes CO, HI, NM)" excludes Colorado, Hawaii and New Mexico.

For more information see: EEO is the Law Poster and EEO is the Law Poster Supplement

View our privacy policy and accessibility info

_source.description:

We do too.Plex is more than a software company andmdash; weandrsquo;re a team of disruptors who are driving innovation and unlocking the promise and value of smart manufacturing.It isnandrsquo;t a trend or a moment, itandrsquo;s a movement. And weandrsquo;re leading it, but we canandrsquo;t lead it alone. Thatandrsquo;s where you come in.Plex Systems, Inc.andreg; delivers the first smart manufacturing platform, helping the worldandrsquo;s leading innovators to make awesome products.Built in the cloud, the Plex Smart Manufacturing Platform includes MES, ERP, supply chain management, Industrial IoT, and analytics.We believe that anything that can be made can be made better, and we are focused on finding the right people to help us achieve the big important tasks ahead.Is that person you?In support of our ongoing growth, we are looking for a Software Engineer to join our application team and play a key role in helping build the Plex Automation and Orchestration product. Your role is hands-on with exposure to different aspects of the product andndash; API, UI, business logic, SCADA, and more. IS IT IN YOU?Computer Engineering degree with 3+ years of software development experience, ideally within Java
Object-oriented programming such as C#, C++, Python, PHP or Java, etc
Full stack skills or comfortable working in multiple domains
Knowledge of HTTP protocol and web sockets
Knowledge of JavaScript APIs (i.e. Mutation Observer)
Knowledge of Java Streams
Ability to solve business problems
Ability to work independently and in a team environment
Preferred skills:Knowledge of Tridium Niagara
Knowledge of the Velocity template language
Personal/professional experience developing and maintaining web sites
Experience working within a team
Experience working in an agile environment

General knowledge:RESTful APIs
Quality testing
SQL databases as an end user
Web security and best practices

WHATandrsquo;S IN IT FOR YOU?We are proud to be recognized as one of the top workplaces in the tech industry. Our inviting culture fosters collaboration, innovation, and motivates team members to take on important work, every day.In addition to all the benefits youandrsquo;d expect from a world-class company like ours, we also offer Day 1 benefits, career growth and professional development opportunities, tuition reimbursement, unlimited paid time off, a wellness allowance to support your familyandrsquo;s well-being, sustainable work-life balance, and flexibility. Our multiple office locations offer a casual-dress workplace, complimentary snacks and drinks, and andldquo;de-stress areasandrdquo; complete with amenities in some locations like massage chairs, golf simulator, ping pong tables and more.Plex values the power of diversity and inclusion andndash; it isnandrsquo;t just a talking point for us. Plex urges our employees to understand, accept, and celebrate the differences among people.SOUND LIKE YOUR DREAM JOB?Apply today!EXCITED ABOUT PLEX BUT NOT THE RIGHT GIG?Donandrsquo;t despair andndash; your perfect fit is on its way! _source.description_html:
Software Engineer – Automation & Orchestration


Want to work with fearless innovators, visionaries, and community-minded people who challenge the status quo? We do too.


Plex is more than a software company — we’re a team of disruptors who are driving innovation and unlocking the promise and value of smart manufacturing.


It isn’t a trend or a moment, it’s a movement. And we’re leading it, but we can’t lead it alone. That’s where you come in.


Plex Systems, Inc.® delivers the first smart manufacturing platform, helping the world’s leading innovators to make awesome products.Built in the cloud, the Plex Smart Manufacturing Platform includes MES, ERP, supply chain management, Industrial IoT, and analytics.


We believe that anything that can be made can be made better, and we are focused on finding the right people to help us achieve the big important tasks ahead.


Is that person you?


In support of our ongoing growth, we are looking for a Software Engineer to join our application team and play a key role in helping build the Plex Automation and Orchestration product. Your role is hands-on with exposure to different aspects of the product – API, UI, business logic, SCADA, and more. You’ll wear many different hats, so we’re looking for engineers that like to explore, learn, and innovate!


Preferred location is Troy, MI but highly qualified remote candidates will also be considered.


WHAT’S YOUR IMPACT?



  • Design and develop the product, evaluate new use cases, write connectors to 3rd party products, and establish data flows between Plex and its product stack.

  • Collaborate with other developers, managers, customers, and stakeholders

  • Strengthen the security, stability, and scalability of the product for existing solutions

  • Responsibilities:

    • Write web applications for the front end

    • Write Java code for the Tridium back end

    • Build custom web pages based off customer specifications

    • Create pages interacting with Tridium Niagara wiresheet (SCADA integration)

    • Create Java objects for use in web templates

    • Test web applications manually or through automation

    • Maintain Java objects for web transactions/RESTful API calls




IS IT IN YOU?



  • Computer Engineering degree with 3+ years of software development experience, ideally within Java

  • Object-oriented programming such as C#, C++, Python, PHP or Java, etc

  • Full stack skills or comfortable working in multiple domains

  • Knowledge of HTTP protocol & web sockets

  • Knowledge of JavaScript APIs (i.e. Mutation Observer)

  • Knowledge of Java Streams

  • Ability to solve business problems

  • Ability to work independently and in a team environment

  • Preferred skills:

    • Knowledge of Tridium Niagara

    • Knowledge of the Velocity template language

    • Personal/professional experience developing and maintaining web sites

    • Experience working within a team

    • Experience working in an agile environment



  • General knowledge:

    • RESTful APIs

    • Quality testing

    • SQL databases as an end user

    • Web security & best practices




WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?


We are proud to be recognized as one of the top workplaces in the tech industry. Our inviting culture fosters collaboration, innovation, and motivates team members to take on important work, every day.


In addition to all the benefits you’d expect from a world-class company like ours, we also offer Day 1 benefits, career growth and professional development opportunities, tuition reimbursement, unlimited paid time off, a wellness allowance to support your family’s well-being, sustainable work-life balance, and flexibility. Our multiple office locations offer a casual-dress workplace, complimentary snacks and drinks, and “de-stress areas” complete with amenities in some locations like massage chairs, golf simulator, ping pong tables and more.


Plex values the power of diversity and inclusion – it isn’t just a talking point for us. It drives our business and fosters fresh thinking, and is reflected in the individuals we hire, and the culture and community we’ve built to support them, such as our Women@Plex and Pride@Plex groups. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applicants of all types and from all backgrounds. Plex urges our employees to understand, accept, and celebrate the differences among people.


SOUND LIKE YOUR DREAM JOB?


Apply today!


EXCITED ABOUT PLEX BUT NOT THE RIGHT GIG?


Don’t despair – your perfect fit is on its way! Stay connected, sign up for job alerts or submit a general application on the Plex Careers page

Willkommen beim DLR!Unser Institut fanduuml;r Instandhaltung und Modifikation in Aachen sucht eine/n Ingenieur/in Luft- und Raumfahrttechnik, Informatiker/in, Mathematiker/in o.andauml;. (w/m/d) fanduuml;r die Ermittlung material- und nutzungsspezifischer Bauteilentwicklungen fanduuml;r eine individuell optimierte Instandhaltung.Ihre Mission:Im neu entstehenden Innovationszentrum fanduuml;r Kleinflugzeugtechnologie in der Region Aachen/Merzbranduuml;ck erforschen und entwickeln Sie datenwissenschaftliche Methoden zur Prognose von Bauteilzustandauml;nden auf Basis individueller Materialeigenschaften und Nutzungsprofile fanduuml;r die Optimierung der zukanduuml;nftigen Instandhaltung solcher Komponenten.Dabei arbeiten Sie in engem Austausch mit dem Projektteam vor Ort sowie mit weiteren DLR-Instituten, u.a. in Hamburg, Braunschweig und Stuttgart.Ihre Qualifikation:erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium (Diplom, Master) im Bereich Informatik, Datenwissenschaften oder Luft- und Raumfahrttechnik (mit datenwissenschaftlicher Ausrichtung)
gute Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Datenbanken
sehr gute Kenntnisse in einschlandauml;gigen Programmiersprachen und Entwicklungsumgebungen (insb. Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Kenntnisse in den Methoden der gemeinsamen Softwareentwicklung
selbstandauml;ndige und eigenverantwortliche Arbeitsweise
hohes Abstraktionsvermandouml;gen
Englisch in Wort und Schrift

_source.description_html:
Willkommen beim DLR!


Unser Institut für Instandhaltung und Modifikation in Aachen sucht eine/n Ingenieur/in Luft- und Raumfahrttechnik, Informatiker/in, Mathematiker/in o.ä. (w/m/d) für die Ermittlung material- und nutzungsspezifischer Bauteilentwicklungen für eine individuell optimierte Instandhaltung.


Ihre Mission:


Im neu entstehenden Innovationszentrum für Kleinflugzeugtechnologie in der Region Aachen/Merzbrück erforschen und entwickeln Sie datenwissenschaftliche Methoden zur Prognose von Bauteilzuständen auf Basis individueller Materialeigenschaften und Nutzungsprofile für die Optimierung der zukünftigen Instandhaltung solcher Komponenten.


Dabei arbeiten Sie in engem Austausch mit dem Projektteam vor Ort sowie mit weiteren DLR-Instituten, u.a. in Hamburg, Braunschweig und Stuttgart.


Ihre Qualifikation:



  • erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium (Diplom, Master) im Bereich Informatik, Datenwissenschaften oder Luft- und Raumfahrttechnik (mit datenwissenschaftlicher Ausrichtung)

  • gute Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Datenbanken

  • sehr gute Kenntnisse in einschlägigen Programmiersprachen und Entwicklungsumgebungen (insb. Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch)

  • Kenntnisse in den Methoden der gemeinsamen Softwareentwicklung

  • selbständige und eigenverantwortliche Arbeitsweise

  • hohes Abstraktionsvermögen

  • Englisch in Wort und Schrift


Ihr Start:


Freuen Sie sich auf einen Arbeitgeber, der Ihr Engagement zu schätzen weiß und Ihre Entwicklung durch vielfältige Qualifizierungs- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten fördert. Unser einzigartiges Arbeitsumfeld bietet Ihnen Gestaltungsfreiräume und eine unvergleichbare Infrastruktur, in der Sie Ihre Mission verwirklichen können. Vereinbarkeit von Privatleben, Familie und Beruf sowie Chancengleichheit von Personen aller Geschlechter (w/m/d) sind wichtiger Bestandteil unserer Personalpolitik. Bewerbungen schwerbehinderter Menschen bevorzugen wir bei fachlicher Eignung.
_source.position_name: Data Science Methoden zur Prognose von Bauteilzuständen at Deutsches Zentrum für Luft- und Raumfahrt e.V. (Aachen, Deutschland)

_source.description:
From autonomous industrial robots to self-charging drones and chatbot platforms, we're building it and you can be part of it. Motius is a research and development company specializing in the development of products and prototypes in the latest tech fields (AI, IoT, AR/VR and many more). With the unique combination of a permanent core team and an interdisciplinary tech community, we reinvent RandD and develop the tech products of the future together with our customers.As Senior Backend Architect (m/f/d) you're part of our Software Cluster and join our diverse RandD projects (each ~3-9 months duration) in small and agile teams as Lead Engineer. But in this role, you'll not only be part of 1 or 2 of our exciting Motius projects. By asking the right questions and using your comprehensive technical know-how, you will also work closely with our clients and our Sales and Partner Impact Team to develop initial product ideas and concrete technical solutions from vague problems. Internally we call this position Tech Specialist. You can find sample projects in our Motius Success Stories.Your roleLead Backend Engineer in our RandD projects with engineering teams of 2-5 people
Depending on your background and your preference, you are building complex production ready systems and digital solutions for a wide range of industries and for different use cases
Defining the right tech stack and setting up the architecture for the new projects in close collaboration with our Sales and Partner Impact Team
Following a two-weekly Scrum process using GitLab, Jira, Slack, Continous Integration and Delivery, etc., mostly working with the team in the HQ in Munich or remotely - we don't do customer-on-site consulting
Mentoring and coaching engineers on Backend, Architecture and Cloud topics, making sure we build high quality products
Constantly improving our Software cluster and building up knowledge by introducing new tools, best practices or frameworks and sharing learning from our projects
Your profileUniversity degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or in similar disciplines and at least 4 years of experience in agile development projects
Proven experience with backend development using Python, Javascript or any mainstream language. We are free to choose tech stacks for most of our projects, but we most commonly work with Django, FastAPI and GraphQL
Experience with AWS, Azure, or GCP is a plus since some of our projects are built using AWS technologies like S3, SNS, SQS, Lambda, DynamoDB, Glue and CloudFront
Knowledge of frontend development using tools like React and Vue is a plus and curiosity for our DevOps processes and infrastructure (Docker, Kubernetes, Rancher)
Experience in engineering practices such as code refactoring, design patterns, design driven development, continuous integration, building highly scalable applications/digital product
Strong analytical and problem solving skills paired with the ability to develop creative and efficient solutions for our clients
Comfortable with ambiguity and rapid changes common in early-stage product development and strong command of English language (both verbal and written), German is a plus
Our offerUnique and inspiring working culture with many smart engineers from diverse backgrounds (e.g. software developers, Embedded system engineers, Mechanical engineers, Computer Vision researchers etc.) coming from over 15 different countries
Exciting insights into the markets, technologies and products of the future through collaboration with clients from a wide range of industries plus the opportunity to accelerate our clients' innovation cycles
Fulltime and permanent employment as a Tech Specialist and a defined Talent Journey for your further development, as well as regular peer reviews
Learning and development budget and our regular Tech Discovery for learning and discovering new technologies
Pushing and realizing the topics that you're interested in and using Motius as a machine for that
Other perks and benefits of a startup: Lots of flexibility and responsibility, flat hierarchies, regular teambuilding and company events, free access to our workshop area and also to Makerspace, you can find more details and reasons why you should join Motius in our latest blog post and on Instagram @teammotius.
We are looking forward to receiving your application with CV, motivation letter, possible start date and salary expectation.
_source.description_html:
From autonomous industrial robots to self-charging drones and chatbot platforms, we're building it and you can be part of it. Motius is a research and development company specializing in the development of products and prototypes in the latest tech fields (AI, IoT, AR/VR and many more). With the unique combination of a permanent core team and an interdisciplinary tech community, we reinvent R&D and develop the tech products of the future together with our customers.


As Senior Backend Architect (m/f/d) you're part of our Software Cluster and join our diverse R&D projects (each ~3-9 months duration) in small and agile teams as Lead Engineer. But in this role, you'll not only be part of 1 or 2 of our exciting Motius projects. By asking the right questions and using your comprehensive technical know-how, you will also work closely with our clients and our Sales and Partner Impact Team to develop initial product ideas and concrete technical solutions from vague problems. Internally we call this position Tech Specialist. You can find sample projects in our Motius Success Stories.


Your role



  • Lead Backend Engineer in our R&D projects with engineering teams of 2-5 people

  • Depending on your background and your preference, you are building complex production ready systems and digital solutions for a wide range of industries and for different use cases

  • Defining the right tech stack and setting up the architecture for the new projects in close collaboration with our Sales & Partner Impact Team

  • Following a two-weekly Scrum process using GitLab, Jira, Slack, Continous Integration & Delivery, etc., mostly working with the team in the HQ in Munich or remotely - we don't do customer-on-site consulting

  • Mentoring and coaching engineers on Backend, Architecture & Cloud topics, making sure we build high quality products

  • Constantly improving our Software cluster and building up knowledge by introducing new tools, best practices or frameworks and sharing learning from our projects


Your profile



  • University degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or in similar disciplines and at least 4 years of experience in agile development projects

  • Proven experience with backend development using Python, Javascript or any mainstream language. We are free to choose tech stacks for most of our projects, but we most commonly work with Django, FastAPI and GraphQL

  • Experience with AWS, Azure, or GCP is a plus since some of our projects are built using AWS technologies like S3, SNS, SQS, Lambda, DynamoDB, Glue and CloudFront

  • Knowledge of frontend development using tools like React and Vue is a plus and curiosity for our DevOps processes and infrastructure (Docker, Kubernetes, Rancher)

  • Experience in engineering practices such as code refactoring, design patterns, design driven development, continuous integration, building highly scalable applications/digital product

  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills paired with the ability to develop creative and efficient solutions for our clients

  • Comfortable with ambiguity and rapid changes common in early-stage product development and strong command of English language (both verbal and written), German is a plus


Our offer



  • Unique and inspiring working culture with many smart engineers from diverse backgrounds (e.g. software developers, Embedded system engineers, Mechanical engineers, Computer Vision researchers etc.) coming from over 15 different countries

  • Exciting insights into the markets, technologies and products of the future through collaboration with clients from a wide range of industries plus the opportunity to accelerate our clients' innovation cycles

  • Fulltime & permanent employment as a Tech Specialist and a defined Talent Journey for your further development, as well as regular peer reviews

  • Learning & development budget and our regular Tech Discovery for learning and discovering new technologies

  • Pushing and realizing the topics that you're interested in and using Motius as a machine for that

  • Other perks & benefits of a startup: Lots of flexibility and responsibility, flat hierarchies, regular teambuilding and company events, free access to our workshop area and also to Makerspace, you can find more details and reasons why you should join Motius in our latest blog post and on Instagram @team_motius.


We are looking forward to receiving your application with CV, motivation letter, possible start date and salary expectation.
_source.position_name: Senior Backend Architect (m/f/d) at Motius GmbH (München, Deutschland)

_source.description_html:
Are you an enthusiastic medior or senior software engineer (C++ or/ and C#) and do you love to work in a fast-paced environment?


An international company in Hoofddorp, Amsterdam has an excellent job vacancy for a medior or senior software engineer role who loves to build complex software solutions. In this role you will receive an annual salary up to € 70.000 and many training opportunities.


For this role you already need to live in the Netherlands.


In the role of Software Developer you will have the opportunity to develop complex software solutions for the aviation industry.



Activities:

Programming new software or adapting existing software;
Building and managing the simulation software for our test and acceptance environment;
Installing software at the end user;
Conducting tests on developed software;
Solving problems/malfunctions on existing controls and software;
Taking care of system documentation;
Exchanging information, discussing work assignments with project team members regarding size and delivery time;
Attending project meetings;
Providing service work.


Who are we looking for:

You have a completed HBO or WO education in the field of Software engineering, Computer Science, Industrial Automation or equivalent;
You have knowledge of higher programming languages (preferably C++ or C#);
You have knowledge of programming SCADA systems (preferably Siemens WinCC);
You have knowledge of programming PLC systems (preferably Siemens S7/TIA Portal);
Work experience is not necessary yet, but the willingness to learn and develop yourself further;
Excellent command of the Dutch and English language in word and writing;
You have good analytical skills;
You have a proactive attitude and an assertive character;
You are eager to learn and willing to fully master the complex processes of the customer;
You have a flexible attitude in terms of working hours and you find it no problem to work with on-call services;
You are in possession of driving license B.


What do we offer:

We offer you a very varied job in a unique working environment at an innovative organization. We offer you the opportunity to contribute to a dynamic, creative and enterprising organization; an organization that focuses on opportunities instead of obstacles.

We also offer:

25 vacation days;
Phone and laptop; and you can also use it privately within all reasonableness!
Travel allowance in accordance with legislation and regulations;
110 pleasant colleagues;
A full-time position;
And an enthusiastic and highly skilled team of specialists and experts;
Personal development opportunities in the form of training and coaching. In addition, we are a growing organization in which career opportunities arise and can be picked up


Interested?


Apply online or send your CV to [Son Pham] via [s.pham@progressiverecruitment.com]. If you would like to know more about this job or similar jobs in IT, contact [Son Pham via [020-5305800] or [s.pham@progressiverecruitment.com].
_source.position_name: Software Engineer at Aviation company (Hoofddorp, Netherlands)

_source.description:
From autonomous industrial robots to self-charging drones and chatbot platforms, we're building it and you can be part of it. Motius is a research and development company specializing in the development of products and prototypes in the latest tech fields (AI, IoT, AR/VR and many more). With the unique combination of a permanent core team and an interdisciplinary tech community, we reinvent RandD and develop the tech products of the future together with our world-class customers.

As a member of our tech community, youandrsquo;re either a student, a professional freelancer, or a PhD / researcher. You join our diverse RandD projects in small and agile teams - either on a flexible and short-term basis, or continuously from project to project. You can find sample projects in our Motius Success Stories.Being part of our Software Engineering Cluster, you join RandD projects as a Backend Engineer. For instance, building the backend of a platform aimed at bringing startups and investors together for tech challenges or building chatbots are just some examples of plenty innovative projects at Motius.Your roleYou develop new backend features and ideas for the conception and implementation of our tech projects
You are part of one of our interdisciplinary and multinational development teams
You work in a team of 2-4 developers with support from our DevOps team
Together with your team you are a key-role of the complete software development process (kick-off, bi-weekly sprints, retrospective)
You have a direct impact on the products and innovations of our customers
Your profileExperience in agile software engineering projects
Experience with Python and/or Django, Flask, node.js, etc.
You know when to use relational DBs and when to use NoSQL DBs
Having worked with Docker, GitLab CI or comparable tools is an advantage
You are curious and motivated to develop yourself both technically and personally
Our offerInsights and impact into markets and products of the future on a growing company
Steady learning curve through internal workshops (like OpenShift, Blockchain, NLP, VueJS or functional programming)
Open and communicative culture andndash; on a professional and personal level
We trust your skills, youandrsquo;ll get a lot of responsibilities and as TUM student you can combine one of our projects with your IDP
Regular community events, teambuilding, flexible working hours, competitive salary and numerous benefits
You can find more details and reasons why you should join Motius in our latest blog post and on Instagram @teammotius.

From autonomous industrial robots to self-charging drones and chatbot platforms, we're building it and you can be part of it. Motius is a research and development company specializing in the development of products and prototypes in the latest tech fields (AI, IoT, AR/VR and many more). With the unique combination of a permanent core team and an interdisciplinary tech community, we reinvent R&D and develop the tech products of the future together with our world-class customers.

As a member of our tech community, you’re either a student, a professional freelancer, or a PhD / researcher. You join our diverse R&D projects in small and agile teams - either on a flexible & short-term basis, or continuously from project to project. You can find sample projects in our Motius Success Stories.


Being part of our Software Engineering Cluster, you join R&D projects as a Backend Engineer. For instance, building the backend of a platform aimed at bringing startups and investors together for tech challenges or building chatbots are just some examples of plenty innovative projects at Motius.


Your role



  • You develop new backend features and ideas for the conception and implementation of our tech projects

  • You are part of one of our interdisciplinary & multinational development teams

  • You work in a team of 2-4 developers with support from our DevOps team

  • Together with your team you are a key-role of the complete software development process (kick-off, bi-weekly sprints, retrospective)

  • You have a direct impact on the products and innovations of our customers


Your profile



  • Experience in agile software engineering projects

  • Experience with Python and/or Django, Flask, node.js, etc.

  • You know when to use relational DBs and when to use NoSQL DBs

  • Having worked with Docker, GitLab CI or comparable tools is an advantage

  • You are curious and motivated to develop yourself both technically and personally


Our offer



  • Insights and impact into markets & products of the future on a growing company

  • Steady learning curve through internal workshops (like OpenShift, Blockchain, NLP, VueJS or functional programming)

  • Open and communicative culture – on a professional and personal level

  • We trust your skills, you’ll get a lot of responsibilities and as TUM student you can combine one of our projects with your IDP

  • Regular community events, teambuilding, flexible working hours, competitive salary and numerous benefits


You can find more details and reasons why you should join Motius in our latest blog post and on Instagram @team_motius.

_source.description:
Java Software Engineer (f/m/d) - 1 year fixed term contracteBay is a global commerce leader that allows you to shape how the world buys, sells, and gives. Youll be in a work culture thats been genuinely committed to diversity and inclusion since its founding more than 20 years ago. Here, you can just be yourself, do your best work, and have a significant impact on people across the globe. We are looking for people with drive, ideas, and a passion for helping small businesses succeed to help shape the future of eBay - does this sound like you? If so, wed love to talk to you!About the teameBays DE Product Development team is based in Dreilinden (Berlin) and is part of the global Core Product and Technology team. We enable commerce at scale, and have massive customer impact. Whilst doing all this, we are on a mission to improve eBay technology, drive Agile adoption and demonstrate customer-centric development targeted towards our customers in Germany. While focused on local market needs, we also chip in to eBays global product and technology portfolio. To do this, we improve existing experiences, build or extend core products and experiment with new innovations to make the lives of eBay customers better. We are continually targeting for the highest quality, and work in small focused teams following bits of Scrum, bits of Kanban, with a healthy dose of Extreme Programming (p.s. These arenand#39;t buzzwords to us, we do this stuff).Our cross-functional teams have Product Management, all aspects of Product Development (including DevOps and Test), and UX all working together every day. We are collocated with eBay Germanys business teams and closely interact with our German customers and other eBay teams every day. Working at eBay is a rewarding, challenging and inspiring experience. We are currently looking for the following type of Software Engineer (Java) (f/m/d)Requirements:Experience in building high availability, scalable applications and RESTful APIs. You will need to be able to own the design and development of medium complexity applications.
You have very strong skills in object-oriented programming and Java. Functional programming and Scala are a plus, and so is some experience with Node.js.
Most of our applications are written in Java, Scala or TypeScript/JavaScript. As someone who is passionate about development, youll be open to pick up new languages and frameworks when the situation arises. Furthermore you will also come up to speed on various existing eBay technologies for an internal open source model where we work in various projects and codebases.
We love people with diverse experience who are committed to learn and move things forward with an obsession for delivering customer value through the craft of software development. Show us your GitHub repo, side projects, and open source repositories that you have chipped in to!
Our developers decide the right tool for the job, so you should be able to make these decisions as well. We have a lot of fun discussing the merits of different technology, and we want you to join and lead these conversations.
You will be passionate about test-driven, clean code, software craftsmanship, delightful user experiences and all the appealing stuff thatand#39;s involved with automatically tested, continuously deployed applications. You will enjoy pair programming on pretty much everything.
You will write your own tests, whilst learning from embedded test engineers who code. You have depth of experience, but are open to being more broad too. For example, our Java developers learn from the JavaScript specialists, and vice versa.
Having a desire to expand and master something new while collaborating, means youand#39;re a good fit for us.
You are highly proficient in English, fluency in German is a plus.
What we offer:Dynamic, international teams with very skilled personalities, a passion for e-commerce, professionalism and a good sense of humour.
The chance to work closely with other teams across eBay; in Europe, Australia, the USA and globally.
Silicon Valley amenities, such as iPhones and MacBook Pros, crazy high spec dev machines and brand-new office facilities.
Tech-rich office building equipped with 500 devices ready to connect across five continents and 16 countries in Dreilinden.
An opportunity to build applications which are used by your friends, neighbours in addition to millions of people globally.
Free access to online learning resources and annual budget for trainings and conferences.
Benefits:Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether youre single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs. Including maternal and paternal leave, paid sabbatical, and plans to help ensure your financial security today and in the years ahead because we know feeling financially secure during your working years and through retirement is important.Here at eBay, we love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isnt just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel eBay is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work.. To learn about eBays Diversity and Inclusion click here: https://www.ebayinc.com/our-company/diversity-inclusion/.#LI-AZ1#SO #Premium#StepstoneDEeBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talentand#64;ebay.com. _source.description_html:
Java Software Engineer (f/m/d) - 1 year fixed term contract

eBay is a global commerce leader that allows you to shape how the world buys, sells, and gives. Youll be in a work culture thats been genuinely committed to diversity and inclusion since its founding more than 20 years ago. Here, you can just be yourself, do your best work, and have a significant impact on people across the globe. We are looking for people with drive, ideas, and a passion for helping small businesses succeed to help shape the future of eBay - does this sound like you? If so, wed love to talk to you!

About the team

eBays DE Product Development team is based in Dreilinden (Berlin) and is part of the global Core Product and Technology team. We enable commerce at scale, and have massive customer impact. Whilst doing all this, we are on a mission to improve eBay technology, drive Agile adoption and demonstrate customer-centric development targeted towards our customers in Germany. While focused on local market needs, we also chip in to eBays global product and technology portfolio. To do this, we improve existing experiences, build or extend core products and experiment with new innovations to make the lives of eBay customers better. We are continually targeting for the highest quality, and work in small focused teams following bits of Scrum, bits of Kanban, with a healthy dose of Extreme Programming (p.s. These aren't buzzwords to us, we do this stuff).

Our cross-functional teams have Product Management, all aspects of Product Development (including DevOps and Test), and UX all working together every day. We are collocated with eBay Germanys business teams and closely interact with our German customers and other eBay teams every day. Working at eBay is a rewarding, challenging and inspiring experience. We are currently looking for the following type of Software Engineer (Java) (f/m/d)

Requirements:

  • Experience in building high availability, scalable applications and RESTful APIs. You will need to be able to own the design and development of medium complexity applications.

  • You have very strong skills in object-oriented programming and Java. Functional programming and Scala are a plus, and so is some experience with Node.js.

  • Most of our applications are written in Java, Scala or TypeScript/JavaScript. As someone who is passionate about development, youll be open to pick up new languages and frameworks when the situation arises. Furthermore you will also come up to speed on various existing eBay technologies for an internal open source model where we work in various projects and codebases.

  • We love people with diverse experience who are committed to learn and move things forward with an obsession for delivering customer value through the craft of software development. Show us your GitHub repo, side projects, and open source repositories that you have chipped in to!

  • Our developers decide the right tool for the job, so you should be able to make these decisions as well. We have a lot of fun discussing the merits of different technology, and we want you to join and lead these conversations.

  • You will be passionate about test-driven, clean code, software craftsmanship, delightful user experiences and all the appealing stuff that's involved with automatically tested, continuously deployed applications. You will enjoy pair programming on pretty much everything.

  • You will write your own tests, whilst learning from embedded test engineers who code. You have depth of experience, but are open to being more broad too. For example, our Java developers learn from the JavaScript specialists, and vice versa.

  • Having a desire to expand and master something new while collaborating, means you're a good fit for us.

  • You are highly proficient in English, fluency in German is a plus.

What we offer:

  • Dynamic, international teams with very skilled personalities, a passion for e-commerce, professionalism and a good sense of humour.

  • The chance to work closely with other teams across eBay; in Europe, Australia, the USA and globally.

  • Silicon Valley amenities, such as iPhones and MacBook Pros, crazy high spec dev machines and brand-new office facilities.

  • Tech-rich office building equipped with 500 devices ready to connect across five continents and 16 countries in Dreilinden.

  • An opportunity to build applications which are used by your friends, neighbours in addition to millions of people globally.

  • Free access to online learning resources and annual budget for trainings and conferences.

Benefits:

Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether youre single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs. Including maternal & paternal leave, paid sabbatical, and plans to help ensure your financial security today and in the years ahead because we know feeling financially secure during your working years and through retirement is important.

Here at eBay, we love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isnt just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel eBay is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work.. To learn about eBays Diversity & Inclusion click here: https://www.ebayinc.com/our-company/diversity-inclusion/.

#LI-AZ1

#SO #Premium

#StepstoneDE

eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible. Jobs posted with location as "Remote - United States (Excludes CO, HI, NM)" excludes Colorado, Hawaii and New Mexico.

_source.description_html:
Frontend-kehittäjä, Yle Artikkelitiimi


Miltä kuulostaisi merkittävimpien uutistapahtumien mahdollistaminen, puolueettoman tiedon välitys ja demokratian edistäminen tuotetalossa, jonka devauskulttuuri ei kalpene yhdellekään itseään kunnioittavalle tekkitalolle? Viikottaiset kolme miljoonaa kävijää artikkeleissamme takaavat sen, että juuri tämän näkyvämpää fronttia et tässä maassa pääse tekemään. Jos siis haluat koodisi jokaisen suomalaisen verkkokalvoille, tule meille!


*) Fyysiset toimipisteemme sijaitsevat Helsingissä ja Tampereella, mutta etätyön tekeminen myös muualta onnistuu, jos olet akuuteimman pandemiatilanteen jälkeen valmis tapaamaan tiimiä sovitusti muutaman kerran kuukaudessa.


Mitä on luvassa?


Tiimimme vastaa siitä, että Ylen käytetyin tuote, uutisartikkeli, toimii ja kehittyy koko ajan paremmaksi jamonipuolisemmaksi työkaluksi ajankohtaisen tiedon välittämiseen. Artikkelimme saavat kymmeniä tuhansia sivunäyttöjä jo ensimmäisten minuuttien aikana ja sivulatauksia kaikissa artikkeleissamme on kokonaisuudessaan noin 15 miljoonaa viikossa.


Yhtenä konkreettisena esimerkkinä päivittäisestä työstämme on kehittämämme artikkelien live-seurantatyökalu, joka mahdollistaa sekä live-seurannan tekemisen että monipuolisen sisällön, kuten tekstien, videoiden, grafiikan, kuvien ja suorien striimien näyttämisen. Kehittämäämme työkalua hyödyntävät muun muassa Pentuliveä seuraava ja jatkuvasti päivittyvä artikkeli sekä maailman sitouttavimpien artikkelien joukkoon noussut koronapandemiaa käsittelevä seuranta-artikkeli. Artikkelilla on jo yli 75 miljoonaa sivulatausta ja se kerää tuhansia tunteja lukuaikaa joka päivä.


Jatkuvasti päivittyvien artikkeleiden ohella kaikki Ylen verkkojulkaisut, olivatpa ne sitten Yle-sovellukseen, Yle-verkkosivuille tai Uutisvahtiin, tulevat meidän kauttamme. Tiimimme mahdollistaa myös sen, että perinteisten artikkelien sijaan Ylen saitilla tullaan näkemään entistä enemmän monipuolisempaa mediasisältöä, kuten videoita ja audiota. Muutamia esimerkkejä tällaisista artikkeleista löydät täältä ja täältä. Yksi tiimimme merkittävimmistä tavoitteista lähitulevaisuudessa on yhdenmukaistaa Ylellä käytössä olevaa fronttia läpi palveluiden ja rikastaa sen käyttömahdollisuuksia laadukkaamman journalismin tuottamiseksi.


Tiimissämme on neljä kokenutta devaajaa, joilta pääset ammentamaan oppia niin teknisistä ratkaisuista kuin media-domainin erityispiirteistäkin. Riittävän työrauhan ja oikean suunnan meille varmistaa rautainen team leadimme Teemu. Kantaviin periaatteisiimme kuuluu, että työtä saa tehdä itsenäisesti, mutta apua on aina tarjolla eikä yksin jätetä.


Työskentelemme Reactilla, React Nativella, TypeScriptillä, Clojurella ja Nodella. Jos siis bäkkäripuoli ja esimerkiksi Clojure kiinnostaa, tarjoamme mahdollisuuden työskennellä senkin parissa.


Tällaista työkaveria etsimme:


Aiempi työkokemuksesi voi olla vaikka start-upista, tuotetalosta, konsulttipuljusta tai kaikista näistä, kunhan sinulla on vähintään muutaman vuoden kokemus joko Reactilla tai React Nativella työskentelystä, olet kiinnostunut loppukäyttäjistä ja sinulla on hyvä ymmärrys CSS:stä. Plussapisteitä irtoaa, mikäli sinulla on kokemusta saavutettavuuden implementoinnista ja TypeScriptistä.


Koska tiimimme koostuu mukavista, reiluista ja työhönsä intohimoisesti suhtautuvista tyypeistä, sopii joukkoomme parhaiten joku samanlaisia piirteitä omaava ja arvostava henkilö. Tiimimme toimii itseohjautuvasti ilman esihenkilöitä ja jatkuvan parantamisen -periaatteiden mukaisesti, jonka vuoksi toivomme, että nämä toimintamallit eivät tunnu liian vastenmielisiltä.


Miksi meille?


Yle on ainutlaatuinen tekkitalo, jolla on ainutlaatuinen tehtävä. Julkisen palvelun toimijana tekemistämme ei siis ohjaa raha ja muut kaupalliset intressit, vaan päivänvaloa kestävät eettiset arvot ja maan parhaan mediapalvelun tuottaminen. Tämä ei-kaupallinen puoli näkyy päivittäisessä työssämme muun muassa siten, että meillä on aikaa ja resursseja tehdä asiat hyvin ja projektikohtaista tuntikirjanpitoa ei tarvitse pitää. Koska työn jälki on usein priimaa, julkaisemme sitä myös open-sourcena, jota voit käydä tutkailemassa täältä.


Se mihin julkisen puolen toimijuus ei puolestaan vaikuta, on devaajiemme palkka, sillä eihän meillä muuten olisi kovia tekijöitä duunissa. Palkkaus on siis linjassa maan isoimpien konsulttitalojen kanssa ja usein vielä parempaa. Julkiselle puolelle ominaisesti meillä on tarjota myös pidemmät vuosilomat (6-7 viikkoa aiemmasta kokemuksesta riippuen) sekä muita mukavia etuja, joista voi lukea tarkemmin täältä: https://yle.dev/


Erityisen ylpeitä olemme hyvästä yhteisömme rakentamasta devauskulttuurista, jossa ei ole esihenkilöitä tai vaikeaa byrokratiaa. Sen sijaan tiimeillämme on korkea autonomian aste ja tiimit päättävätkin itse työskentelytavoistaan, teknologiavalinnoistaan sekä teknisten haasteiden ratkomisesta. Lisäksi meille on ensiarvoisen tärkeää, että elämääsi mahtuu muutakin kuin työ. Tämän vuoksi olemme joustavia ja työt hoituvat mainiosti etänä myös koronan jälkeen. Huolehdimme myös siitä, että saat riittävästi kesälomaa meille vaihtaessasi.


Kiinnostuitko?


Jos kolahti, laita meille cv:si 6.2. mennessä ja jutellaan hommasta lisää. Lisätietoja tehtävästä ja Ylestä voi kysellä Teemulta ja tiimin muilta jäseniltä osoitteessa: rekry@yle.dev
_source.position_name: Frontend-kehittäjä at Yleisradio Oy (Helsinki, Finland)

_source.description:
SOFTWARE ENGINEER (M/W/D)
FandUuml;R DIGITALE DIENSTE UND VERNETZTE FAHRZEUGEDie Erforschung und Validierung innovativer Technologien fanduuml;r vernetzte Fahrzeugarchitekturen ist eine der zentralen Aufgaben unseres europandauml;ischen Forschungs- und Entwicklungszentrums am Standort Offenbach. Unser globales Netzwerk von RandD Zentren nutzen wir fanduuml;r gemeinsame Forschungsprojekte und zur Definition von technischen Entwicklungsstrategien.Mandouml;chten Sie sich beruflich weiterentwickeln, Ihre fachliche Kompetenz und Vielseitigkeit in einer international geprandauml;gten Arbeitsumgebung einbringen und weiter ausbauen? Sind Sie ein anduuml;berzeugter Digitalist (m/w/d) und interessieren sich fanduuml;r extrem spannende Zukunftsthemen in der digitalen Mobilitandauml;t? Dann erwartet Sie in unserem Bereich Digital Solutions and Electrification Research ein breit gefandauml;chertes Tandauml;tigkeitsspektrum mit dem Schwerpunkt auf Software-Architekturen fanduuml;r vernetzte Fahrzeuge.Ihre AufgabenAnalyse und Weiterentwicklung von Software-Architekturen fanduuml;r digitale Dienste und vernetzte Fahrzeuge
Software-Entwicklungen fanduuml;r interne Forschungsprojekte andndash; von der Planung und Konzeption anduuml;ber die Implementierung bis zur Dokumentation
Zusammenarbeit mit externen Software-Dienstleistern an kooperativen Softwareprojekten
Einbindung von gandauml;ngigen Sicherheits- und Cybersecurity-Anforderungen
Entwicklung von Cloud-Diensten fanduuml;r digitale Dienste im Bereich (Elektro-)Mobilitandauml;t
Hierbei arbeiten Sie mit unserer Konzernzentrale in Japan sowie mit externen Software-Firmen in einem hochmotivierten Team zusammen.Ihr ProfilAusbildung oder Studium im Bereich Informatik, Systemarchitektur oder Software-Entwicklung
Mehrjandauml;hrige Berufserfahrung im IT-Bereich
Sehr gute Kenntnisse anduuml;ber Methoden der (agilen) Software-Entwicklung
Erfahrung mit den gandauml;ngigen Programmiersprachen, wie z. B. Python, Java/C++, JavaScript sowie ein sicherer Umgang mit typischen Code-Konventionen
Von Vorteil ist auandszlig;erdem Know-how in folgenden Bereichen:Entwicklung von Web-Apps und mobilen Apps
Distributed Ledger Technologies, z. B. Blockchains
Linux
Bewandauml;hrte Sicherheitsprinzipien und kryptographische Algorithmen

Ihre sehr guten Englischkenntnisse bilden die Kommunikationsbasis fanduuml;r eine Mitarbeit in unserem internationalen Unternehmen. Sie haben einen Blick fanduuml;r Innovationen und anduuml;berzeugen durch Ihre ausgeprandauml;gte analytische Denkweise.Haben wir Sie neugierig gemacht?Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung.Ihre Unterlagen senden Sie bitte online anduuml;ber honda.pme-net.de an die von uns beauftragte PME andndash; Personal- und Managemententwicklung Horst Mangold, Postfach 1334, 55206 Ingelheim.Jetzt bewerbenHaben Sie Fragen? Herr Mangold steht Ihnen gerne fanduuml;r weitere Informationen unter 0 61 32 / 8 99 04 - 0 zur Verfanduuml;gung andndash; auch in den Abendstunden.
_source.description_html:
SOFTWARE ENGINEER (M/W/D)
FÜR DIGITALE DIENSTE UND VERNETZTE FAHRZEUGE


Die Erforschung und Validierung innovativer Technologien für vernetzte Fahrzeugarchitekturen ist eine der zentralen Aufgaben unseres europäischen Forschungs- und Entwicklungszentrums am Standort Offenbach. Unser globales Netzwerk von R&D Zentren nutzen wir für gemeinsame Forschungsprojekte und zur Definition von technischen Entwicklungsstrategien.


Möchten Sie sich beruflich weiterentwickeln, Ihre fachliche Kompetenz und Vielseitigkeit in einer international geprägten Arbeitsumgebung einbringen und weiter ausbauen? Sind Sie ein überzeugter Digitalist (m/w/d) und interessieren sich für extrem spannende Zukunftsthemen in der digitalen Mobilität? Dann erwartet Sie in unserem Bereich Digital Solutions & Electrification Research ein breit gefächertes Tätigkeitsspektrum mit dem Schwerpunkt auf Software-Architekturen für vernetzte Fahrzeuge.


Ihre Aufgaben



  • Analyse und Weiterentwicklung von Software-Architekturen für digitale Dienste und vernetzte Fahrzeuge

  • Software-Entwicklungen für interne Forschungsprojekte – von der Planung und Konzeption über die Implementierung bis zur Dokumentation

  • Zusammenarbeit mit externen Software-Dienstleistern an kooperativen Softwareprojekten

  • Einbindung von gängigen Sicherheits- und Cybersecurity-Anforderungen

  • Entwicklung von Cloud-Diensten für digitale Dienste im Bereich (Elektro-)Mobilität


Hierbei arbeiten Sie mit unserer Konzernzentrale in Japan sowie mit externen Software-Firmen in einem hochmotivierten Team zusammen.


Ihr Profil



  • Ausbildung oder Studium im Bereich Informatik, Systemarchitektur oder Software-Entwicklung

  • Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im IT-Bereich

  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse über Methoden der (agilen) Software-Entwicklung

  • Erfahrung mit den gängigen Programmiersprachen, wie z. B. Python, Java/C++, JavaScript sowie ein sicherer Umgang mit typischen Code-Konventionen

  • Von Vorteil ist außerdem Know-how in folgenden Bereichen:

    • Entwicklung von Web-Apps und mobilen Apps

    • Distributed Ledger Technologies, z. B. Blockchains

    • Linux

    • Bewährte Sicherheitsprinzipien und kryptographische Algorithmen




Ihre sehr guten Englischkenntnisse bilden die Kommunikationsbasis für eine Mitarbeit in unserem internationalen Unternehmen. Sie haben einen Blick für Innovationen und überzeugen durch Ihre ausgeprägte analytische Denkweise.


Haben wir Sie neugierig gemacht?


Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung.


Ihre Unterlagen senden Sie bitte online über honda.pme-net.de an die von uns beauftragte PME – Personal- und Managemententwicklung Horst Mangold, Postfach 1334, 55206 Ingelheim.


Jetzt bewerben


Haben Sie Fragen? Herr Mangold steht Ihnen gerne für weitere Informationen unter 0 61 32 / 8 99 04 - 0 zur Verfügung – auch in den Abendstunden.
_source.position_name: SOFTWARE ENGINEER (m/w/d) für digitale Dienste und vernetzte Fahrzeuge at Honda R&D Europe (Deutschland) GmbH (Offenbach am Main, Deutschland)

_source.description:
Curious about the future of event marketing?SpotMe is the event management platform for B2B marketers. With over 2 million users and 400+ customers, G2 and Forrester say we are one of the key contenders in the space. Brands like SAP, Pfizer, and KPMG use SpotMe to drive demand, build connections and grow revenue. Our software powers virtual events, webinars, and hybrid meetings with apps, video, attendee engagement, and analytics.Behind the magic stands a curious, diligent, and humble team with over 30 nationalities. A team that feels a deep pride in the work they do, a team that cares for each other, and a team that always chooses to play the next game.Mission:As a Technical Product Manager you will be delivering streamlined experiences and solutions for our B2B event marketing platform while working with our engineering team through all the steps from concept and analysis, design, implementation, and release.
You will be striking the right balance between understanding engineering opportunities and constraints, mastering business analysis, and thinking holistically from and organizer and participant perspective.
Responsibilities:Be the expert of the B2B event marketing ecosystem and how the product, tools and technologies work together for our target customer segment
Build our APIs and native integration roadmap based on that knowledge and the needs from the market we evolve in
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including the engineering for the roadmap execution and best practices, with marketing to build a messaging and go-to-market around the capabilities, and also other product managers to build an API strategy for each product
Prototype new integrations and mocks of integrated products to showcase our capabilities
Requirements:3+ years experience in relevant fields of enterprise SaaS software as a technical product manager, solution consultant or a software engineer
An eye for the detail, meticulous taste, conceptual thinking with track record to prove it
Technical background with software engineering degree and ability to write code
Knowledge of Salesforce, Marketo, Eloqua or similar CRM/MAP software is a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English, including in writing technical documentation.
We are in hypergrowth mode and with demand exploding, we are rapidly scaling and expanding our teams. If working with us in shaping the future is the opportunity you are looking for, we want to talk to you. Our Work From Anywhere approach enables maximum flexibility for all our talents.SpotMe recruits, compensates, and promotes regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, parental status, or veteran status.
_source.description_html:
Curious about the future of event marketing?


SpotMe is the event management platform for B2B marketers. With over 2 million users and 400+ customers, G2 and Forrester say we are one of the key contenders in the space. Brands like SAP, Pfizer, and KPMG use SpotMe to drive demand, build connections and grow revenue. Our software powers virtual events, webinars, and hybrid meetings with apps, video, attendee engagement, and analytics.


Behind the magic stands a curious, diligent, and humble team with over 30 nationalities. A team that feels a deep pride in the work they do, a team that cares for each other, and a team that always chooses to play the next game.


Mission:



  • As a Technical Product Manager you will be delivering streamlined experiences and solutions for our B2B event marketing platform while working with our engineering team through all the steps from concept and analysis, design, implementation, and release.

  • You will be striking the right balance between understanding engineering opportunities and constraints, mastering business analysis, and thinking holistically from and organizer and participant perspective.


Responsibilities:



  • Be the expert of the B2B event marketing ecosystem and how the product, tools and technologies work together for our target customer segment

  • Build our APIs and native integration roadmap based on that knowledge and the needs from the market we evolve in

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams including the engineering for the roadmap execution and best practices, with marketing to build a messaging and go-to-market around the capabilities, and also other product managers to build an API strategy for each product

  • Prototype new integrations and mocks of integrated products to showcase our capabilities


Requirements:



  • 3+ years experience in relevant fields of enterprise SaaS software as a technical product manager, solution consultant or a software engineer

  • An eye for the detail, meticulous taste, conceptual thinking with track record to prove it

  • Technical background with software engineering degree and ability to write code

  • Knowledge of Salesforce, Marketo, Eloqua or similar CRM/MAP software is a plus

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English, including in writing technical documentation.


We are in hypergrowth mode and with demand exploding, we are rapidly scaling and expanding our teams. If working with us in shaping the future is the opportunity you are looking for, we want to talk to you. Our Work From Anywhere approach enables maximum flexibility for all our talents.


SpotMe recruits, compensates, and promotes regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, parental status, or veteran status.
_source.position_name: Technical Product Manager, Integrations & APIs at SpotMe () (allows remote)

_source.description_html:
Experience: Senior Level


Hello! Are you ready to Work from Home and transform your career?


We're looking for a Front End Engineer to join the engineering team at Modus. Want to help our clients build awesome solutions to accomplish their goals and vision? Are you interested in working from home with some of the best talents on the planet? Then keep reading.


About You


You love building great software. Your work could be supporting new feature development, migrating existing features, and creating other mobile and web solutions for customers. You'll have a primary focus on frontend development using React. You may be asked to jump into backend code from time to time. Our client’s tech stack is React and Typescript. We use modern tools, which means you’ll have the opportunity to work with Webpack, Redux, Apollo, Styled Components, and much more.


You have worked with teams before on large and demonstrable projects. You have worked on fintech and payment apps before with big international teams. You understand Agile software development, Unit testing, and DevOps practices, and can work closely with other teams to optimize your code.


You relish creating high-quality code from the comfort of your own home. Your engineering projects will focus on understanding customers' needs and translating those needs from product specifications into functional, production-ready code. You'll have the opportunity to ship code daily that will be used by customers.


You love learning. Engineering is an ever-evolving world. You enjoy playing with new tech and exploring areas that you might not have experience with yet. You are a self-driven, self-learner willing to share knowledge and participate actively in your community.


Having overlap with your team is critical when working in a global remote team. Modus requires all team members to overlap with EST morning hours daily. In addition, reliable high-speed internet is a must.


Things You Might Do


Modus is a fast-growing, and remote-first company, so you'll likely get experience on many different projects across the organization. That said, here are some things you'll probably do:



  • Give back to the community via open source and blog posts

  • Travel and meet great people- as part of our remote-first lifestyle, it's important that we come together as needed to work together, meet each other in person and have fun together. Please keep that in mind when you apply.

  • Teach and be taught: Modus creates active teams that work in internal and external projects together, giving opportunities to stay relevant with the latest technologies and learning from experts worldwide

  • Interact directly with internal and external clients to represent Modus and its values


Why Modus Create:


Our Benefits may vary according to the country you are located in, so please reach out to our recruiter in case you have any questions.


If you become a contractor we offer:



  • Competitive compensation

  • 100% Remote work (could vary according to the client's needs)

  • Travel according to client's needs

  • The chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech


Do you have what it takes? Apply today!
_source.position_name: Front End Engineer (React, Typescript) at Modus Create () (allows remote)

_source.description:
The Role At Personio we are on the amazing journey of becoming the leading HR Platform in Europe!

We in the Payroll Domain know people like to say: It's not rocket science.
But sometimes it just is. The same goes for payroll.
It has been there for some time, there is a way to do it, just as it has always been done. There are rules and regulations, customers and stakeholders.

But we just know that there is also another way to do it. A new way to do it. A sexy way to do it.

The Payroll Domain is on a mission to make Personio the big player of payroll and offer a smart payroll solution that can handle any kind of employees and use HRM data blended to payroll. Using our services, our customers save tons of money and time - and HR Managers can delegate the most complex tasks to us so they can gain peace of mind and focus on what really matters: people.

Like all our tribes we are a cross-functional group of engineers, designers, and product managers from many different nationalities and backgrounds, spread across different locations and we continue to grow in 2021. Join us and help shape the Payroll Domain journey for Personio.

Your tasks and responsibilities in a nutshell

Direct contribution to Personio codebase as a frontend engineer, as part of a product team
Identifying, documenting, and communicating technical improvements within your area of responsibility in the team
Support in the development and reinforcement of frontend engineering standards and guidelines
Close collaboration with technical (backend, QA and infrastructure) and non-technical (product, design) roles to understand and challenge end-user requirements and ultimately translate these into effective technical solutions
Participating in cross-team engineering initiatives as individual contributor
Helping with selecting, onboarding, and coaching of junior members of the team
What you need to succeedRelevant experience working on fast-scaling and complex systems
Appreciation towards software craftsmanship, clean code, and SOLID design principles
Deep knowledge in JavaScript and strong expertise in React and Redux or a similar stack
Sound experience in automated testing, performance monitoring, and optimization
Driven by impact. You are eager to create customer value
Teamplayer. You are passionate about working with talented and inspiring people. Your heart beats for receiving and giving feedback, to grow both personally and as an engineer
You are business-fluent in English
Why Personio Aside from our people, culture, and mission, there are a variety of additional benefits that help make Personio a great place to work! Work with us and receive:

Competitive compensation package that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
Two Impact days you can use to have an impact on the environment and society. One day is for an individual project and one for a company-wide initiative! #SocialResponsibility
26 days of paid vacation + 2 days off for Christmas and New Year's Eve (because we love what we do, but we also love vacation!)
Annual personal development budget of andeuro;1,500 for conferences, courses, books, career coach, etc.
Regular company and team events like Oktoberfest, ski trips, Christmas parties, and more! (COVID permitting)
Comprehensive healthcare scheme covered for each permanent employee (excl. taxes).
Pension scheme with up to 5% matching contribution
Discounts across a range of brands so you can save money while shopping at Adidas, LG, Bosch, Apple, Dia, etc.
Find your best way to work with office-led, remote-friendly PersonioFlex! We offer a roughly 50% remote, 50% in-office working framework to suit your needs
Mental health support, as we know that mental wellbeing plays a major role in both our personal and professional success. #PersonioCares

Personio is an equal opportunities employer and does not discriminate on the grounds of gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, race or being a member of the traveller community.

_source.description:
At TeleClinic, we aim to be the patientsandrsquo; starting point for all of their healthcare needs by building the leading on-demand platform for online doctor visits.Digitalisation of the German Health System is ready for take off and one thing is for sure: With TeleClinic you get the chance to revolutionize this industry. Why? Because we were not only the first to offer telemedicine in Germany but are also the market leader. We are a platform for online doctor visits in Germany and, in 2018 Forbes Magazine already announced us amongst the 100 most innovative startups.We are looking for an experienced Backend Developer with Python/Django knowledge willing to work in a lean and agile environment.In this role, you will:Develop highly scalable APIs in Python and Django
Design and deploy services on cloud infrastructure (we use AWS)
Be a technical mentor for other engineering team members
Ship clear, maintainable and thoughtfully commented code.
What you need to be successful:3+ years of professional experience with Python
Experience with Python-based frameworks (we use Django)
Strong SQL skills and experience with ORMs
Experience with testing frameworks
Experience with cloud services (we use AWS)
Competent with revision control systems (we use Git)
CS, engineering degree, or equivalent experience
Who you are:Independent, self-motivated
Fluent in English, written and spoken
Proven track record of always learning and growing.
Proactive attitude
Whatandrsquo;s in it for you:Competitive salary
Be part of a cross-functional, international, diverse, highly motivated and open-minded team
1.500 EUR personal development budget per year, 2 days additional leave for attending conferences and courses
27 vacation days per year, with an additional vacation day for each year andndash; up to 30 vacation days
Home Office and flexible working hours
Notebook of your choice and all the tools and gadgets you need to be productive
Do you like riding a bike? Then profit from the cooperation with JobRad
Regular fun team and company events (e.g. Oktoberfest, Isar-rafting tour, laser-tag and much more)
You donandrsquo;t speak German? No problem! You get 350andeuro; per year for German courses
Work in our modern, bright and spacious office and recharge at our hangout lounge where you can enjoy free fruits, snacks, and drinks

Because we were not only the first to offer telemedicine in Germany but are also the market leader. We are a platform for online doctor visits in Germany and, in 2018 Forbes Magazine already announced us amongst the 100 most innovative startups.


We are looking for an experienced Backend Developer with Python/Django knowledge willing to work in a lean and agile environment.

  • Design and deploy services on cloud infrastructure (we use AWS)

  • Be a technical mentor for other engineering team members

  • Ship clear, maintainable and thoughtfully commented code.


What you need to be successful:



  • 3+ years of professional experience with Python

  • Experience with Python-based frameworks (we use Django)

  • Strong SQL skills and experience with ORMs

  • Experience with testing frameworks

  • Experience with cloud services (we use AWS)

  • Competent with revision control systems (we use Git)

  • CS, engineering degree, or equivalent experience


Who you are:



  • Independent, self-motivated

  • Fluent in English, written and spoken

  • Proven track record of always learning and growing.

  • Proactive attitude


What’s in it for you:



  • Competitive salary

  • Be part of a cross-functional, international, diverse, highly motivated and open-minded team

  • 1.500 EUR personal development budget per year, 2 days additional leave for attending conferences and courses

  • 27 vacation days per year, with an additional vacation day for each year – up to 30 vacation days

  • Home Office and flexible working hours

  • Notebook of your choice and all the tools & gadgets you need to be productive
